title: Service at front desk MUST improve!
text:
How strange is to rate the JW Essex house only 2**?

Well, if you don’t feel welcome at any point of your stay ( not to mention the fact that I am Marriott Titanium Elite), get unfriendly and even rude behavior from a front desk manager and need to argue for what is suppose to be Titanium guaranteed benefits, thank I guess that would be the appropriate rating for me.

This is a luxury hotel ( so luxurious that the US president himself spent a night there at the same time that we were there) the location is great and the room spacious and clean.

BUT the front desk service was so terrible. They don’t even try to be nice- not even a smile !
So why come back to a hotel that doesn’t want me as a guest?

Luckily there are very kind and pleasant staff members at the lounge ( like Juliette Johnson) that make a difference with their very friendly and attentive behavior.

Don’t get me wrong, I was very upset with the incidents I had at front desk and I complained .  I was compensated but I am still left with a very unpleasant feeling that will prevent me from returning here. It’s all about the service! And in that area there should be quite an improvement! 
I shouldn’t really be surprised that this is the general front desk attitude as I reached out to Mr Montoya, the front desk manager ( left several phone messages, emailed him and the hotel ) and never got any reply.
I guess that says it all unfortunately !

title: Perfection in NYC
text: Absolutely wonderful- we traveled from California and this was our families first time in NYC. From the minute we arrived the staff were accommodating and friendly. The location is superb and the hotel lobby and guest rooms are updated but with an  old school New York vibe that we loved! We had a Jr suite for our family of 4 and we had plenty of room. We did not eat any meals in the hotel restaurant so I cannot speak to the food. Several great restaurants are within walking distance. The hotel is right across the street from Central Park and we very much enjoyed exploring the park with our two children! This is a great place for families and the location can’t be beat! 5 stars all around!

title: Refurbished, still nice
text:
I love the location of this hotel, its staff and the flowers in the lobby.  I stay in it whenever I go to New York.  For me, they did not need to have mono colored updates or a sleeker, contemporary look.  But I still love it.  
The location with Central Park across the street, Lincoln Center a few blocks away and subways accessible in a couple of blocks makes it easy to get around the city.

title: Very Dirty Hotel
text: No longer a clean easy go-to when visiting NYC. Stay away. Was given two rooms with peoples items already in them when checking in. Stains on carpet. Dirty sheets. Previous guests items in mini fridge. Previous guests dirty beauty products in bathroom. No bellman at night. Hour or more for room service. Staff not friendly.

title: privilegian sus eventos a los huéspedes, mala experiencia.
text: Había leído que el hotel no era un JW marriot en cuanto a su servicio, pero su localización me hizo reservar; desafortunadamente mi estadía esta siendo muy mala, el hotel esta remodelado ciertos espacios, en especial el comedor causando muchos problemas, habilitaron el salón principal para dar servicio de desayunos un par de días pero vendieron el salón para una convencionalistas y hoy 4 de abril de 2024 NO HAY RESTAURANTE, te mandan a pedir en roo service, privilegian la venta de su salón al bienestar d los huéspedes, no hay donde sentarse a trabajar , estoy en un rincón al lado del conserje con mi laptop en mis piernas y una café en una mesita... muy decepcionado d esta experiencia.

title: Yamira from Front Desk Knows Hospitality
text:
My glorious stay here at the JW Essex was memorable due in part to Yamira of the Front Desk team!   Yamira knows how to cater to Bonvoy Elite members.   Upon check-in and seeing my status, she inherently knew to roll-out the red carpet.  Not all front desk agents have this knack and I applaud her for it.  Hence, this well-deserve review.  And BIG THANKS for an upgrade to a suite.  She definitely made this Easter weekend memorable.  

The concierge club lounge is under renovation but the make-shift ballroom for breakfast works quite well!  What a spread!  Definitely come hungry.  

Conveniently located across Central Park, walking distance to steakhouses, pizza places, Magnolia Bakery for famous banana pudding, Broadway Shows and the Ed Sullivan theater for Late Night with Stephen Colbert.  Great location for everything.  The rooms are premium so if you’re gonna splurge and want to enjoy a quiet room with spa amenities like Aromatherapy lotions, the JW Essex is where it’s at!   

Titanium members and above - look for Yamira.  She’ll take care of you.   Silver and Gold - the Fairfield Inn is in Queens.  Hahaha. J/K.   Don’t embarrass yourself asking for a suite upgrade at the JW touting your Silver/Gold status and asking for Yamira. Unless you enjoy getting laughed at behind closed doors.  

Overall, great property!   I’ll be back!!!

title: 酒店服务一塌糊涂
text: 我要预订酒店，打过去问了房费和早餐价格，从客房预订的charlie和Nathan，一问三不知，告诉我问早餐价格要找前台，电话也不给转，只能重新打，前台的女的说没有早餐价格，又转到了客房送餐，客房送餐说没有自助早餐只能零点，让确认一下，又转到了客房送餐的经理，经理报了个税前价格，我要问税后价格，人家说不知道，也不知道具体税率是多少，又转到了guestservice，更好笑了，客服也说不知道，要我找预订部或者餐厅，我和她说就是你们餐厅转过来的，她才告诉我价格，和税率，最后我问他叫什么名字，居然让我等一下，等了半天告诉我叫julettejohnson...搞不懂这是什么鬼酒店，就问个早餐价格，问了快一个小时，真的不如国内的酒店，哪怕不是万豪旗下，别的小酒店也比不了

title: A great 5 days at the Essex House
text:
After reading the either hate or love reviews for the Essex House I almost cancelled my reservation but am glad that I stayed there. Yes it is under renovation however, I always stay at Marriotts and the staff here are the best I have ever encountered. From check in to checkout the staff were courteous always going above & beyond to be of assistance. My room o the 30th floor was exceptionally clean and well kept. The lounge breakfast was outstanding. Bar food was good and  the concierge exchanged my $35 resort fee for tickets to the MOMA. 
The location is across from Central Park making it easy to walk to Lincoln Center, Rockefeller Center or the MOMA.

title: Poor service all around
text: I never leave reviews. But the service here is not what I would expect for a hotel I’m paying $900 a night to stay at. There were lots of things that went wrong - the worst was not being able to order dinner for my kids from room service because it was after 10:30 - even though I called before 10:30 and was on hold for about 10 minutes, which then made it after 10:30. The menu for kids says “All Day” and room service doesn’t stop until midnight. We had just gotten back from seeing Lion King and I promised we could get room service. I asked to speak to the manager and was told by the woman on the phone that she would have to get him from the restaurant and have him call me back. Surprise surprise - no one EVER called me. If you are expecting a typical 4 star style hotel, prepare to be disappointed. We’ve had a great trip to NYC - but I will never stay here again and will let anyone else I know visiting to not stay here as well. They also delivered a cake to our room but set it right inside the door, and I didn’t know that and stepped on it. Kind of ruined the birthday cake for the 9 year old.

title: Beautiful property, Anticipatory Service
text: Fantastic experience at this property! Kevin at the front desk was extremely accommodating and professional. I am a professional musician and had an audition in the city and he was kind enough to offer a space for me to practice in. Definitely a pleasant surprise. He also gave us several great local restaurant recommendations. Kudos for the anticipatory service provided by your staff! Executive lounge staff were kind and accommodating, the buffet had a great selection, and the lounge was stunning! Room was well appointed and had a nice view of Central Park. Housekeeping did a terrific job keeping things spotless and provided timely service. Would put this up there as one of the best hotels I’ve stayed at in NYC!

title: The best location in NYC hands down.
text: This is my go-to in New York. With its proximity to Central Park and the spacious rooms and super friendly staff, this is my hotel of choice in NYC. This hotel is literally the best location you can be in when visiting New York City. I will be back asap, thank you Essex house for being my home away from home.

title: Great Holiday Stay in NYC
text: We stayed here for a night in December. The hotel was very helpful and accommodated our request for a refrigerator for our newborn. We stayed in a gorgeous big suite with beautiful views of the park. The bathroom is well equipped with a great bath tub. The titanium breakfast was solid and even had options for me as I am dairy free. The hotel is renovating but it wasn't an issue at all. The lobby was still well decorated for the holidays. This hotel is very well located and has everything you could need. The bed was quite comfortable as well. All of the staff were helpful and friendly. I am in the city a lot for work and this will definitely be a return destination. In fact, we just booked another trip to come back for work. We are looking forward to it!

title: Where is the grandeur?
text:
We had a quick overnight visit to the Essex house before a night at the Beacon. Upon entering one side of the lobby was curtained off for renovations. Lobby that was left was full of flowers and really beautiful. We were checked in right away and the front desk was nice. 

The hotel annoyingly charges a $35 location fee which is a food and beverage credit or you could use it for other stuff in the city. We live in Brooklyn so basically had to pay an extra $35 to go to get drinks at the bar which we didn’t want and then wound up spending more on mediocre drinks, and sad hummus in a old stuffy environment (see more below).

We got to our room and it was fairly large for a NYC hotel room with a great view of a brick wall. If you moved close to the night table and really squinted you could see a sliver of the park. 

Bed was comfortable and room seemed pretty clean, then we got into the bathroom and the vent was disgusting (see photo) there was also a bath mat in the shower hanging up to use that was soaking wet. We weren’t sure if it was used or if there was a leak. Either way it was gross.

Shower pressure was fine and the bathroom was large.

The restaurant was the strangest part, it is in dire need of a gut renovation. Between the awful wallpaper, old carpet and furniture it was just stuffy and old. There was also a giant tv playing golf which didn’t fit into the old stuffy decor of the rest of the room. It was like a pub decorated by a Grandma in the 1950’s.

There is a ballroom next door  which is serving as the executive lounge where they had some food at 5pm and then the breakfast. It was super old in there as well and looked like it was untouched since the 1980s. Breakfast was a buffet with a decent selection but reminded me more of a Courtyard not a 5 star hotel. 

Later on I see around 1am we wanted to watch tv, there were multiple streaming services to connect to but nothing worked. I chatted someone on the app and they checked with engineering and apparently streaming just wasn’t working in our room. So they called up at 1:30am and asked if we wanted to move, which in theory was very nice but we were already ready for bed and didn’t want to move rooms. 

The staff was nice but Marriott really need to gut this place. It has worn out its grandeur and ambiance. There are so many other places you can stay at the same price level that are nicer.

I wouldn’t come back.

title: Welcome home and great staff
text:
I am staying at the residence here, great location and worth the value that you pay. From the warm welcoming from the bell boys and the smiles you get once your shipment arrives regardless how big or heavy it is they will help you get it inside your unite 

A perfect home away from home in NYC and perfect residence

title: Decent Experience
text: Stayed in the Junior Suite with my family.  Check in was a little frustrating as we had to wait 20 minutes for someone to check in our luggage while we waited for our room to be ready.  Only real complaint for the stay though.  The room was nice, but needs some TLC as there wallpaper is starting to come off the walls in a lot of places.  We ordered room service at night which took a reasonable time to come.  Concierge was very helpful as she booked us tickets for the zoo.  Overall,a good stay.

title: Wonderful !!!
text: Wonderful property filled with amazing employees. Couldn’t have picked a better place to spend Christmas with the family ! Great executive lounge even with on going construction.  Looked forward to breakfast every morning !

title: Disappointing Family Stay
text:
Booked a Christmas evening stay at the JW Essex House on Central Park S. Horrendous stay. We were in a Manhattan Suite as a family of four. Even though we had booked months in advance (with points as I frequent Marriott hotels for work), the suite was only set for two. When we were going to bed after a long day, we realized there weren’t any blankets or sheets for the pull out couch. We called guest services, who told us they’d be there in 20 minutes. An hour later, my wife and I used the main bed comforter for our toddlers on the pull out couch since they still hadn’t arrived. After another hour had passed, we fell asleep with only a flat sheet since they never came at all. 

We also asked for ice to be delivered to the room after I walked around and could find the ice maker. This was earlier in the day. The ice also never made it to our room. 

On checkout day, we got up to shower and get ready for the day. But there were only two bath towels for the four guests. 

What a joke. Super disappointing for a suite that costs over $750/night. I expect better from a Courtyard, let alone a JW. 

Soend your money or points elsewhere in NYC.

title: GOOD PLACE TO STAY FOR BUSINESS OR VACATION
text: Upon arrival the front door men greeted us and ask if we needed any help. It was a bit crowded at the front desk, but the ladies got everyone through in a timely manner. The rooms were clean and felt fresh. Housekeeping did a good job at keeping everything nice once I left in the mornings.

title: Buyer beware
text: Buyer beware – this hotel is a total dump, despite being branded as a JW Marriott. Half of the hotel is under construction, the hotel is falling apart – dirty carpets, elevators that aren’t running, broken, light fixtures, etc. You can’t get room service – was told it would take over 90 minutes to get a pot of black coffee. do not stay at this hotel.

title: Love it in a heartbeat
text:
My husband and I have always been a fan of JW Marriott (it all started when we had our honeymoon at JW Marriott Khao Lak). Since then, whenever we have the opportunity to book at a JW Marriott hotel in our destination, we lock it in!

Let me start off with the splendid art deco ambience of JW Marriott Essex. Its pristine atmosphere is awe inspiring.

New York is the epitome of hustle and bustle and in the conclusion of your day, you would want to shut down and rest with utmost comfort which you will at JWME. They havr plush beddings, spotless clean room and a marble bathroom with a shower that has the perfect water pressure.

The view of central park is one of the amazing selling point of JWME. It is very relaxing just to stare at the views in the morning and ponder while watching the city lights at night.

The location and the vicinity is another selling point, the hotel is a few blind steps from Central Park, around 15 minutes walk from Times Square and Rockefeller Centre.

Thefood at Southgate is scrumptious that offers a variety of choices. They got the best wedge salad  and the central park mule (cocktail) is a must try.

The customer service is beyond fantastic! This is the main reason why we love JW Marriott, their staff are well trained especially with interpersonal communication skills, efficiency and hospitality. They are simply the best! Thanks Greg and the team ❤️

title: Serene, stately uptown landmark
text: Iconic uptown experience at Essex House! Couldn’t get over the swanky, historic vibes with unbeatable views. Clean, comfortable, and responsive hospitality. During our stay, some of the rooms had scaffolding blocking the windows, but we requested a change of rooms and we were accommodated. Glad they are taking care of such a landmark!

title: NYC Weekend
text:
We spent two nights here for a quick stay. We were a group of mom friends with daughters doing a little holiday trip. We chose this hotel based on location ( wanted something uptown & slightly quieter than the. Plaza or Ritz) and the price point was great. 

I did see the hotel was under renovation & it appears to be minimal. The hotel is a classic beautiful well kept space.

The curbside luggage handling was fast, the front desk was friendly & able to accommodate our request of side by side rooms.

We found the rooms clean & well kept. Relatively modern. The one improvement that can be made is the bathroom. The Tub didn’t hold water very well and the shower head did leak a bit while the kids were bathing. Otherwise we had no troubles.

Housekeeping was thorough, but no turn down service.

Room service ( dinner) was quick and pretty good. Avoid the soup.. but everything else we tried was good for what we needed for a quick meal the first night.

Front door service can be improved. There were many times we were trying to enter or exit with strollers and couldn’t find anyone to assist, or if they were there we had to prompt to help. 

Street & hallway noise are to be expected a bit in NYC, and were prevalent but the white noise on my phone did cancel out most of it.

The location is great if you’re looking to do uptown activities, dining or shopping. A really competitive nightly rate for the location for sure. 

We would stay again if we’re in town.

title: Faded glory :(
text: What a shame... A bit of a disappointment. It seems that THE Essex House has changed from a Hotel to a Motel. Too bad. A big loss for all of us that have always loved the QUINTESSENTIAL experience of an old-world "grand dame" hotel stay. With the excuse that the lobby and restaurant are being renovated breakfast is  served now in either the ball room foyer  or an upstairs meeting room. One is bad. The other is worse! No ambience; poor food quality; and offered with as much enthusiasm as a bottle of great champagne that lost all its bubbles. The lobby is no more. A few chairs scattered around and a settee or pair of chairs in the center hallway is all there is. Seeing guests sitting on the floor or steps to ancillary spaces just seems wrong. The idea of the bell staff handling bags discreetly through a service entrance and staff elevator has gone away... the entry hall (can't even call it a lobby) and the guest elevators are now as elegant as the baggage claim carrousel at the airport. And finally the room... a low floor park view king... nothing like the pictures on the website. Ridiculously small (room 814) with just ONE window, was just enough for me to know it's NOT the place I would want to stay NOR one I would ever recommend to others.

title: JW Marriott or Motel 6. Hard to tell
text:
Location great everything else motel 6 quality.  Tv did not work box hanging off wall behind tv phone did not work   Several hours after requesting these items be fixed they weren’t.  We had to go to front desk and complain. Then they were fixed. 
Next issues was no one’s room cards would work on elevator. Employee had to use their card to get us and 3 others to their floors. 
Is it worth the $$$$$.

title: Wouldn't Stay Here Again - Very Disappointing
text:
Extremely disappointing rooms, spotty customer service, and no true acknowledgement of Bonvoy status.

I stayed here for two nights mid-August with two rooms booked. The website promised connecting Junior Suites. Prior to arrival, I saw that this was instead going to be one Junior Suite and one regular King with a hallway connector. When I contacted the hotel via email, I was rudely told that I was mistaken, and this is what we get. 

I am Ambassador Elite and my mother traveling with me in the second room is Platinum for Life -- big statuses. We were put in our (incorrect) rooms on the lowest guest room floor. Our views were of the back of other buildings. (The plus side to that was they were very quiet.) I'd asked in advance for a coffee maker for each room. Mine had one, hers did not. The bellman promised to ask for hers. When we returned from dinner at about 9:30pm, it still wasn't there. All I got for my Ambassador status was a card. I've not stayed in any other hotel where I didn't get a small acknowledgement gift of some kind along with the card. (And typically an upgrade - the St. Regis even upgrades me to a Suite.) I understand upgrades aren't guaranteed, but frequent travelers know that you're always told shorter stays are more likely to get them. During housekeeping, they also don't replenish that coffee maker. You have to call room service, which we didn't know until that night.

We dined at the hotel the first night because of a somewhat late arrival. The food was mediocre, and my mother had to send hers back because it arrived cold. The second night we had a cocktail at the bar before leaving for dinner off-property. I asked what kind of glass the cocktail I ordered would come in. I was told a Martini glass. I requested a rocks glass, the bartender then proceeded to give me a Martini glass... we were the only people there.

The Concierge team was helpful before we arrived with arranging transportation; however, after I got home I saw I was charged $50 more than quoted. When I contacted them, I was told the company charged me a waiting fee. I responded asking if they could explain why, since my flight was early and we immediately met our driver at baggage claim. I have never received a response, and it's been almost a month. I gave up. (BTW - The company was Empire CLS, which I swore off of using a couple of years ago because they pull this scam constantly all over the world.)

The website also lists a Spa on-property. Prior to arrival, I contacted the hotel to see about getting two pedicures. The person who assisted was extremely helpful, but it turns out they weren't at the Spa, which is only open when necessary, I guess. A vendor set up in-room pedicures using freelance aestheticians. This meant I technically didn't qualify for the Spa credit promised with my check-in materials. My mother's pedicure was ruined by the end of the day. The company happily sent the lady back out the following morning, but I was still charged a ridiculous $500 + for this service (which I was never quoted). 

So back to my first comment -- This is a very disappointing hotel. The location is excellent, but that's its redeeming quality. From other reviews, it also appears that if you are lucky enough to be deemed worthy of a view (or you pay extra for it), you're rewarded with street noise. There are too many options in NYC to stay here again.

title: My Experience
text:
Great Trip! 
Great Swimming Pool!
Great Room Service!
Clean Bathrooms!
Rasheer
Kandray
Agathoon
Abid
Great help from these guys!
Overall the experience is worth staying at this hotel I don’t travel often but it was good

title: Da evitare perché vecchio e non tenuto molto bene
text:
Abbiamo prenotato l’hotel con grandi aspettative anche in relazione al costo pagato.
Stanza piccola, arredi vecchi, moquette vecchia, bagno piccolissimo con vasca e tendina in plastica per la doccia. Ne va del buon nome dell’hotel e della catena perché credo che non mi vedranno più….

title: Not a great Marriott
text: got the room wrong not once but twice-very disappointing, I am a Marriott member and stay only with them. The hotel staff seem to be confused about hotel policy-one wanted to charge $600 to my credit card up front to cover any room snacks and liquor out of the mini bar??

title: Summer Hell at Essex House
text:
Huge disappointment.  Terrible experience. We spent 1 night on August 26th in a Central Park View Upper Floor we had booked - price was 1000 $.  Experience was horrible from the time we stepped into this “hotel”.  Receptionist present on August 26th at 3:30 pm was unfriendly and cold.  Our room was on the 14th floor (1406): tiny, dirty and small windows - the only plus was the view. The rest looked like a student hostel’s room. Dirty and old carpet, dust everywhere (see pictures), water did not evacuate from the shower so it was left like a cesspit.  1 single chair looked like a second-hand office chair from the 1980’s with stains.  1000$ for this “room” is a fraud.  We asked to change rooms and were given a slightly better “room” on the 22nd floor.  It was still shabby-looking, dark and small but cleaner so we ended up staying there.  There was constant background noise coming from the air conditioning or the elevators nearby.  Checkout was quick but again, receptionist was cold, unfriendly and couldn’t care less about the poor experience we had and told her about.  It was a relief to leave.
Advice from seasoned travelers:  AVOID THIS PROPERTY at all cost.  Needless to say, we will never be returning here and suggest that you do the same.  Perhaps this can encourage Marriott to thoroughly improve their staff management and rooms.  Overlooking Central Park should not be an excuse to sell a dump.

title: Nice classic hotel, very busy location with street noise.
text: Nice classic hotel, in a very busy location with lots of street noise.   This is hard to get away from in this area.  We probably wouldn’t stay here again and would go south to a quieter location.   We were on a lower floor on the back of the hotel.  No view and listended to the dump trucks and other deliveries even at 1AM.  We did have access to the executive lounge and that did provide a nice breakfast.

title: Second stay here not as polished as first
text:
My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights in July. 
Room - We got upgraded to a large Manhattan view suite, which was quite large especially for NYC, and had a nice view of some of the mega sky scrapers.  It has an entrance hall, a large sitting room with couch and chairs, and another hall with closets leading to bathroom and bedroom.  

The bed was very comfortable and the room it self was large.  The bathroom was a bit cramped, especially the sink / toilet area, but there’s a large shower and seperate bath. 

The room was showing a lot of wear and tear however which should be addressed for a 5 star hotel.  

Location - across from Central Park and lots of subway.  Very central.  

Food - I was disappointed, not necessarily in the fare provided, but just the process.  The executive lounge itself is under renovation, so it’s in a large open ballroom. When I used the executive lounge for breakfasts, there were some times there was no one “manning the gates” and the place was jam packed, making me wonder if people who weren’t entitled to it were able to get in.  

Service - same complaint as a lot of people.  Trying to get ahold of people takes forever.  Requiring multiple calls.   At one point we tried to use our elevator to get to the lobby, but it wasn’t working, so we had to walk down from the 30th something floor to a floor quite a ways down that used a different elevator bank. When I tried calling from my floor, they intimated they were aware of it “oh yea someone else mentioned that”, but didn’t give any solution or that anyone was working on it.  Thank goodness we didn’t have to walk back up. 

Overall - 4/5.  Great location.  Good hard product in need of a bit of TLC.  Service and executive lounge needs a bit of work.  Especially at that price point.

title: Great service
text: My wife & I went to NYC for the 1st time. We stayed at the JW, wanting to be close to Central Park. The staff-from the time we checked in till time we left was OUTSTANDING!  Especially Carlos Mendoza, one of the Managers. Steven, one of their bartenders, and Luis one of their doormen. Their entire staff is courteous, outgoing, and very informative. I would highly recommend this hotel. There was some lobby construction going on, but again, the staff went above and beyond to make us feel comfortable. Again- this was our 1st time in NYC, maybe there are better places to stay. I know if we go back, we will definitely stay at the JW Marriott Essex House Hotel.

title: More plusses than minuses
text:
The negative reviews put me off a bit, but I’m glad we stayed here. We asked for a quiet room, so were not surprised to be given a room facing… a brick wall, but it didn’t bother us. Our room was nicely maintained, and bigger than what we’ve come to expect in many Manhattan hotels. This is an older building, so it wasn’t surprising that the bath was small, with an old shower/tub setup and just a single sink, but it had been updated and was in good condition. 

The lounge is currently in one of the ballrooms, and the evening offerings were substantial enough to count for dinner: beef skewers, lots of roasted veggies, hummus, a cheese platter, salad… I could have filled up, but wisely restrained myself because we had dinner reservations later.  

Service could have been better. When we called to request a light blanket, the "at your service" number rang seemingly ad infinitum, so we ultimately made the request in person at the front desk. Hours later, the blanket still hadn't been delivered, but at least when we called to follow up, the call was answered quickly. 

The hotel’s location is lovely, on the south end of Central Park, and steps from lots of cafes, shopping, and museums. Overall, the plusses outweighed the minuses.

title: Great location
text: Really nice hotel, the staff is very nice and helpful, the rooms are spacious and nice, the location is amazing! If you want to stay in front of the Central Park. Dinner and lunch was good, however breakfast… if you can, skip it… it’s not the best. The rooms need to improve cleaning services, the air vents at the bathroom where full of dust. Other than that it’s a good hotel, would definitely stay there again.

title: Great hotel, perfect location
text: I've had the pleasure of staying at this hotel several times over the years  (first as the Jumeirah Essex House) and now as the JW Marriott and no matter who it's owned by, I've had excellent visits. It can't be oversold how convenient this hotel is - Central Park is literally across the street, Times Square and the Great White Way are a short stroll away and literally everything else - from world-class museums to dining to shopping are all within easy reach. The rooms at the hotel are comfy, not too cozy :) and the staff, excellent on every visit. It's also fairly accessible by car and either the hotel will valet your vehicle or you can park in a nearby garage. I think it a perfect location to explore the big apple.

title: Disappointing JW
text: Really disappointed in this hotel. We’ve stayed in many JW’s and I think this was the worse one. Our room wasn’t ready when we arrived so we bell-checked our luggage. When we finally received our room, it had a interior view of the wall & other rooms. It was also near the elevator. We requested a park view and not to be near the elevator. We were told that’s all that was available - we booked this awhile ago. We could tell it was cleaned quickly as there was a razor left in the bathroom (ew) and half of the stuff was missing from the mini bar. We didn’t want any of it, but I didn’t want them to think we had it & get charged for it. And surprise, surprise we were charged for something we didn’t take. We had breakfast there once & regretted that. Wished we had gone somewhere else as we had some awesome breakfasts other places. The location was good, being close to Central Park. It was also nice that we got bottled water every time we were coming & going. We had 2 rooms & spent  a lot of money. For that I expected a nice park view. We couldn’t even put up our blinds as we were looking in other rooms.  We will stay somewhere else next time we come to New York.

title: Great location - Great Hotel !
text:
Great location. Staff really looked after us during our stay. Coffee machine and ample coffee pods delivered to our room upon request. Loan of a yoga mat for Central Park yoga class. Easy access to the park. Lovely serving staff in the bar.  Decent gym.
Very informative concierge and door staff.  
Rooms were small but that’s expected with a city centre hotel.

title: Great base of Operations in NYC
text:
We used the Essex Hotel as the base of operations for my daughter's wedding. The events manager, Rachel was attentive to all our needs. The whole staff was attuned to service.
The only potential shortcoming would be the renovation of their main restaurant which will be in play for the foreseeable future.

title: Great location, comfortable room
text: I may have been given a larger room than is standard, but it worked well for me. The view wasn't great, but having a room with a couch and a desk more than made up for this. The bed was very comfortable and the blackout blinds made for a good night's rest. The location is great, so I would stay here again.

title: Perfectly fine for what it is
text:
I don't know what all the complaining is about by other posters.  We stayed at the Essex house a few nights ago.  The facility was fine.  It was clean.  The room was clean and very serviceable in every particular.  The shower was excellent; the linens were clean and fresh.  

Really I don't know what the complaining is about.  This is not a 5 star hotel folks - it's a 4 star, so don't expect to be treated like a movie star.

I recommend the place.

title: Never again! JW strikes again
text: Decent location and reasonable entrance facade but the room’s amenities and services are very poor! The room is what you would get in a third class hotel. Very small, cheap curtains, about 40-50sf bathroom. The doormen have no function but they congregate at the entrance and race my wife to the door when they are entering pr existing! After a long day, we come to the room and the key doesn’t work so must wait for someone to unlock! The poor restaurant for breakfast is simply unprofessional (just watching the waiter deal with other guests is appalling) with dishes similar to Dennis or iHop for 20 times the prices. Last time we stayed at the Palace hotel and was quite amazing experience.

title: Great location, kind staff
text: My husband and I came for a weekend in New York. We loved our stay here, and will be coming back to this hotel on our next trip.  Every single staff member we came across was kind and helpful. We were always greeted and offered water. If we had any questions, everyone was happy to answer. Location was perfect! Fairly quiet rooms, considering it’s in the city. Lounge breakfast was amazing! We hope to come back soon, but this time with our kids and this hotel will be perfect for our family.

title: Horrible phones and internet system
text: The hotel has the worst communication and their phones don’t work. The phones ring ring ring and no one will ever pick up. The tv is slower than traffic in Times Square. We expected more from this hotel in the heart of Central Park. I hope they fix their problem as this was a massive inconvenience.

title: Polecam
text: Hotel ma doskonałą lokalizację przy samym Central Parku . Wszędzie jest blisko . Obsługa hotelu bardzo miła i pomocna . Jedzenie dobre czy to śniadania czy kolacje . . Pokoje przestronne np nr 1207  z widokiem na Park. Jak na hotel 5 gwiazdek chyba wymaga drobnego remontu.

title: Outdated, subpar executive lounge,  no recognition of Titanium status
text:
The rooms were fully equipped, comfy bed and nice linens, somewhat spacious for NYC, but very outdated in decor. That’s about where the positives end.

No complimentary water provided in room - they were offered at the lobby entrance but often ran out and came in the tiniest, wasteful bottle size! I did not get any recognition for my titanium status beyond the obligatory executive lounge access. Sadly, said executive lounge was very disappointing as it felt more like a cheap, budget hotel cafeteria than that of a JW Marriott.

They did not email me my invoice after checkout as I had requested, and there seems to be communication issues with Bonvoy as well, as I have been unable to receive points or elite night credits for my two paid rooms, despite ensuring my Marriott membership number was on both.

title: street people working at a 5 star hotel
text: This hotel needs an update on all the rooms. The lights flicker like a cheap motel(no changing of bulbs), the bathtub had hair in it once I arrived(so it hadnt been cleaned[gross]), the room smelled of vomit upon arrival, the staff are perverts(the bellman barged in my room as I was getting dressed, he did not knock, he said he didnt hear me say "just a minute", thank goodness I was in the back room. He insisted on collecting room service cart like I was being timed to eat. I had to YELL at him to get out. He was also flirtatious when we checked in. The other room service staff decided he was going to rush me for cart and then look around the room for the vomit SMELL I mentioned. I was like"there is nothing to see... it is a SMELL." He literally RAN straight to the bedroom to look at my belongings. It was weird., like having a wild animal in the room with me. He got way too close to me to talk. I felt scared. There are no blankets to be had. The maids pester you to clean early. The room is full of dust and ancient dirt. They disregard "do not disturb" signs. I do not feel safe here with the men who work here. I KEEP my door locked. They seem like street people. It is like, as soon as my man left for his meeting he ran up here to barge in my room. Scary and UNNACCEPTABLE.

title: Beautiful stay at a historic hotel
text: I can’t believe this doesn’t have higher ratings. I had a wonderful two night stay here for business. Beautiful historic hotel with clean, cozy rooms. Loved the art deco elements and the easy downstairs bar/restaurant. Service everywhere was great. Great location across from Central Park and walkable to great shopping and restaurants.

title: A first class well run hotel
text:
Fast check in and made to feel welcome,
Room was very clean and comfortable with an amazing view of Central Park, and was quiet and peaceful.
Staff friendly pleasant and helpful.
A very good breakfast was served with some very tasty above average dishes 
Beautiful decor in the reception and lobby areas with a magnificent flower table.
To conclude a very pleasant stay and nice experience - definitely a hotel to return again.

title: Quiet, understated stay.
text:
Quiet, spacious room at a lovely location on the south end of Central Park.  The staff was friendly and helpful.  Why not 5 stars? Minor things. I wish the bathroom had more counter space. Our room faced a dark wall. A cup of coffee cost $9.00 at breakfast.  But the room had comfortable beds, the location was ideal for walking, and there was zero street noise. 
So, at the end of the day, it was a restful stay which is so important in NYC.

title: Excellent hotel with Central Park view.
text: Brilliant hotel and we had a room with a great view of Central Park.  The staff all made us very welcome and we’re very helpful.  We only ate once in the hotel when our room was ready and we were given 150 dollars to enjoy a meal and drink.  It was ready within 5 minutes but we still enjoyed our meal.  The room was adequate size for my daughter and I.  We had a double bed as it was the only one with a view of Central park but it was an super king bed and very comfy on the 11th floor.  There was no kettle in the room but after phoning room service and asking for a kettle, we were given a hospitality tray with kettle, mugs, tea, coffee and milk on.  We had this replaced again as we were there for 4 nights/5days.  All in all we would recommend this hotel for a stay in New York.

title: overpriced and run down
text: I booked this hotel because I wanted connecting rooms. I called twice prior to arrival and I was assured that the connection was in the room. This was not the case. The rooms were next to each other. When I asked for a price adjustment because the connecting family room was much more expensive, I was ignored. I tried to reach out so many times. Calling, emailing and I didn't receive a response. I finally stopped trying. This hotel is very dated. Wallpaper is peeling off, furniture chipped and falling apart. The bathroom floor was so sticky our shoes stuck to it. Even the service wasn't up to par for a 5 star hotel. We asked for a comforter for the pull out sofa and they brought an old scratchy blanket. When I asked the person who brought the blanket for a comforter I was ignored. I called the front desk again and they said they were out of them. I paid over 1800 a night for the family connector which didn't connect. Be very careful when booking this hotel. It is very overpriced and  you may not get the room you were promised. Also it needs a huge renovation. We went to New York for my daughter's bday and it was so disappointing that the hotel was so run down and we didn't receive the rooms promised. I would never stay here again.

title: На пути в Калифорнию
text:
Замечательное место с видом на Централпарк. Провели несколько дней. Отличное расположение. Вид потрясающий на Центральный парк. Комнаты очень разные даже за одну цену, но безусловно очень удобная, хорошо убраны. Удобная кровать.
Хорошая ванная комната. Есть СПА понравился, есть сауна и влажная парилка, причём раздельно для мужчин и женщин. Цены в ресторане конечно высокие, как везде в этом месте, но красиво и хорошая кухня.

title: the room was hot, needed furniture replacing, and the price was ridiculous
text: oh how i wanted to like this hotel..we are frequent visitors of new york city and used to stay at 4 star hotels mostly but decided it was time to stay at the 5 star hotels and get valet, room service and all that comes with the hefty price tag..boy, were we disappointed! we booked a double bed room and aside from the good size of it, and the very large bathroom, the rest was absolutely no better than the hampton inn down the street for half the price..the chairs in our room were ripped, the air didnt work properly and we had to call repair which still didnt work, the bathroom rug was shredded, and the view was of a brick wall..they upcharged for every little thing, including 35$ for literally picking up a jar on the mini bar and never using it..just looking at was an automatic charge..the room was not spotless as it should have been..the rug looked like it hadnt been vacuumed and we had to wear shoes in the room because we felt it not cleanly..we were charged 200, yes you read that right, for 3 breakfast of eggs and oatmeal and though it tasted good, it is strong arm robbery to charge that much..the lobby was nice, nothing out of this world, and we really felt that the rooms did not match the hotel rating..so lesson learned..if you dont mind paying top dollar for average hotel in good location then you will enjoy this..but knowing that there are other hotels right down the street half the price with the same average accommodations, well, let us just say we wont be coming back.

title: Front desk should be friendlier and not so strict!
text:
I really wanted to give this hotel 5 stars BUT I was left with an uncomfortable feeling at checkout and thus this rating .
Apparently if you remove an item from the minibar ( in order to put milk, yogurt etc inside) you get charged automatically. And it is expensive!! There is no note warning about this.
So at check out I realized I was charged for quite an amount for minibar usage. I had to explain and argue in order to get this taken if my bill. And then I was reprimanded by the young associate….
As Platinum Elite, I get late checkout- 4pm . Starting at 3:30pm I got phone calls and housekeeping knocking on my door inquiring and reminding me about the fact that I needed to checkout…. Quite bothering and totally out of place!
These are little things but they bother , disturb and should not happen in such a hotel. I feel service should be more welcoming and not so strict.

This is a luxurious hotel in prime location, the room was spacious and clean .
The breakfast buffet is amazing even though the lounge gets over crowded .

title: One of the best hotel views
text: Great location facing Central Park. World class restaurants and nightlife around the corner. Very busy and large hotel which is sometimes at the expense of customer service. Some additional employees at the front desk certainly won’t hurt. However, I had a good time and enjoyed the stay in New York.

title: Gran eleccion
text: Muy buena elección. Perfecta ubicación para cualquier tipo de viaje, ya sea negocios, vacaciones, etc. Buenos servicios. Buen gimnasio. Buen acceso. Buen restaurante. Personal muy agradable. Nada que cambiar ni mejorar. Super recomendada la visita.

title: Top Notch Staff, Service, and Ammenities
text: We were Immediately Welcomed by friendly and helpful concierge and front desk staff. Felix, both checked us in and out with such ease and explained all of the amenities and services available during our stay. Regardless of the time of day or night, staff is always present to greet you with a smile. From housekeeping to rooms service, to the beautiful atmosphere, and everything in between, it was truly a 5 star Experience. If you are looking for a safe, clean, conveniently located hotel to all Manhattan has to offer, this is the Place!!

title: What a wonderful New Year’s Eve stay!
text:
We had an incredible one-night stay in Essex House for New Year’s Eve.
Of course, the location is just superb, and everyone we met at the hotel was very helpful and friendly and made us feel welcome.
The room was very clean and well kept, on the high floor, facing Central Park - thanks a lot to hotel team for this little new years gift! We enjoyed beautiful views and could even see famous Wollman rink in Central Park right from our window! By the way, Destination Fee was totally worth it because it also included 2 complimentary tickets to the rink! (I wish I did more planning because we had already bought tickets in advance)
I’m a little sad we didn’t get to experience hotel restaurant/bar because we already had plans for both the night before and the morning after, but I’m sure one day we’ll be back to this stunning hotel!
Thanks again to Essex House team for our wonderful stay in NYC!

title: What an amazing hotel!
text:
One of the friendliest hotels we have ever stayed in! When we arrived we were greeted by the wonderful staff, and at breakfast and around the hotel the staff were all super friendly and chatty too. 
We had a family room (a suite and connecting room), and as we notified the hotel in advance, there were games and tee-pee tents in the room. My kids were delighted!
The location couldn't have been more ideal! Directly opposite the hotel is Central Park,. with the kids playground also conveniently directly opposite. We did daily walks in the park and enjoyed the route around the large lake.
5th Avenue and all the great shops are also walking distance, along with some of the great restaurants such as Sara Beths and Serendipity 3.
Bryant Park is a short 20 minute walk through Times Sq, and you can also walk to the High Line at Hudons Yard if you fancy a real stroll!
The rooms were also clean, modern and amazing views of the park. 
We will definitely be back!

title: Terrific Location - Terrific Stay
text: This hotel was perfect - super friendly staff, loved being located right across the street from Central Park and close to 5th avenue (window) shopping!   Will definitely return for another stay at JW Marriott Essex House!

title: Rough experience
text: Arrived and checked in and was sent to a room that had someone else staying in it - awkward. Came back down to get a different room - no apology. Executive lounge was the most bare I have ever seen at a Marriott.

title: Rooms May Be Refreshed But Service is Still Terrible
text: Rooms are nicer than they used to be, but nothing special. Meanwhile, service is sorely lacking. We had vowed after our prior less than stellar experience that we wouldn't come back, but they had the best rate in the area, so I gave them another try. Big mistake. I had to make four calls and wait seven (hours) for water that was supposed to have been in my room in the first place. I got to be woken by the prior guest's alarm set at 5:30 a.m. They hadn't bothered to refill the tissues in the bathroom from the prior guest. When I told the front desk they said a manager would contact me. No surprise that that never happened. Then, I thought to myself, I'll bet they screwed up my bill. Sure enough, there were bogus charges. Stay way. Too many better options.

title: January Stay
text: Location is terrific. Central Park is outside the front door and the upper west side  and midtown attractions are a short walk away. Lobby and common areas are very nice. The rooms are nice sized with furnishings that are a bit dated. We had a decent view of Central Park but our windows were filthy pretty much ruining the view. Breakfast in the on-site restaurant was a complete waste of money. The buffet was terrible with sub-par quality offerings yet pricey. Bad decision on our part to eat there. Service was fine and friendly. Overall this is a nice hotel in a great location but feels like nothing special.

title: Love JW Marriott Essex House
text:
I was in NYC for the CNN Heroes 2022 televised show and event festivities Dec. 10-12 hosted by Jelly Ripa and Anderson Cooper.  My friend was one of the top 10 heroes being honored.  JW Marriott Essex House hosted the CNN Heroes’ stay, and fortunately my stay as well. OMG…What a great hotel!  Beautiful and clean.  The Staff was extremely professional, cordial and accommodating.  Great amenities; great restaurant/bar, and food.  Perfect location—across from Central Park between 5th and 6th Avenues.  Great surrounding restaurants, fashion houses/venues, entertainment, sightseeing spots/landmarks.  Felt completely safe and secure during my stay.  Looking forward to staying at this hotel again…Very SOON!  Thanks JWMEH!   
~Belinda B/Suburban Chicago

title: Average
text: Nice staff and pretty decorations but the facility needs an update and the rooms have erratic temperature systems with awful noises. Health club is inadequate. Location is excellent with easy access to subway and Central Park. Did not try the dining options but lots of great nearby restaurants

title: HORRIBLE Customer Service!
text:
I cannot stress enough how bad my expierence with this hotel was. I had a one night stay here Dec. 17-18, peak Christmas time in NYC. I just booked a standard room for my husband and I, but was pleased to check the app the day before my trip and discover that I had apparently been upgraded to a Central Park View room. My husband and I arrived around 10 am the next morning to check in. The front desk clerk said that our room as available- great!- and we could go straight up. I swiped my credit card for the standard $150 security fee and proceeded to the room. Imagine my surpise when I opened the door to our room and saw the view of another building/alley way. I don't know if the clerk just decided on her own that I'd rather have a room then as opposed to waiting for the Central Park View room indicated in my app, or what, but that was certainly disappointing. We decided just to ignore it and proceed about our stay anyways. The room was the typical tiny NYC size. Bed was comfortable enough, towels were nice. The room seemed slightly dated and like it hadn't been updated in a while. I was VERY surprised to see this room had a shower curtain... not even glass paneling for the shower. At $1000/night peak rate, you could at least upgrade the shower.

The real fun with this hotel started after I checked out. I had booked my reservation using a Marriott free night certificate of 85k points that was set to expire on 1/1/23, plus an additional 15k points to hit the 100k point room rate. Imagine my surprise the day after I check out when I discover that my free night and 15k points have been refunded to my account, and the hotel billed me for $1022!! And not just pending, a POSTED charge in that amount, PLUS an additional room's night pending on my card. What has ensued since then is absolutely absurd. I've been on the phone with Essex House or Marriott Bonvoy almost every day since then while one blames the entire situation on the other person. Essex House told me that I booked the room on a AAA cash rate. I don't even have AAA. Then Essex House tried to tell me I booked the entire thing on points. Also a lie, and I have the confirmation email to prove it. Bonvoy insisted the case was in Essex House's hands and there was nothing further they could do. The only person who seemed to be even remotely interested in trying to assist me was Vuong in Accounting with Essex House. I finally received an email Christmas Day from Marriott informing me that the refund would be on my credit card by 12/28 and if it's not there to respond to their email to let them know. I wake up 12/28 and, shocker, the refund is not on my credit card. I try to respond to the email to inform them and, shocker, mail to that account is undeliverable. I then called Marriott again and, after being hung up on while transferred three separate times, reached a supervisor who told me she'd have the manager of Essex House call me that day. I finally received a call from Madelyn in the GM's office who told me a refund was being issued to my card that day and it would show up in 5-7 business days. I asked her to please email me confirmation of that and she said she would. I reminded her that my free night certificate would expire on 1/1/23 and that they needed to redeem it from my account prior to then. She then called me back approxiately 20 minutes later to tell me my entire booking was on points. I assured her it was not and that I, again, had proof of that. She assured me she would get it straight and email me confirmation of my refund. Two hours go by and it's now 4:50 and still no email from Madelyn with my confirmation. I then had to call Essex House AGAIN and speak to someone in Accounting and ask that the email showing the refund be sent to me immediately. I finally received that from them. At this point I have no idea if they will even redeem my free night certificate before it expires--that's their problem, not mine. If the refund does not appear on my credit card in the stated time, I will be filing a dispute with my credit card company for fraud. At this point, Marriott and Essex House have no excuse for this whatsoever other than sheer incompetence or willingness to defraud their customers. Spend your money elsewhere when staying in NYC. The Hilton Conrad and Thompson Hyatt are both delightful and will get my business again after previous stays.

title: Disappointing Accomodations
text:
This was a Christmas present for us to celebrate a Wedding anniversary.
Requested a higher floor with a view months ago and we got a 3rd floor room with a view of a rooftop. 
We were told other guests were being allowed to checkout later…
That’s great but what about other guests. Front desk check in were not customer service oriented and not very friendly. 
Room is out dated.

title: Fantastic Iconic Hotel
text: Incredible service, atmosphere and location.  We had an amazing stay just before Christmas and the hotel is beautiful inside and outside.  The staff are so very attentive and professional. Aliana at check in took very good care of us when we were tired from a very long trip.  Highly recommend, we will be back.

title: uncortable accomodation
text:
i make the reservation true booking - i call the front desk 7 days before my arrive to make sure to have all the services i need for the stay.  When i arrive at the front desk at 4 pm my room was not ready and the front desk Manager she told that check in at JWMarriot is from 4pm to 6 pm AND THIS IS NOT TRUE-

we arrive in the room 732 and the heat ws not working in the bathroom and i ask assistance and they told to add more carpet on the floor. 

At this point the situation get not confortable and we have a lid with us. After 5/6 argue with the front desk, the front Desk Manager show up and change the room 

We ask  the front desk to make reservation for Christmas b fast and dinner and she told us DON T WORRY IS WALKING IN IN THE LOUNGE.

December 25 we walk in the lounge and we find out that the lounge was close for holiday.

after multiply complain we find out that some of the management don't know the hotel and all the mistake it was on our experience.

i will not raccomande this hotel.

Mr Danilo DI Michele

title: Great Thanksgiving visit
text:
We spent Thanksgiving weekend here.  I was worried that the hotel would feel too crowded and chaotic for the holiday, but it was a delightful experience.
- location by Central Park was great
- there was never any wait for the elevators 
- Executive lounge served a plentiful breakfast 
- the Manhattan Suite was on a high floor so we didn’t hear any street noise.
- lobby is beautiful 
- housekeeping came every day and early in the day, which was great
- service was great with the exception of one doorman and one housekeeping staff member.  Everyone else was warm and welcoming.  Every time I called guest services for any request they brought it to the room very promptly.
- the only negative was that I could hear noise from the room above.  Sounded like the guests above were running around (or possibly children having a dance party) and moving furniture early in the morning.

I’ve stayed at the Ritz Carlton down the street previously and I much prefer the Essex House.  I will definitely return.

title: Nice visit for biz travel
text:
We had a lovely experience at the JW Marriott. We work in midtown and the location was great for the plaza district area. 

I found the service to be outstanding with very attentive staff. We used suite nights to upgrade and the junior suite was massive and lovely. Very clean, quiet. The free breakfast was surprisingly good! We will definitely return :)

title: Not worth the money
text: This was the most disappointing experience I have ever had at a JW Marriott.  The location is great but the service was horrible. I even reached out to the manager and Marriott to discuss and got no response. Not worth the cost.  I have stayed at Courtyards that were nicer than this.

title: Great Stay, So much Love and Energy for the NYC Marathon
text:
I stayed at the JW Marriott Essex House in New York. It's so convenient for my trip to run in the 2022 New York City Marathon and the Abbott Dash to the Finish Line 5k. Centrally located within easy city walking distance to the Expo at the Javit Center and the Finish Lines at Central Park.
  The Hotel Staff is Awesome, Friendly and courteous. They made my stay so enjoyable. In the mornings I would have breakfast at the restaurant. Their buffet has all the options needed for a nutritional start of my day. I met Juliette, the energetic, friendly and polite hotel manager. She assisted me in finding locations to shop Awesome souvenirs. Plus her smile and laughter are contagious. Also Ryan, one of the servers. He always had a nice smile, positive Energy and really cheered me on for my running events. 
  During miday lunches or evenings dinners. Jessica, the evening shift supervisor would be helpful in meal choices. She would also check on mu stay. I love her positive Energy and Vibe. You could really tell she loved what she does. It was a pleasure talking with her. I felt so comfortable and at home. The Bartenders Oliver and Quentin, one of the evening shift servers were also friendly, helpful and accommodating. 
  What I love is I also stayed her last year. I see a lot of the same staff. Which tells me alot about Essex and its positive relationships with their employees. It also makes me feel like I'm coming home. Talking with old friends, getting caught up.on what transpired over the last year. That's so rare when your traveling alot as a guest. I really appreciate this type of atmosphere. 
  Thank you for making an already amazing experience even more safe and wonderful. By having such a loyal and friendly staff to greet me during my stay. I love the professionalism, knowledge and courteous I received. Plus those smiles and positive Energy was so Awesome as well.  I'll see you all next year.

title: Disappointing Experience
text: Very expensive room ($1000+) that was dirty and unkempt. Open bottle of (Fiji) water left in dirty tray, razor blade plastic cover found on unvacuumed carpet, cigarette burn on couch. Tired overall decor. The ONLY upside was a fabulous view over Central Park!

title: Excellent Customer Service
text:
This is a very beautiful and clean hotel.  Check-in was quick and pleasant.  The staff  all look very professional and address you by your name, very personalized.  The dining room attendant had us smiling and laughing when we arrived for breakfast.  She is such fun!  She brightens up your day.  I don't have her name but she did say she's from Jamaica. 

 What we missed the most is our coffee and tea.  There is none in the room and is only available for pick up in the breakfast area until 11 am.  There was a special event on one of our days there, so we weren't even able buy one that evening.  We like the convenience of having it in the room early in the morning or at the end of a long day.

We were surprised by a mini bar charge, the system is automatic if you open the door and check out the supplies.  The front desk staff removed the charge immediately when we told them we were just looking at the variety of wines.  Also, Marriott member do not pay for wi-fi, so if that charge appears, you just request to have it removed.

title: Do not waste your money. You will be irritated.
text: Do not let the current rating of the hotel fool you. Especially for high status Marriott Bonvoy members (Ambassador and above), the customer service issues are so acute. As a business customer, they make the check in so difficult (why do I need to explain why my corporate amex does not have a company name on it). Second, they will do everything they can to avoid giving you an upgrade although the hotel is not even half booked. They will also remind you kindly that it is based on availability, which you have no way to confirm. The front desk is very arrogant,  not sure why completely as it is not even a luxury hotel. If you want to feel as a valued customer for a $800 room, this is not the hotel. This is why so many people leave bad reviews. Avoid.

title: Horrible service
text:
What a horrible experience at a brand I have been staying for 25 years and have been so loyal too.  I was rudely mistreated by this hotel front desk clerk Cesar and his glorious manager Gabby in a failed attempt to "manage revenue".   They ended losing $1800 of business trying to hassle an ambassador Marriott member.  Bad customer service is bad for business in the short term and long term.  My brand loyalty will go only so far and I can’t wait to see these two explaining why highest loyalty members are mistreated. 

 Btw, the hotel is a dump and has not been renovated since 90s.   It was convenient for my trip but certainly not the quality experience I was looking for.  The hotel is going to get in serious trouble  for questioning which credit card I use, and discrimination.

title: Mr David Mushin
text:
The hotel was ok have stayed a few times before.
But Customer Service TERRIBLE. Billing problems, Bonvoy problems.

No reply to my issues. Just auto replies saying we will get back to you soon.
Very frustrating.

title: Close to Lincoln Center and the Park!
text: Love this hotel! It’s right in the middle of bustling city, but we were able to relax and enjoy some family time with the hotel’s excellent room service. The front desk and valet car service were top notch, and everyone seemed to go out of their way to help us.

title: Wonderful stay in NYC
text: I enjoyed my stay at the JW Marriott Essex House.  It’s a great location near Central Park!  My guest room faced Central Park which was an unexpected treat.  The staff and management exceeded my expectations.  I had the opportunity to experience the M Lounge during my stay and it is in a large space with many food options for breakfast and in the evening.

title: Not worth the price
text: My partner and I stayed here for a week in August for our anniversary and paid to upgrade for a view...our view was of a brick wall and they would only be able to give us a proper central park view 3 days in to our stay, the pictures online are very misleading. Front desk staff were not the friendliest and not overly helpful either except for Carolynn at the concierge, she was absolutely lovely and very helpful. As for the restaurant, we were demanded to leave a larger tip then what we already had left by one of the waiters which was disgustingly rude and the staff seemed reluctant to serve you unless they knew you were going to leave a large tip. Definitely would not recommend and wouldn't stay here again when we go back to NYC

title: Fabuloso frente al central Park
text: Este hotel es una excelente alternativa para quienes quieren estar en la zona del central park, cercano a Columbus Circle y la Quinta Avenida.  Es un hotel de un edificio tradicional, pero con una restauración y conservación de lujo. Las habitaciones son muy cómodas y la estancia en general fue genial, tanto que nos repetimos en febrero.

title: Always good to be back
text:
Reception is excellent staff is friendly
Hannah In reception is extremely hospitable.
Definitely wouldn’t recommend it for others to stay.
The room and its amenities are very nice.
Overall hotel services are excellent.

Always good to be back

title: Amazing stay at the JW Marriott Essex
text: Our 9-night stay at the JW Marriott Essex House in March of this year was all around superb. From check in to check out, the staff provided outstanding customer service. Located right across Central Park, the view was wonderful each day we stepped out of the hotel. The area is safe and nearby lots of eateries and shops. I would like to commend housekeeping, most notably Maria who took wonderful care of our room. She left such sweet notes that made us feel so welcome. Additionally, Howard Jackowitz, the concierge, was extremely accommodating. He arranged for a private driver for the day so we could visit colleges all around New York. Overall, I highly recommend this hotel if you are visiting the city. Coming from Hawaii, the staff at JW made our stay such an amazing and memorable one. Aloha and mahalo JW Marriott Essex House!

title: NO RESPONSE IN 30 DAYS
text: I  have tried to contact hotel and front desk via email and phone calls for billing error, and problem resolution! NO ONE FOLLOWED UP in 30 DAYS!  Am I  not a valued guest, and Marriot Bonvoy member who has stayed at your hotel numerous times?

title: JW Marriott Essex House New York
text:
The JW Marriott Essex House, commonly known as the Essex House,  is a luxury hotel at 160 Central Park South in Midtown Manhattan, New York City, at the southern border of Central Park. 
The hotel opened in late 1931, is 44 stories tall and contains 426 Art Deco–style rooms and 101 suites, as well as 147 condominium residences. It features a distinctive red neon rooftop sign.
JW Marriott Essex House New York is a member of Historic Hotels of America, the official program of the National Trust for Historic Preservation.
Check - in and check- out was was very friendly, efficient and professional, like all encounters with other staff as well.
Recognition of Lifetime Marriott - Bonvoy - Level.
The well appointed, clean and fresh smelling junior suite was overlooking NY City and city areas. 
Plenty of space to hang and store your clothes, sit on couches and chairs to relax and desks to work and or organize your days. 
Unsecured Wifi was working strong throughout our 3 night stay.
Beds were extremely comfortable with solid menu choices of pillows.
Room & bathroom were spotless clean, perfect job done by housekeeping.
Water pressure in shower and sinks on 22nd floor was very good.
Towels are fluffy, plentiful and smell nice.
Room - service and offerings are great, of good quality and competitively priced for NY. 
Unfortunately there was no water kettle or Nespresso machine available in room but numerous Starbucks, Pret and other shops within 2 mins walking distance from hotel.
Les Clefs d’Or concierge team is old school with great ideas and tips and can make things happen in NY at any time.
As a family, we really enjoyed our stay at the Essex House and we are already planning our next trip back.

title: Thanksgiving Let Down
text:
I am a Bonvoy member and stay at Marriott properties when possible. I have a dream of taking my family of 5 to New York City for the Macy's Day parade. I was so excited to learn that rooms can be booked at the  JW Marriott Essex that provide a view of the parade. On the app I was unable to book a room with the assurance it would provide a view. 
I called the JW Marriott Essex directly and connected to reservations. I was met over the phone with an incredibly rude service representative. I explained why I was calling and that I could not book a room. I provided the ages of my children (6,6 and 15). Our family always books 1 room (Disney, Chicago...everywhere). The sales representative told me that she could put me up in another hotel however I wanted to stay at this property to view the parade. Her response "well that's not happening". 
I was beyond disappointed that someone could say that to a loyal customer. As if she was saying "oh well". 
I can tell you this, Marriott hotels obviously only want the cookie cutter family of 4 and do not want anything else. In addition, I won't be staying at Marriott properties again. 

Disappointed,

Katie Ward

title: Very good!!
text:
We were travelling as a family of three to NYC for the first time and were overwhelmed by the accommodation choices!  Very happy we chose the JW Marriott for the following reasons:
- location was excellent 
- friendly hotel staff 
- concierge staff,  Polina and Carolynn, were very helpful 
- beds were super comfy and there was no street noise
- nice lounge for a cocktail 

We were however disappointed with the view from our room on the 10th floor which essentially was  an inner “courtyard”- the brick walls of the hotel.  We were told there were no other options as we needed a room with two beds.    The room itself was spacious but had some of the peeling wallpaper I had read about in other posts, along with some peeling in the bathtub and a chipped mirror.  We had a dirty shower curtain the day we checked in which did get changed on the third day of our four day stay.  Some small stains on the wallpaper were never wiped away.  Perhaps they are permanent.  These are the reasons for a four star rating instead of five.

title: Great location, wonderful staff, average rooms
text:
Even though The Plaza is our favorite NYC hotel, we decided to give Essex House a try.

Obviously, the location on Central Park South is great.

However, the rooms say mid-level, average Marriott, and we ran into some issues while staying here that we wouldn't have expected at a JW Marriott.  

Fortunately, the real saving grace of this property is the wonderful, gracious staff who made sure to rectify everything to our satisfaction, but more than that, were just genuinely exceptionally lovely people.

title: hotel close to central park
text: we visited New York city for 3 days, stayed at mariott Essex hotel. we had a beautiful view of central park. the staff were very friendly and helpful,  but the cleaness needs to improve. the location was great, we could walk everywhere to shopping centers and moma museum.

title: NY Weekend, Top location with average rooms
text: From a travel perspective, location is excellent, Having stayed at an excellent JW Marriott in Florida earlier this year helped influence my decision to try the Essex House by Central Park. I anticipated the smaller rooms being in downtown NY in an older building, but the rooms with a view overlooking central park are significantly smaller than the rooms with a side view. They do not tell your the differences upon check in. I had a tight room with a great view and my fiends had a more comfortable room with not much of a view. The hotel in the common areas and hallways is nicely appointed, but the same level of luxury as my Florida stay was not there in the guest rooms and there were no coffee makers in either of our rooms. All in all, average sums it up for this weekend getaway.

title: Nice time in Central Park Suite
text:
Had a nice 6 day stay, got upgraded from the Manhattan suite to Central Park View Suite (and a temporary normal room since we got there too early). Lounge breakfast was good, they also have food (dinner level but only 2 options) after 5pm and coffee at other times. 
Made good use of the destination fee between zoo tickets, food and laundry. I debated between RC and this and for probably the same price got a much better suite and a lounge with good variety.
The one thing that could be better : water bottles. Both in the lounge and gym people were taking 3-4 at a time since they were mini bottles - wish they had the regular sized ones instead.

title: Unhappy people
text: The property needs a renovation. Overpriced just for the prime location. Unfriendly and rude person in charge of the Executive lounge. Breakfast quality poor. Room service don't answer the phone. The lady at check-in and the bellboy (Kofi) were cool.

title: Thank you, Luis!
text:
Family had a lovely stay at Essex House. Can’t be the location, right across from Central Park. We stayed in a suite, which was quite spacious, especially for NYC.  The room was updated and modern. The shower looked a bit dated and the tub was dusty around the edges, but other than thar I loved the room. The bed was very comfortable and the walk in closet was a bonus. They don’t keep coffeemakers in the room, but they will bring it up if you ask, including with actual milk. We didn’t want to get coffee service every day so we used the ice bucket for the milk. We had to refresh the ice about twice a day, but it worked.  Destination fee comes with 2 courtesy tickets to the zoo (wish I had known that ahead of time) and a $35 meal credit and I think a laundry credit. 

Parking is a whopping $95 and we were told the rate is going up…. 

The hotel staff was very welcoming, especially one of the front door attendants, Luis. He was very respectful, courteous, and very warm. Whenever we came back from an outing, he made us feel like he was welcoming us home.  

Overall, it was a really nice stay and I’d stay at the Essex House again.

title: Incredible!
text:
I have been platinum with Marriott for about 10 years now & travel a lot both for work and leisure. I would say my expectations are high.  My 2 night stay at JW Essex House exceeded all expectations. I expected location and the building itself to be wonderful. But service there blew me away! From Jamilla at check-in, to Ramon, to Omar at the restaurant, to guys at the bell desk… everyone treated us like we were guests of honor there. The only other time I had that experience was at Ritz Carlton Cancun. 

Thank you to the team! What a treat and I can’t wait to be back. 

Kamilla.

title: Amazing location.  Not inexpensive.
text: The location is amazing!  We stayed for a few nights in a junior suite.  Used award points for some.  Our room was in the back and was very quiet.  The space was large enough for our family.  The breakfast that was included was just ok. I’d recommend eating at one of the many restaurants in the neighborhood.  The hotel is pricey and I’m not sure we would have stayed there if we didn’t have points to use.

title: Traumaufenthalt nach COVID im EssexHouse
text:
Best mögliche Lokation direkt am Central Park
Wir hatten ein Zimmer im 28. Stock mit Blick auf den Central Park. Da unsere Ankunft schon am späten Vormittag war, hatten wir Sorge, nach einem langen Flug erst später einchecken zu können, war kein Problem, wir bekamen sofort das Zimmer, super freundlicher Empfang, Zimmer perfekt sauber, bestens ausgestattet.
Frühstück war sehr gut. Concierge extrem freundlich und bemüht.
Jederzeit wieder in New York: JW Essex HOUSE

title: What a disappointment!
text: We were only there for 2 nights for family wedding.  No service to the room at all during that time, even though I called for new towels.  Towels never showed.  Restaurant with limited menu (no soup at all).  Not worth the $$$ at all!

title: Love this place
text:
When I travel to NY, occasionally the pricing at the Essex House is within company policy.  This last time it was.  The location is just amazing - right across the street from the park.  For business travel they have everything you need: good lighting, good outlets, good place to work.

I was fortunate to stay in a higher floor, which I would recommend because the lower floors can be noisy. 

Staff was superb, as was the stay.

title: Fabulous - We give it a 96%
text:
Real old-world charm and ambiance.  Subdued and quiet.  Staff was great, especially Gary who check us in.   Gary understands the secret to the hospitality business: Make every guest feel special!  As a Life Titanium member with 1,700 Marriott nights, we were upgraded to a very spacious two room suite.  The concierge breakfast buffet amenity for elite members may be about the best in the country.   Late 4PM checkout?  No problem.  The Marriott Corp does a great job of keeping their customers loyal!!!   the location is beyond fabulous.  With over 3,000 hotel nights in our past, this may be one of our favorite hotels worldwide.
So why did I give it 96% and not 100%?   I'm so glad you asked!
First, there is the "destination fee" which I prefer to refer to as the "destination rip-off".  It's a real shame that the great Marriott company has to subscribe to this nickel-and-diming of guests.
DANGEROUS:  slippery shower floor and no grab-bars.   Where are corporate standards?  Is the insurance company watching?
No convenient electric outlets or USP ports on one night table.
Robes and towels are old and hard.  In fact, one towel was actually fraying.
--Definitely avoid the restaurant!!!  Food was "pretty good" but not nearly worth $36 for a burger with bacon or $31 for a modest salad serving with four medium size grilled shrimp or $30+ for a pasta dish.  
Weighing the pro's and cons, the pro's greatly great points greatly overcome the complaints.   Fabulous hotel!

title: We were led to believe this was a luxury hotel?!
text: We came to NYC from the UK to celebrate our daughter's significant birthday and our wedding anniversary.  We mentioned both before we arrived.  We weren't expecting an upgrade but it would have been nice and the hotel didn't see busy at all to be honest.  We got a measly plate of strawberries and a bottle of non alcoholic cider, and of course no upgrade - to be expected!  The room (2014) was ok but noisy with the aircon vents for the whole building right outside our room.
