The icing on the cake was that my view was of other brick buildings. This is what my Marriot Rewards gets me. Should've gone to the Hilton or the Hyatt. I will NOT be returning to a $500 a night room with no views!!!

title: Central Park must do
text: Great property on the edge of times square and Central Park.  The staff, property and facilities are all top notch (dare I say "spacious" for NYC).  The lobby is gorgeous, as is the restaurant and bar area.  The elevators remind you of classic films, and if you get a central park view, you're in for a wonderful treat each time you look outside your window.

title: Efficient & Convenient
text: It had been 5 years since we had last stayed at this peoperty and the recent renovations are quite nice. The traditional Essex House decor shows well in the public spaces, and the lobby is welcoming. Valet and doorman services is quick and efficient, especially for NY. Check-in is quick. The members lounge offers a nice, full breakfast and the restaurant next door is convenient. A variety of packages are offered including different room grades, amenities and meals so pick one that suits your tastes.

title: Excellent front desk staff and great service overall!
text: I almost never write a review but the service at the Essex House for our stay here in NY has been so great I decided to write.  The valet and bellman were both terrific, incredibly prompt, and helped answer all of our questions.  But a special shout out to Melvin at the front desk.  He worked super hard to ensure we were in a very quiet room and also helped figure out a room that would work for us since our daughter was unexpectedly traveling with us.  Thank you Melvin and all of the staff at this beautiful hotel!

title: Lovely hotel
text: Convenient location, clean hotel, nice member lounge. The best were comfortable, and the room was quiet. There's an adjoining restaurant with mediocre drinks and terrible unfriendly service. I wouldn't recommend that.

title: Unverzeihlich schlecht
text:
Bellboys bei Ankunft nicht aufmerksam und nur auf der Jagd nach Tipgeld. Uniformen optisch nicht gepflegt.

Checkin wie immer als Bonvoy Platinum Member kein Upgrade möglich, ich würde zulange bleiben so die Mitarbeiterin, nach Diskussionen gab es eins. Upgrade war
enttäuschend. Übernachtungspreis im
Gästezimmer, Kingsize Bed (USD 650). Zusätzlich Destination Fee pro Tag (USD 35), welche im Hotel wieder eingelöst werden können. Rezeptionsmitarbeiterin sehr freundlich. 

Bonvoy ist ein schlechtes Kundenprogramm und bringt nur minimale Vorteile. Man ärgert sich nur, denn billige Ausreden werden vorgetäuscht, damit die Leistung nicht erbracht werden muss. Nach über 5 Jahren höchster Status weiss ich wovon ich reden. Überall gibt es im Programm Sternchen mit Randbemerkungen, wann, wie, wo was ausgeklammert werden kann.

Zimmer mega klein, abgenutztes Mobiliar, dreckiges kleines Fenster, was den Blick auf den Central Park leider trübte, kleiner Schreibtisch und bietet sehr wenig Platz für einen Geschäftsreisenden zu arbeiten, Safe war vom Vormieter geschlossen und musste geöffnet werden,  trotz Öffnung war der Safe nicht benutzbar, da Batterie leer, Wasserkocher fehlte und Lieferung kostete USD 10 extra, kein Flaschenwasser auf dem Zimmer. Badezimmer ebenfalls klein, keine Ablagen, auch keine Ablagen am Waschbecken, Toilettebrille schief montiert, kleine Badewannen/Dusch Kombination, im Kleiderschrank als Ablage ein optisch altes Ablagebrett.

Executive Lounge: Schrecklich ungemütlich ausladend eingerichtet, Kaffee und Heisswasser aus Pumpspender, Kaffeemaschine vorhanden, keine Gläser und Tassen vorhanden dafür Pappbecher, Wasser aus Plastikflaschen 237 ml (NO GO Umwelt), kein Service, Essen schlecht.

Room Service war schnell aber überteuert. Liebloser Burger mit Pommes knapp USD 40 inkl. Plastikblume als Dekoration. Jede Lieferung wird mit USD 5 extra berechnet. 

Wäscheservice ebenso ein No Go. Überteuert und alle Hemden sind faltig geliefert worden. Alle Hemden mussten von mir bei gebügelt werden. 

Überteuerter Spa: Haarschnitt z. B. USD 185.

Liebes Hotel bitte keine Rechtfertigung! 

Kurzum nie wieder!

title: dobra lokalizacja drogi zabytkowy gotel
text:
hotel dobrze położony, zabytkowy, ale w Polsce miałby najwyżej 4 gwiazdki, pokój standardowy nawet na wysokim piętrze będzie miał widok na ścianę ...! Jeżeli chcesz jakikolwiek widok lub na Central Park musisz zapłacić ponad 1200 $ za noc
Mieszkałem w pokoju 1126 a hałas z sąsiedniej łazienki obudził nas w nocy ...1 To żenujące w hotelu 5 * szczególnie po remoncie za 200 milonów $ ...!!! Hotel jest elegancki ale po tym remoncie w pokojach nie wiele zostało.  Za te pieniądze można by zbudować nowy , ale to NY.....!

title: Fabulous property and location but perhaps overwhelmed
text: The recent renovation of rooms is quite nice, but perhaps has lost some of the old-school luxury charm of the hotel. The location can't be beat. Fabulous lobby. Service is just OK relative to previous ownership. Little to no value for Bonvoy Titanium Platinum status. Some deluxe rooms with wall view. VIP lounge is overrun at breakfast making a table for 4 or more almost impossible. Staff response to guest issues not in-line with luxury property.

title: Classic Hotel, Great Location
text: My CEO has been staying here for many years and as a result when our team comes to NYC for meetings this has been our to go. I think this past time will be our last. The price is just too high--over $500 for a Tuesday night in a standard room. The rooms are a good size for NYC and the location is superb. My issue is just that there are other hipper hotels, for a better price. It's a fine hotel. Expect the grandiose classic design in the lobby. Everything just feels a little dated.

title: Made my childhood dream come true
text:
I had to write this review after receiving such wonderful service from Yamira on the front desk last week. 

I had always wanted to stay at Essex House since I was a little girl after seeing the hotel on TV and on movies. During a walk around Central Park during a week long holiday 3-9 Feb, I saw the iconic building towering over the South of Central Park. My husband and I decided to venture in for an afternoon coffee (just to say I’d been inside really). The restaurant staff were very accommodating to us and the overall feel of the restaurant is very welcoming. It is situated in a perfect spot for watching the world go by. 

My husband decided to ask at the front desk to see if it would be possible to stay on our final night in NYC in a room overlooking Central Park as it was my birthday the day we departed for home. 

Yamira could not have been more helpful. She was very happy to assist us in every way. She ensured we got a good deal for a room with a spectacular view. Not only that, she surprised us on check in with room service including a birthday cake, a bottle of Prosecco and a hand written birthday card. It really made my day. 

The room was beautiful. The hotel was amazing and Yamira made the whole experience 100% better...thank you so much!

title: Terrible service from the front desk - killed the charm of an otherwise beautiful property
text: The wifi in my room (4th floor) was so bad I was unable to work - a problem when traveling for business. When I requested help from the front desk, they were indifferent. When I requested the code to access the conference floor access point (right below me) the answer was "no" - bounced it up to the manager - still "no" - I am a platinum member - as a result, won't come back here again. Sent an email to the main Marriott contact - no response 4 days later.

title: Wonderful stay
text: Stayed here for five nights.  Staff at reception were helpful and efficient when dealing with a reservation glitch.  Rooms clean and well appointed.  Relocated to a room on 39th floor - spectacular views over Central Park.  Well worth it!

title: Extremely poor service and soft product overshadow a great hard product
text: We've stayed here multiple times - given the location and history of the building, we want to compare it to the JW Grosvenor House in London, but a comparison is almost impossible. Beyond the location, this hotel pales in comparison to the Grosvenor House in every other possible measure. Despite being lifetime platinum members at Marriott, we received extremely poor service from the front desk. Makes me wonder what service non members can expect to receive. We had complained about the service the previous time we stayed there too and were dismayed to see that there had been no improvement. We arrived pretty late - past 2am after almost 24 hrs of travel. Despite there being 3 people at the front desk, not one of them raised their head to acknowledge the fact that we were there. We eventually went up to one of them and without raising her head to greet us her first response was go to the next person. This next person made it feel like we were interrupting her more important work and dejectedly asked to see ID - no smile, no welcome, no how can I help you. We complained about this and asked to see the manager who was more welcoming and understood our level of disappointment given how tired we were. The rooms were tiny, the Grosvenor House makes us feel special especially because of our status and always goes out of their way to give us the best available upgrades. No such luck at the Essex house, we got a tiny room on the 3rd floor. Service doesn't even stand up to Courtyard standards, let alone JW standards. Front office staff is extremely poorly trained and unfriendly. Overall - avoid. Stay at the Ritz on CPS if you have to be on the park instead. Service

title: LOVED IT
text: We travelled to New York with another family.  We got the family connector rooms....not cheap but worth every penny.  For New York hotels, the rooms are very large.  Bed is super comfortable.  Shower and amenities great.  Hotel staff is awesome and duper helpful.  Fitness center is excellent with ......get this.....sauna and steam room. Location is fantastic and right across from Central Park.  For Marriott Uber Reward members the Concierge Lounge has a spectacular breakfast.  Will be back again!

title: Great hotel, hard to get to
text: We had a wonderful time at this hotel. The staff were helpful and friendly. The lobby was beautiful. The room was clean, spacious and comfy. Didn’t have a great view (we were on the back side of the hotel and could only see an alley) but it was still a nice room. The only issue was that the road was closed at random times for the majority of our stay and it was extremely difficult to get Uber’s to pick us up. When we checked out we had to drag all our luggage about half a mile through crowds in the freezing cold to get to a car. This is just something to keep in mind. For this reason alone I probably wouldn’t stay here again in Winter. Other than that, we had a great time.

title: Couples Weekend
text: My wife and I routinely go to this hotel for weekend getaways to the city. We are always very satisfied with the service, check-in etc...Our room was ready on time (@ 12:00 PM) as per my on line check-in via the Bonvoy app. The room is always very clean and the beds are remarkably comfortable. The bar this time of year was rather busy but the service was excellent. We did have one glitch. The parking garage could not fin my car so it did take an extra 30 min to find and bring my car around. Yamira at the front desk waived my parking fee, which we though was so gracious. I will say that Yamira has checked us in several times and she is one of the best, most attentive front desk people I have seen and I travel quite a bit. I hope she checks us in next time. Hats off to her.

title: Pour l’emplacement
text:
J’ai séjourné 5 jours dans cet hôtel dans le cadre d’un déplacement professionnel. Emplacement top face au parc. Pour le reste.... mais où est donc passé le sens du service et de l’accueil ? 

Chambre ok mais c’est quand même un minimum. Par contre pas de bouilloire... sympa quand on se réveille à 4am à cause du décalage horaire. 

Le service au restaurant est inexistant. Sourires absents, Accueil glacial. C’est mécanique et automatique. 

Franchement pour le prix il y a bien mieux à NYC.

title: JW Marriott brand diluted - not really a 5-star hotel IMO
text:
My husband and I stayed 5 nights here from Dec. 9-14. We were here on business and pleasure. Our room was on the 5th floor and faced 58th street. We've stayed at other JW Marriott hotels, but lately, we've noticed a drop in the level of service/quality.

Pros: location, the staff was attentive and friendly. Our room was well-appointed and supplied robes, slippers and bathroom amenities. The hotel was decorated nicely for the holidays.

Cons regarding the room: no full-length mirror (only 1 mirror in bathroom), very small closet, drafty (windows not sealed) to the point of us catching colds even though windows were closed and blinds were drawn the entire time.

Cons regarding the executive lounge: 2 out of the 4 days shoo-ed us out right at 11 a.m. so they could use the space for a reception for a conference. On another day they ended breakfast an hour early. On 2 of the days, we were not allowed to enter the lounge until 5 pm (we usually have access to the lounge all day to get drinks and snacks).  Management decided to prioritize some company's conference's needs over the Customers who pay for the Executive Lounge. This was not a good move on Management's part - I was not the only upset customer.  Finally, the Executive Lounge (during breakfast on Friday) felt more like a circus/Marriott-like as it was filled with mostly families with young children.  Having stayed at JW Marriotts elsewhere, we've never seen either of these things happen before.

Note: charging $35 per day "resort fee" was a bit ridiculous, in my opinion.  (This is another thing that made it feel more like a Marriott than a JW Marriott.) We didn't have time to use the gym, so what is that fee for?  We found out we could apply a portion of it to charges made in the bar (charged to our room) and to laundry.  The prices in the hotel bar were high, even by San Francisco standards ($16 for a shot of Frangelico).

There is a back door in the hotel that opens onto 58th street which is useful, especially when it is raining. This is a nice hotel, however, it appears the JW Marriott brand is being diluted - it's not in the same class as the St. Regis which is a truly deserving of a 5-star rating.

title: ちょとリッチなホテル
text:
新婚旅行で滞在しました。チェックイン時にフロントで部屋のランクが下がると言われました。ポイントで返すと結われました。年始年始だったのか予定より1時間早くチェックインしたのが理由か？プラチナエリートなのに部屋のグレードが下がってました。バスタブの部屋にしたはずがシャワーだけで、部屋に無料のフルーツや水もおいてなかった。部屋から年越しの花火が見れると期待していたのに残念でした。
立地は最高です。ホテルの従業員も素晴らしいです。過去に近くのいくつかのホテルに泊まりましたが値段は同じ位なのに他のホテルはサービス従業員の質は悪かった。ニューヨークはホテル代が高いので逆に安いと思いました。
セントラルパークが目の前なのでランナーにはオススメします。走り終わったら入口でミネラルウォーターが用意してありました。近くに美味しいレストランもいくつかあり、コロンバスサークルが近いのでホールフーズも近くにありました。
年越しの花火は歩いて１分で見られます。
また泊まりたいです。

title: Boxing Day in NYC
text: We had a wonderful stay at the J.W. Marriott Essex House. We were greeted by Greg at the Front Desk who extended a warm welcome and took excellent care of us. The Essex Room was larger than we had expected based on other reviews. We were very pleased with the comfortable bed and walk-in shower. We would highly recommend the J.W. Marriott Essex House for it location, well appointed rooms and courteous staff members, most notably Greg. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay in New York City.

title: TERRIBLE CHECK IN/ OUT EXPERIENCE
text: I will start by saying that i love Marriott brand, i always choose Marriott hotels over other   hotels. We recently stayed at JW Marriott Essex House and had one of the most terrible experience ever. We drove all the way from Vermont to New York, so we can be there for New Year's Eve, it took us almost all night because of the winter storm, i called the hotel to ask if we can have an early check in and they said YES, which i really appreciated and was grateful for, but.... When we finally got there and after checking in  and going to the room the front desk clerk  start calling the room to say that they can't find the keys to our truck, which we gave  to the valet driver, they called our room nonstop since we arrived that they could not still find the truck keys. The next day, our check out day...it took them forever to bring our truck upfront, we called the desk twice to make sure they did not forget about us, we gave back the green parking ticket which was suppose to be $95 and told them to charge it to the room. Next day when i got my hotel bill i found out that i was actually charged twice for parking, $190 ( for exceeding the 24 hour permit) and another separate charge in amount of another $190.00?????????? Very very disappointed with the stuff that never apologized for disturbing our stay or never called to notify us that they finally found our truck keys

title: Run down facilities, poor management and hygiene practices
text: Very disappointing hotel for the JW Marriott brand: the room was dated and dirty, the gym equipment was mostly broken. There was an electrical issue with a flickering lightbulb that took two days and a lot of back-and-forth to resolve. One day I returned to see that housekeeping had left an open bag of garbage (including bathroom items from other rooms) on top of the bed, I was put on hold repeatedly by management when I called to have it removed (I eventually moved it to the hallway myself).

title: Dated but still classy
text:
Love the location and the staff were very accommodating. The room was big but needs a facelift. 

We had breakfast on the main floor restaurant and it was good. 

I would next time get view of Central Park.

title: Substantially Overpriced, Average Hotel
text:
I stayed here years ago before Marriott took over and it was the iconic hotel that deserved the rave reviews it received. Great location and a fantastic, luxury hotel. 

All that is left is the location. The hotel is actually a 3 star (at best) hotel, but priced to imply it is equivalent to The Surrey, etc. 

Quite frankly, it's dishonest and the Marriott should be embarrassed.

The staff and folks at the hotel are warm, friendly, and do their best. But the property is a sad shell of what it once was and the pricing is appalling given what the customer receives.

title: Decent overnight for a staycation, but NOT a luxury experience
text:
Long story short: this property has a beautiful location but is really showing its age (and not in the way it SHOULD), and service was really bad across the board.

Our suite (I was very happy to see that our upgrade request had cleared!) had chipped paint all over, a crack in the siding in the bathroom, and just in general needed to be updated. There was no bottled water waiting in the room for us, and when I called down before leaving asking that someone drop it off, they said okay but then never did it. There was no turndown service, and the elite lounge experience was pretty lackluster. 

Check in was a zoo, and when I asked if they had an Elite check in line, as an Ambassador member, I was told "this is an Elite property, so that's not a thing here." That is also not a thing, I'm afraid.

Lastly, the 4pm checkout that is guaranteed to Platinums and above was not available to us, but I was told they would make a "very big exception" to offer me a 2pm checkout - again, not in line with Marriott's required offerings.

It was still a nice stay, and the view from our suite was really great, but I was expecting a creme-de-la-creme 5 star experience, and it fell quite short of that. At this price point, there are undoubtedly better options in NYC.

title: Fun in the City
text: My husband and I come to NYC every Christmas. This was our first stay at this hotel. We enjoyed the location, the service and hotel staff. We stayed in a Manhattan suite which was a nice room with 1.5 bath and nice views of the city.

title: Perfect Location
text:
We stayed at the Essex House in mid-December. The Central Park location was perfect! Great access to all the sights! Central Park is right across the street -also close to museums, Rockefeller Center, Radio City Music Hall, Times Square, etc. 
However, I was concerned about street noise since I am a light sleeper. We checked into an interior room which was perfect! It was extremely quiet-no view-but I would rather have the quiet room! We got a great night’s sleep every night. The Club Lounge was fantastic! A great breakfast buffet every morning and great food in the evening. 
Thanks We were not given an upgrade when we checked in ( we are titanium status) but the front desk associate sent a bottle of wine and chocolates to make up for it. The service in all areas of the hotel was excellent-front desk, club lounge, housekeeping, restaurant. This will be our go-to hotel on future visits to New York!

title: Just the bare minimum...
text:
On the plus side: Great location, iconic hotel, (at last) some central park views

But I'd expect a lot more from hotel in this price range and JW Marriott branding and when being in their top tier elite (Ambassador) status. They are certainly not into surprise and delight but rather on focusing on just delivering the absolute minimum: First off suite night awards didn't clear despite ample inventory available and (I believe going unsold) followed by a room allocation that technically was central park view but not really (floor 4 out of 40 with a delightful view of a tree and ample street noise) and was shoebox sized room. That despite of having requested a high floor and having offered to check in later they still were adamant that this would be my room and that's the best I'd get). I managed to get a slightly bigger room on a higher up floor for the last night - but it really felt like I had to fight for it (and still got some attitude plus a park view cum scaffolding).

And then there were things on which they didn't even delivered what they were supposed to... - e.g., not even answering to a Your24 request, no turndown service provided, no information about elite benefits and what comes with the destination fee , no answering on my feedback on the Bonvoy app's question how my stay was going (guess what this read) and more (like even having to chase proper points credit / them cutting a corner on welcome points).

So, pretty disappointing

title: All that glitters is not gold..
text: We stayed here for couple of nights and were disappointed to say the least, we’ve stayed at many JW’s around the world so had similar (high) expectations from this one but we’re proved wrong. We understand that it’s located at a premium location of a busy city so we ignored their tiny lobby and all other typical fancy treatment that you’d generally expect from a JW, we’re particularly disappointed by their service and lack of basic amenities. A few hours after we checked in a family showed up at our door claiming the room has been assigned to them, it was amusing at first but it took a while to get sorted out and was not a pleasant experience. Their tiny lounge had nothing much to enjoy or remember and nobody likes a rude staff bothering you to check your room number while you’re eating. We stayed at the Sheraton Times Square as well during this trip and would rate them much higher than this JW, so in a nutshell, all that glitters is not gold and this expression perfectly fits this JW.

title: Outstanding service, Fantastic Location, a really great experience
text: From the moment we walked in until the moment we left we were treated to the upmost in quality service. To a person everyone we encountered was professional courteous and friendly. We had a room with a view of the park which made our experience all that much better. The room was spotless and the bed very comfortable. The Essex House is not inexpensive but like everything else in New York City you get what you pay for. And what you're paying for at the Essex House is a luxury hotel in a fantastic location with an outstanding staff.

title: 5 STARS !!
text:
This is without a doubt the most amazing hotel I've stayed in NYC! 
The staff are outstanding and make the stay special they go above and beyond to delight you though out the stay! Bappy at the bar was very nice ! 
We will definitely come back next time we are in NY. 

If you get the chance to stay here you will not be desappointed !

title: A lot of room for improvement
text:
So, we typically stay at the Parker meridian when we stay in midtown manhattan but now that hotel is not longer a Starwood property and is, in fact, split into 2 hotels. So, this time we chose the Essex house b/c we can earn & use marriott points. There were 5 of us: a teen son & our adult son/girlfriend, my husband and myself. We need to have 3 separate living spaces with preferably 3 bathroom options [like double room for our adult son & gf and perhaps a suite with 2 bathrooms or adjoining rooms for the teen and us]. But best we could do during this thanksgiving week was a suite w/ pull out be in living room, and two doors into the 1 shared bathroom + the double room for adult son/gf. The hotel was sold out so we did not have a lot of options—that was the set up for our 5 night stay.

The good: the suite was quite large, both the bedroom and living room and fairly nicely updated. Since we could not get a 2 bathroom suite & they had no more adjoining situations, the 2 doors into the bathroom were helpful. [It is much more awkward when the teen has to go thru our bedroom to get to bathroom]. The bathroom had a separate walk in shower & tub, also preferable, but it would have been more functional if the toilet was separate from the main bathroom so someone could be showering while someone else used toilet. Bed very comfortable, the safe big enough for anything you want to store electronics wise. Walk in closet, desk, all laid out well. Very quiet too, though i will say our room overlooked basically to interior of utility area of hotel. Some machine clatter but pretty muted with windows closed. Not sure what it would’ve been like for room overlooking street with traffic noise. Also, good location b/c right across street from central park & about 10ish blocks to Times Square & broadway [which is why we were here to see several shows]. Staff is fairly responsive, if a bit slow, to requests but see below.

Now the bad: lobby was a bit dowdy & dead. There is a restaurant off the lobby but we couldn’t for life of us use it b/c it always seemed about to close when we might want late bite/drink/snack etc. there was an area outside of the restaurant to sit and maybe have drink but the one time we were there, there were dirty glasses and dishes on every table/coffee table etc. and we sat there for almost 2 hours one evening about 9-11pm and no one came out to move dishes, offer us a drink or whatever. It was just odd & off putting. We ended up going into restaurant and just harassing people to give us items—water, menu drinks & then we would carry out. No one offered to help or come out or ever walked out the door. Just odd.

Though the rooms are fairly roomy and nicely decorated, i found it a bit shabby at the corners. Chipped baseboards, some discoloration on tiles, grubby grout-not new looking bath mats etc. wouldn’t take much to make it look crisp but clearly no one cared. I also had a problem with cleanliness of bathrooms. Debris on the floor, not very clean under toilet. That old bath mat actually had specs of dirt or something on it and the next day when the room was “Cleaned” the specs never got vacuumed. Finally, i just called down and asked to replace bath mat b/c who wants to walk around barefoot on that? The pull out couch in living room was VERY uncomfortable with old mattress with springs almost poking through and it kind of curled up like a lumpy taco. The first morning after my son slept on it, he talked about feeling really uncomfortable all night & usually he sleeps like the dead. So we tried to see if they could bring in a new mattress and they couldn’t. They offered a rollaway but then the whole point of a EXPENSIVE suite with living room would have become moot with bed set up in the free space. Finally, they brought 2 mattress pads & then you could not close the pull out with out stripping off the pads & piling in the corner. Anyway, you get the picture—just not a functional situation when you are paying through the nose for a suite. Last thing, housekeeping was VERY sporadic and in the 4th day of being there, our room was not cleaned at least once, we made up the pull out at least 3 times, and, when cleaned, dirty dishes were not cleared etc. it was just not a thorough cleaning. So, i dont think i will stay here again. It was as expensive as a top tier hotel, but not run like a top tier hotel.

title: Do not stay without a earplug!
text: Although the hotel is reasonable for its category, be aware that if you stay at a room facing the 58th street you will not be able to sleep without a earplug. Trash trucks run the whole night and the windows are of poor quality with no noise reduction.

title: Great Hotel in Central Park area
text: The Essex House is great.  We only stayed two nights and didn't have any meals here but we did have drinks in the bar.  Great atmosphere and plenty of seating.  They offer complimentary coffee in the morning which was so convenient.  The rooms are spacious and clean.  Will definlty book here again.

title: Lovely
text: We stayed for 3 nights in October with a Central Park view, which as noisy. We stayed on VISA and Marriott points so were not affected by the $800 per night rate.  There was a $35/day food/beverage credit, which we used, and a spa credit, which we didn't use. The hotel was beautiful, spotless, friendly. The room was spacious, the restaurant good. My one complaint was a bit of nickel and diming. We were charged $24 for a (small) bottle of water. We didn't actually take it, so we were credited. Room service was $50 for coffee, 2 English muffins, fruit and "homemade" granola--which came in a Kellogg's box. This wasn't bad actually, nor was the 18% gratuity, but the $5 delivery fee was silly. Since it was room service, the gratuity is for the service. I'd recommend it for those not on a budget--or with a lot of points.

title: Excellent operation but gold status no longer has access to Executive Lounge
text:
This is a world class hotel that knows how to run a New York location. Away from the chaos of the Marriott Marquis, the Essex house is perfect location near central park. 

Despite room service delivering items to our neighbors a few times at least we weren't charged for the robes that were sent there after it was straightened out.

Even though Gold status no longer has access to breakfast...all higher statuses can still access the first floor room for full breakfast and then dinner o'dourves. Can't wait until our next visit.

title: Simply Amazing!!!
text: What a wonderful first class hotel.  We just stayed here for the New York City Marathon and the accommodations as well as the staff were amazing.  The staff saw to our needs and they were all very pleasant and personable.  As for the accommodations, the room was spacious (large king size) and quite.  I would highly recommend.

title: Excellent with a touch of disappointment
text:
We arrived very early to New York unfortunately there was no  room available to us for check in. But you could notice that the crew did there utmost to try and expedite our check in.  
The hotel is Luxurious and even more beautiful than in the pictures.
The room was very clean, you can see it was visited by the cleaners several of time during the day.
The only two things i can say i was personally disappointed for:
One,  we came there for vacation and celebration of my birthday, usually at other hotels we stayed at along the years, took notice of it without the need to mention it. This time although we mentioned it, because we were disappointed at our previous hotel (we came from LA), not even a card waited for me at the room.
Second, we took the junior suite, which was a very nice, spacious room, but the down side, that it was not facing the Park.  
Since this is the only "bad" things i can say, we recommend this hotel and will surly return.

title: Nothing to not like
text: We've always stayed at the Mandarian Oriental in NYC.  However, the price of a suite went up to $3k there and it's just not worth that.  So we tried the Essex House and it was great.  It was a third the price of the Mandarin and just as nice.  We had a one bedroom suite with a Central Park View.  The view was out the bedroom window only for the park but that was adequate.  We asked and there are some rooms that have better and more expansive views.  The bed was comfortable.  The suite only had one bathroom but we managed without the powder room we usually had at the MO.  The shower was extremely powerful and it heated up immediately.  There was no hand held sprayer.  There was a sprayer next to the toilet like you see in some countries.  We had room service breakfast every day and it was perfect.  The mini bar was extremely expensive so I wouldn't recommend that.  It was $10 for a small bottle of water.  Club soda was $20!  Whole Foods is just down the street.  It is in a great location for walking to tons of things.  It's easy to get a cab or uber from there.  The staff was extremely friendly and helpful.  This is our new hotel for NYC.

title: Excellent Everywhere
text: From the moment we pull our car to the front of the Essex House, the service was beyond excellent. We were welcomed at the front desk and asked if we wanted an interior room or one that overlooked Central Park. The staff member even walked us to the elevator and gave us a little mini tour of the amenities. The room was lovely, the bathroom was clean, with ample towels, and the plush terry cloth robes were hung on the back of the door ready to be used.  I requested a room away from the elevators and quiet. That is exactly what we received! So thrilled!!! We had drinks in the bar after we return from the opera. The bartender was very busy but very attentive...a true professional.  The housekeeping staff was wonderful and helpful. We had breakfast in the Executive lounge and it was probably the most extensive buffet that I have seen in   an executive lounge.  The offering of an array of high quality fresh fruit and breads/pastries was impressive. The usual scrambled eggs, sausage, and bacon was on par. I have to comment that the valet service was so helpful and professional. We really had such a lovely stay from start to finish. The location of this hotel is also a high point. We walked to dinner and then to Lincoln Center to the MET Opera. We also walked to   Columbus Circle for lunch at Bouchon and for some shopping. It is an easy walk to 5th Avenue and a bit longer walk but manageable walk to Times Square. It’s also great for families eith the close proximity to the Natural History Museum, MET Art, and Central Park.

title: Para ser un JW Marriott le falta
text:
Este hotel frente al Central Park ofrece habitaciónes park view y como nos toco el piso 5 no veíamos el parque más bien la calle , este tipo de habitación es especialmente pequeña , el baño es pequeño , tiene servibar pero no cafetera 
Si quieres cafetera te la ponen por 10 dólares y ademas te cobran el café ( no muy bueno por cierto ) , me parece ridiculo
Cuando pagas 3800 dolls por 4 días , en cuanto a recepción y check in , a mi llegada era un caos increíble y las personas a cargo estaban estresadas y de mal humor al menos la que me atendió , el restaurant para desayuno bien con buen servicio el buffet no muy variado pero suficiente eso es lo que incluye el desayuno , también hay a la carta y se veía bien , en general ya hospedados se puede decir que el personal es amable y se interesa por satisfacer la cliente , cuando pedí que me cambiaran a una habitación con vista lo cual no se pudo , me permitieron subir a una suite en piso 38 
La vista es excepcional

title: Beautiful place
text:
My husband had business to do in New York and I was just tagging along. We didn’t have the best room with a view, it was on the third floor and inside the building, but we were happy to not have street noise. It’s a safe and convenient location to lots of places including the subway. 
Our room was very clean as was the rest of the hotel. Lots of events were happening throughout the week we stayed and only one time was the elevator lobby crowded. The restaurant was good, but with so many places nearby we only ate there twice. 
Someday I would like to return, but for now we’ve had our fill of NYC.

title: Not happy
text:
Checked in at end of September to our upgraded suite
We had stayed here at end of June with no issues:
We found lots of clumps of hair in the shower stall right away; mentioned it to front desk and to maintenance person, both said they would let manager know, heard nothing from anyone over the course of our stay. Was really shocked as I am a rewards member and always stay at marriotts

title: Always feels like home
text: Took wife on a business trip. We often stay at Essex house because of great location, room configurations that are great for families, the nice workout facility and the executive lounge for breakfast. This stay was as good as always.

title: Amazing location and room but lacking in service and value
text:
This is one of the best locations possible in NYC for everything we love about the city - Central Park most of all but also Broadway, Columbus, Fifth Avenue, almost all the best shopping and restaurants and landmarks, all within walking distance. We upgraded to an amazing large suite on the city side with a great terrace wonderful to enjoy day and night, room 2411, and I highly recommend that, at least if not possible to be on the Central Park side.

That said, there were some negative points that would have made my rating lower if not for the awesome location:
1) There is no lounge or other area from which to see the Central Park view from a high elevation - what a missed opportunity!!
2) As a Titanium Elite member, we enjoy the club access but this one is not at all memorable compared to many locations. There is no view, it’s very plain, just like a little diner or something. There are no alcoholic beverages provided complimentary in the evening as at many locations - instead they charge $14 if you want to pour yourself a glass of wine. There was no expresso machine and the hostess in the morning said we’d have to pay for expresso from the restaurant if we wanted that. Later, another gentleman brought us some expresso so that made up a little for the rather nasty way the first one had responded. It looks like they may be installing a new machine so hopefully this will improve.
3) Laundry was not delivered when promised and we had to call to have it searched for.
4) Cocktails such as a Manhattan in the restaurant were premixed and cost $28! That said, it was a great Manhattan but the price and being premixed doesn’t make it such an enjoyable experience to want to keep going back.

title: Struggling
text: Despite a great location across from Central Park the rooms are worn and lack basics for a hotel ... robes, water, coffee. Check in was also long. The worst was the roach in the bathroom ... needless to say, not what is expected at a moderately priced hotel

title: Great location and rooms
text:
Let's start with the obvious fact that the nightly rate can cause sticker shock. However, there is no doubt about what you get. Located right across the street from Central Park and other landmarks, it's in a great location.

The room itself was well maintained and clean. The staff was very professional and friendly. There were a few personal issues that came up, and they were there to help support. I would definitely stay here again if staying in the area.

title: Not what we expected
text: We stayed at the Essex House for one night.  Valet and check-in a breeze.  The room was just barely average for the cost point. Grout around tub was grubby, products in bathroom weren't anything special.  Noise from construction is fairly annoying in the morning.  Our alarm went off at 5am - thanks to the folks who left that on for us.  Check out was a nightmare - due to a wedding they moved the reception to the other side of lobby and the wait was tremendous.  The destination fee is for that day only, not the day you check out so very misleading way to obtain an extra $35 from you.  Valet parking is in 24 hour increments so be prepared to probably pay more than you expected as well.  Welcome to NYC!  Disappointing overall.

title: AWFUL IN ALMOST EVERY WAY!
text:
I stayed here for 2 nights in August. As expected it was very hot in NYC in August and my room was extremely hot as the AC was not working. I complained 3 times and was told each time someone would come to fix the AC. Unfortunately, it was 3 false promises. No one ever came and I had 2 awful nights trying to sleep while sweating.
I mentioned the problem again while checking out and was told "oh sorry".
In addition, the room was very small and not very nice.
I wrote a complaint which not surprising was ignored. I then reiterated my complaint in writing and they gave me 5,000 points for what would have required 160,000 points had I used points. The location is good but the service and the rooms are awful. they just couldn't care less and I feel obligated to let potential customers know.
STAY AWAY, FAR AWAY!

title: Three Strikes and and I'm Out
text:
I've stayed at this JW Marriott many times over the years, and even 3 times this year. And each time I leave feeling like they are doing me a favor by allowing me to stay there. And honestly, that's really just due to the attitude of the front desk staff. It's as if I'm trying to gain access to some exclusive Hollywood Club, and the front desk is the bouncer. Why do I say that? 

Over this past year, I've seen my Bonvoy status grow from a baseline "member" to silver elite to (now) gold elite. And yet I've never noticed any difference in the treatment or welcome from the front desk. Now, I realize I'm not a super high level yet...but you'd think a little recognition would be nice. I'm not asking for special treatment. Even an explanation of what my status will get me at that property would be nice (even if it's nothing). And this past week the front desk agent greeted me with, "have you stayed here before...or been here many times?"  Seriously? You can't take a moment to look and see that I've stayed there many times? A simple, "welcome back" would be appropriate. Is this the end of the world? No. But seems like a baseline effort could have been made.

As far as room assignments, it's always a challenge. My simple request (quiet room not up against the elevators) seems to challenge them every time I check in. It took at least 7 minutes to find me a room. (Next to me, people were being checked in left and right...with no issues.) Again, I feel like they are doing me a favor. And why do I make this request? Because some rooms are up against the elevator and so it's hard to sleep. And some rooms on lower floors near the busy street so they are loud. Is this unique to NYC? No. But when soundproofing isn't great, it makes it hard to sleep. Also, some rooms have much better layouts. That can make a huge difference having extra space...or an actual shower stall (rather than bathtub combo). Over the many stays I've had, I've learned that asking for a quiet room is incredibly important. The response I got from the desk agent, "we are nearly sold out tonight." Fun fact...I've heard that response every time I check in. Sigh.

The front desk sets the tone for the visit. And unfortunately after years of giving this place a chance, I've decided to shift my stays to another property. So after checking in, I promptly called and canceled my upcoming 4 night stay in November and shifted to another hotel. 

There are lovely folks working at the hotel...from the staff in the restaurant, to housekeeping to the concierge desk...but the front desk is really the face of the hotel and they need to make some improvements there from an attitude standpoint. 

Not much more I can say. No turn down service (unless you request it - which I did and they still didn't come). I noticed room service trays in the hall in the evening and the same trays still in the hall when I left in the AM. The end of the world? No...but for these prices that shouldn't happen. 

Lots of room for improvement, especially at these prices. Until that happens, I'll have to stay elsewhere.

title: A wonderful hotel overlooking Central Park!
text:
It was a wonderful experience staying at the Essex House. We were waited on at the front desk by two amazing staff members - Cesar and Hannah.  They were so friendly, and really wanted us to enjoy our stay at their hotel.  

The reception rooms and the halls at the Essex House are beautiful, elegant, inviting, but not stuffy.

All of the staff at the hotel were very friendly and welcoming. (We did smile and say hi when we initially saw them.)

We felt so fortunate to have a room looking at Central Park.  Our room and bath were spacious, and very attractive.  We did not hear any sounds from the rooms above or on either side of us.

We do wish that there was a coffee maker in the room or on the hall, and that there would be an icemaker nearby.  There is no refrigerator in the room.

The hotel is only a block and a half away from a large, great Whole Foods Market in the Time Warner Building at Columbus Circle.  They have a huge selection of prepared food that you can eat at their dining area in the store.  We actually had one lunch and one dinner there - at about $14 per person.

The bar at the Essex House is inviting.  Be forewarned that the drinks are expensive.  We had a Manhattan, which was superb, which cost $25, and over $30, with tax and tip.  A gin and tonic was $23 plus tax and tip. The staff were really nice.

While staying at the Essex House, a wonderful way to start the day is to walk up the middle of Central Park, starting at 6th Avenue, to almost 65th Street, and ride the Carousel in the Park!  It only takes about 10 minutes to walk there.  We were told that the Carousel runs when the weather is above 50 degrees.  You can call (212) 439-6900 ext. 4 to find out if they are running.

Our thanks to Cesar and Hannah, and to all the others who made our stay so memorable!

title: Lovely place to stay
text: Definitely a high end hotel across the street from Central Park. Nice sized rooms and amenities. Close to Bergdorf Goodman and Bloomingdales for shopping. The staff was friendly and helpful in securing cabs, town cars and theater tickets.  It has a good restaurant and is close to some great places to eat.

title: Nice updated modern rooms
text: Rooms is big. Lighting is amazing after new updates.  Bathroom are big.  Breakfast not bad.  Loved heated flooring in bathroom. Great location easy access to Columbus Circle Subway, right across Central Park.

title: Цена завышена
text:
Останавливались на две ночи. Отличное расположение.Вид потрясающий на Центральный парк. Комната большая и чистая. Удобная кровать. В общем- то на этом преимущества заканчиваются. 
Очень тесная ванная. СПА нам вообще не понравился, одно только название, нет джакузи, присутствует только сауна и влажная парилка, причём раздельно для мужчин и женщин. Цены на еду в ресторане убойные. И вообще, много пафоса. Считаю, что можно найти отель не хуже и намного дешевле поблизости.

title: Location- location - location
text: We enjoyed the hotel.  Location is great- can walk to lots of great venues.   Our room was very comfortable and updated.  I’m titanium- and the hotel upgraded the room and we had a view of city not a wall.   Concierge lounge is adequate and we liked the bar.    Service great.  Only a 4 star because bathroom needs updating.   But overall - enjoyed the hotel and will visit again

title: This is a well known hotel in a wonderful location--on south side of Central Park
text:
This is a flagship hotel for Marriott.  The location is about as good as it get in NYC--on the park, close to many venues and restaurants of interest and many of the GREAT museums.  The traffic in front of it can be very heavy and it messes up the cabs and Lyft drivers--they can't seem to figure out how to get the car pointed in the right direction to drop you off at the front door!   I had the Lyft drive drop me off at the park side and waked to the light to cross--as did a number of people I talked to.  To Jay walk here is to have a death wish!

The lobby is nice, but not a great one.  The front desk is efficient and does the hotel proud--no stupid mistakes.  Checking bags is a piece of cake--the bellmen are alert.  The elevators are conveniently located and there is a guard to make certain you are staying in the hotel--it makes you feel safe!   

The coffee shop/restaurant on the first floor is a good one--very expensive, but attractive and has good food & service.  If you can get to eat in the Gold Member lounge, do it if you know someone staying at the hotel.  The breakfast food there is really good!

The rooms are "standard" but nice.  Very quiet for being in a major city.  The decorations are very good.  The prices are over the top expensive and the "add on's" are killers!   The taxes have to be the highest in the world!

This is a great hotel if you are on an expense account.  For what we were doing--meeting a lot of people one on one and in small groups--this was THE perfect hotel.  We had no complaints.  I am not certain I would use it for person travel--it is nice, but at that price.....

title: Not worth the money
text: The room was fair at best, looking out a 3 walls all for only 875.00 a night. I am a gold member with Marriott and asked for something better and she basically laughed at me. We are totally full sir. Will spend the extra and move up.

title: Wonderful experience in the heart of NYC
text:
The south end of Central Park and the historic hotels, such as the Plaza and the Essex House that line the street, are one those timeless, special areas in this great city. One is also reminded of numerous movies and shows where this is the backdrop. 

It was an incredible hotel with wonderful rooms. Our family was there attending a wedding and most of the guests for the wedding were also staying here. 

There were just a few things that kept me from choosing a five star rating. 
The massive delay in getting our car out of the valet in the morning (40+ mins). They did not handle our early checkin as we had arranged. This was cleared up by speaking with management but that should not have been necessary. The inaccurate application of charges and credits. This was also cleared up at the desk but took a little extra time. 

I would certainly be open to staying at this hotel again, the next time we visit NYC.

title: 最高の滞在！！
text: ニューヨークのホテルの対応は本当に差が激しいです。良いホテルはとても対応が良く酷いホテルは高級ホテルでも最悪っていうことも多いです。しかし、このホテルはとても親切です。コンシェルジュやフロント方も英語が苦手な私の話を親身に聞いてくれました。客室についても広くて大満足です。ホテル内はユーチューブなどで検索してみた方がわかりやすいです。w

title: Poor customer service at JW Marriot Essex House in NYC
text: Sat at check in for 10-15 minutes while they tried to figure something out on their computer.  Enjoyable weekend to come to NYC to watch the US Open for 3 days over Labor Day.  Our hotel experience was totally ruined by the poor customer service at the lobby bar.  We came in at around 11 35pm after the US Open tennis matches were over hoping to grab a glass of wine with some friends before bed.  We were ignored for 15 minutes after we sat down and finally I flagged the bartender.  He told me we are closed.  I asked him when they close and he said midnight, however last call is at 11 45.  I told him you have been watching us sit here for like 15 minutes and not waited on us??  His manager and his manager's manager all came over and instead of taking 5 seconds to pour two glasses of wine for us they argued with us for 15 minutes telling us to call room service..  Really pissed me off to pay $3000 to stay at this place and they can't comply with a simple customer service request???  The lobby manager looked like he was 18 yrs old and was very rude.  The wine itself is completely overpriced $25/glass for a very poor cabernet, however I was willing to pay for it if someone would have waited on us....  Look to stay at another hotel that has class and customer service.

title: One of the HOT hotels in NYC - nothing beats Central Park location combined with an elegant hotel
text:
We chose to stay here for our recent short trip (5 nights) to NYC. With so many offers for a Marriott Bonvoi Titanium member, it's difficult to chose the "right" place. And my past experiences in NYC were quite a mixed bag. 
So we decided to use the positive experience of my husband some years ago and booked the Essex House. 
First disappointment was the neglection of using our suite vouchers, due to zero availabilities. Then, when we checked in, we did not even receive an upgrade, as the hotel was fully booked. Unfortunately it was the US Open tournament and it seemed like everyone related to tennis was in this hotel...
Despite my initial disappointment, I was positively surprised in the end! The king room we booked was a really good size and lovely decorated (seen much worse in NYC.  The bathroom was spacious and elegant, incl fluffy towels and bathrobe. I appreciated the gym classes at Exhale (part of the destination fee perks) and the executive lounge. Although I have to say, that the choice, quality and presentation of the food rather reminded me of a mass tourist hotel. 
Still it is nice to have breakfast and evening drinks sorted, in the hotel, if you don’t go out.  The location is fantastic and the attitude of staff was very friendly, which I also had seen very different in NYC. 
Special thanks to Yamira at Front Desk and Michael and Kevin at Concierge Desk for adding a positive flavour to our enjoyable stay. We sure will be back!

title: Great hotel overlooking Central Park
text: Went here with my Bonvoy points and was impressed by the size and comfort of our suite, the view of Central Park and the helpfulness of the staff.  It is walking distance from tons of stuff you’ll want to do in Manhattan.  I drove in with my Tesla and the valets even recharged it for me during our stay.

title: great location, good facility, service can be spotty
text: I love JW Marriott's location, across the street from Central Park.  Great restaurants and shops nearby, especially a Whole Foods Market just 2 blocks away.  The housekeeping service is a little bit of a hit-and-miss.  On one of the days, they did not show up until late in the afternoon.  The Doorman had a bad disposition and was not very helpful or friendly.  Rooms need to be updated, especially for the price they charge.  Overall, would recommend this place again, but for the price, I would probably stay at Trump next time.

title: Great stay
text: Lovely staff, great upgraded room (elite membership) with a beautiful view of Central Park, nice clean executive lounge with a good breakfast buffet. Location is excellent with a quick walk to Columbus Circle, Sarabeths, and across the road from Central Park. Dropped one point because the room service was disappointing and the gym was just okay, but would still go back.

title: 4 Wonderful Stays
text: WE have stayed in here four separate occasions. This place has quality staff thatnin my opinion is better then the Ritz Carlton down the street, Each time we have stayed here they have made us feel special. The rooms are good. As Titanium Elite Marriott members, they have always offered us a complimentary room upgrade and club access complimentary. You are safe staying here The room prices are always below the competition.

title: Spacious luxury in a fantastic location
text:
This is a beautiful, classy hotel in an unbeatable location across from Central Park.  We had the family suite which had a large living room with a sectional sofa that pulled out into a bed, a desk and a walk-in closet.  The master bedroom was equally spacious and comfortable.  The view is not great when you get a family suite. You are probably looking down to a back alley, so request a high floor and look up at the sky. :)  The upside is that you will not likely hear any traffic noise.  Our suite was very quiet. 

We took full advantage of the amenities provided with the daily $35 resort fee. I get why people have balked at the mandatory fee. But since you have to pay it, I figured we should get our money’s worth.  my daughters took turns taking a daily exercise class at the Exhale studio which is a couple of doors down.  One class would usually cost more than $35. We also made use of the daily $30 laundry credit - very useful when we’ve been on the road for two weeks. Lastly, we definitely used the $35 daily food/drink credit at the restaurant or for room service.  

I should recognize some staff members who made our stay extra nice. Yamira, Felix and Melvyn at Reception were exceptionally helpful, kind and responsive to my requests and questions.  The guys in the executive lounge, including Robert and Charly, worked hard, always with a genuine smile.  Concierge staff, including Michael, were very efficient and friendly.  The Housekeeping ladies were excellent too.

title: Sprawling property with great location but no service
text:
Even though this property sits on the south edge of Central Park, most rooms do not have park views.  We were in one such room on the 11th floor with a view of neighboring condos and an alley way.  Thankfully we had a few windows so even though we were on a lower floor, we had some light.

The property has been recently renovated which was nice.  However the bathrooms were not and I found them rather dark and cramped.  The one bedroom suite we were in had no desk in the living area, only a square table with no suitable plugs for a  laptop.  Hotels should do a better job of providing a work space with enough jacks and plugs for different electronic devices.

While the room itself was nice and comfortable enough, the service was definitely lacking.  You have to ask for everything including what should be in the room such as slippers, laundry bags, etc.  Nothing is anticipated and one gets the usual gruff New York style greeting and responses.  

There is only one restaurant cum bar at the property and when we wanted to patronize it at 11:00 am, we were told that it was not possible as they were in between service.  So if you plan to meet someone, make sure that you do so when there is service available or else meet elsewhere, outside of the property.

title: Fantastic stay at JW Marriott Essex House!
text:
Fantastic stay at JW Marriott Essex House!

I came here with my mom for 6 days(5 nights).

Unfortunately we've failed to use  SNA(getting a suite room.) because there were many people  booked for the rooms so there were no more left for us.(So sad..)

Despite that, I am really enjoying my stay so far.

First of all I would like to thank the Assistant Front Office Manager TERRENCE JULES.

He tried his best to give me the best room available at the check in time, and also remembered my name and also greeted me at the lounge breakfast.

I really appreciate his services to me. Thank you.

Also would like to thank to SHARLENE, she was also very nice to me when I was checking in.

Furthermore she also remembered me when I was passing the lobby this afternoon.

JW Marriott Essex house, I think all the staffs in this hotel, housekeeping, bell desk, restaurant, fitness...
Everywhere, everyone is really nice to the customers.

I really like it and also I am really touched for their good services.

In addition the location, and the facilities are fantastic in NYC.

JW Marriott Essex house,
Thank you!

title: Nice building and location but rooms nothing special
text: The hotel itself is nice, historic and in a good location.  It's right across the street from central park.  The staff was very friendly at check in and any services that we had on the property.  With that being said, the actual rooms are nothing special and very small.  I'm sure it's because of the age of the hotel but regardless, very small rooms.  I would stay there again.

title: 建物は古いですが、リノベーションで内装は新しい
text:
歴史的なホテルもリノベーションで、水回り含め新しいホテルになっています。ホテルマンの対応も洗練されており、さすがだと思います。
エグゼクティブラウンジも利用できるとゆっくりできます。

title: Great location off Central Park
text:
We decided to stay over one night after a late lunch in town.  The location is very convenient to mid-town activities.  Comfortable bed, good bathroom product, and our upgraded room was fairly spacious.  

The furnishings are spartan - Marriott style - so, they lack a luxurious feel.  The furnishings reminded me of a W in their simplicity.  We had breakfast in the club lounge on the first floor but were disappointed to find that the afternoon lounge hours are not in effect on Saturday and Sunday.  

Overall, it was an okay stay.

title: Enjoyed our week
text:
We were here one week.  My husband was here on business so my daughter and I tagged along for some fun in NY.  My husband is a Titanium member but the hotel was full so we were not offered an additional upgrade.  Though, our junior suite provided plenty of room for the 3 of us.  My husband asks for an inside room without a view because street noise wakes him.  That was happily granted.
We enjoyed breakfast every morning in the lounge and had a drink every night at the restaurant.  Hey, they were charging us $35 per day so we were going to get our free drinks.  We also used our zoo tickets and the laundry service.  
Our service person on the 25th floor was great.  She was always around when we needed something and very adaptable to our schedule.  At one point the ice machine was not working on our floor and they got that fixed within a day.  My husband hurt his foot and the ice helped.  The staff also called to see if he needed anything else.
Overall, we loved staying here.  Hope to stay next summer as well!

title: Lily
text: We just had the amazing stay at JW Marriot Essex House for five nights. We were well looked after by the staffs. A big thank you to the  manager on duty Terence and all lounge staffs, friendly and efficient. The hotel is also located in a superb area with easy access to anywhere. We will definitely come back as a family!

title: Amazing Stay
text:
Recently stayed here while traveling for a concert, the service at this location is amazing! The lobby, as soon as you walk in, is beautiful and there are many employees that are waiting to greet you. The room was nice, however with the family connector, there is not really a "common area", just two rooms that have a shared entry way. This was not a problem for us though. 

Very convenient location, right next to Columbus Circle and right across from Central Park which was nice for a morning walk. 

Will return and would recommend this hotel!

title: Nickel and Dime JW
text:
If you stay at this JW property, be prepared to be nickel and dimed for everything. After the ridiculous $35 daily resort fee, you will still find yourself paying for extraneous things with a sub-par room. If they give you "executive lounge" access for your Marriott status, don't be thrilled. It's nothing more than a sub-standard hotel breakfast that would almost match a Residence Inn. They don't even have an espresso machine to make espresso, lattes, or cappuccinos. And if you ask for one, they have to charge you. Only American, dirty water coffee is available. What sort of "executive-ness" is this? Additionally, in the evening, their appetizer offerings are barely edible and they have an "Honor Bar" where you are required to PAY for your drinks. I just came back from staying at a REGULAR Marriott where I was given access to their M-Club Lounge, and all drinks, wine, beer, liquor were complimentary. And now here at the JW in NYC they make you pay for them...I believe it was $12 for a glass of wine. I was appalled. 

Additionally, when I checked in, the lady told me that my "request" for a high-floor room was honored by putting me on the 15th floor. Honey, the building goes up to 40-something floors and this isn't even half way up the building. Furthermore, I was in a tiny room that faced the back - to 58th street. No upgrade or mention of anything as I am a platinum elite member of Marriott Bonvoy. 

OH! And if you need to print something in the business center, YOU WILL HAVE TO PAY FOR THAT AS WELL. They charge you per sheet if you need to print something other than a boarding pass. I'm sorry, I thought this was the JW Marriott, not a Motel 6.......You pay more than $500 a night, and they charge you for a glass of wine in the lounge AND if you have to print something at the business center. What a rip off. 

This JW Marriott is a fraud, and I won't be staying there ever again. You shouldn't either. 

PS - dont use the hotel Valet parking service because it is something ridiculous like $80 per day. You can park yourself a block away on 59th Street for half the price.

title: Typical
text:
The reason I booked the JW is because it was close to the hotel my family was at and I redeemed points for the stay.  Normally I wouldn't pick a JW because I don't believe that the price justifies the value that is given. 

Rooms 2 Stars: We were not upgraded for my Elite status, the room was quite small and a little dated. But they were very clean. There was no coffee maker, and for the price this hotel demands, the irons need serious upgrades. Bathroom was tiny. 

I am a westin person, the JW scent in the soaps is hardly bearable, they need to update it really bad. . 

Staff 5 Stars: Staff is well trained and attentive

Location 5 Stars: Location couldn't be any better, which is why the price is so high.

title: Excellent hotel but expensive
text:
This hotel was in a great location right across Central Park and near the carriage rides.
Great hotel to come with kids since the hotel is so close to Central Parlk.

However, It is very expensive.  Spent over $1000/night for a small suite and parking is additional $85/day.

The views are excellent.  Front office staff  are OK and could be more pleasant.

title: Memorable Long Weekend in NYC
text:
Just enjoyed a fabulous long weekend in NYC with my family.   We came to NY to celebrate my teenage daughter’s birthday by taking in a Broadway show, see some sights and enjoy a few restaurants.  

JW Marriott Essex House was the perfect location for us and was the icing on the cake - from check-in to check-out, we found all of the staff incredibly pleasant and helpful.  The hotel has a great old world feel that has been tastefully updated - the reception is particularly grand.  We had a beautiful two-room suite (very nicely sized for NYC) overlooking Central Park and started each day with a great breakfast from in-room dining.  Fabulous location as we were able to easily walk to our Broadway show, Times Square, Top of the Rock, and through Central Park. 

We would definitely recommend the Essex House and look forward to future stays.  Thank you for making our NY stay so memorable!

title: Finally a better than average stay in NYC
text:
I went a little further from midtown than usual for a two night business trip. Booked far in advance and with my corporate travel team to get a decent rate. Usually it shows up as over 500 a night. Got a corp rate of 333. 

Great location across from the park. Near subway stops and not a long walk from Times Square. Reception was nice and had a quick checkin with no wait. Given a basic room. Platinum status didn't get me any upgrades. Room was a good size for NYC. Better than average but not much better than the Renaissance. Nice comfortable stylings like other JWs but much smaller bathroom. 

Gym was small but decent. Lounge was ground floor but had nice offerings for breakfast and happy hour. Enjoyed the property and comfortable room and would stay again for the right rate. Not worth the 500-600/night I usually see at this property, but would stay again for the right rate. Worth the walk to get away from the more touristy Times Square Marriot/SPG properties.

title: Clean and great location
text: The hotel was great for our stay. Obviously the location is amazing. The staff were all very pleasant from the moment we checked in. Our room was quiet and very clean. Hotel overall was true to Marriott fashion and appeared clean, smelled nice and had attentive staff. The only downfall we experienced was the many dogs that were inside the hotel lobby at any time. My husband has allergies and this was not ideal.

title: Picture perfect only till picture
text: Was expecting too much but was too below average kinda stay.. I didn’t like anything about the hotel except if you like being close to Central park thats the only and walking distance to Times Square. They dont have bottle water for you. The bath is mediocre, room is fine. View was nothing. We booked for 7 nights but checked out early. As my first time in New York i was thinking this would be the best pick but sadly dissatisfied

title: Money scam
text: Our family is currently staying at the hotel. After a long trip, we were “welcomed” by a rude receptionist who took more than 30 min to check us in as he was trying to verify if the room is prepaid (which it was). The following morning more than 800$ were taken off by the hotel and when asked about it, the receptionist explained that it was a mistake in the system. Nevertheless, the withdrawals of various amounts continued and so we confronted the manager about this issue, who apologized and assured us that the problem will be solved and it was all due to the system error. After all these countless explanations and promises, money are still being taken off our account. This has been one of the most disappointing experiences so far. Unfortunately, my family’s situation is far from the worst. Our friends who checked in the hotel at the same time as us, were checked in under 5 min. However, then 4000$ were took off their account as the receptionist failed to see that their room was prepaid in advance. They still didn’t receive their money back.  This is certainly not a level of a 5 star hotel and we are deeply disappointed by this stay.

title: Owners no longer platinum, property isn’t either
text:
We have stayed here before and found the location to be very good. The rooms, albeit a bit shabby, are comfortable. Bathrooms are also a bit shabby. We could walk this area safely quite late and there is a Whole Foods just down the street which made taking care of family easier.
As Westin timeshare owners we used to have breakfast included. Marriott merger has now downgraded owners to gold status. This meant the kids could no longer get breakfast as they were accustomed to. They did enjoy being across the park, and there are plenty of restaurants nearby.

title: Mr pawandeep dhunn
text: I stayed in the hotel with family from 12th of July to 18th July 2019 .hotel needs a serious training for service .one day light was off and hotel has no generator for back up .its a 5 start hotel and no ba k up generator .I stayed in India Mumbai in jw martiot alot times and the have their everything. And then I ordered  a food at 9 PM and they delivered at 11 pm .all r confused they dont even know what's going on .staff needs a alot training .and now I am waiting for the .manager since 30 minutes and he hasn't showed up yet .its a 5 start hotel and they r dealing like a 2 star hotel .I will never come ba k here again nd dont recommends this hotel .very prime location but the worst service I experienced.

title: Great Elegant Hotel.  Great Location
text:
We love the Essex house.   Great service.  Rooms are very nice.  Little views here and there.  Across from Central Park.  Great restaurants.    Easy access to theater district and subways.     If you are executive Bonvoy the lounge is one of the best ever for breakfast. Snacks and drinks.  No view.  But good food 

Also.  They have a front and back entrance. Makes it easier for walking around the city 

Have fun.   Follow us @nickellfamilytavel

title: Excellent!
text:
We have a go-to hotel in the city, but it was booked this week so we stayed at the JW Marriott and were extremely impressed.  The rooms are so very clean and up to date, not even a perfume smell, just fresh.  The room size was much bigger than can be expected in the city and the staff was very classy.  Probably the best part is the concierge lounge (yes, I'm Platinum).  I've never seen a better selection of food and drinks.  

The location cannot be beat - right across the street from Central Park.

The only down side is the resort fee - didn't get much in return for it.

title: Impressed, not blown away
text:
For our first visit to New York, we spent half our time at the Essex House and the other half at another Marriott property. Beautiful lobby, room was gorgeous (used Suite Night Reward upgrade), wonderful location! I was definitely impressed with the concierge, very kind and helpful!!
Just because we love our JW, I’m a little critical—plus the price, you’d think it would check the boxes. My little negatives would be for the price, the room has some issues—peeling wallpaper, only 2 working elevators for 40 (estimate?) floors of rooms. The biggest let down was the executive lounge. Other reviews said is the nicest they’ve seen, not at all. Maybe I’ve just been spoiled at the places we’ve visited (Nashville, Sydney—much better). I understand food and snacks can’t be out all day, but there was food and trash all over the lounge-each time we visited with the staff just standing around leaning against the walls. Not good at all. We just have higher expectations than this. 
Overall, I would recommend this property and would consider staying again but didn’t live up to our traditional JW expectations. Thank you for helping make our first visit to NY memorable!

title: Good Location Opposite Central Park
text:
My wife and I stayed for I night in a Central Park View King Room on the 39th floor with great views over the park and the city. The room was large with small bathroom, with bath and overhead shower. 

The staff were are very friendly and helpful.

The hotel is directly across from the park and less than a 5 minute walk to 5th Avenue. There are subway stations close by too.

All in all, a nice hotel in a good location, but not particularly memorable.

title: Front Page Lifestyle Living is Uptown NEW YORK
text: Uptown and on the park is still the best New York has to offer and the downtown advocates might just jump into the Hudson River.  Yet, you'll need at least a suite to fully appreciate the lifestyle.  The hotel is working very hard on service and customer focus.  This property is hitting on all cylinders and is a very good value.

title: Convenient location mid town
text: We came for the Tony award , the host arranged for this hotel as not too far from Radio City .  There are two entrance  prefer the one facing Central Park. . The reception area is grand , and reception is professional . We have a Central Park View room , the room is clean , sizable and nice decor and amenities . The exercise room is24/7 and is nice with steam  room and showers .Room service is efficient too, but not 24/7.   The  Restaurent Southgate is decent. Our three night stay is pleasant

title: Warm welcome Great Hospitality
text: We stayed at the JW marriott essex house before, we love being able to wake up early morning and have Central Park at our door step. The breakfast was delicious both times we stayed. This last time we stayed was very special. We got married at the JW.  It was a hectic day and the front desk staff was so nice and so helpful. Her smile and kindness made it worthwhile. And this is why I love being a Marriott rewards member. Special thanks to Front Desk Agent Yamira L.

title: Accounting Department Requires Brushing up their Customer Service Skills
text: For my upcoming repeat stay here, I noticed that I had been overcharged on my credit card (through Marriott Bonvoy Member rate advance purchase) and after not getting anywhere with the Marriott Bonvoy Program in trying to resolve the higher charge, called the hotel directly. The front desk transferred me to the accounting department who in a matter of fact manner and without apologies explained that this was owing to a separate Destination Occupancy Fee that had not been charged previously and had to be collected. From my perspective, that was alright as long as either they (the hotel) or the member rewards program had let me know in advance that there would be a discrepancy in charges seen on my credit card statement relative to what I had approved previously. The woman from accounting who I spoke to offered very little concession in her stance on the matter expect to state that she would take it up with the hotel accounting department. The whole experience of trying to understand this charge with the rewards program and hotel took more than one hour when it could have been resolved in a few minutes. This is certainly not a Holiday Inn and I expect better for the money that I have paid towards my reservation, especially from an accounting employee. I'm already disappointed and will be dreading my stay here in fear of other unexpected customer service faux pas that may occur during the stay.

title: Wonderful New Year’s Eve Celebration
text: We celebrated New Year’s Eve in NYC with a group of friends. The room was clean with a great view to Central Park and a marble bathroom. What impressed us the most was the interior of the restaurant and the special attention to every guest. The food was presented in a very attractive way and tasted delicious. We had a wonderful celebration thanks to the staff who made us feel like in a fairytale.

title: מצפים ליותר ממלון על הפארק
text:
נתחיל בזה שהמיקום פנטסטי - בין ה58-59 ממש על הפארק ובין השדרה ה7 ל-6. בקיצור רחוק מהבלגן והדחק של דאון טאון אבל ממש במרכז. אחלה מלון בסה"כ, חדר כושר קטן, חדר אוכל עם ארוחת בוקר ב-55 דולר לסועד. כמו ברוב המלונות בארה"ב אין למלון חניה, אבל יש חניון ממש מאחורי המלון ובעבור הון קטן אפשר להשאיר שם רכב ללילה.
חדרים - ניקיון על הפנים.. אמנם מסודר אבל מצאתי במקרר מגש עם אוכל רקוב של דייר שהיה לפני, שיער באמבטיה וכו'.
מיקום החדרים - לבקש לקחת את הצד המזרחי כי בצד המערבי ממוקם כנראה המזגן המרכזי של המלון ומדובר בצינטרפוגות שעושות רעש בלתי נסבל ובגלל זה אי אפשר לפתוח חלון להכניס קצת חמצן לחדר! אם אני לא טועה המספרים הזוגיים זה צד מזרחי ומספרים אי זוגיים - צד מערבי הבעייתי.

title: Old School Charm on Central Park
text: Essex House, you did not disappoint! This hotel is so old school and charming: rooms are just lovely, updated and clean. We stayed in a large one bedroom suite (no view but so what, didn't' go to NY to sit in the room!) and enjoyed ourselves immensely. We felt well taken care of and of course, the location was fantastic. Admittedly it was quite pricey but really, we were just there for a night! Would definitely stay again as we truly had no complaints.

title: Hate to Give 3 Stars
text:
I hate to rate this hotel 3 stars, but they ruined the hotel portion of my family trip. First the positives. The staff is professional and very friendly, especially those at the front desk. The rooms are decent size and very clean. The housekeeping staff does an exceptional job. The location of the hotel across from Central Park and steps from all the Columbus Circle greatness is the best in NYC.
