Now the only negative and it was a dealbreaker. I was given an interior room for my 4 night stay with my family. After the first night I went to ask for a park room view. After unpacking for 4, this is a big decision. The lady at the desk was super accommodating and said they would move us. We just needed to pack and the luggage team would move everything for us. Nice touch. After a day in the sun and enjoying NYC we went back to re-check in. The man looked at my family and said “you need two beds?” I agreed and was then informed that ALL rooms with two beds were interior... I asked if there was a suite where I could pay to upgrade. Nope, hotel full. It was a busy weekend. 

If I would have known all rooms with two beds were interior I would have moved on to another property. 

If you are looking for a room with one bed, I highly recommend this hotel. If you are traveling with a family skip the JW and stay somewhere down the street.

title: Great location. Old standard hotel
text: The location of this property on Central Park South is one of the best.  Because of that, the hotel has very heavy traffic and has the challenges of a midtown hotel catering to businessmen and women, touring foreigners, families and others.  This hotel is iconic but like most icons, needs a lot of work to keep it relevant in "modern times."  Front of the house was excellent.  Wait staff in the hotel bistro were very good.  Food was good, hot and fresh.  I was there for a large group business meeting and the breakfast and lunches served were pretty much standard.  Nothing exceptional but nothing to complain about.  I hadn't stayed on the property in about 35 years and had forgotten how convenient it is.  There were no surprises, good, or, bad.  I would stay there again, just for the location.

title: Perfect New York stay
text: Second time I've stayed at this hotel and it can't be beat. Great location right across the street from Central Park and within walking distance to so many must sees plus large rooms, beautiful lobby with fresh flowers and the nicest staff. Will definitely return again.

title: Disappointing
text: Old school priorities ... and old dated rooms. This hotel caters to male business travelers, to the exclusion of others.  I am a loyal Marriott traveler so disappointed that this hotel could not deliver on service.  Traveling for business and my room is located In a very loud location in the hallway, (on the alley so no view) and a low floor so the wait for the elevator takes forever.  At check in, there were 10 guests for 2 reception greeters. Very abrupt service and inexperienced staff.  Guests can be assured much better quality at The Edition or W Hotels with more progressive and service oriented teams.

title: Nice hotel, but valet banged up my bumper.
text: The hotel was nice enough by city standards, but the charged me $85 to park my car and returned it with the bumper banged up.  The parking vendor, ipark, took a month to review the claim, and has now rejected it.  Time to figure out how to appeal (getting to be a lot of stress for a weekend of relaxation).

title: location good, staff amenities poor
text:
So the pros of this hotel:
1. awesome location , bang in front of central Park.
2. Superb lobby, very upscale and a lovely place to bring someone
3. reception was great, they gave us the room at 12 .30 pm
4. as a gold member had to ask for upgrade but they gave it finally,
5. Rooms are cozy, bathrooms are big and bright

Serious Cons:
1. No TEA MAKING HOT POT IN ROOM!!!!..ridiculous, totally ridiculous. If you paid i excess of $500 to stay here per night, they should be giving you this basic amenity of hot coffee of tea whenever you want , right in your room
2. Staff is really lazy of non existent. If you phone reception from the room, they actually NEVER picked up. I tried 5 times at diff times.
3. Room service menu is VERY TINY and VERY VERY expensive. We ordered 2 salads and they cost around $60 after adding in all their fees.
4. LIFTS to the rooms are ancient and VERRRRRY slow.
5. Concierge needs to IMPROVE DRAMATICALLY. = we took several of their suggestions and each was a huge flop..eating at various restaurants they suggested..so don't follow them, maybe they get commissions from their top suggestions or they havent eaten their in a while. It was truly a flop every single place they said to go. So do your OWN research and try nice places reviewed better
7. There is NO WATER to DRINK in your room. YOU HAVE TO CARRY YOU WATER FROM THE RECEPTION UP TO YOUR ROOM or got to the gym and take a backpack and fill it and bring back as often as you need. NOT A LUXURY STAY for sure. be prepared. service is very poor here. Housekeeping was great room was clean enough, though we found a cigarrete butt under the sofa while searching for our shoes..
8. They charge you a mandatory $32 fee PER DAY which is a super pain.

overall I would say, that if you can use points and stay here do so, KNOWING you cant have hot water in your room, have to carry drinking water and also the unnecessary fee will be levied.
Otherwise a great location.

title: Location is #1 but value is limited with price and amenities
text:
First off - the cleanliness, safety, etc is just fine - no worries at all for that.  The location is fantastic - walk out the door and you are at Central Park next to Umpire rock (where my son loves to play half the day).  Easy (if relatively in shape) to walk to Broadway or Rockefeller etc.  

The main drawback is the cost - it is very pricey and the rooms are just fine but not something that is worth this extra cost.  The service is average for this price - meaning they are nice and accomodating but nothing beyond that.  Beds can always vary - ours was OK but if you are under 35 you can sleep on concrete and be fine.

title: Ryena Advani
text:
My daughter and myself were really looking forward to our stay at the JW Marriott Essex. We are extremely disappointed with what the hotel has to offer. At every point , it clearly shows that the hotel is in desperate need to cut costs !! We had missed our connection flight and had ended up a day later to check in. I am a bonvoy titatanium card holder and entitled to an upgrade. At the check in desk I was politely refused an upgrade and informed they have no suites available! I went online and informed them there were several suites available on the Marriott Bonvoy site. They have refused to even see what I have and declined an upgrade insisting the room I have been given is fabulous! My room is decent but not a suite or with any view but old buildings around ! Upon arrival after a long day and long flight I am looking forward to my coffee which is not available in the room. You have to go all the way to the lobby for your free cup of coffee! On insisting they obliged and sent the in room coffee pot. On arrival we had 2 bottles of water which have not been replaced . If I need water again I need to “ask”housekeeping for in room water bottle. There is no turndown service unless again I “ask” for one every evening ! The toiletries provided are so tiny I am worried it won’t last for my evening shower and again I would have to “ask” for it ! I have never made so many calls to housekeeping asking for basic things which should be provided by the hotel rated so high and so expensive! 
I am absolutely fine with a hotel not providing most of the things mentioned but then, it should not be rated as JW Marriott and they cannot be charging the amount they charge!!

title: So glad JW is managing the Essex House
text: We were delighted with our stay at the Essex House now managed by JW Marriott! Excellent location right across from Central Park and walking distance to plays, restaurants and shopping. The Staff is exceptional and as you would expect at a JW...Melvin (front desk reception) is by far one of the best Marriott employees I have encountered (and I am Lifetime Platinum). Highly recommend and we will be back here for our next NYC visit.

title: Valet parking rate excessive
text: My wife and I stayed at the Marriott Essex House in New York recently. We arrived at 10:30am on Saturday and departed at 1:45pm on Sunday. I just opened my American Express bill and saw we were charged $190. I will never use their valet again and actually may stay elsewhere in the future. Travelers beware!!

title: Beautiful property, great location, service is lacking
text: I had reserved a small suite with park view and they did upgrade us to a larger space (extra bath), but it was on the 3rd floor so we had all the street noise & scaffolding to look out at with a smattering of trees above that.  I really was hoping for a better view (and thought that is why I was paying a premium).  As for the property itself it is very nice, with real walls and nice touches.  I do think they should take out the mini fridge full of items & put in a usable mini fridge and coffee pot.  You'll pay $20+ in the morning to order a small pot of coffee from room service.  Finally, instead of guarding the property like prison wardens perhaps a better use of the doorman would be to put them by the doors & have them open the doors when people are obviously arriving with their suitcases.  The location is central park south, which is great.  But I never give a 5-star review for a nice building, it has to have the service to go along with it & this hotel is sorely lacking in that department.

title: Pure Luxury in Historic Hotel
text: I can't imagine where the bad reviewers actually stayed.  My daughter and I recently spent 5 nights at this hotel (May 21-26) and enjoyed every minute!  We had a Manhattan Suite that included an extra half bath which made getting ready in the morning a breeze for two ladies.  The city and partial central park views were lovely.  A request for a microwave and mini-fridge (complimentary) was handled within minutes.  The meals we had in the Executive Lounge were great.  Ceasar at the front desk went above and beyond.  As did the attendants who stood "guard" near the banks of elevators - and always returned my greeting.  Fabulous conceirge group who told us to take water whenever needed and had a fun map of Central Park.  As most of NYC has scaffolding, the extra touch of fake grass around their scaffolding made us smile!  Grand hotel, grand location.

title: Shockingly bad
text:
I joined trip advisor six years ago and have found it to be a useful research tool but always agreed with the reviews but on this occasion I feel passionate enough to write a review so other travellers are aware of what awaits them with this hotel. I stayed in this property with my Family for 2 nights. 

First, I simply cannot understand how and why this is considered a five star hotel, it is simply not! check in was slow, the rooms did not meet five star standards, the room dining menu was abysmal. The location and the willingness of the staff to assist was enough to mitigate the disappointment we felt as a family, what I found utterly disgraceful was the fact that our cards were charged TWICE!  My husband spoke to the hotel they agreed to reverse the transactions but here we are 10 days from the day the “ erroneous “ transactions where posted this is still to happen.  My bank advises that if the hotel has indeed reversed the transaction as promised my account would reflect it within 24 hours, we are still waiting... I am honestly disappointed and would think twice about staying in another JW Marriott property and would certainly never stay in this one nor recommend it. It’s just disgraceful not good enough!

title: Bad service despite good location and facilities
text: I stayed at the JW Marriott with my family between 23rd and 28th of May. We had a great time in the city but I give a very low score to this hotel because of the level of service we experience. I constantly stay at Marriotts, and in general get good service. This hotel has been a disappointing exception. A JW should have the highest level of customer service, mainly with their best customers of the Bonvoy program. This is not what this hotel demostrated. Since the checking the experience was very mechanical, and I had a feeling the staff was not really keen to have families (I have two 9 yo daughters) and is happier with business travelers. The worse part of the experience came on Saturday evening, when I called and asked for Ice and a new remote control because ours had depleted batteries. The lady answering the phone had not patience, and was quick on saying she would send both right away. The remote control came after 20 minutes, but after 45 min, we had no ice. I called again, and this time she was very unpolite saying I had to get the ice myself. No problem with that, but she could have told me the first time I called. She indicated me where to get the ice. I went there, the machine was broken. I called again asking where else I could get ice. She was even more impatient and said she would send the ice. After a while (and with no ice) I called again and told her I didn't need the ice anymore, since it has passed over an hour since my original request. I turn on the do not disturb signal and we went to bad. 15 minutes later, someone knocks on the door, with ice.... I called again to complaint because they woke up my kids, she was even more unpolite saying that I should be happy because I had the ice. I asked to be transferred to the manager. The manager was not much better, was trying to get me out of the phone and offered me some compensation. I was not really looking for anything other than being treated well, and she volunteered to put 45,000 points on my account, I said fine. She never did, so she lied again, she just wanted me off the phone. Terrible service, I have better service consistently on Holiday Inns. Avoid this hotel, I will never use it again, and based on this experience willa void JWs on my business trips. They are not up to the level of service they say they have and if you are looking for high end hotels, go for the Intercontinental.

title: Very Enjoyable Experience
text: We visited NYC for a wedding and enjoy JW Marriotts.  The hotel itself definitely has a historical feel to it in the lobby, but offers a very updated experience in guest rooms and the JW Executive Lounge.  Our room was incredibly spacious, clean, and the lounge was definitely one of the best I’ve experienced.  The staff was friendly and overall we had an excellent experience.  We also enjoyed the close proximity to good shopping, Starbucks, etc.

title: Average Hotel
text:
May be I had expectations misplaced. I was expecting a top of the range hotel (in the range of St Regis) with appropriate recognition for my Platinum status with Marriott (though really a SPG person). Instead it was a very average to poor experience. 

The check-in experience was crowded, impersonal and slow. Yes, there was the - thank you for your loyalty- said but it was only as meaningful as good evening. There was no offer to even take luggage to the room. 

The rooms were a bit dated which I did expect as it was housed in a period property. The room otherwise was functional. There was of course no turn-down service in the evening. 

They had an executive lounge but there were no drinks in the evening. In the morning, for breakfast there was not even any mats on the table. When I asked a member of staff- how come? He promptly replied - Sir, they are hard to clean. An honest response which was an honest reflection of their approach to hospitality. 

On a positive note if you want to be near Central Park, the location of the hotel is brilliant. 

To summarise, JW Marriott is no St Regis. For this kind of hospitality, you maybe better off with Air BnB.

title: Great location, not a huge fan of the hotel itself
text: I'll start by saying that the rooms are nice, spacious and the bathrooms are a good size. We had a double and I did not feel like we were squished in there. That said, the downsides outweigh the upsides, especially given the hotel's claim that it's been newly remodeled. My first night there, I could hear a spring-loaded thud that would repeat on an irregular basis. I have jet-lag induced insomnia for the first few nights, usually, so you can imagine how this sound was akin to water torture for me. I went down to the desk the next day, thinking it might be the elevator (note that all double rooms are located next to elevators). A desk attendant came up and said that it was the water pressure, because the building itself is old. Basically, whenever someone in the right/wrong room uses their bathroom, I could hear the sound loudly echo in my bathroom and bedroom. Second complaint is that I was told that I'd have to pay the $35 resort fee for all five nights, but I'd get a $35 meal credit. Turns out that I didn't have to pay the $35 for the last 3 nights (because I was paying a higher room rate), but of course, I was eating at the overpriced restaurant to get the meal credit. So it would have been nice for them to get their information straight. I don't think I'd stay here again--I didn't think service was very attentive and the water pressure noise is ridiculous for a supposedly excellent hotel.

title: Nicely furnished hotel on Central Park South
text: Location is ideal. Good gym. Bathroom somewhat small. Excellent staffing.  If you get into executive club with Marriott status, terrific selection for breakfast. My only nitpick is expresso and/or latte, etc. in restaurant and/or room service, i.e., can't get  latte or expresso to go. Overall very good

title: This was my second stay at the Essex House.  I love the location and service staff, however.
text: I would not stay at the Essex House again. I am disappointed in the customer service I received from the management staff.  Early one morning as I stepped out of bed, I felt something crunch under my left foot and I felt several "somethings" run past my right foot.  When I turned on the light I realized I had stepped on and killed a good size "cockroach", about 2" long.  This was not what I was expecting while staying at at a JW Marriott.  Management was quick to give us a different room and have house keeping recovered the dead cockroach body.  I was told the room would be "comped".  As promised they did not charge us for the room however we were still charged all the taxes associated with renting a room in New York City.  I would have preferred not to have been charged for anything while sleeping in a cockroach infested room.   Our stay at Essex was not pleasant as we had to keep all of our belongings and luggage secured and closed.  In fact when we got home, all of the luggage was kept outside and sprayed with insecticide.  Where I'm most disappointed in, is the fact that no one from the management team ever followed up with me. It was just as cold as doing business outside, nobody really cares who you are, just pay me. I was hoping for more of a human touch, a connection, nope just another business transaction.

title: Excellent Stay if You've Got the $$$$
text: Everything about our stay was excellent, and we were very impressed by the comfort of the beds, so much so that my wife photoed the labels, and after we were home, found and bought pillows by the same manufacturer and a bed topper that simulated the comfort of the mattress. All personnel were helpful, friendly and capable - and they should be when our room was $600+ per night. Food in the restaurant was quite good for breakfast or a late bite. We had a Jr. Suite, which was spacious, but we were a little disappointed that there was no divider between sleeping and sitting area as shown ion the web site.

title: Terrible service, overpriced, old property
text:
It was my first time to New York and wanted to stay somewhere special and the wife suggested near Central Park so I came across this hotel as we recognised the brand and have some membership status with Marriott so thought to treat ourselves since it was our Anniversary. 

Decided to upgrade to Central Park view paying more of course and only to discover that this would be a view of just trees straight in front of us (we were told by a not so friendly receptionist the room would be on the third floor).

We were tired from a 30 hr flight so just got to the room only to discover how dirty and run down it was. Hairs in the bathroom and dusty every where. Since we got the lowest floor possible (I was joking with the wife that they threw us in the basement) we were literally looking past the flags that were above the entrance to the hotel to our ‘Central Park views’.

The next day we managed to get a change of room to one on the fourteenth fl but it was the size of shoe box and still filthy and dusty. The normal fridge in the cabinet under the tv was out of order so they decided to put a replacement one that they must have picked up from the local junk yard (it looked like it had fallen down all the stairs of one world tower). Because the room was already do small the fridge had to be put at the end of the bed taking up more space leaving nowhere to walk to access that side of the bed.

Then the wife unpacks only to get an electric shock from the faulty cupboard lights no doubt due to lack of maintenance which is theme that runs through this whole place. So hotel is notified and offers of apology are begrudgingly given making yourself feel the guilty party as if you need to convince them that the complaints are real.  By this time after all the packing and unpacking we get put into an even smaller room on the eighth fl but have already lost a precious night in NY and will never get back. Seeing our dissatisfaction we were given some flowers and bowl of fruit and some truffle chocolates with two small Moët champagne bottles as they probably felt sorry for us on our anniversary. Unfortunately we’re not big drinkers.

Service wise the room service receptionist was polite (Rosemary I think) and attentive but the prices are way too high and slow to arrive although food service attendants were generally also polite except one time when we just asked for a few things it was as if you were asking the guy to cut his arm off for you. Food itself was generally ok. Due to all the misadventures the hotel gave us a late check out at 4 pm and when we requested a bit more time were begrudgingly given another half hour. The whole experience can be summed up as a total lack of love. From check in to dealing with staff to the general atmosphere around the lobby you get a sense of unwelcomeness. Actually the feeling around the lobby and property it’s as if your in some high security stakeout given the looks your given by the the staff/security swat team.

To sum up will never go back again and don’t mind paying more for the plaza hotel as I’m sure that will live up to it’s reputation.

title: Outstanding Hotel...Perfect Location with Superlative Service
text: We recently stayed at the Essex House for a ten day visit. The primary focus of our trip was to attend the graduation of our granddaughter from Barnard College...but we added on time to visit friends, family and some of our old haunts from our long ago time living in and around New York. For us the location could not have been more ideal. We loved being across the street from Central Park, yet also conveniently close to Columbus Circle, Carnegie Hall, Lincoln Center, Radio City Music Hall and the Times Square/Theater District area.  All were within walking distance. In addition to location, and the overall quality of this property, what stood out the most for us was the remarkable level of service provided by staff in all functional areas that we dealt with. The Concierge team is about the best I have ever encountered, and I travel globally on an extensive basis. Kevin and Michael are absolute stand-outs, who provided us with excellent restaurant recommendations, theater tickets to one of the hottest plays in New York, and advice on places to visit. They were instrumental in arranging a post-graduation dinner for our extended family, and several other group dining experiences. The entire Concierge staff was warm, friendly, most helpful and took customer service to a new level. However, outstanding and friendly service was also provided by the Front Desk, especially Felix; the Doormen, Art and Danny; our Housekeeper; and the wait staff in the excellent Executive Lounge. Without reservation, our stay at Essex House was an incredibly positive experience.  Needless to say, whenever we return to Manhattan, our residence of choice will always be this wonderful hotel. I recommend Essex House without any reservations.

title: Seeing Clients in NYC
text: This is the 3rd time I have stayed here when in NYC and I love the property and location.  Lots of great restaurants in walking distance.  Excellent service from friendly staff.  Right across the street from Central Park.  One of my NYC favorites!

title: Essex house - excellent location
text: We stayed at the Essex house last December. This is a really interesting historic hotel in a great location - with views of Central Park and walking distance to Times Square, MOMA and the Met. Rooms were ok and the service excellent. Ithought this hotel was a vast improvement over the Michaelangelo which we had stayed at previously, which had horrible rooms with views of the alley.

title: Executive Lounge was the Highlight
text: We stayed for 4 nights as Platinum level guests. I reserved a park view room. We could see the park - but our room was on the side of the building so it was more of a partial view. I guess I expected an upgrade to a full view of the park... Housekeeping was spotty. Be aware that instead of Do Not Disturb signs, there is a switch for a light by the door that signals the housekeeping staff. Even after we figured that out, sometimes we had to call for service. We also had the magically appearing/disappearing bath rug. It was never consistent. That said, the staff was very friendly and helpful. Take advantage of the amenities that the resort fee (you are paying anyway) offers - food credit and free zoo passes. The best amenity was the Executive lounge. Included -  if you qualify - free breakfast, late afternoon appetizers, snacks and beverages throughout the day. Really saved us time and money. Be aware of the times it is open, tho. Limited hours on the weekends.

title: Great location, great view with very nice customer service
text: I spent one night at the Essex House. The location is great, right on Central Park South. My room overlooked Central Park, but I was only on the 5th floor, but, still, a nice view. The room was small, but clean and everything worked well. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was modern. The customer service was excellent. My Marriott status gave me access to the Executive Lounge. The breakfast buffet was the most extensive I have ever seen. In addition to extensive, it was also very good.

title: Great hotel, great service, great experience!
text: We loved our stay at Essex House. The rooms are beautiful and meticulously clean. The beds were really comfy! Every member of staff we met was so pleasant and Jasmin Chen in particular went above and beyond to sort out an issue with the room for which we were very grateful. The concierge was fantastic and gave us so many tips for New York and booked us into a great speakeasy which was on our list of things to do! The hotel is in a great location near to the tube stations and within walking distance of key New York attractions. We won’t stay anywhere else when we return to New York!

title: Quiet room in great location
text:
We stayed 3 nights and enjoyed great service, at the front desk and from housekeeping. The room was tight, but well-appointed.
 Also had a drink in the very hopping bar. Blackout curtains in room, great bath products.

title: Excellent experience
text:
I stayed 4 nights in early April. The first 2 were in a room with a view of Central Park, very pretty to awake to. It was a small room so we asked if, as a Platinum elite, we could move to a larger room. Natalie (guest services) was extremely helpful and we moved to a large room  no view, but very comfortable.
I'd like tu o also give thanks to the manager of the executive lounge. She's from Jamaica and is fabulous, it's my own awful memory that I can't recall her name. She was extremely gracious, especially as some guests were quite rude. The breakfast options were very good.

title: Perfect location
text:
Perfect location for our daughter’s 22nd bday trip.  Just across the street from Central Park, walking distance or easy subway ride to theater district, some fun cocktail bars, and great dining.  
Staff was attentive, and helpful. Hotel is classic but still looks great.  Our Park view suite room was perfect for what we needed for the three of us.

title: Sadly, very poor customer service
text:
If the hotel staff can't get a room ready by 8pm what would have happened if we'd arrived at 4pm, a 4 hour wait?
I suppose the view of a tree which happens to be on the opposite side of the road in Central Park counts as a Central park view!
Dinning, the restaurant is more like eating in a shopping mall.
Had breakfast and got chased out of the restaurant. My crime, having waited for seven minutes for the bill to arrive I got up and walked out. You might question how I know it was seven minutes, or why was I timing them. Well having waited a long time for coffee and eventually having to ask another server timing them seemed only fair.
 Even more concerning is their response to a poor review. "We hear your concern and would like to discus more about this, Barry. Can you please send us your email and reservation name?" Three days later I'm still awaiting a response.
Having just asked for an extended check-out I was given 1 hour. Maybe they'd forgotten the 4 plus hours from check-in.
I'd rate this hotel 2 stars with nice chandeliers.

title: Excellent
text:
Wonderful location, next the Central Park. 

Room are good, for NYC standard and also the service is ok, all this considering that we are in New York City 

Breakfast is good, and you can find good options.

title: Very underwhelming
text: Just stayed at the JW Marriott Essex House in NYC.  The location is terrific right across from Central Park. The hotel is very underwhelming for a JW.  First, I checked in online early and my gold status got me the beautiful view of a brick wall attached.  The room is ok but not special and worn (see picture of bathtub).  Also found hairs in the bathroom.  The desk is very small and not for business.  No power outlets on the bedside table.  If this were a regular Marriott and ~$300 in NYC I could somewhat understand but I paid $750 for the room and got to look at a brick wall and had a poor room.  Not at all JW standards.  Will go elsewhere next time.

title: Avoid - Rude staff - Poor front desk.
text:
Staff was very curt and uninterested in guest concern or needs.  The front desk, especially Liz whom refused to put Allen on the phone.  I requested a 45 min - 1 hour extension as an Elite Gold member and she told me those benefits were not available.to me.   I then called the operator and asked for Allen to call me- still no response. I then called and asked for the executive offices and again was refused to be put through.  I enjoy so many Ritz and Starwood properties and could not understand how one person feels the need to block a guest from speaking to another staff member.  
 I will not stay here again.

title: Quiet king room with a view of Central Park
text:
We are all about the comfort of the bedding and this hit the mark. 

The room was very well laid out with ample charging ports and sitting accommodations and the view of the park was an added bonus.  

We used room service a couple of times and were impressed with the quality of food and service.

title: This JW is exceptional, so are the views and the bed linens!
text: For years I chose other luxury hotels in NYC because my stay at the JW Marriott the first month it opened was just awful, and worse, the staff seemed miserable too.  I had waited for the transfer to Marriott as the location is outstanding and wanted to surprise my husband with a Central Park view.  The rooms were gold and old, the staff was unhappy, and it showed, and so were we.  Last week I came back after two friends told me of their recent stellar experiences.  What a wonderful transformation.  The staff was hospitable and professional, the room was generous and beautiful, and the Guest Relations team could not have been better.  They heard it was my birthday and went all out to make sure I had a great day, and a great stay.  From the front door to check out it was the kind of experience that will bring me back for business and pleasure for many years to come.

title: Luxury overlooking Central Park
text: We had a fabulous experience at the JW. Service from front door to concierge to room service was all 5 star. We stayed in the Manhattan Suite overlooking Central Park and it was amazing. Gorgeous views, a lot of light and plenty of space. As Titanium Elite Bonvoy members we had access to the lounge where there was a nice buffet breakfast offered in the morning. The location of this hotel is perfect. Loved being out of the hustle of Times Square with the serene Central Park location.

title: Stay 4/18/19 Essex House
text: Wonderful night at the Essex House. Since Starwood and Marriot merged, I finally used some points for a Marriot location. I am a gold member and was able to secure a room with park view THANKS to Melvin at the front desk! He was awesome. Great representative to be front line with guests. As was the bartendar who has been there for 27 years. The room was great. We are picky, we love Ritz Carlton and other more luxury properties, and the Essex House did not disappoint. We WILL be back. We often go to concerts at the Beacon Theater and the hotel is the perfect location. We walked to the show through the park on a lovely full moon evening:)

title: JW’s are usually fantastic. This one, not so much.
text: The location is superb, but the rest of my stay was only mediocre. I am “only” a gold Marriott member, so maybe one must be titanium to get adequate service at this establishment. I did not receive any special greeting at check-in. In fact, the desk staff barely grunted at me. Staff did not go out of their way to speak to me at all during my stay. My room was small with no view, and 2 doors down from the elevators (which I heard all night long). Internet (which was supposed to be “premium”) was far from serviceable. I did contact the front desk about it because I was unable to connect reliably (it kept going out) and I could not get work done. I ended up walking around the corner to a restaurant with Wi-Fi to finish my presentation. Also, I could not use the streaming services on the television due to internet dropping out multiple times mid-stream. I asked for more towels, and washcloths in specific — it took three calls to get it right. Really disappointed. Glad my client was paying for the room and not me out of my own pocket.

title: Best Kept Secret across from  Central Park
text:
I have stayed at this hotel two  other times.  I am a Marriott Titanium member and love great service when I travel.
The staff goes way and beyond.  Everyone is accommodating from the doorman to house keeping.  No reasonable request is refused.  The rooms are spacious and clean.   The executive lounge has great food choices and the variety of food  in the morning is enough for breakfast and Lunch.

The location is perfect, across the street from Central Park and around the corner from 5th avenue.  It is also a few blocks from Lincoln Center.  Multiple restaurants of all price point surround this hotel for anyone on a budget.  The park is great for families.  We rented bikes and had a great time exploring the park. 

This is definitely my go-to hotel when I am in New York.

title: Fantastic location for New York
text:
The hotel is right across from Central Park, near great restaurants, and shopping.  The hotel is clean and professional.  The hotel restaurant is not up to JW standards though.  It is up to the standard of a random Marriott in Kansas City.  The food quality is ok, the service is not up to JW standard, and it's mediocre ambiance.  I would not eat at the restaurant on purpose, or recommend it.  Really disappointing, and kind of a joke.  The room service is also WAY over priced, and also mediocre.  

The room is very comfortable, and modern.  The bed is great, and the pillows are comfortable.  The TV has an added feature to sign into your netflix account, which is great.  For New York standards, it's a big room too.

title: Experience at Essex
text: We had a very comfortable stay at this hotel on a weekend visit to Manhattan. The most appealing thing about this property is it’s location. This hotel is right across the street from Central Park, a block from Columbus Circle and easy walking distance from all the shows on Broadway. The building itself is old but everything works great in terms of the plumbing, heating and cooling systems. The lobby is small but we experienced no problems with the front desk, concierge or doormen. The beds are nice and maid service was very satisfactory. There is a nice breakfast buffet in the restaurant off the lobby and the service staff there are very good but prices are high like everywhere else in NYC. The hotel went out of their way to honour an AMEX reward that was attached to our booking. I would definitely stay there again.

title: Great location and views
text:
We had a Central Park facing room on the 19th floor with beautiful views of the park. We had an event at the Plaza hotel on a Saturday night so this was convenient to the event.

The room was clean and modernized with plenty of outlets conveniently placed for charging personal devices.

The front desk, concierge, bell hop and restaurant staff were very professional and nice. Sunday morning we took a long walk in the park which was directly across the street.

title: Return Visit
text:
We returned here after a visit in Nov 2015 - where we said if we were ever back in NYC this would be the place (subject to cost!) we would stay.  We were travelling with two children (17 & 12) and booked a junior suite and got an upgrade to a Manhattan suite (with Marriott rewards - the only way we could afford it!). This was well worth it as the Manahattan suite gives you a proper separate living room with couch that makes up into a double bed. We had partial views of Central Park which was an added bonus. The kids said the couch bed was comfortable enough but after the 5th night they said a proper bed would be good. The rooms have all been recently upgraded and were very comfortable in general. No tea/coffee making facilities in the rooms nor fridge for your own things, however you can ask for a fridge /microwave for your room. 

The hotel permits dogs and there were guests with dogs on our floor (36) - we never heard the dogs other than when we were walking to and from the elevators. 

The hotel has an Executive Lounge which we used and provided you with a full breakfast every day, and evening dishes Monday thru Thursday with an honour bar. A little disappointed that it is no longer open the other days in the evening, and after breakfast on those days it isn’t open during the day at all not even for teas/coffees etc. 

In terms of location - it’s fantastic. Steps to Central Park and only ten minutes walk to Times Square and many other sights. We had lunch at the Foodcourt at the Plaza a couple of times - a great find for quality lunch when you don’t want a sit down meal. Would definitely recommend exploring here.

We ate in the Southgate restaurant at the hotel a couple of times. The food was of a good quality however the menu is limited and it is a little on the expensive side - but probably not for NYC. We met up with relatives one evening and the restaurant proved a good venue with a large high table for the 8 of us to sit round - for a relaxed finger food experience. Our lady server was excellent. 

I would say it is a comfortable hotel in a good location (it is however a little more expensive) would definitely stay again when back in NYC.

title: Wonderful stay!
text:
Spent 3 nights at the Essex House in one of their suites.  We were with our 2 young kids and the set up was one of the most spacious for NYC hotels.  The living room had plenty of space for both of our kids to comfortably sleep and play.  Location was ideal, across from Central Park, subway station on the block and surrounded by lots of restaurants.  Easy check in and concierge was helpful and accomodating.  
Only complaint is that we had a view of a brick wall and it sounded like jet engines (giany exhaust fans) outside our window.  This blocked out all of the loud street noise though so I guess it was the lesser of 2 evils.   Will be staying here again because of the great room set up for our family!

title: Great location but lacking in service
text:
Pros:  Great Location, Beautiful remodel, historic.

Cons: Staff lacks courtesy and attention to details.  Service is weak.  I felt like a nuisance to the staff when I asked them questions or requested things.  The concierge were helpful however.  Room service forgot things, our room had a couple of things that needed to be repaired.  I expected more from a JW Marriott and also considering how much we paid.

title: Hotel near Central Park
text: Best part of hotel is that it is around corner from Le Pain Quotidien and across street from Central Park!! Staff was friendly, hotel was clean, room spacious, beds comfy. It’s in expensive side, and while very nice,  not sure it offers more value than say Park Lane, a few doors down. That said, I would stay there again in a heartbeat if I could afford it.

title: Fun trip to NY
text:
It always seems that no matter how much you try ,something goes hay wire ,we advice of our membership number, doesnt come out, we had a door that locked some of us out, some of us in, not fun at all !!
It had been broken before we arrived but no one took notice and they had to change rooms,
Good location, good restaurants, people were nice and helpful !!

title: Disgraceful
text:
Originally booked to stay for 5 night but due to technical fault had to extend to a further 8 nights.

Concierge was extremely rude and finished at 21:00 each night which when trying to make requests for transport no one there to assist. Tried to ask if hotel management could  assist but again was told no.

They tried to encourage the use of their own vehicle, (which is below adequate for a chauffeur) This has all been reported to the chauffeur company.

 The hotel was extremely slow and seem quite difficult to do the most similplist things like, check in, this was all too much. Bell service refused to take luggage to the suites because they never got a tip straight away. 

Absolutely disgusting treatment because they didnt get the tip straight away and expected extortionate amounts.

Upon final check out, a hotel member chased us out the hotel to our awaiting chauffeurs, to make sure they would get payment. We paid everything up front and to be treated like a criminal is beyond words! 

I would welcome a formally apology from the hotel staff especially the rude and aggressive concierge Cameron.

Utterly speechless.

When travelling to NYC, personally would avoid staying at the Marriott Essex House.

title: Excellent
text: Had an excellent visit - comfortable room, excellent fitness center equipped with 3 pelotons, free WiFi and the location directly across from Central Park is incredible. I didn’t have to park but beware it’s $85/day.  Had a dinner catered by the hotel in one of the meeting rooms which was delicious. Great customer service by the front desk staff.

title: Excellent
text:
Location and service was amazing.  The executive lounge was undergoing renovation and was open for breakfast only this particular weekend at a different location.

I can't say enough about the location.  It is across the street for Central Park South and walking distance to Time Square.

title: Fabulous stay
text:
Everything about JWM Essex House is fabulous. Location, across from Central Park, staff, very friendly and helpful, room service, breakfast was incredible and the beds are so comfy. Great wine selection in the bar.
We will be back.

title: Spring break with family
text:
We had an amazing stay at the JW over Spring Break. I wanted adjoining rooms with my daughters (ages 17 & 12). The only adjoining rooms don't have a view, but we did have our own hallway! So we had a locked door to the hallway plus our 2 separate rooms. I was a little nervous about not actually adjoining but the private hallway was perfect. 

The hotel is gorgeous and the service was impecable. The location can't be beat - right across from Central Park and walking distance to many sights. We stayed at the Ritz down the street last year and found it comparable. 

We experienced road closures twice - one was the St Patrick's Day parade and the next day was the half marathon. Made it difficult to get to our hotel so be aware of that. The morning we left for the airport, we weren't able to get a cab outside the hotel so the bellman loaded all 5 suitcases on a cart and rolled it several blocks for us and hailed a cab. Now that is service! We almost didn't make our flight because the road closures were very extensive and we were stuck in traffic!! Keep that in mind if you are leaving on a parade/marathon day!

Also - the room service was great!! We had room service several times and it was delicious and fast. I asked my 12 year old to call for me and she looked at the hotel phone and said "I wasn't trained on that kind of phone!" haha

title: Worse Marriott brand hotel.   Will never stay here again.
text: This is the by far the worse Marriott hotel I’ve stayed at.  The mini fridge was broke and wouldn’t open and I reported almost every night to have it serviced but no one even came up.   The bathtub drains very slowly.   I reported a bug bite and they took months to came back to me to tell me they found nothing.  So disappointed that a historic hotel like this is such horrible service.   Will never stay here again.

title: Business trip
text: I enjoyed my stay. My room was clean and ready on time. The staff was professional and friendly. The meeting space was efficient and the lunch meal was very good. Proximity to Central Park was an added bonus.

title: Proffesional Service
text: 最高でした。特にベルマンのPAULとフロントデスクMELVINはプロフェッショナル。綺麗なコロンバスサークル近くで便利！

title: Excellent value for Central Park hotel
text: We stayed here for a NYC weekend.  The hotel’s location is wonderful!  Walking distance to innumerable activities.  We are Bonvoy platinum.  We used  two of our suite nights, and we were upgraded to a Manhattan suite.  It was quite nice and spacious.  The food and beverage options at the hotel were good.  It’s good that the activity fee goes toward that.  Staff were friendly and helpful.

title: Average hotel, great location
text:
I was very underwhelmed with our stay here. The customer service was subpar for a higher end Marriott chain. There were no staff members who were looking to go out of their way for an exceptional experience. Definitely not the Ritz. It wasn’t bad just didn’t really notice it. The only negative experience I had was when a bellman tried to steal a taxi that my wife and daughter had just flagged down for another guest. The guest saw it all occur and gave it back to us. Thank you!
We stayed in a Manhattan suite during our stay. The room was nice and spacious. The bathroom was a little small and dated for a suite. If you are just looking for a place to stay at a decent rate in a great location this is a great place for that. Just don’t expect anything above and beyond.

title: Beautiful hotel
text: This hotel looks directly across the street from Central Park & we took a carriage ride through on our way to the metropolitan museum. It was cold outside but the blankets warmed us while we rode past runners and dogs in their warm outfits.

title: Wonderful stay
text: What can I say. I’ve stayed at this hotel before alone and decided to spend my honeymoon with my new wife here. From start to finish we had a fantastic experience. Nothing is to much trouble for the staff at Essex house. I ordered some flowers and chocolates in the room this was done. John the bell man cares way above and beyond his job role that everything is perfect and general friendly manner of staff is top class. We was given an upgrade and a small treat in recognition of our special ocassiin which really did mean a lot. I have stayed in many 5 star hotels around the world for me this tops the list. Love the design of the hotel keeping it’s character really feels like a classic. I have read many reviews saying the rooms are small all I can say to that is you will be very disappointed if you stay anywhere in the uk, there is plenty of space. I spoke with one of the management Ana, who was a very nice lady indeed. I do not have enough praise for this hotel. I will be recommending to friends, family and business colleagues and me and my wife will be back. Well done Ana and all the team at Essex house keep up the great work and don’t change a thing!

title: Great location, great view
text:
Stayed in the family suite mid February with the wife and kids. 36 floor with views from the bedroom to the park.
The smallest had never experienced snow before so to see her face as the weather predictions came true and the snow clouds began to crawl across central park was priceless. Needless to say we then spent 2 cold hours in the park, which is just across the road from the hotel.
The standard of the room was high, very clean and well maintained. I would have one suggestion though, modern families travel with a plethora of electronic goods iPods iPads etc, so a few more charging stations wouldn't go amiss.
As for the location, great! tube station just around the corner, convenience store 1 block away. You can not beat it!
Stayed for the marathon also, but never wrote a review at that time. however, we enjoyed the same standard of service both times.

title: I loved it
text:
I use to travel a lot and I can simply say we felt home. All the stay , unfortunately only  2 nights , almost perfect , all the staff simply amazing. Close to Central Park5th Avenue and the most famous activities/places in upper Manhattan. 
See you soon :)

title: Well below the JW Marriott standard
text:
I had stayed at the essex house back when it was still independent and then under the Jumeirah brand for a while so I decided to try again for this Valentine day romantic week end.
First my room was not ready only upon arrival at 2pm and I had to wait for a better room for another 2 hours, I was eventually checked in at a nice floor but with a VERY PARTIAL/ CORNER view of central park.
I has specifically booked for the front view so I requested a real FRONT VIEW and got it afterwards. albeit a lower floor.
Both these superior rooms at the Essex house seemed a bit run down, badly in need of renovation but is not the worst problem that this hotel is facing: while patiently waiting  for my room to be ready, I decided to head to the bar for a comfort drink-I was sick with a bad head cold.  As I asked the bar tender to offer a suggestion as for a hot toddy type of drink, eggnog or rum, he dismissed me, vaguely pointing to the bar bottle display and immediately turning his back to me…More than 10 mn after I ordered , a hot tea came up from another waiter without anything else ( alcohol) at the same time the front desk manager came to inform me of my room being ready: I left after barely drinking half and paying which should have been offered as courtesy for wasting my time. I later gave my full feed back to the manager of the bar about this rather unwelcoming/rude and unprofessional attitude and he apologized on behalf of this employee.Needless to say that we never spent another dollar on this restaurant during the rest of our 4 day stay...
The cleaning of our room was also a problem: after leaving our room in the 9 am hour, we formally requested front desk to have the room cleaned and twice the room was still untouched upon our return after lunch…
We also ordered room service and once a simple herbal tea took 35 mn to be sent after I had to call back and inquire.Another time, we ordered in basic dinner soup and sandwich and were amazed at the pricing of such basics, not to mention the added taxes that make a simple combo like this more expensive than your average good meal at a nice restaurant around !
Even better, we had the pleasure of a scaffolding coming down in front of our window on the first day of our stay, totally obstructing a window of our front view of the park. On top of that, drilling all throughout the day when you are trying to rest and recover from a severe head cold. When I reached out to the front desk, some back office employee told me that they could not do anything about it although we had clearly booked the Essex House in part for a nice , unobstructed front view of the park.
I had to talk directly to the construction workers to make sure that they lift the thing away from our widow before leaving the job at the end of the day, which luckily they did.
All in all, this hotel is not run at the level of the JW Marriott standard and what you would come to expect from the price point.There seem to be a total absence of management / leadership and customer-first spirit. Almost as if the location was already a privilege granted to guests and customer experience the last concern of this crew.
The Ritz or Park Lane nearby seem to run a better, tight ship despite their similar prime location on Central Park.Therefore, we will likely opt to stay away –as you also should- from the Essex House till Marriot Corporate realize the shortcomings of this operation and get it back to the level where it should be...

title: Great hotel!
text: Spent 2 nights at this hotel accompanying my husband on a business trip. Accommodations were very nice and the service was exceptional!  The Concierge complimentary breakfast and evening appetizers exceeded our expectation and service was excellent! I loved being across the street from Central Park and a short walk to Times Square, theaters and lots of restaurants. Had a lovely short but sweet visit to the Big Apple! Will definitely stay there again.

title: Can't Beat The Location!!!!!!!!!
text: I was sooo pleasantly surprised when we stayed at the JW Marriott Central Park ESSEX house. The rooms are clean and decent size given it is NYC and rooms are on smaller size. The building although older has been remodeled and has all the amenities you would want. We stayed there over new years eve with children and found it to be very convenient. Room service was on time and staff was generally helpful.

title: Enjoy your Stay
text: I really enjoyed my stay at the Essex house during Thanksgiving week 2018. Last time I reviewed this hotel I felt the service was a bit lacking but this year all my expectations were met. Great location! Clean spacious room with a view of Central Park etc... With very pleasant staff.

title: Fantastic Hotel just off Central Park
text: Booked this hotel for a special celebration trip to New York and I was very pleased with the selection! Everyone of the staff was great including the bellman, front counter, concierge (Michael), lounge staff and housekeeping were very accommodating. The location of the hotel was very convenient for our planned tourist activities. Room accommodations were perfect and appear to be recently refurbished. The suite room was huge by New York standards.

title: Gold and Gilded
text: I recently stayed at this beautiful hotel. What a hidden gem. The rooms have been renovated and they are very luxurious. I highly recommend purchasing the entry-level rooms and asking at the desk if you can pay up for the next level. Even if you don’t have a view, it’s still spectacular because of the accommodations and luxury of it all. Marble bathrooms, double sheeted linens, fluffy pillows, it’s just amazing.  The restaurant on site is also a great place to hang out and people watch. This property is very secure and you can only access the guest floors by passing security and showing your key. Absolutely 100% safe if you’re a solo traveler.  Location is ideal, not too far from Dupont Circle, and Central Park. It is literally steps from Central Park. This is the best neighborhood in NYC. Easy to catch the subway line as well.

title: Well located and very comfortable property
text: We thoroughly enjoyed Essex House.  It had been over ten years since our last visit and the renovation was nicely done.  The suite was very comfortable and spacious with nice toiletries and amentiies.  The executive lounge was quite functional with good selections of food and wine.  It was odd that the bus table (with dirty dishes and food scraps) was adjacent to the door for the food and beverage area (surely another area could be designated).  The hotel service was very good and the location cannot be beat.

title: Great Location - Didn’t Meet Expectations
text:
This hotel is in a great location across from Central Park with plenty of good restaurants nearby.

The Executive Lounge is one of the best.  

We were promised a view of Central Park and only had a view of a building during our stay.  Spoke with a manager and wasn’t able to offer any options.  

In addition to not having a view, there was a construction project in the bathroom that wasn’t done correctly.  

This property does not fully reflect the experience one would expect with a JW Marriott.

title: Pessima limpeza
text: Esperavamos um minimo de padrao por ser Marriot.Decepcao!! Limpeza dos quartos praticamente nao existia.Definitivamente nao retornaremos.Funcionarios do Concierge sempre com ma vontade em atender.Localizacao muito boa em frente ao Central Park.Definitivamente nao retornaremos.

title: Great Location, Iconic Hotel and Helpul, Friendly Staff
text: My wife and I, along with our two teen-aged sons, stayed at the Essex House for quick getaway in New York. We had the "Family Connector" rooms, which provide one room with a king bed and another entirely separate room, attached through a hallway/vestibule, with two queen beds. The rooms were nicely decorated with large bathrooms, extremely comfortable beds and were hauntingly quiet - a rarity in Manhattan. So, while not inexpensive, they were reasonably priced for relatively spacious, well-appointed family accommodations right on Central Park. The only downside? Our windows looked out onto the interior "courtyard," with the scaffolding, roof-lines and other brick walls as our view. Not really a problem, since we spent little time in the room. Staff was friendly and helpful, particularly David, the concierge who assisted us with dinner and brunch reservations at the last minute - after we extended our stay. Yes, we enjoyed the Essex House so much, we added an extra night to our reservation, which the hotel gladly accommodated. The entire staff, including Gregory at the front desk for our check-in, were friendly, professional and always helpful. We will definitely stay at the Essex House for our next stay in Midtown. Highly recommended.

title: Front desk staff extreme unprofessional
text:
I’ve always had the best experience at this hotel
until now. Aaron front desk supervisor
Just lacks good customer service his tone when speaking to guests is very condescending .... they charged me for early check in although a platinum member with the Ritz Carlton brands and the room that was given to me was dirty will never stay here again

title: Girls weekend in the city
text: My 2 girlfriends and I stayed in the Manhattan Suite as part of a birthday celebration.  I cannot say enough about the wonderful service and the beautiful hotel!  We stayed on an upper floor, and the refurbishing of the room was more like a city apartment rather than a hotel room.  Comfortable living area, all in shades of navy, grey and cream.  Given that this is an older  hotel, I was surprised at how large the bathroom was -- complete with a deep soaking tub.  We usually stay at the Marriott Marquis, but decided this time around to stay in a quieter location with a view.  I would definitely stay here again.

title: Love the hotel
text: Great hotel- classy old New York in Midtown Manhattan. Back rooms away from the street and Central Park are quiet with subdued street noise. The staff is friendly and the hotel is close to all the major NYC atttactions popular at the holiday season. My 2nd stay there and love it. Great for Marriot gathering points as well.

title: Great view, small room,excellent Staff!!
text: Area can't be beat, Central Park South (of course).  We wanted to stay somewhere different this time around.  Usually stay at Marquis in Times Square.  Did not want the hustle and bustle of that area.  Stayed with my husband who had business in the city.  Hotel is pretty but not very large.  Very clean common areas and rooms.  No complaints there.  Just be careful when staying here.  We were upgraded to a king room with a view of the Park.  It was very nice this time of year.  But the room was small.  I guess I should have known because this is an old building.  The old Essex House building.  I believe they do have larger rooms on higher floors but I am sure they are very,very expensive. For the cost of the rooms they really do need to upgrade the windows.  It was very cold and the air streaming through the window was ridiculous and not soundproof at all.   They do have a nice restaurant/bar , but the bar seating itself is very small.  It is more lounge like.  All in all nice hotel but I think I am one and down with this Marriott property.  Rooms are pricey and not very large.  First room we had faced a courtyard of other rooms. Larger room but felt closed in because we did not see the street.  Did not like that at all.  So beware unless you might like not hearing the street noise. Did not care for the resort fee?  Really? They had an excercise room.  That's it!! We used points, we are platinum members with Marriott.  This hotel is in the same category as the Ritz and the St. Regis.  They take the same amount of points per stay at those hotels.  I would definitely stay at one of those hotels first.  This hotel should not be in the same category as the Ritz or St. Regis.

title: Great Location, beautiful hotel but...
text: We stayed 4 nights at the Essex House & loved the location. The hotel is beautiful & well kept with very very friendly staff. What you should know before you book though is that you will likely NOT get the Platinum Elite upgrade if you have Marriott/SPG status & the club lounge is PACKED with Platinum members so much that in the morning you will likely have to wait in line for breakfast. The lounge has a great breakfast though but with limited hours. Just go early!! The first room we were given (booked w/ points) was closet sized with a tiny tiny window. We requested a large window & moved the next morning, the staff accommodated us right away. Hey Marriott!!! FYI don’t give your best customers a crappy room if they use points. Overall we’d stay again but we would book the Central Park view in advance & go off season.

title: Hotel rides on reputation; means staff and facilities are a little neglected
text: So the hotel’s location is unrivalled. The lobby is beautiful. Staff are helpful occasionally but none were typically attentive that we found. We were celebrating a special occasion and it felt like no one cared at all which is fair play but not the usual standard we get being Elite members of Marriott/ Ritz Carlton. Breakfast buffet was the worst we have ever had at a JW Marriott. We were guided to what we would ordinarily call a “lounge” which other guests paid for or got included if they met a certain quota of stays for the year. It included the usual “free” stuff such as porridge with water not milk and cheese, bread, beans, poor quality fatty bacon, all in metal bowls. For the price it was dreadfully awful.

title: Excellent Location in Stunning NYC Landmark, Essex House
text: Sitting on Central Park South, this hotel offers an excellent location coupled with stunning views of the park.  The hotel itself, a Manhattan Art-Deco icon, originally opened in 1929, and has had several owners since then. With a sweeping, enormous lobby that narrows down into a stunning walkway through the building, the first floor glows with brass fixtures everywhere and classic New York architectural elements such as the black and white tile. First floor has a hotel bar of some sort, though I did not get to visit it, a jewelry store, gift shop, Executive Club, and a few other eateries. One feels impressed walking in, which is important because at present the exterior is covered in scaffolding while the building undergoes restoration. Check-in went very smoothly, with everyone welcoming and helpful. Upon entering my room, it became apparent the effort Marriott has put into upgrading this property. The room, spacious and intelligently-designed, gleamed with crisp white and black lines, an impeccable bathroom with full size tub, and a built-in desk, mini-bar, dresser, luggage rack fixture that looked beautiful while functioning extremely well. The room also came with a couch for visitors, and a large, comfortable king sized bed.  Having arrived very late, I ordered room service which arrived promptly (less than 25 minutes) and tasted delicious. In fact, it was the best chicken Caesar salad I've ever had - came with real anchovies and grilled chicken that had clearly just gotten grilled. The next day, I needed a late check out to work before heading to the airport. The hotel graciously arranged the late check out without issue and arranged my transportation to JFK. I do have Platinum status, and as such was granted access to the Executive Lounge. Due to schedule, I was only able to make breakfast down there, but it offered a terrific buffet spread with a variety of tasty selections. I imagine the other offerings throughout the day are just as good. While they do not advertise it, the waiters will secure espresso drinks upon request, and thus we started the day with two lattes while enjoying the rest of the meal. The staff helped me several times, and always offered polite and excellent service. Though I could easily manage my baggage, the doormen would not let me lift a finger, and insisted on bringing everything to the car and driver. All in all, I am very glad I stayed at this hotel, which I will now add to my list of places to stay in NYC.  Keep up the great work!

title: Excelente hotel frente al Central Park
text: Hotel de lujo ubicado al lado del Central Park, espacios comunes y habitaciones amplias, descuentos para socios en el desayuno, ticket gratuito para patinar sobre hielo. Amenidades completas en la habitacion

title: Fantastic Stay at the JW Marriott Essex House
text:
We've been staying at the Essex House for a number of years (back when it was operated as a Westin, then a Marriott and now as a JW Marriott).  It's been a while since we've last stayed here and I'm glad to say that the service and the quality of the rooms have been kept up to standard.  

Our most recent stay was over New Years and we had 2 rooms booked on points (one room for my husband and I and the other for my daughter and son-in-law).  My husbad and I both have Marriott Platinum Elite status as well as my son-in-law. I mentioned to everyone that we shouldn't expect any upgrades during this busy time of year.  In addition, my daughter and son-in-law were taking a red eye flight from the West coast and we were arriving later that same day a round 6pm.  When my daughter and husband checked in at 8am (not expecting to get a room that early) they actually checkd them in and gave them their room key.  It was a small room, but neverthelss and room that still met the J W standards and someplace where they could take a quick nap before touring the city.  

When we checked in, the front desk attendant apologized for taking so long but that he's trying to find a bigger room for us.  He did managed to find a nice corner room that was definitely bigger than our daughter's room (maybe about 450-sq ft).  

As previous posters have mentioned, the lonnge isn't very big and the food selection and quality are mediocre.

There is a $25/day resort fee, but they also give you a $35/day food and beverage credit (you can't roll it over to the next day if you don't use it)  that can be used at the bar, in the restaurant or even for the in room mini bar.  Surprisingly, we found the food in the restaurant to very good.  My husband had the duck and said it was delicious while I had the filet mignon sliders which was outstanding.

Overall, we had a nice visit at the Essex House and would definitely return.

title: Fantastic hotel, knows how to put things right - Marriott Platinum
text:
Context: European, frequent business traveller (Marriott Platinum), travelling as a couple.

Experience:
Hotel is large, great location beside park and nice setting. I was initially reluctant about the hotel having read the reviews, however - I have stayed in probably 300 different hotels and this ranks high on the list. 

Arrived late got nice welcome and went to room on 14 floor. Room was spacious, clean. I had requested a pack of cookies to be in the room upon arrival - these were not there. 

I contacted the inhouse team via email and was astonished by the prompt reply. Next day came back to the room - 5 cookies, plus cheese and fruit, plus water, plus a bottle of champagne - wow - the colleague then upgraded us to the 38th Floor. 

Lounge was closed on one of the days. Overall I was very impressed with a large hotel delivering like they do. 

Keep up the good work and particularly the outstanding service.

title: The worst hotel I have ever stayed
text:
A receptionist is lazy, not well-minded to explain about the hotel service with 
client's beneifts. It looks like they are trying not to avoid polite explnation and any kind of complaints, meaning almost all hotel staff are not willing to provie a quality service here. It is like I have come to a second-class British hotel.

title: Want it to be better
text: Spent a week at the JW Essex House. Most of it was good some things very good some not as much.Cesar at the front desk & Michael at the conciergerie desk were as good as it gets. Guest comfort & needs were clearly task 1. Did have a few issues with housekeeping but they did get resolved. Management was quick to respond & I will definitely be back for another chance. Location is perfect. Rooms are NYC size but well decorated.

title: Beautiful hotel building, but lacking in finishing touches w/in lounge or rooms
text:
We enjoyed our stay at the JW Essex in December, but felt that for the price paid, the hotel could do more to improve the overall experience.
 
Positives: lovely decorations for holiday season, staff was friendly, very comfy bed, nice shower + bathroom amenities, free lounge access (due to Lifetime Platinum status). 

Areas for improvement: extra price for room with "Central Park View" shouldn't apply unless you're above a certain floor - we were on the 6th floor, and couldn't see much of anything. Lounge breakfast was tasty, but room felt small, crowded, and chaotic - they also only offered to-go cups for all drinks (coffee, juice, etc), which seems wasteful. Room decor feels drab compared to the beauty of the lobby area, and we would have loved a Nespresso in our room. Room only included one robe when they knew two persons would be staying there. Bar area was also stylish, but could use more of a range in drink prices - not all glasses of wine should be $12-15+.

title: Essex House - Great, But Not the Same
text: Fortunately I had the opportunity to stay in the ESSEX House when it was THE ESSEX HOUSE. It is a great hotel, well run, nice rooms with great beds. It could not have a better address. J W Marriott's are top of the line in practically every way. BUT there is one maybe minute, maybe un-meaningful way. The ESSEX HOUSE had a personality and a sense of pride that emanated through out the entire hotel and its staff. The staff of the JWMarriott hardly noticed us, the concierges made not efforts on our behalf when asked and didn't notify us when they failed to help us.  The only friendly staff were the early morning cafe where we at least acknowledged with a smile. The Garden Restaurant, where I had my first, pinky toe crabs, was gone and replace with an a very nice bar scene, but not a restaurant I aspired to dine in.

title: One of the best hotels in the country!
text: The Essex house in NYC is spectacular.  Sitting on Central Park South it has tremendous views all times of the year.  The service of the entire staff really separates them from the pack.  Big, beautiful lobby with awesome bar and restaurant.  the M lounge has some of the best offerings you will see.  large, expansive fitness center with all the right equipment.  Rooms are fresh, sleek and comfortable

title: Birthday night
text: Hotel is beautiful. Location and view are amazing. The staff went over and above to make our birthday celebration night very special. Prior to arrival I was contacted to see if there was anything needed for our weekend. Once I informed them it was our birthday they made sure our room was decorated upon arrival. The bed was extremely comfortable and room was very spacious.

title: Superb New York Property!
text:
Very happy that the old classic Essex House, recently renovated, has returned to Marriott operation! The lobby is all beautiful marble, and door and bell staff are very warm and have a superb customer service focus. Reception team is great, and we had a fantastic experience with Hannah, an associate this hotel should clone! Hannah did all she could to ensure a wonderful stay for us, and we thank her!
Our suite was lovely, with an unbelievable view of the entire Central Park. Wow! Living room and bedroom were beautifully appointed, and very, very comfortable. Bathrooms were handsomely decorated. A true home away from home!
In-room dining was delicious, timely and wonderfully served. A great team, on both the ordering side and delivery.
We are thrilled the Essex House is back in our SPG/Marriott portfolio, and are excited to return!

title: Magical in the heart of Central Park
text: We were lucky to have reward points to use otherwise we couldn’t have afforded the stay, but I am glad we did!  The hotel rooms were updated and very clean!  Our beds were super comfy and the hotel staff was very kind and helpful.  We were out and about most of the days so we didn’t dine in, but we did order room service one night and it was delicious!  I am very picky about the quality and cleanliness of hotels and I would definitely recommend the Essex house!

title: Great all around
text: Terrific location, remodeled rooms, great staff -- Cesar always remembers me and often has my room key ready when I check in which is really exceptional. Great executive lounge and decent gym. Restaurant is overpriced but serviceable.

title: Poor Service
text:
Poorest hotel I have stayed at in the last 10 years. We travel extensively and unfortunately had the bad luck of staying at this property. The food is terrible. The service is lacking. Two days we had to call for the rooms to be cleaned and had an attitude from staff when we requested basic services. 
Avoid this property !

title: Lost some lustre, but still a nice hotel with epic views and location
text: Once upon a time, the Essex House embodied New York glamour.  The location remains sublime.  The views of Central Park remain tremendous.  However, while very pleasant it should be thought of as a high quality Westin or JW Marriott instead of a classic luxury hotel.  With that said, I give them credit for a solid "frequent guest" lounge and a very good fitness center, complete with Pelotons.  Unburdened by expectations of past glory, this is a very nice hotel and a great launching pad for NYC.

title: Great location and expensive read the review
text:
Wonderful hotel location for Central Park and the subways. The rooms & some areas having been refurbished. 

Food and drink will cost the “earth”💰💰💰💰💰 in any restaurant, coffee shop or cafe in this area. 

If you want a less “crazy” busy areas - go slightly further east or west away from Central Park. 

Stay away from any hotel around time square area. It would drive anyone insane with the hassle even trying to find space to walk on a pavement with the amount of people.  😫🤬😱🤯

title: A Classic!
text: A terrific property in a fabulous location with great service and amenities. What more could one want? From the classic rooftop sign to the elegant elevator doors, this is a grand NYC experience. Right on Central Park South, it's an easy walk to the shops on 5th Avenue and the subway lines at 7th Avenue and Columbus Circle. For those with lounge access, the breakfast buffet offers an outstanding selection. For such a large hotel, the elevator service is great; we never had to wait more than 30 seconds.

title: Woefully inadequate
text:
Ok It’s in a nice location, room is clean and some of the people are friendly...
But ...When you pay 1 k for a room and ask for a park view and the answer is we have those allocated already it is a shame -

especially with 119 Marriott nights this year and 1200 lifetime -Platinum Ambassador level 
And to be told you can’t bring a bagel up to your room from the executive lounge (which is not Marriott quality ) it is insulting 

To many rules and you have to pay for drinks in the executive lounge 

will not stay here again (but have to until jan 2 )

title: Decent hotel, great location
text: The hotel is right across from the park and a short walk to Carnegie Hall, Times Square, etc.. so the location cant be beat.  Try to get a room with a park or at least a partial park view because otherwise you are looking at a courtyard which is not very scenic.  Nice gym facility.  My only issue was the club hours, as a Platinum member I would like longer hours especially on weekends so it is easier to grab a cup of coffee.

title: Excellent Service and Modern Amenities
text:
My wife and I stayed here for a 5 night stay in early December to enjoy some Christmas shopping and shows.  We had not made any other plans and the concierge team, and Kevin in particular, were amazing at setting up reservations and giving recommendations that paired extremely well for us throughout our stay.  We had lounge access with our Marriott status and did not find any issues with the lounge capacity being too small as others noted.  The lounge's daily breakfast was a nice spread of hot/chilled/continental items.  The staff throughout the entire hotel was very friendly and helpful.

As one can expect, the rooms are sized on the smaller side as one would expect in New York City.  Rooms with a Central Park view are worth it with the great view the hotel offers from the south end of Central Park.  The location is also great for walking to shopping/shows/dinner and avoiding the overly tourist-driven Times Square area.  The hotel bar/restaurant was rather busy every night, but the staff was still very attentive in getting you served.

We plan on returning and certainly appreciate the amazing experiences we had with in town thanks to Kevin and the concierge team.

title: Ruined a grand hotel
