text: Have to say the Essex House New York is no longer a gem. Don’t bring your family  or plan to entertain at all in your room.   It’s a shoe box.  I have had six rooms now here.  Each no bigger than a shoe box. Or as my son called it the “size of an arm pit.”  What hotel separates a family.  You know how angry you get when your son or daughter is placed a seat or two away from you on an airplane?  Imagine this they put a 13 year old and a 16 year old in separate actual rooms without connecting.  Who does that?  I don’t think I need to worry about the liquor in the cabinet or do I? Serving liquor to minors.  Probably not a big deal in New York City. But that’s the Marriott for you. They now own or operate nearly this entire block. So yes. Never.  Never again.

title: Wonderful hotel but a few misses
text:
I checked in for a five-night stay with my family just before the Christmas Holidays.   The stay was booked with points, and my family and I were excited since we were in town to see the Harry Potter Show on Broadway.  Overall, these were many positives but also several issues that were problematic.

Highs
1. The hotel is beautiful and well maintained.  Common areas in particular are impressive.
2. Staff is polite and helpful.   First rate.
3. Location - across from Central Park - is ideal.
4. Breakfast buffet in executive lounge was outstanding (included since I am a Platinum member).

Neutral
1. Although the hotel charges a $25/night fee (which is NOT waived) for award bookings, one gets a $35 credit each day toward food, drinks and similar expenses.  Hard to maximize because they do not carry over if not used each day.
2. Room was small - but hey, this is NYC.

Lows
1. Platinum status did not get me much, other than lounge access.   No suite or room upgrade, although web site did show suite availability.  And my room was small and faced an inner courtyard; so no view - of anything,    Disappointed that they could not at least upgrade me to a higher floor with a view.
2. Lounge was busy eat breakfast time; and on the last day, a Saturday, it was so crowded, that they took names of members entering and informed people that they should expect a 20 min wait!  And they would not allow anyone to take a plate of food back to their room despite the lack of seating availability.    Perhaps a sign that with the Starwood merger; there are so many elite members that benefits may suffer.
3. Most disturbing, when I checked out, it appeared that they had deducted $25 from drinks/ dining each day versus the $35 promised (specified in writing in a brochure that each guest received).   Fortunately, I thought to ask about the disparity upon checkout, and acknowledging that an error had been made, they corrected the billing error without any further debate. I asked if that process was automated, and the representative said that she believed so.    SINCE THIS IS SUPPOSEDLY AN AUTOMATED PROCESS, DOESN'T THAT SUGGEST THAT THE SAME BILLING ERROR LIKELY AFFECTED OTHER GUESTS WHO MAY NOT HAVE NOTICED?

Overall, a wonderful hotel, and primarily a positive experience.    I do wonder though whether the overcrowded longe and lack of upgrade availability are signs that Marriott is simply too big, and the billing error just should not happen.  

I recommend the hotel, but anyone staying should check his or her bill and carefully.
.

title: Every aspect was outstanding
text: We were thrilled when Marriott acquired this property, as we've stayed here many times when it was a Starwood hotel.  Everyone was wonderful, including the doorman, reception (Hannah was so accommodating!) housekeeping, and room service.  Very clean, updated rooms.  The fitness center was we'll equipped.  Can't say enough about this property; it felt like we were coming home.

title: The WORST hotel stay ever experienced
text:
As a first time visitor to New York, I was happy to find a first rate Marriott property that offered a view of Central Park and was excited to make a reservation at the Essex House. My family are Platinum Elite level members and the room was booked as such. 

Unfortunately, my happiness was short lived. I was first taken aback at check in when the desk person regarded me as if I were a piece of gum on her shoe; impatient as I searched through my bags for my ID and credit card. She begrudgingly gave me access to the Executive lounge; making sure I knew I didn’t deserve it. (Don’t worry, I didn’t besmirch the lounge with my unworthy presence.)

Secondly, for almost $800/night, I expected a fabulous room with a view of the park. Instead, I received a 6th floor room that I’d equate to being given a table in front of the bathroom in a chi-chi restaurant. So MINIMALLY acceptable as to be insulting.

But the biggest insult was being stopped in the hallway while going to/from my room - not once, but TWICE - and asked to show proof that I was a legitimate guest by showing my room key.

Every look, every encounter conveyed suspicion and disdain so much so that I felt uncomfortable every second I spent there. 

Having stayed at Marriott hotels of all levels in various parts of the world, I was shocked and offended to have been treated so shabbily and disrespectfully.

My time in New York was a blast despite, not because of, my experience at this hotel. Neither I, nor any family member or friend will ever stay at this property in the future.

A final thought - Marriott Corp likes to convey the prestige and benefits of achieving the highest levels of their Rewards Members Program. It’s interesting seeing so many negative reviews on this property by Platinum and higher level members. Apparently this property doesn’t give a flying fig about any of that.

title: Below JW Standard
text: Currently staying at this property (12/20). Booked two rooms as Platinum Elite. Requested extra pillow and blanket and after 4 hours we have not received them. Bathroom condition is below JW standard with paint missing in tub and amenity trays in bad shape. Seems like a lack of attention.

title: Great Family Stay
text:
Took my daughter (7yrs) and nieces (11, 12, 14yrs) to NYC for a “girl cousins” trip. The girls don’t see each other much and I wanted it to be special and memorable. Kevin Oakes, and all of the concierge team I came in contact with were excellent. Kevin went out of his way to set up teddy bears in the room for the girls. Shortly after arrival the girls answered the door to a special delivery of milk and cookies. They were over the moon and very much felt they were traveling in style.

Not only did Kevin take the time to email with me leading up to the trip to answer my questions, he also offered ice skating and zoo passes. Extremely generous and amenities I would not have known about had he not cared enough to offer them. We did both and the girls had a truly great time making memories together skating and at the zoo. What Kevin didn’t know, was that this trip came after my nieces recently had a baby sister born with Down’s syndrome and some handicaps that will likely cause her to never walk. As one can imagine this came as a heartbreaking surprise and has been a lot for my brothers family and oldest two girls (who came with us to NYC). This trip was my attempt to get the cousins together for a lighthearted, stress free weekend heavy on holiday cheer. I share this because the customer service and kindness of the JW staff was that much more meaningful and appreciated in these circumstances.

Highlights:

Room was clean, stayed warm, lots of hot water despite 4 little girls and myself showering.

The hotel upgraded us to a “two doubles” room which was large enough for us and brought up rollaway, at no charge. (I am platinum elite so upgrade maybe a result of this)

The hotel offered us to help ourselves to water bottles from the gym, it was great to have access to water throughout our 3 night stay. 

Literally every security guard we walked passed engaged with the girls and made them feel welcome. I stay in a lot of hotels and travel frequently with my now 7 year old and it’s truly amazing how few hotel staff acknowledge children, let alone crack jokes etc. 

We had breakfast in the executive lounge one of the mornings. While waiting for our table to be ready near front desk I was talking with the girls and mentioned I would check with the concierge desk after breakfast and see about the zoo tickets they had offered. The gal behind the lounge desk mentioned she had overheard me and that she’d love to go grab the tickets for us and bring them to the lounge. This was unexpected gesture and awesome showcase of customer service at its finest. I had no problem getting the tickets myself but the offer and initiative to chime in and let me know she would get the tickets was top notch CS. Again, I stay in a lot of hotels and don’t see this level of ownership often. It was a sentiment that echoed throughout our trip and did not go unnoticed. 

My daughter and I are rolling out a travel blog site specifically for travelers who are seeking luxury hotel experiences that offer great amenities and experiences for the children without compromising customer service, luxury and so forth for the parents. With reviews from both a well traveled child and adult perspective. The JW Marriott Essex House is a perfect example of the type of hotel we look to stay at.

title: Great People and Great Service
text:
Last week I had to move from another hotel in town to the JW because I was so disappointed in the room and the service. I stay at the JW frequently for business and I’ve never written a review but I felt after this stay it was long overdue. 

First, the people at the JW are so warm and friendly, everytime I stay I’m greeted by name and taken such good care of. On this particular stay I tried another luxury hotel in the city only to be terribly disappointed in almost every aspect. 

The accommodations are terrific and the rooms are clean and well cared for. The beds are very comfortable and the concierge lounge for breakfast is wonderful! The food is plentiful and well cooked. 

The concierge desk is also always smiling and willing to help with whatever my needs are. 

The location is great just across from Central Park South and an easy walk to just about anywhere uptown. 

I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the city for any reason.

title: When there are amazing places for a comprable price, just eh.
text:
I wasn't blown away by any means, but for NY I guess the room was spacious and clean enough. I just feel like the JW Marriott is trying to be the Ritz, but you simply get so much more at the Ritz. For instance, the robe was just pitiful. It was extremely thin and felt terrible on the skin. But you could tell it had been put there as though it was some sort of novelty - like it checked off a box for them (yep, fancy robe like the upscale hotels have. check). 
As far as I could tell, for when we stayed in the city, the prices were comparable to the Ritz (which is why I'm making this comparison), but the Ritz was all booked up. I was also very put off by the receptionist when I called to check in on the items I'd ordered to the room (extra towels, because there weren't enough for two people). After 30-45 minutes I called to simply check on them as I wanted to shower and go to bed, and the woman proceeded to argue with me about how long I'd actually been waiting (yeah, because that's a good approach).
The concierge was very knowledgeable and friendly and recommended a restaurant that we'll actually be trying when we're back in town this weekend. No complaints about that experience. He was great.

title: Front Door Personnel Mediorce
text: I did not stay here but went to a an event in the restaurant.  It was lovely but way too warm. But what really struck me was the lack of competence in the doorman hailing a cab! I had to wait 20 minutes! I have NEVER had that with an upscale NYC hotel. Instead of trying to hail a cab, he kept talking to the very attractive women who were asking if they could park in front of the hotel for 5 minutes since hey were waiting for someone....happened 3 times...interesting to say the least.

title: What a perfect location
text: Was here for business and what an amazing location. Adjacent to Central Park on the south, the hotel is within walking distance of practically everything I wanted to see. Just a couple blocks from 5th Avenue, 10 minute walk to Times Square and Rockefeller Center, Broadway just around the corner, horse and carriages right outside the lobby, etc, etc, etc.. Only regret was that I couldn’t bring my wife this time. Next time I’m in NYC I would definitely consider returning here. Rooms were very nice but a bit small, which should probably be expected given the location. I didn’t spend much time in the room anyway. Thanks to the staff for a great stay.

title: Perfect Everything!
text: We had a brief (one-night) stay at the JW Marriott Essex House to celebrate a milestone birthday in the city, and it was perfect in every way.  From our Park-view room to breakfast before checkout, our stay was perfect in every way!   The hotel was beautifully decorated for the holidays, and the staff was very friendly and accommodating.  It's a great location (we walked just about everywhere!)  Highly recommend!

title: Surprised by room size
text:
My husband and I stayed a weekend early Dec. We arrived at 2PM and the room was not ready. I had specifically emailed the Manager and my Ambassador (Platinum Premier Elite Status) to request early check in, but they are much busier with the holidays. We were told our room is required to be ready by 4PM at the latest so we took off for a little exploring. 

We arrived back at 4PM and still no room. I wasnt pleased, however, the front desk offered us a $100 restaurant credit for the inconvenience (which we know takes care of ~2 rounds of drinks at a JW). Finally, we made it into our room, and I was actually surprised by the size. I have stayed at the Westin Grand Central, the Renaissance, a few Courtyards, the Lexington, and the Marriott by the Lexington. This is by far the nicest hotel, albeit, the most expensive (we were staying on points). 

The lounge is closed in the evenings on the weekend, but the breakfast spread is a great way to kick off your day! It was a nice arrangement and plenty of choices. One note, they do not keep the lounge open for quiet time access (which means no access to waters). However, the Concierge will give you bottled waters in absence of access to the lounge, just ask! 
Overall, great stay. Quiet hotel, well appointed.

title: Great Hotel and Great staff
text:
We travelled with our family of 5 and 2 grandparents. We hade a room issue at check in, there was some cleanliness problems with our room. Orlando, the housekeeping manager came immediately to rectify the situation. He was amazing, upgraded our room, gave us lounge access, and even had milk and cookies brought the room for my kids. We also got champagne and chocolate for the adults. They upgraded our rooms and were very attentive to making sure we had an amazing time. 

The hotel itself is well suited for family visits, microwaves and fridges available. The one bedroom suites are very spacious.

Second time staying here, will definitely be back.

title: Pleasantly surprised
text: Booked here as part of a group - then read the TA reviews and arrived expecting to be disappointed. Our 3 nights here were excellent. The hotel was clean and well appointed, staff were professional and friendly, the location is great (adjacent to Central Park), and rooms were comfortable. We reported the fact that we had no tea/coffee making facilities in the room and within 2 hours that was rectified. No complaints, would recommend and would return. The only negative observation is that it is very pricey - but that goes with the territory!

title: Fantastic location and Views of the park
text:
Location wise the hotel was brilliant, just a short walk to Central Park and easy access to subways.
The hotel itself is beautiful and felt very grand but the rooms were very small. We were lucky to have a stunning view of the park on one corner of the room - the other window started into the windows of the building next door but that's part of being in New York - not a complaint.
The room did a feel a little bit creeky at times and the lamps would sometimes flash/blink a little bit.
The walls were very thin - one morning we were woken up by the family next door having a heated discussion, we could hear every single word. 
Food in the exec lounge wasn't great which was quite surprising for Marriott properties. I think the JW Essex House could have done a little more to recognise lifetime platinum prem lifetime elite members but overall the hotel was beautiful with a great location.
Being a Marriott fan I'd probably check out the other Marriott/SPG hotels on offer in NYC but would recommend staying here - especially if you get a lovely view of Central Park.

title: Weekend Getaway
text: Nice to getaway. Centrally located in city. Convenient to many attractions. Enjoyed the steam and sauna facilities as well as the fitness room. Renovations to the rooms were nice. The loading zone was too crowded with taxis and limo services. It was too hard to valet.

title: Here for Thanksgiving
text:
We stayed at Essex House over Thanksgiving weekend using points.  The location was very convenient and is across from Central Park.  The hotel provided an informational booklet all about the Macy’s Thanksgiving parade, where to watch, amenities available (or not) during the holiday.  It was very helpful.  Our room was very quiet and well appointed.  Since it was so cold standing outside for the parade, we appreciated staying so close to the parade route and then returning to a nice warm room and hot bath.  
 
We ordered room service the night before Thanksgiving- super expensive for two salads and an iced tea ($86).  Ok, would not do that again as it was very average.  

The executive lounge had a nice breakfast buffet on Friday and Saturday, which was convenient and helped us expedite getting on with our activities.  

We enjoyed our stay at Essex House.

title: Kevin was the star of the stay
text:
Thanks to Kevin the concierge we got to try things that would have never shown up for us or would have used much lesser but expensive options.
It started when he arranged the perfect shuttle to move part of our party to the hotel w/o us even having checked in.
He then continued to help us find places to eat and things to see.  He is super positive and pleasant to be around and was the star of our stay.
It was a great venue to enjoy the parade and the staff worked hard to keep everyone safe and happy.

title: Exceeded expectations
text: Everything about the Essex House exceeded my expectations. It's a terrific hotel, with friendly service, modern rooms, and good food. The complimentary breakfast for Marriott/SPG elite members was an unexpected bonus. I would happily stay here again.

title: Thanksgiving Weekend
text: We stayed at the JW Marriott Essex House for 5 nights over Thanksgiving.  The hotel is beautiful and within walking distance to 5th Avenue, Central Park and Times Square.  The staff was friendly and kind.  The hotel is immaculate and beautiful. Our room was nothing special, but for NYC, I suppose that is ok -- lack a view and did not have much counter space or drawers to unpack.  The concierge lounge was one of the better ones I've been too.  My only complaint was lack of maid service.  Although they did clean our room daily, our towels were never refreshed or restocked and we were constantly on the hunt for fresh towels every morning.  Overall, I was pleased and would stay  again.

title: Average
text: It’s a very beautiful hotel from all the angles. The hospitality is great. My issue with this hotel is it kind of gets too crowded and that can get on one’s nerves. Also the food wasn’t amazing which one would expect from a property like this. Ok for enjoying the views.

title: Not Nearly as Bad as they make....
text:
Themselves out to be.  Here for the long Thanksgiving weekend on Marriott Points and got two rooms directly across from each other; one king and one king with sofa bed and big bath/shower.  We had asked for a room with two beds, and even appealed fruitlessly  to platinum reservations but were very happy anyway. The hotel prints a souvenir Macy's Parade booklet explaining that they are monetizing the heck out of view rooms, so not surprisingly we didn't get upgraded. Nonetheless, housekeeping staff were hardworking and cheerful, and our room on 58th was quiet and comfy.

Other bloodcurtling admonition in the booklet was ruthless limits on the M Lounge access--just one guest per Platinum.  So do you take junior, dear wife, or granny?  Fortunately, unlike the Canal Street Marriott in NOLA, they were only kidding, and welcomed the whole family.  Good for them.  Just as openhearted as the Marriott Marquis in SF at Christmastime.  Things did get crowded, but staff was friendly and welcoming, even if latecomers had to wait behind velvet ropes while we early birds enjoyed breakfast.

Thanksgiving eve we enjoyed the bar, and our big group on the barstools were treated very well by the efficient barkeep.  No complaints, and they kept the delish barnuts coming, although the tab was what you'd expect.

The hotel handles Thanksgiving well, so it never felt jammed, although the lobby and entries were full of large polite men in dark suits keeping a benign eye on us.

Really is a perfect location right on the Park and around the corner from Carnegie Hall with lots of little restaurants and  even a Morton Williams grocery for snacks or a quick bite.  

All in all, much better than their own Macy's Parade booklet would lead you to believe.

title: Walkable, Classy, Affordable
text: The hotel is a classic Art Deco design that gives it a sense of stepping back in time — from the attentive and kind staff to the time when Sinatra and Sammy Davis roamed the halls. It is right across the street from Central Park, so if you would like to take a stroll in the park or be able to say you went for the run in the iconic park it is an ideal location for that. If you are in town to catch a show at Carnegie Hall it is just 2 blocks away. There is access to all of the main transit lines, so you can easily get to any part of the city and get to the Bronx to catch a Yankee game in 20 minutes. There are six block of serenity that separate you from the insanity of Times Square, and another block to Penn Station and Madison Square Garden. After touring the city all day the room is a cozy place you can lay your head on the same block as Lady Gaga and many other celebrities that pay millions for this location and view of Central Park.

title: It's Been Better
text:
It has been (much) better.  Having stayed there at least once or twice a year over the last 6 years, this hotel has experienced a significant change and it's not for the better.  While some of the issues could be explained, a number of changes were deliberate.  In many ways, the services at the hotel looked less like a luxury Marriott hotel and more like a Fairfield Inn.  While not cheap, this is NYC, some genius thought it was a good idea to add a $35 per day "destination fee" to the bill.  "Destination fee", really?  Does one have to pay $35 just to enter the island of Manhattan?  Specific problems with the room, included a broken cracked window, an un-repaired gash in the inside of the entrance door.  No robe, although one was supposed to be there.  Since this was supposed to be for two people, shouldn't there have been two robes.  Then there were issues with the executive lounge.  They only give one key card per room.  As a result, if one person went first, the second person had to call the other person to open the door and give them access to the lounge.  For drinks and coffee, there used to be regular cups.  Now there are only paper cups (very Fairfield Inn).  There used to newspapers, the WSJ, etc.  No more.  The final issue occurred at checkout.  There was a $10 overcharge on the bill which was obvious when they checked the  receipt.  It should have been immediately adjusted.  No.  it took two of them almost 15 minutes before they could make the correction.
As a Lifetime Platinum Marriott member, I have close to a thousand nights at Marriott properties around the world.  Never have we ever experienced drop-off in quality as bad as this one

title: Gorgeous hotel, perfect location
text: My husband & I surprised our 10 year old for his birthday with a trip to NYC. We chose this hotel because of location & also  because my husband is a platinum member. Check in was smooth & we were upgraded to a bigger room when they noticed the 10 year old in tow. We also had access to the club level & the food & service are great! Besides the loveliness of the hotel, the staff are phenomenal. The concierge, Kevin Oakes, went above & beyond to ensure our stay & trip is wonderful. From booking tickets to events to avoid waiting in lines, making recommendations/reservations for us, assisting with subway navigation & even following up on how our previous day was, he is outstanding. He truly made our stay even more enjoyable & we will definitely be returning!

title: Great hotel to rest or visit nyc
text: Large, renovated bedrooms and well appointed lobby. Very good service and welcoming ambiance. This hotel is a great option to visit nyc.  High end clientele. Highly recommended for couple, solo and family travelers. Good restaurant and bar as well.

title: JWマリオット
text:
セントラルパークの向かいにある歴史ある高級ホテルです。
タイムズスクエアまで歩いて20分ほどです。
室内はきれいでしたが、バスタブ周りが今ひとつでした。

title: Just OK and everyone seemed to busy to assist or care.
text: As a Platinum Member for many years I was very shocked and was forewarned that this hotel is not the best in customer service.  I pre checked in and requested a view and upgrade.  Well my upgrade was 2 beds and a view of the back trash area! So if you are rushing to be a Platinum member like me don’t rush it’s disappointingly not really worth it except for the Club M.  When we arrived we went into the bar and sat there for 20 minutes for someone to actually acknowledge us and take our order, that never happened and we just left and went some where else. Sadly wasn’t warmly welcomed like most JW properties.  Checked out and went to another property that was not so crazy and disorganized.  Very disappointed as I was on vacation and was really looking forward to the weekend at the JW Marriott using my well deserved points.

title: A classic is back -- fresher and a bit smarter
text:
One of those structures that stands proud on Central Park's south border.  Grand without being over the top.  The rooms had space, smartly designed. Big bathroom with soaking tub and separate shower.  Comfortable bed and linen.  
I was on the 4th floor and unfortunately some humming machinery did just that....ALL NIGHT LONG.  I checked in very late and by the time I got in bed too much to change rooms.

title: Wonderful location
text: By bus or taxi  10 minutes from museums, upscale shopping and theater district Cross the street and you are in Central Park. Hotel staff service outstanding.  Very clean rooms but decor is only "so so".

title: Location is great- the hotel was a little disappointing
text:
We were super excited to stay at this hotel but I have to say- we were a little disappointed- it’s definitely missing some pretty standard things.

There is no water anywhere to be found. Make sure that you buy plenty when you are out. No tea or coffee facilities either. 

One night we woke up by a noise which sounded like there was water in the walls- we realised the next morning this happens when someone has a shower in the adjacent rooms. 

The room was a little tired- little things like frayed pieces of carpet and the soup dish being chipped. 

Oh- and the hotel bar was definitely the worst - it’s small / not very nice and super pricey. 

Overall it was an ok stay but we won’t be rushing back.

title: Okay...not great.
text:
We stayed here for a few nights back in October.  Had a mixed reaction to this hotel.  The good:  Location right across from Central Park, staff (Barron at front desk) polite and helpful, room was decent size and had a good make up mirror, water pressure in shower was good, lobby was attractive and we met Gerarad Butler in the hotel bar!
The not-so-great:  When we checked in the room still had trash in the wastebasket (uneaten food!) and the mini bar snacks had not been replenished.  Snacks were never replenished during our stay.  We had no view.  No in-room coffee (isn't that standard?) and our bathroom was tiny. (Friends had a room down the hall with a big bathroom but very small bedroom).  Overall, for the price, we felt it was a little on the "just-okay side."

title: LOVELY!
text: We spent four nights here and felt incredibly spoiled. Our room on the 11th floor faced Central Park and had a view that took our breath away!  The park in fall has to be one of the most beautiful things in the whole state of NY!  Our bed was comfortable, the room was pristine, and the staff was incredibly warm and helpful at every turn.  The breakfast for platinum members was SO good.  The hotel was at capacity for the marathon, but it was still quiet.  The location of this hotel was literally perfect - we had no problem walking or taking the subway, and the hotel staff was awesome about helping us find our way.  I have no idea how some people can complain about this hotel ~ I've stayed at plenty of 4 and 5 star hotels, including Marriotts, and this one exceeded my expectations.  Yes, the rooms are small, but it's NYC!  There was more than enough room for 2 people with 3 large suitcases. We would stay here again in a heartbeat.

title: One of the best in Central Park
text:
Lovely staff and great hotel.
The rooms are big and confortable with amazing views to the Central Park.
Very confortable bed and fantastic buffet breakfast for Marriott members.
Very well located just in front of the most famous park in the world!

title: Location
text: The location is rights across the street from Central Park. Very nice lobby, nice restaurant attached. The rooms are very nicely designed. This hotel is very busy and the wait to check in can get lengthy at times. Columbus Circle is a short walk, as is many other landmarks. Easy to catch a cab.

title: Stay elsewhere even if you are platinum member
text: Below average service notwithstanding, stay else where.  The rooms are very small and feels extremely cramp.  If you are in dire straights for a Central Park view, check out the Mandarin Oriental, the Taj, The Trump or even the sister property, the Ritz Carlton.  Service is non existent and as a platinum member, the Essex House service team appeared surly.  Uninterested staff on check-in, no greeting in the executive lounge and food quality below par.  When I spoke to the front office manager, the response to my complaint is to leave if I don't like it, as the hotel is fully occupied.  For services and recognition, I would recommend Plaza Athenee, the Peninsula or the Four Seasons.  Until a thorough house cleaning by Marriott Corporation, stay away from this hotel. This hotel was once occupied by the Jeremiah and later the ANA group; at this rate, I wouldn't be surprised if it changes hand again.  Soon I hope.

title: Great location and an architectural gem, but not quite up to Marriott standards
text:
We have stayed in Marriott hotels practically since there were Marriott hotels and generally we have had very good experiences. This hotel is a beautiful Art Deco facility obviously remodeled a few times since its original opening in 1931. I wouldn't rate it 4 stars even though it has a prime location in NYC. The hotel falls short primarily because of a few staff. The check-in staff and the restaurant hostess were unfriendly to the point of being rude. 

I had been told when I made the reservation that because we had a suite, we had concierge lounge access.  The front desk said that we didn't have enough points to qualify. 

The room was described as a suite but it was really just a large room with a partial wall in the middle. The lighting system was poor, since it illuminated the whole space. A person couldn't use the sofa to read without disturbing the spouse who had gone to bed. 

There was a very complete free buffet but no one bothered to tell us about it; we heard about it from another guest. We had one robe for the two of us. The bathtub took an hour to drain. There was broken tile in the shower. There was a total of two drawers for clothes, no refrigerator and no coffee pot. Our room looked down on 58th which is very noisy in the early morning for garbage collection.  

On the plus side: the buffet was excellent and complete; the elevators came promptly; one of maintenance guys, Miguel, who fixed the window shade assembly (which fell off) was knowledgeable, friendly and helpful; the lobby is a work of art and very comfortable, and there is free coffee in the morning.

title: Horrible experience - won't be back
text:
Don't even know where to begin..so many things were wrong. 

So, let me start with check-in. Don't desk clerk was rude, curt and unhelpful. Didn't seem to want to be bothered with doing anything. I was travelling for work and asked for a room away from the street because I had to be up at 4am for a meeting. What room did I get? You guessed it - 3rd floor on the street. When I asked the clerk about the location he even told me it was a good room and quiet. 

So, strike one.

Strike two was when I woke up and started to get ready. I turn on the water in the sink and it is brown. Not tan, dark brown, like Coke colored.

Call the front desk and am told it is because of ConEd. Okay, these things happen. Clerk tells me to wait about 20 minutes and everything should be okay. Twenty minutes later, water is tan
 But, is now ice cold. Back to the clerk, who says now "give it about 30 minutes". 

So, do I wait 30 minutes for potentially hot clear water and be late or do I take a shower with cold tan water and be on time? The latter is the only option.

When I checked out I mention to the clerk these issues and he tells me thr manager will call me this morning to apologize and see what he can do to make earn their business again. Okay, fair enough.

Does the manager call? Nope.

Strike 3. I'm out of there and won't be back.

title: One of the worst hotels we've ever stayed at.
text: Having been platinum SPG for years, we used to the very best in terms of amenities and service so because of the Marriot Merger we decided to give this one a try and wish we didn't! No water in rooms, staff that blatantly ask you for tips at every corner (this was the worst) , unfriendly porters, any request such as use of business center - not possibly if you don't pay for it. Access to the Exec Lounge only allowed entry with one card, so if you are a couple with different agenda's, SORRY for you. But that's when you can even get a table in the exec lounge - Its crowded and runs on its own schedule which you have to fit into. No upgrade and the room was small so having to stay in this space for 7 days was not fun at all.

title: Excelente hotel
text:
Este hotel es de lo mejor de NY, la mejor ubicación frente al Central Park, hotel súper lujoso y muy buen servicio. Totalmente recomendable 
Las habitaciones son grandes y cómodas.
La ubicación fundamentalmente es lo mejor, cerca de columbus circle y de la Quinta Avenida.

title: Luxury old style
text:
An expensive luxurious hotel. Spacious room with a side view to the park on a very high floor (due to reward status). Very comfortable bed, quality linen, and a good night’s sleep. 

Many amenities but do not provide a water bottle, something I’ve come to expect. 

I didn’t pay for this one but I believe it’s quite expensive.

title: Luxury at its best.
text:
Beautiful hotel, very helpful staff, gorgeous large room with extremely comfortable super king bed and Egyptian cotton linens,
All the facilities you could want for, the only downside was the time it took to refund my initial room deposit (around 2 weeks).

title: OK stay
text:
This was a 130k point reward stay.  Marriott Platinum member.  In town for the AL Wildcard game

Room was clean, tiny,tiny bath tub and very cramped room.

2 windows that literally looked right at a windowless brick wall.  

Hotel is on the park and has easy access to the subway.

mini bar is so finicky it cost me $ and my son  (9) barely opened the door of it.  

No fridge, no ice machines, 

Just call for ice and they bring you up a few cubes at a time.  

I don't think you should get nickel and dimed when you are staying at a signature property and thats what happened.  

Room Service, was bad.  Cold food, long wait.  

Concierge was helpful.  

All in all the Ritz on the next block is a much better hotel in every way at the same price point.  

Doormen were disinterested, Valet took about 45 min to get my car. 

Son was scolded by a guy in a tie, while not an issue if there was a behavior problem, in this instance it was petty and not at all reasonable.   

Again . .  not worth the money (or points)

title: Solid 4 Star JW
text: Stayed one night due to a wedding in the vicinity.  Requested early check in at 1pm via a web request and a phone call to the hotel in the morning and the request was granted without any discussion and it was much appreciated.  Check in was efficient and we received a room on the 6th floor facing 58th street.  I am a platinum and didn't bother to ask for a better room as I got the early check in.  Room was small but it had a great bed, large TV with many channels and a modern bathroom.  Location of this hotel speaks for itself.

title: Lovely hotel
text: Had a wonderful couple of days of business and pleasure in NYC. This place is in a great location. Right at Central Park. About a mile to the MET. Close to MOMA. Just over a mile to theater district. Very good hotel. Great customer service by the staff.

title: Perfect Location
text: This hotel is placed in a perfect location! Just right across from the central park. The room is soo comfortable; esp the mattress. I got free breakfast and dinner but they are only offered on weekdays! Overall stay was pleasant!

title: Perfect location
text: Had a very good time staying here in June. Central Park is literally across the street, and location is perfect for many iconic attractions. Check-in was easy and staff was very friendly. I was able to check baggage easily after checkout and before my flight home. Would stay here again for ease of location and friendliness of staff. Room was on the small side, but very comfortable. Overall we had a good stay and I would definitely stay here again.

title: Excellent Location
text: I stayed here for two nights with  my 15 yo daughter.  This was my first time staying at this hotel.  I choose this hotel secondary to  having excellent experiences at other JW Marriotts.  The hotel was nice, check in fast and easy.  Staff was welcoming.  The room was on the small side, but very quiet and clean.  Safe area and felt comfortable allowing my daughter to venture out on her own for a morning jog in Central Park.  Doormen always said welcome back whenever we returned and asked us if we need a cab whenever we were leaving.  I would definitely stay here again.

title: Not on par with prior experiences
text:
I have staid in this hotel 10+ time when it was still owned by Jumeira and three times recently. This week was the worst experience I ever had. We rented a junior suite, and as a Manhattan “five star” hotel that is not a cheap room. I am travelling a lot and have 500,000 points on my Marriott loyalty account. 

After entering the room the first time we saw that the minibar was half empty and there was an opened and half empty wine bottle and an opened and half eaten waffle package. This is just nasty. 

The suite was in the third floor and even when I explicitly asked we could not get a higher floor. So at 6 a clock in the morning every day it was impossible to sleep because of trucks having their motors running or beeping while backing up. I understand that not everyone can have a room on a high floor, but why are there not soundproof windows in such rooms? So after 3 days of this torture I upgrade to an even pricier Manhattan suite. 

One of the most important things for me is a reliable internet connection. In some mornings it was so slow (I booked the “high speed” plan) that I could not even do email properly.  Sometimes it worked fine sometimes it was unusable. 

My wife booked an 80 minute massage in the SPA and came back flabbergasted. She had never experienced a more unfriendly massage therapist “in her life”. So instead of relaxed she came back stressed. 

After ordering soft boiled eggs 3 times and getting hard boiled eggs 2 out of these three times we gave up ordering eggs. 

After we had moved to the new suite we became new keys that stopped working the next day because they where not programmed right. 

The Minibar in both rooms was locked and even in both cases the room service was not able to get them unlocked and keep them unlocked. They locked themselves again. In both cases we had to trick the deadbolt by stuffing some paper in the mechanism. 

When I asked housekeeping to come at a certain time (even talking to the actual housekeeper in the hallway) it did not work. We came back two hours later to find the room not cleaned. Same happed when we needed the sofa bed set up for a night. Some one came in the room and tossed two pillows on the sofa that was it. 

I am not even sure if I remember all the things that went wrong there were so many. 

I expect a high quality service in a five star hotel that costs nearly 1,000$ a night. But the management of this hotel does not seem to care about these details. I complained about it but I did not get any better. They called back and apologized shortly and that was it. They asked if they could do something for us and I asked them to set up the sofa bed. Read above how that worked out. What kind of manager are you that you do not make sure that the one thing a disgruntled customer asks for is actually done? This just means you are not interested at all. 

If you don’t care about details, service and are lucky enough to get a room on a high floor so that you can sleep this is still a nice hotel. But for me that was my last stay here. Sad how some hotels go downhill over time. Compared to ten years ago this is not even half as good as it used to be. 

RIP ESSEX HOUSE

title: Not a first-class experience! Thorough review:
text:
I visited JW Marriott on 160 Central Park S, aiming to find a fitting hotel for accommodating employees and guests in NYC. We want a front row hotel to Central Park with an iconic view, which should make Essex House an obvious choice. Its location is exceptional.
 
However, it became a somewhat mixed experience. 
 
We normally stay in Park Hyatt hotels; otherwise, in Taj hotels. However, I have stayed in JW Marriott hotels in Asia and they have always met my expectations to the standard of a 5-star hotel which encouraged me to try out Essex House.
 
Since I had made two reservations to try out two different rooms, I will provide a full review on both for comparison:
 
Central Park View, Guest Room, 1 King - #1205 – 2 nights
 
You do not get nice views without paying for it - I know that. This room was around $600 per night. I had the great luck of being greeted by front desk member of staff, Melvin, when I checked in. When I told him that I was here to check out the rooms and the view, I instantly got the impression that he went out of his way to allocate the best room he had at hand for me. Big kudos to Melvin for being so attentive and going the extra mile to set me off on a good start.
 
And the park view did not disappoint! 180 degrees full view of Central Park. It was absolutely stunning! 
However, I was extremely disappointed that the windows were so filthy that it was impossible to take a decent photo of the view - it was like a vintage filter was already added (and not a good one). You do expect clean windows in a first-class hotel - especially one that has THE NYC VIEW NONPAREIL as part of its uniqueness. 
 
Overall, the room itself was small, the bed very comfy, there was a chaise-longue conveniently placed in front of the window and the bathroom contained a nice, deep bathtub. The bathroom amenities were nice, including bath salts and mouthwash.
The room did not have a fridge; I called Guest Service and they brought me a mini-fridge immediately; there was really nothing mini about it - it took up quite a lot of space and it was noisy. Talking of noise, by the way, I was happy to find the floor I was on very quiet. The outside street noise on the other hand was noticeable, although I was on the 12th floor; personally, it did not bother me.
There was no complimentary water in the room and none was offered, which was a bit odd considering the room rate. No tea/coffee/kettle either.
 
The rooms were apparently renovated during autumn 2017. My room presented itself as being a little run down already. I guess this reminds us of just how much wear and tear that comes with hotel guests. However, this should not be an excuse for not cleaning the room properly. A former guest's plastic bag was tossed between the chaise-longue and the window. It remained there during my stay.

However, the thing that really upset me was the indifferent attitude shown by some members of the staff towards guests. It is important to stress out that this was not the case for all the hotel staff - as mentioned, Melvin from the front desk was great. After check-in the first day I headed for the elevators trying to locate them. A hotel staff member stood in the hallway and simply looked away when he could obviously see that I was looking for directions. Such encounters occurred several times during my stay; a hello, a nod or just some kind of acknowledgement of my presence would have been nice – and is considered good manners everywhere.
 
Overall, I am giving this stay 4 stars (not large stars), mainly because, on the plus-size: the amazing view from my room and the location – and on the negative: the filthy window, no fridge / kettle at hand, and the lack of desire on the part of members of staff to help guests or make them feel welcome which was displeasing. (Also, small slips such as forgetting to include my orange juice in the in-room breakfast and still charge me for it was rather inattentive).
 
---

Central Park View, 1-bedroom suite - #3405 – 2 nights

For the second part of my stay I had booked a suite. This was well over $1000 per night. Again, Melvin at the front desk tried his best to allocate me a great room. The suite was spacious and fresh with comfortable sofa and chaise-longue, the bedroom contained a large comfortable bed and the bathroom was nice with both a roomy bath tub and shower.

Once more, the view from the windows was crucial to me since I specifically booked “Central Park View”. However, from the suite you could see only half of central park (the western side) and it was solely visible from the bedroom. From the living room one was able to see Columbus Square and a partial view of the park. This was disappointing and should have been outlined in the online room description at booking. 
Boy, was I happy that I got to stay in the much cheaper (but smaller) room #1205 during the first part of my stay and got the Central Park full view experience there, to boot! I would have been very disappointed paying the overall amount of money for the whole stay if that had not been possible. 
Furthermore, just as in #1205 the windows in this suite were filthy; practically ruining any chance of capturing the views in a decent photo.

The suite did not have a fridge either, so I had to ask for that again. Neither were any water or coffee/tea facilities available in this $1000 suite and it was not mentioned if there would be lounge access for me. 

The lights in all the lamps in the living room flickered constantly when they were on, making it very uncomfortable in the evening.

Unfortunately, yet again I experienced indifference from some members of the staff. When I came back from shopping with my hands full of shopping bags, struggling to get through the front door - a hotel employee was standing just on the other side of the door looking at me (direct eye contact), but not offering me a hand. When I finally made it through the door (on my own), he looked at me and just said "Hello". I was literally speechless and have never experienced such a lack of simple service and courtesy.

When checking out from my first room midway through my stay, everything got very confused. Front desk was not able to allocate me the suite until around 4 pm, which was perfectly fair since it is their policy. This meant I used the room during the day while in and out of the hotel. However, housekeeping was not informed about that so I had to explain the situation to the cleaning lady; later in the afternoon a gentleman from the hotel locked himself into the room where I had my belongings and was literally chocked to find me there, so I had to explain myself again and I was asked to spell my name to him. Then front desk called me telling me that a bellman would be up shortly to bring me the key and take me to the suite. I waited for almost 45 minutes just sitting in the room with my luggage packed and ready. I called front desk, but no one answered. Finally, I left the room to go downstairs but then found a rather stressed bellman in the hallway apparently coming to collect me. However, he did not bring a key card; he said he had not been informed about that. He could get me to the suite anyway, he said – I just had to show ID. Then I offered to go to the front desk myself to pick up the key card, but he insisted that he would be right back bringing it to me. One hour later, nothing had happened, and I headed downstairs to pick it up myself. No apologies were given, the lady at the front desk just said they were all busy.

More details: This room had a traditional alarm clock on the night stand (as did #1205). However, this one did not work, and it showed 9 o’ clock throughout my entire stay. As with many of the other previous mentioned big and small issues in this review, this just shows a lack of focus on details from various departments in this hotel. 
During the first evening in the suite there was an order form available to me for conveniently ordering breakfast, but this was not replaced for the second night, leaving me to have to call room service; again, no consistency. 
The breakfast was not delivered on time on the last day. The waiter apologized for this and of course these things do happen, I know. However, in my opinion, the problem at Essex House is that there are so many things which do not work out and it really leaves you with an impression of a hotel that is rather unconcerned and unfocused on its guests. 
This is not how to run an international 5-star hotel.

Given the above reasons I will give this stay in the suite 3 stars. I did stay in contact with hotel staff several times throughout my visit, but, frankly in 5 star-hotels things are supposed to run smoothly; as a guest you should not constantly be on guard pointing out various issues to the hotel – they should see it before you do. It presumes a lot if this supposed to be a first-class experience. 

Was it worth almost $2500 for two nights in this suite? No.

Will I go back to Essex house? Probably not. Too bad, I loved the location, but this experience did not match what I expect from JW Marriott.

title: Excellent hotel
text: Stayed with my son, it was his first visit to NYC and we told the check in person when we arrived. She was very friendly and my check in was easy and fast. We got into our room at noon! later that evening, we had cookies, milk, chocolates and a 1/2 bottle of wine waiting for us, with a personalized note wishing us a great trip and fun trip for my son. What amazing customer service. All staff at hotel was very nice, helpful and friendly. Ate at the restaurant and staff there was also very friendly and service oriented. So impressed with this hotel and highly recommend. Also the location can't be beat, you're close to subway lines, the park and 5th ave.

title: Do not bring too much clothing
text: Despite being a Platinum for Life of Starwood and Marriott at this hotel that doesn't mean much. The room we were allocated is below anyone expectation first a city room view looking at a not so attractive back building and a closet that you can barely hang any clothing. Bathroom cleanness not so clean, Price tag US 650 plus per night .... A real disappointment

title: New York done right
text:
My husband and I love the Essex House.  This is where we choose to stay when we come to New York.  
It’s elegant, comfortable and clean. 
We stayed in a Junior Suite.  It was spacious, a large sitting space separated from the sleep area.  The bed was very comfortable - the mattress firm.  
The bathroom is ample - I like that besides an enclosed shower there is a bathtub too.
The one disappointment for me is that there is only one sink and not enough shelving space for toiletries.  
The restaurant and bar off the lobby - Southgate is a plus, the food and busy bar is excellent.  There is something to be said about having a night cap after a dinner out and before going up to bed. 
We also had a daily complimentary breakfast in the Executive Lounge because we are platinum elite members of Marriott. 
The reason I didn’t  give this hotel five stars is because the staff and service aren’t  noticeably friendly nor do they go the extra mile to make you feel welcome. 
There was also a lot of scaffolding outside the main  entrance which is due to upkeep and repainting.  That’s a good thing but it did take  away from the outside appearance of the hotel.

title: Central location!
text: Great location and walking distance to the main attractions in NYC. Central Park, Broadway, Times Square, MOMA, etc.   Great rooms and amenities. Really nice views of Central Park.  Theater fist six blocks away

title: Right on the park!
text: Spent a Saturday night here and was not disappointed.  Right across the street from Central Park, near the subway and lots of places to visit and to eat at.  Rooms were very nicely appointed with modern utilities- bathroom was new and night tables had USB ports and plenty of outlets. Wake up call was a live person.

title: LA MEJOR VISTA
text: Uno de los hoteles con mayor historia, la mejor ubicación. me toco una vista espectacular al central park, habitaciones prácticamente nuevas. el gym muy completo, el desayuno super, cuenta con varios restaurantes, todos excelente

title: Elegant-Beautiful - Special
text:
Right on Central Park South,  15 minute walk to Lincoln Center.  In house restaurant, SouthGate, is quite good.  Many other choices in the area if you don't like hotel restaurants.  
The lobby takes you back to a previous era.  You have to see the beautiful brass elevator doors.  
The rooms are modern and comfortable. Great bedding!  Our room looked out over Central Park, a nice touch for a romantic getaway.

title: Classic NYC
text: The hotel is elegant and stately as to be expected with the JW brand, and the staff was extremely professional. My room and bathroom were larger than typical NYC hotel rooms. Lastly, the location is ideal with Central Park located across the street, and Shopping and dining within walking distance.

title: Great location
text: This hotel has an excellent location near the park. I had a jr suite which was super fabulous. The only thing I didn’t like was no coffee in the room. Isn’t that standard now? It’s on the lobby but I think it’s lame not to have a Keurig in the room. The $25 charge that applies to food in the hotel THAT Day only is also so lame. Just another charge.

title: Extremely wonderful stay during US Open
text:
There is almost too much to say in praise of the JW Essex House.

The staff at every level was so very helpful, courteous and cheerful.

Seldom if ever is it true that an entire staff goes out of their way and goes
the extra mile. From the bellman that helped us out of the car, to the 
late night bell woman, Emelynn, who helped with our luggage; the front desk people Jean
and Indhi, then later in the trip Melvin and Felix; (Indhi took care of a reservation glitch
the first night which was our first impression of the Essex House great service.)

All the security people in the main hallway and elevator area gives one a safe feeling, and 
they were also friendly and helpful with directions as needed. The Concierge staff too numerous
to name, were always there to help with whatever questions or to print boarding passes as Michael did. 

The 19 year veteran server in the breakfast room started our off the days with a friendly smile 
and infectious laugh; and the breakfast buffet was quite extensive and comprehensive.

Bartender Steven and bar server Muhktar did all they could to make our stay fun and pleasant; 
Michael and Joel are two very bright young men on the move. 
Their attitudes of friendliness and enthusiasm are sure to take them far.

And I cannot forget to single out Juliette, who, with her "can do" attitude, 
was very helpful to me the last night of our stay. 
She left me with a great last impression about the hotel. 

Then the bellman who literally got into the street gridlock jam 
and found our car so we could be on our way to the airport. 

One of the greatest features was the shuttle bus to the tennis tournament. (And the two
women who helped with that.) I don't know if the Essex House is responsible for the shuttle service; 
it really made a hugethe difference every morning and evening (including very late night). 

(By the way, I found out about the shuttle when I called the concierge desk two weeks before our stay.)

And I must mention the water bottles near the front entrance. When the heat was nearly unbearable
that water wasa big help. 

And the huge TV projected on the wall in the bar so we could keep track of the tennis. 

And I also must mention the housekeepers who always had a smile and a pleasant greeting. 
Particularly the housekeeper on the 14th floor who sung out GOOD morning is such a 
pleasant and memorable way.

And on top of all that, I cannot forget to mention the little park across the street.

I feel like the JW Essex House is so very buttoned up and superbly managed with 
every detail under control and attended to. I tend to be hyper-critical of hotels.  
As I think through our stay at the JW Essex House, there are only the very most positive feelings
and impressions that come to mind . 

We are very grateful for our stay there. It made the difference between a good trip and a great trip.

title: Central Park location
text: Very busy hotel with a ton of tennis fans. Breakfast area for executive members crazy busy and not enjoyable.  Rooms were adequate but very over priced and thus much better value elsewhere.  Property chosen due to immediate proximity to Central Park but I know there are much better values at Marriott properties in NTC than this one.

title: Great hotel on Central Park
text: I stayed here for work and it was great! The staff was friendly and customer service focused. They were quick to reconcile any concerns. The rooms were clean and the bathrooms were huge in the king room. They have free coffee in the lobby restaurant every morning which is a nice touch.

title: Labor Day weekend
text:
Unfortunately this was a bad experience. My friend booked a suit for Labor Day weekend. We had the room on 3rd floor. Very nice room, clean and spacious. 
The hotel was busy with many VIP guests from the US open. 
  The guests next to us liked to start the party in their room at 3 AM, my friend called the front desk, and they send the security, but that didn’t stop them even on second night. So two nights with no sleep. The second night when he called again the lady said there’s nothing they can do. 
We order pizza and came cold, but too we were too tired to send it back. 
On the third night, when the party started again, my friend called angry and asked for a different room. So instead to sleep at midnight we had to pack and moved on 18th floor and it was worth it 6 good hours sleep before our flight.
  The staff people were amazing. We were looking for ice, this housekeeper blond lady with European accent was friendly, always with a smile. She told us the machine is broken, but she will get us some. We told her there’s no need we will go downstairs and get ourselves. She came back right the way with a bag full of ice and making sure we have everything we need. The back of the house are well trained for customers service. 
 For the amount of the money he paid, we could definitely stay in better hotel.

title: Nice stay good location
text: We like the location and the fact it is a good distance from Times Square.   Hotel is a older and a classic type of decor, we loved it and would stay here again without any hesitation.  We were on the 7th floor without a view, but views are hard to come by in most Nyc hotels, so don’t be shocked if you don’t have one.

title: Out of the Park
text: We visited NY for a week of fun and needed a place to relax and recoup. This hotel couldn't be in a better location. A  superb staff, and the property is beautiful. Too many positives to list here. Looking for a Central Park location?  I wouldn't stay anywhere else. Very deserving of the JW brand.

title: Perfect location...Wonderful staff!!
text:
After staying two nights for business, I had my wife and 3 children (all under 8) join me for the weekend. The location is a perfect spot to enjoy the more kid-friendly south side of Central Park. However, the staff is the main reason I will return next time I am in New York!
 Alicia was wonderful and seemed sincere and willing to help when I called two weeks before to inquire about rooms and upgrade possibilities. The door staff and front desk gave me a warm welcome. King helped me with my bags (also at check-out). He was very professional and incredibly kind while patiently answering all the questions I had about the hotel and city. 
My room was well-appointed, clean, and larger than I expected (King bed, Park view). Once the family arrived, we ordered a roll-away and there was plenty of room to spare. Housekeeping was very friendly, even arranging my kids' stuffed animals in funny ways to welcome us back to our superbly cleaned room. 
The Executive Lounge is on the lobby level next to the elevators. At first I was a little disappointed that it wasn't high up with a wonderful view. But later I found the location  convenient, especially with kids in tow. While we were visiting the Lounge, Collin was wonderful, providing enjoyable conversation and fantastic service, especially with the kids!
Overall, I highly recommend the JW Essex House. I travel for my job and spend an average of over 100 nights a year, mostly in Marriotts and Hiltons. That being said, this property is lovely, the location is hard to beat, and the people are outstanding!
Thank you also to Hannah, Felix, Sharlene, and Michael and everyone else!
See you next time!

title: Amazing!
text: I love this hotel. All the staff are amazing! Me and my wife, we had good experience. I will be back with my son as well! there is nothing i can say anymore because it’s just too perfect! I love my room too...

title: Great location
text: Had to stay one night during the week of the US Open. Prices in the city were off the charts but I'm glad I stayed in the Essex House. I was given a very nice refurbished room. It had a lot of windows and a lot of space for one person. Clearly the place to be if you want to run in the park or have a short walk to the stores on 5th and Madison Ave.

title: Exceptional hotel with great servive + quality.
text:
This is a fantastic hotel, one that we as a family were really looking forward to. Great location, just opposite the park and a few hundred yards from the retail shops and restaurants at Columbus Circle. Every single member of staff we spoke with was polite and helpful. Melvin, on the Front Desk, set the tone of our whole stay by welcoming us to the Hotel, was incredibly helpful and polite. The room itself, we had a family suite, was extremely sizeable, very clean + the housekeeping team were excellent.
My daughter particularly liked the TV's in our room had NETFLIX so she could keep up with shows she is watching. 
We had access, as I'm a Platinum member, to the lounge and this was just fantastic. The quality of food, breakfast, dinner + snacks were first class, as was the service. A special mention to Jasmin, who we met on the lounge desk a few times, she was always welcoming, accommodating + friendly as was Charly who greeted everyone with his warm smile, you can tell he's a popular guy. To me, this was the best lounge I've been in.
Melvin also took time to explain to me the $25 resort fee in detail and entails $25 credit (daily) for drinks, $30 credit (daily) for dry cleaning (excellent service also), free (2) tickets to Central Park Zoo (daily). To me, at least the Marriott are not ripping you off but giving back to us, the customers, value on the daily options. many NYC hotels just charge you the resort fee and give you nothing back so well done The Essex House.
I also got a late checkout with absolutely no issues.
All in all, a fabulous hotel, fabulous staff which made our stay so great, we look forward to staying as a family, we're from Scotland, on our next NYC trip.

title: Classic Hotel in a Fabulous Location
text:
What's not to like about waltzing out your front door every day...crossing the street and walking into one of the most iconic destinations in the US, if not the world, Central Park.
That was precisely my daily routine while spending 3 nights at The JW Marriott (formerly Jumeirah) Essex House recently. Because of my Marriott Elite Status i was upgraded to a fabulous park view room on high floor. It appeared that the room and bath had been renovated. It was spacious and i lacked for nothing. As this is an older building and in the dead of summer, i had to keep the AC at 64 to keep the outside heat and humidity from creeping through. The front desk and concierge staff were extremely polite, professional and very accommodating. They made an impromptu reservation at Nobu57 for me on short notice...all the while Open Table and the restaurant itself was claiming no availability. Well done on that front. After reading this you might ask why only 4 stars. Candidly, while i didnt mind my experiences at the lobby restaurant, Southpointe, it was nothing to write home about. Its almost a departure from the rest of the hotel which is classic and rather charming. As well it was evident to me that my room was once (perhaps long ago) a smoking allowed room. All the fresh paint in the world cannot mask it in the right conditions. The humidity of the outside air easily brought it to the surface. Alas it did not affect my comfort level much. All in all a great stay...a location that cant be beat if you need a car, a bike, the subway..or just on foot. I will be back.

title: Strategic location
text: Luxury hotel, just in front of Central Park and close to 5th avenue and some others of the main streets of central Manhattan. Fine public areas. Great breakfast and very comfortable rooms. Probably one of the best hotels in that area.

title: Great location...hotel getting a little tired
text: Our favorite location in NYC, right across Central Park. Everyone on the staff has always been very nice to us, including the parking valets who know us by now. The hotel rooms are getting a little tired though, and quality varies from room to room.  However, we got a great deal last time at the Trump International Tower and will probably stay there in the future.

title: Great Location, Cool Building
text:
The location of the hotel is excellent.  On the south end of Central Park you are close to most of the major sites visited by others and close to several large metro stations that allow you to get anywhere else with ease.

The breakfast in the lounge was excellent.

We were there for a weekend to catch some shows and other sites in the city and appreciated being in a nice hotel.

Others have mentioned the service and for the most part ours was excellent, but it could be a little inconsistent at times.  The staff was great with our younger children.

title: GREAT
text:
From the moment we checked in, Melvin was able to get an upgrade to a large room overlooking a courtyard.  The room was spacious and very modern. The bathroom was small but well appointed.

The staff was helpful and engaging. We have great experiences in both the executive lounge, amazing food and drinks. Also in the Southgate restaurant, just for drinks.

The located in superb, close to the theater district and shopping, especially the time warner complex and across the street from central park.

title: Meraviglioso
text:
Vacanza fantastica 
Grazie al posto ma soprattutto all’hotel in cui sono stato
Nell’hotel sono tutti più che disponibili accogliendovi meravigliosamente quando arrivate 
Appena arrivate vi verranno immediatamente a prendere i vostri bagagli portandoli nelle rispettive camere.
Esse (le camere) saranno pronte al vostro arrivo senza alcun problema
Camere molto grandi con letti comodissimi e bagni a loro volta confortevoli.

title: Great location
text:
Husband and I stayed for a weekend in the city. We usually stay near Times Square but opted for the nicer location using points. The hotel does charge a 25.00 a day “fee” but you are given the option to have something in the restaurant for “free” to offset the charge. Also free entrance to Central Park Zoo and credit for laundry or spa services. There was no wait for check in . We were warmly greeted as Platinum member and thanked for our loyalty.  We were offered late check out on Sunday which we did take advantage of. Offered a high floor with building views or lower floor with view of the park. Opted for the park view, though it was mostly trees it was still a nice view. There is some street noise, and because of a race in the park on Sunday morning we were awakened at 8 am to a PA system of someone singing the National Anthem. The lounge is only open for breakfast on the weekends.
Breakfast in the club lounge was great,though it does get crowded. A hostess is there to check access and to help seat people. I would recommend this hotel. All staff was very friendly and helpful. Room was small but well appointed, modern. Nice big towels  in bathroom but only one robe and one pair of slippers, which is a little odd. No refrigerator, just honor bar. Fitness center has small bottles of water and cool towels, which was a nice plus.

title: Brown Recluse Spider Bite- DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL.
text: First of all, I am a gold elite member and I have stayed at this hotel multiple times over the last several months, almost every month for several months. I stayed at this hotel from July 4th until July 19TH, 2018, in room 1436,  and woke up with a few spots of skin irritation on my face. Then every day, these "irritations" popped up more and more and I didn't suspect it was a bug bite because it didn't itch and it honestly just looked like a minor skin irritation and that's why I did not report it to the hotel.  I have seven of those spots and now after 4-5 days later, they started to itch like crazy, and it;s been a week now and they are definitely some kind of bites. I had a friend who stayed with me, and she also has same spots that have been itching like crazy. Google image search show they are unmistakably brown recluse spider bites  but what makes me MAD is I've emailed the hotel and marriott twice about this and I still have not gotten a response from them. When I finally did get a call, the person who was "investigating" was unpleasant, insinuated that that I had the bites before I came to the hotel.  This has been bothering me very much to say the last, I feel feverish from the bites and they look nasty, not to mention the itch that doesn't seem to be helped with any cortisone cream. I just find this unacceptable, I knew the hotel didn't have a great service, but this is supposedly a "historic, landmark" marriott hotel, and the fact that no one has reached out to me after repeated contact with them.  - Addendum: The bites are mostly all healed now but they left me lovely scars. If you decide to stay at this hotel, REPORT AND COMPLAIN EVERY LITTLE SKIN IRRITATION YOU WAKE UP WITH and demand to get a different room, document, take pictures and demand that they compensate you. It's been month, I've gotten a letter asking to investigate it further, I've replied to the email in the letter and still NOTHING.

title: Classy. New York. Say No More.
text:
Stayed here overnight after a long flight from Tokyo. Revived a great, clean and quiet room - on points, but was still great. 

Loved the staff the best. Friendly, helpful and what a hotel of this caliber should be. Walked through Central Park in the morning after a great workout in the gym and breakfast in the lounge. Great time with my family. 

We enjoyed the bar in the evening and cannot wait to come back. The staff is what makes this hotel. Service is TOP NOTCH.

title: Weekend getaway
text:
The location is great! Right across from Central Park...and pretty close proximity to theatre district, Times Square and Rockefeller plaza! 
The reason I gave this property 3 stars is mainly because of their service level! Their service level was like a regular Marriott and not a JW! No where near Ritz customer service! 
The checkin process was very smooth Cesar at the front desk was very patient and helpful, he tried his best to meet my request, I had booked 2 rooms, and I needed them to be next to each other and one of the rooms to have 2 double beds, and he was very helpful!
Other than that everything was like a regular Marriott hotel.  I was expecting JW to be more luxurious than a Marriott, better customer service, a doorman maybe, someone directing you to the elevators, someone explaining the property for example restaurants/spa/bar.... but no nothing like that! After check in we were on our own lol no bottles of water in the room, only one bathrobe, and one pair of slippers!
I didn’t have any negative experiences, just not what I expected! 
Will I stay here again? Most probably not! I rather stay at their sister property the Ritz just a block down. 
On a positive note the breakfast at the executive lounge was great! I actually joyed it!

title: Does not quite offer NYC "Luxury Hotel" Standards
text:
This hotel offers great location and stylish rooms, which were cleaned very well throughout my stay. There is also very nice lobby level restaurant, which is open late. Unfortunately, positive experience pretty much ends there.

They did not bring in water to the room and they did not have evening turndown service even if this one was supposed to be a luxury hotel. They have air ventilation issues in the rooms as the air is not going out from the rooms. During the more humid months, like August, the rooms were wet e.g. all linen were continuously very moist. I also tried to use phones in the room, and the phone system did not work.

We tried to look for a minibar price list and they did not have one in the room. Front desk manager tried to find a copy of the price list, but was not able to do so, He even tried to go to different rooms to find one, but could not find one. Maybe they atempt to overcharge their guest, so it is convenient not to have the price lists in the rooms? 

There is an executive lounge in the hotel, but it was such a disappointment. First of al, it was mostly closed during the weekend. This was not mentioned, when I booked the hotel. Basically, they only served the breakfast. One night, it was supposed to be open until 10:00 PM, but when we went there, it was dirty and there was no food available and they had brought in few unappetizing cakes.  Also, the lounge was not open 24 hours a day for water, drinks or coffee even when most of Marriott and Renaissance Hotel Lounges globally are. Overall, water and soda selection was very poor. JW Marriott is supposed to be in their luxury category, so this property failed hard in this category. As the lounge was closed, the management offered to bring a Keurig Coffee Machine to our room. Unfortunately, it never arrived.

This is a nice hotel, but perhaps they need to work little but harder to be worthy of JW Marriott Brand.

title: Unbeatable location, unparalleled service
text:
Recently stayed at the Essex House for a one-night. We were very impressed and will definitely be back the next time we're in New York. 

Overall, we were most happy with the Front Desk team. We asked for early check-in since we'd only be there for one night. We showed up two hours early, expecting to have to stow our luggage with the hotel and head out to kill time, even despite asking for early check-in. But the woman at the front desk said she would be able to get us into a room. 

Sadly, that room was on the 5th floor and view was at the park's tree line - not the iconic Essex view we were after. Went back down and she said she'd work on moving us to a higher floor. This time we did stow our luggage and went on our way. An hour later, she called us to say we could get a room on the 27th floor - much better! View was awesome - totally worth the wait.

Room was great overall - moderately spacious for New York, view you can't get anywhere else, comfortable bed & pillows, etc.  

Only small complaint was that there were only ever two front desk people, so the lines got long. But the Concierge desk right next to the line had 5 or 6 staff who were always milling about. Would be great if that team could jump in to help out and keep things moving.

All-in-all terrific stay - will return.

title: Awful experience
text: I am a Platinum member, and I was asking whether I am eligible for upgrade when I was checking in. The frontdesk staff told me "Our rooms are for sale not for upgrade", literally. I am totally okay with it, at least they are talking the way they are thinking.

title: Well maintained property
text:
My wife and I stayed at the JW Marriott Essex House for one night this past weekend, prior to staying in the West Village for a couple of nights.  We used points for our stay.  The staff treated us very nicely - setting us up in a room with a great view of central park (room 2515); and allowing us to check out at 4 pm.  

We were very impressed with the cleanliness of the room - it appears to be recently renovated.  The room wasn't huge, but it was nicely appointed - with a pretty marble bathroom.  

The fitness center is really nice for a hotel of this size - very spa-like, with good equipment.  We also ate dinner at the hotel restaurant after a lot of travel issues.  The food was not memorable, but perfectly serviceable.  My drink - Moscow Mule - was $21 - Welcome to NYC!

Overall a really nice stay after a rough day in the airport.  We would definitely stay again - hopefully for longer next time.

title: An old review
text:
I actually stayed here in March 2018 and as I was moving from another hotel due to terrible room quality, I really wished my trip in NYC would end up nicely.
