JW Essex House, I cannot say anything bad about this property! Starting from smiling friendly bell men to professional receptionist to great room with amenities, my final stay was comfortable.
Thank you!

title: Always a great time !
text: The location, accommodations and staff are just great.  A classic hotel with superb facilities.  Recent stay, we had 3 rooms and they all had been renovated, very clean, elegant and quiet.  Definitely coming back.

title: Great hotel
text: Spent our anniversary weekend at the Essex House. What a fantastic hotel, our room was on the 14th floor and the views across the park are amazing, nice size rooms with plenty of space, great location. All staff were very friendly.

title: Good hotel and great location
text:
The hotel is very good and the location is perfect. 
We spent 3 night and it was great. The unique issue was the view of the room. I booked a Central Park view but we were at the floor 3 and the view is not as good as the picture. I should have request higher floor.

title: Nice but rude staff for the price you pay
text:
Good
Room is clean and spacious and good location

Bad
There was a night porter that was extremely rude - I checked my bags in at reception and when I came back later the toilets were locked. I asked him if I could use them as my bags were at reception and I was about to leave for the airport. He just gave me a stern look and said he didn't see any bags. Where I live staff will get fired for being so rude at a 500 dollar a night hotel. I know it's a tipping culture in the US, but really!?

Front desk said they'll send me the invoice. Never received it. 

Front desk said my credit card didn't work. I produced a second one and they charged me on both credit cards. I get a text alert for any charges, so fortunately I realised it and sorted it out at the hotel. Is this a scam? 

I checked in food at reception to be kept in the fridge. If you read above then you should know by now what happened. I actually tipped then for not putting my food on the fridge.

You guys can do so much better by trying to be just a little bit friendlier. I stayed at cheaper hotels in NYC and the staff there where a lot friendlier. Your staff only seem friendly when I open my wallet to tip.

title: Great Location
text: Right on Central Park South.  Great for walking in park.  Rooms were spacious for the city, but not impressive.  Our kids room had a view of a brick wall. Our bathroom floor looked dirty from previous guests.  Asked housekeeping to clean it, but still had stains and did not look clean.  Great in-room breakfast.

title: A TOUCH OF HISTORY
text: Sono stato quattro volte in tutto in questo piccolo tempio della storia dei fatiscenti hotel della grande mela. Sarebbe bello che oggi lo rendessero più vicino a fasti del tempo invece che renderlo sempre più standardizzato.Chic è la struttura, l'interno non all'altezza.

title: Saved by the concierge team
text:
I stayed here for 5 days and my initial impression was good, that didn’t last long. 

Melvin the restaurant was a star as were the ladies on the Restaurant front desk.

However when one waiter was abrupt and rude to my colleague I asked to see the manager - he told me to go find him myself, I was shocked so I did and he really didn’t understand why that upset me.

Next my washing was totally messed up and two shirts ruined.

This was when I met Terence Jules - a man who clearly saw how to turn a mistake into an opportunity - he checked out the shirts and arranged replacements from Burberry which promptly arrived the next day.  Thanks you Terence.

Three guys though stand out at the Marriott - Michael, Kevin, Cameron and Howard, the concierge team. And they are a real team and highly motivated. They are excellent and nothing is too much trouble for them.

I reckon the hotel could be great but there were lots of problems when I was there, fire alarms, flooded elevators, just general stuff the management of the hotel should be on top of.

Overall not worth the price - but a great location and some great staff.

title: The Best
text: The best hotel I have stayed at in NYC, so close to central park, great rooms. Everything was spotless and top notch. It is not cheap but the old saying you get what you pay for is true. I will be staying here again.

title: Disappointing second stay
text:
I first stayed at this hotel two years ago, prior to the recent renovation, and had a great experience.  I was actually booked at a different Marriott property for my quick stay but decided to splurge and switched to Essex House last minute.  Knowing how great the rooms and customer service at this property previously were, I was especially disappointed that I left Essex House doubting my hotel choice.

There were only two parties in front of me at check-in and the wait was close to 30 minutes.  A handful of people in line, myself included, had completed mobile check-in, but there was no designated area to pick up keys besides the general line.  Mobile check-in preferences for a high floor and late check-out weren’t initially honored, though I was ultimately able to receive both.  For rewards status I did receive an upgrade from the base room to a Central Park view, as well as lounge access.  The executive lounge was a beautiful space with plenty of seating and a good selection of food for both breakfast and dinner.  My room on the 33rd floor was nicely renovated and had a decent amount of space for a Manhattan hotel.  The room had a different setup than the Central Park rooms advertised online, which made the room feel a little more like a studio suite than a standard guest room.  However, the room consistently had an odor of smoke (or something trying to cover up smoke), and the furniture was noticeably dusty and showing some signs of wear, despite being replaced during renovations.

The main thing about my stay that didn’t settle well with me was a housekeeping/safety issue, and how it was handled by Guest Relations.  I stepped on something sharp in the closet, which turned out to be an old spring coated in rust that was stuck in the carpet.  Fortunately, it did not break skin.  I noticed that there was a designated Guest Relations desk in the lobby and decided to bring them the spring and express my concern.  While the agent somewhat acknowledged the housekeeping aspect, she seemed a bit dismissive about the potential hazard.  Had it been a situation where it broke skin and I did not have a tetanus booster, or a child got a hold of it, I would have left with little confidence that the concern was passed along to a manager.  Customer service overall was okay, but not what you would expect from a 5-star property.  The doormen were very friendly, as well as the older gentleman at the elevators in the evening.  Service from the front desk agents was mixed.

I used Marriott points for my reservation, but if I paid for the room it would have been around $700 for a weeknight.  There are certain brand standards that are expected when staying at a JW, especially one that costs so much.  Despite having a 4pm check out, I ended up leaving at regular check out time due to frustration with the indifference from Guest Relations.  While this is still a classic property in an ideal location, I think significant changes are needed to housekeeping and customer service to elevate the hotel to its full potential and stand out in the competitive NYC hotel market.

title: Nice but...
text: Nice Junior Suite, however and a HUGE HOWEVER, DO NOT stay in rooms 550-540 you will be sorry!  Garbage truck outside window for over and hour and it is now 10 pm banging and making a tremendous amounts of noise! 9,would attach the audio file if I could.  This is crazy!

title: Historic location with stunning views of Central Park
text: This is the famous NYC iconic property that was also host hotel for Saturday Night Live hosts back in the mid 1970's - its been renovated since that time and they did a really nice job with the furnishings. If you can afford a room overlooking Central Park, its well worth it for at least one visit on a higher floor. Absolutely stunning. The housekeeping service is very attentive and circles around twice a day. I haven't been absolutely impressed with the front desk staff as I'm often left waiting even though they have mobile check in that is supposedly rapid - and has never been. The executive lounge tends to be overcrowded by families staying there (parents bring in multiple sets of kids and take up the tables) however you do get access to a plentiful breakfast buffet (the same one the adjacent restaurant charges a hefty price). Its located on the main floor and you have to prove membership although they never seem to check against total number in your party. There is never ever batted water in the rooms like every other JW property on earth - I believe its due to the unions at the hotel which is a shame that the customer experience suffers as a result. Rooms tend to get super expensive. The gym is decent and stocked with waters and towels.

title: Great llocation but doesn't live up to the price.
text:
I love the Marriott and this kills me to give a great hotel an average review.  Ive been a Marriott Gold member for 25 years so when I say this hotel needs a change, it's not to hurt the reputation, but to help them live up to the 5* rating they deserve.

I stayed here with my husband and son June 18 - 22.  The hotels in the city were crazy expensive that week, the Marquis and the Renaissance were $575 and even the garbage hotels were close to $400 so we decided to use Marriott points.  The Essex House was listed on Trip Advisor and even on the Marriott site for $735 a night during that time.

At $735 a night I expect 100% top notch service and it wasn't even close.  We had to wait at check in and I had checked in on the app but it didn't give me a digital key since the hotel was set up yet.

I always order extra pillows and towels, but they were not in the room.  The room was big for NY and the bathroom was beautifully updated with a separate glass enclosed shower and marble tub.

After dinner, we got back to the hotel around 11:30 and the extra towels and pillows still were not there.  3 towels for 3 people in NY when the weather is hot, does not cut it.  We called the front desk and they said they would take care of our request.  At 1:00 in the morning we got a phone call asking if we still need the towels and pillows.  Finally, housekeeping knocked on our door at 1:45 in the morning...Unacceptable. The manager did offer us a free breakfast for the disturbance.

The housekeeping department needs an upgrade.  One day we came back to our room at 1:00 in the afternoon and the room still wasn't made up..again only 3 towels in the room.  But heres what really get me...If a hotel can charge $735 a night, there should not be mold in the shower!  On my first day, I noticed a little bit of mold on the shower knob where the white button logo meets the silver knob, not enough to bother anyone but me and normally, I would wipe it off with a q-tip, but I decided to leave it just see how good the housekeeper was.  Well it was never touched during my 4 night stay.  Also there was dust on the silver arms of the toilet paper holder.

On a positive note, the location is perfect.  Hotel staff is very friendly.  The lobby is beautiful and my favorite was every night between 11 - 12 when we arrived back to the Essex house, the floor waxer was there waxing the lobby floor and always smiling.

title: Kein JW Standard...
text:
Zunächst vorweg: Alle negativen Anmerkungen sind natürlich “meckern auf hohem Niveau”, in der Preisklasse aber gerechtfertigt. 
Wir besuchten das Essex House vom 04.-07.07. Betritt man die Lobby, ist man natürlich erst mal hin und weg. Der Check In hat zunächst gut funktioniert. Wir haben aber leider keine Informationen bezüglich der zusätzlichen, täglichen Gebühr erhalten. Dies erfolgte erst am 2.Tag, als anderes Personal an der Rezeption war. 
Wir haben zuerst ein Zimmer im 7. Stock bekommen. Als wir rein kamen war die Enttäuschung erst mal groß. Klein mit Blick auf eine Wand. Auf den ersten Blick war aber sonst alles in Ordnung. Allerdings alles andere als luxuriös. Das schlimmste war aber ein durchgängiges lautes Summen, vermutlich die Klimaanlage draußen. Sehr nervig. Wir baten um einen Zimmerwechsel. Das hat einwandfrei funktioniert. Das neue Zimmer war im 14. Stock, das nervige Summen war allerdings genauso laut. Da das Zimmer ein gutes Stück größer war, sind wir letztlich da geblieben. Der Ausblick war der gleiche. Immerhin,mit ganz viele Phantasie könnte man meinen die Wand bringt einen zu Gleis 9 3/4. Der Roomservice hat auch nur das nötigste gemacht. Kein Vorhänge zuziehen oder ähnliches, wie man es eigentlich bei Hotels dieser Kategorie kennt. Das Bad war nicht wirklich in gutem Zustand. Die Beschichtung der Badewanne blätterte an einigen Stellen ab und das Waschbecken war dreckig. Alles in allem: Außen Hui, innen Pfui. Preis/Leistungsverhältnis stimmt hier absolut nicht. Es gibt wesentlich bessere Hotels in der Preisklasse. Bei unserem 1. Besuch in New York waren wir im Sofitel, kein Vergleich.

title: Better the expected
text: Was a Little skeptical booking an "older" hotel - but was pleasantly surprised - Room was bigger then expected and park view was AMAZING - the staff was great - We would  stay here again - The Location and Views are well worth it.

title: One Of My Best Memories And Stays Of NYC
text:
I am a Marriott Platinum Rewards member and stayed here on July 2, 2018 for 5 nights celebrating my daughters birthday. This is a classic historical hotel and we loved every minute of it. Check in took about 15 minutes and our room was not done so we went out and walked to the Met Museum and did that and then walked back through Central Park which is right across the street from the hotel. When we got to our room it was clean, neat, and tidy with good pillows and linens. We had a junior suite with a king bed and sleeper sofa which worked out very well. 

One of the best part about this hotel is the club lounge. They serve breakfast each morning and then appetizers and dinner starting at 5PM. This works out very well for the kids as they sometimes require food on demand. So you can start your day off with breakfast in the lounge and then if you return after a full day of sightseeing you can get snacks or dinner at 5PM before a rest or a trip to the spa. Or if you want to dine in at 5PM before you got out on the town for the evening it works very well. The hotel is right across the street from Central Park and about a 5-8 minute walk to 5th Avenue. Taxi's and Ubers are readily available. La Guardia Airport is a 25 minute drive with no traffic.

The hotel is still under renovation but it does not effect services. During my stay I did make it to the spa to use the steam room and sauna. They do need to offer more supplies in the spa lockers rooms. This was the only hotel I think I ever been to that did not have shave cream, razors, deodorant, ect. for the guests? I was actually quite surprised by this but worked around it. 

I want to give a shout out to the employee's that helped make our stay even better. Denise in guest relations was more than helpful. Rashed in the club lounge was fantastic. Anna in guest relations was a life saver when our flight was canceled and she kept adjusting our late check out time not knowing if we would even fly out that night or not. Also one gentleman at check in gave us the wrong hours of the club lounge by an honest mistake and he tracked us down in the lobby to tell us he gave us the wrong info. I apologize and I just cant remember his name but he knows who he is. 

*Speaking of the club lounge please note they are only open on Friday for breakfast and closed the rest of the day. See the photo I posted with the hours and plan accordingly.

title: Upscale hotel that needs to get its act together
text:
Overall a solid choice with renovated rooms but can be pricey for what you get.

Location: If you want to be near Central Park, you can't beat this location. Directly across the street to a main park entrance. Also near many subway lines.

Rooms: I saw 3 different rooms as I'll detail below. The first room was pretty small (though not horrible for NYC) and faced scaffolding from the 3rd floor but was considered a "park view."  I saw some trees over the scaffolding but it's a joke to call that room a park view.  The 2nd room was on a higher floor and was considerably bigger with a great view of Central Park and northern Manhattan.  And the 3rd room was a junior suite that was quite spacious and on a corner with decent "city" views.  All rooms appeared to be renovated.  

Amenities:  The gym is very nice with modern equipment, lots of space, and a full locker room with steam room and sauna.  Excellent hotel gym.  The executive lounge had a very nice breakfast and better than average evening hors d'oeuvres for a hotel lounge.  It wasn't the most spacious lounge so I only stayed in there for meals. And there are no windows in the lounge.

Check-in:  This is where the hotel gets docked major points.  I'm a Marriott Platinum and it was still a disaster.  I arrived at 11:30pm and there was a line to check-in (granted the hotel was close to sold out that night).  The woman who checked me in was friendly but couldn't seem to figure out which rooms were ready.  I was finally given keys to a 3rd floor room that I was told was an upgrade.  Rather the room was tiny and faced scaffolding on 59th Street. Being on the 3rd floor, it was also quite loud. So I went back down to the front desk and demanded another room that wouldn't be so loud.  I was given a high floor room that faced the park. It was a very nice, bigger room with 1 problem - it either hadn't been cleaned or someone else was still using the room as the bed was a mess, the bathroom was dirty, etc.  So I went back down again and they finally gave me a junior suite which was very nice.  So ultimately I got a nice room and a couple free drink coupons for the hassle, nobody actually apologized for the mess and they just didn't seem to have their act together at all.

title: Beautiful hotel
text:
We stayed here in June after spotting it near the park a few years ago and it being Essex House (we are from Essex!).

It didn't disappoint when we arrived, beautiful hotel, think very 1920s, absolutely stunning inside. There was scaffolding outside which kind of meant you couldn't see the full front facing on to the park but there is scaffolding everywhere in NYC so you get used to it! Superb location facing the park.

We had a few niggles on our first night which I wont put on here other than to say certain members of staff including Michael at the Concierge desk were very helpful and sorted things out for us, we also got some complimentary wine and snacks for our trouble and $200 off the bill when we left.

Only negative was the room we were in (we had a double bed room) on the 7th floor the view was terrible with hardly any light coming in. When we have stayed in NYC before we have been much higher meaning the view was still buildings say but where you are higher up it doesn't matter so much as you can still see sky - we couldn't even see the sky unless we leant round and looked right up so was hard to see what the weather was doing and the room felt dark.

Other than that fab stay, you get what you pay for plus it is one great location opposite that stunning Central Park! Right near all the shops and easy to get pretty much everywhere. 

We hope to be back.

title: You know what to expect at JW!
text:
Not easy to visit New York and expect much in the way of discounts. And the JW, directly across from Central Park, is no exception. However this hotel is a great example of ‘you know what you’re getting’ kind of place. Quality staff, lovely & comfortable rooms that didn’t feel at all like closets, plentiful club level lounge, they hit all the marks. As we traveled with friends on this trip, we went with their hotel preference and weren’t disappointed. No hub-bub of Times Square to deal with, yet a terrific walk back to the hotel after 2 nights on Broadway. 

Sometimes it can be hard to choose with hundreds of hotel options in NYC, but if you’re a fan of JW/Marriott, this classic spot will fit the (pricey) bill just right!

title: Holiday visit
text: My room was very comfortable, huge bathroom and writing desk.  Only downside was the view - it was of the middle of the building and I had to keep the shades down all the time.  I was a t a conference held at the hotel so it was very convenient.  Loved walking across the street to Central Park.

title: Espaçoso.
text: Vista para o Central Park, staff muito gentil, acomodações espaçosas, academia aceitável. Se for usar o frigobar para suas bebidas, peça um cooler a parte pois ao retirar garrafas do mesmo elas serão debitadas automaticamente à sua conta (que prontamente restituíram-se o valor debitado).

title: Great location, some details for the manager to work on
text:
Stayed for 5 nights in this hotel. Been in NYC many times and in different hotels. From FS, Ritz, Park Hyatt but also Hilton etc. We found the hotel nice, great location, nice entrance and the rooms were nice but we struggled with some management details. 

At check in we were give other rooms than booked with a discount and the promise to move the next day to a better room. First time I got that treatment as loyal Marriott member.... took us 30 min to settle on a deal. Not sure why this is so hard. Guess the room we wanted was available in the end. Manager had to come done, lots of wasted energy and not the way to start a stay. As said, once solved, we enjoyed the rooms. Sound of neighbors is an issue but the building is old so not a big surprise.

Then there is the luggage room. Wanted to leave one (1) piece of luggage as we would come back at this hotel before traveling home. Big speech that it needed manager special approval, got it all arranged after several conversations at front desk and still at check out got the same speech from a bell boy how difficult this is and if I got the manager approval ?! Not suitable for a hotel of this standing. 

Lounge as others indicated has a good breakfast but is far from appealing as a room. The evening buffet is not worth the visit - and certainly compared to other hotel lounges one of worst I have seen in a while. We did enjoy most of the serving staff, managers in the lounge seemed uninterested in their guests.

Okay visit but not our choice next time, Ritz is much better but also more expensive.

title: Arrive A Day
text: If possible to avoid getting stressed arrive at your hotel one day early. Check-out time for guests is 11am, your room will not be ready until 3 or 4pm. Plan evening activities for your first day in NYC. Also watch out for the Destination Fee at checkout, it is a charge so that two people can visit the Central Park Zoo or get coffee in your room. I questioned it and the clerk gave me credit. The benefit of staying at JW Marriott’s Essex House is the location. It’s near everything, Broadway, 5th Avenue shopping, major museums (The Met and the MOMA, restaurants, churches (St. Patrick’s), and if you like jazz or classical music and opera there’s Lincoln Center a few blocks away. Oh I almost forgot Rockefeller Center which is great at Christmas.

title: Disappointing Experience at Every Turn
text:
I booked two adjoining rooms, as I was traveling with my family, which includes small children. My wife actually called several days prior to arrival to confirm we had adjoining rooms with double beds. Upon checking in, I was informed that we did not have adjoining rooms, and there were no adjoining rooms or suites available at all at entire property. So, we were given two rooms, not with double beds (only kings) next door to each other (but not adjoining) with delightful views of a courtyard full of dumpsters. Next, the crib we ordered for our littlest person didn’t get delivered and took several more phone calls to surface (mind you, it was about 10pm). Then, prior to checking out and departing to the airport, I called the valet for my rental car 30+ minutes prior to needing it. After checking out (more than 30 minutes after I called), car was still not there. Took about an hour from when I called to get my car, which I was repeatedly assured was “just a few blocks away”. That delay made the drive to JFK to catch our flight that much more unpredictable than normal. Overall, a thoroughly disappointing experience, particularly considering the price and that I reserved several months in advance. I only wish that, instead trying to just make the best of it, I had left and gone to one of the many other properties within a few blocks, where it’s inconceivable we would have fared any worse.
(I feel compelled to disclose that someone called me after checking out to inform me that they had not charged me for parking. While I appreciate the gesture, I would have much preferred to pay full price for parking and gotten my car in under an hour so I could have been at the airport on time.)

title: Marriott Needs to Do Better
text: Although we got a room with a view of Central Park, The room was just a little old fashioned.  The furniture wasn't fresh and new.  We had read that they had remodeled but I saw no real sign of remodelling.  It was nice and service was great, but we were disappointed.  Having stayed at the St. Regis last year for our Anniversary, we were expecting the Essex House to match it in all respects.

title: Amazing hotel with unbelievable Central Park views
text:
This hotel was a great experience for my girlfriend and I enjoying a few nights around the Independence Day festivities. We checked in early and the staff was extremely accommodating, helping us upgrade to a park view room on a high floor -- and the VIEW was totally worth it!!

I wouldn't recommend the room service, since the food isn't anything spectacular for the prices -- but the service was very quick.

Room was amazing and we didn't have any of the noise issues that others talked about, but again we were facing the park and my gf and I are both heavy sleepers.

I would ABSOLUTELY stay here again as the central (no pun intended) location, access to Central Park and incomparable views all made the stay very worth it.

title: Mitigé
text:
Test pour éventuellement en faire le camps de base de mon employeur lorsque nous séjournons à New York avec à la clé chambres + location de salles de séminaires et de réunions. 

 Accueil par une jeune femme adorable, courtoise et parfaitement professionnelle à la conciergerie de l’hôtel, réponse claire à nos questions, disponibilité et gentillesse. 

Composition florale dans le hall jolie, le comptoir de la réception et les ascenseurs sont ce qu’il y a de plus remarquable dans l’hôtel. 

Pour le reste... bof rien à dire de particulier rien à retenir de particulier non plus. Les chambres sont correctes, lits confortables, salle de bain bien sans plus. 

Moment de solitude lorsque mes collègues et moi alors que nous attendions silencieusement dans le hall avons étés très largement toisés par ce qui avait l’air d’être la coordinatrice des événements (Mademoiselle vous devriez prendre du recule vis à vis de vous même!) : le personnel se la pete vraiment mais nous ne sommes pas dans un palace !! les chasseurs se sembles investies d’une mission divine, seuls les concierges et les agents de sécurité sont réellement aimables. 

Résultat nous nous attendions à un bond dans le temps à un lieu cosy chic agréable aux hautes prestations hôtelières : résultat merci mais non merci ! Nous avons signé ailleurs !

title: 가성비 최악의 호텔
text:
비싼 가격에 비해 낡고, 오래되고, 서비스는 구리고, 딱히 좋은지를 모르겠어요. 위치가 센트럴 파크 바로 앞이고 센트럴 파크뷰를 택하면 방에서 센트럴 파크가 보인다는게 장점인데 그거 하나가지고 방값을 이렇게 올려받아도 되는지 모르겠어요. 여기 묵을 돈이면 인근에 있는 훨씬 좋은 호텔에 묵을  수 있어요.

이 호텔이 역사가 오래되서 그 자체로 historic building인데, 저희는 잠을 자러 온거지 유적을 구경하러 온게 아니거든요. 100년 가까이 된 호텔인만큼 엄청나게 낡았어요. 1층에 라운지가 있는데 음식도 그닥이고 주류는 전부 유료.. 전통있는 호텔을 좋아하신다면 모를까 굳이 이 가격에 갈만한 곳은 아닌 것 같아요.

title: A nice extended business trip.
text: Arrived at about 3pm and the room wasn't ready yet.  No big deal.  Dropped bags with the expectation that we'd receive a call when our room was ready.  Very courteous staff gave us a couple of drink coupons for the hotel bar which based on the price of a draft beer, were worth $24.00.  It got to about 5pm and no call so we decided to go to the desk and inquire.  Room was ready to go.  Went to our room and were very pleased with the room itself.  We are platinum at this hotel but I am certain that we weren't upgraded.  View was of some AC units and empty Home Depot buckets on a roof (5th floor room).  We kept our blinds down the entire time.  Bed was very comfortable, the shower had plenty of hot water and great pressure and most importantly, everything was clean.  We enjoyed the location by the park for morning walks...OK, I slept and my wife walked.  The only complaints that we have are the lack of communication about check in and the bar staff at the Southgate (hotel bar).  The gentlemen over there could use a little bit of customer service training.  No personality at all and slow service (not just the time that we used the drink coupon).  All in all we enjoyed our stay and will be back should a visit to NYC be required.

title: Sleepless in NYC.  Marriott Hotel Essex
text: Worst 4 nights of restless sleep in a room opposite a recycling dump.   Trucks offloading starting st 12:30 am until 4:30 am every evening.   Feel like they saw as coming.... would never recommend this hotel unless you get a room that isn’t opposite the dump.   Should have been discounted price for a room you can’t sleep in due to the overwhelming NOISE!!!!

title: Worst stay at any Marriott using my credit card with fraudulent charge
text: Checked in as an Elite Lifetime Marriott Platinum Member using points when made reservation days before. Advised at check in my Visa card would be charged $150 and my computer and theirs shows I was for incidental purchases. On checkout the front desk people had NO IDEA WHY I HAD AN ADDITIONAL CHARGE OF $269.69 and would not remove it. I tried to dispute with my credit card company but the credit card company says the merchant can put any amount on my card and keep it there for thirty days with no cause and no explanation. The credit card company supervisor said this is unusual for this Marriott level hotel and I agree. Their front desk manager promised to have accounting call me back the next morning July 4. Guess what . No call. I will see if this is legal in NEW YORK STATE. Hard to believe. First the $150 which was appropriately credited before leaving less a destination charge of approx. $29.00 but keeping the $269.69 for up to 30 days with no reason and possibly a hotel employee or someone used my card. My credit card company said I will have to wait thirty days on this pending charge before disputing it. Poor hotel management and accounting in our computer age

title: Luxury & Kindness
text: Our room was fantastic, so spacious and well done. We had a great view of Central Park. The location is top notch. The staff were all so kind & friendly. From check in to check out everything was wonderful. This hotel far exceeded my expectations.

title: Great Manhattan hotel
text: I wholeheartedly can recommend the Essex hotel on Central Park south, now called the JWMarriot. I stay in many hotels all around the world and although NYC is very gritty everywhere, this hotel is very nice. The service staff from reception to concierge to security to bar staff to room staff-all are very courteous and efficient. Foe a reasonable room rate you are next to the great Central Park and not far from the theatre district.

title: very smelly hotel
text: actually we meet very bad experience in hotel they have very smelly in flower 35 and for 6 hours they cant fix it , and when we ask to change rooms they said no availability and they have availability online

title: Unless a Central Park view is the goal, stay at other Marriott properties
text:
I had some decent expectations of the Essex house - given it's history and placement in NY - they really could offer a great 5 star stay here.  Except, at every turn - they just don't.

The front desk was very helpful while we were here, the people were very friendly and that was about the only 5-star service we received/experienced while at the Essex house.

The rooms are fine.  There isn't anything wrong with them, but plenty other 5-star hotels in NYC offer far more space and more comfortable furnishings.  Probably the most irritating part of the room is that apparently there is a mini-bar in the drawers under the TV.  Never knew it was there until we got the folio in the morning with $40 charges for a pack of M&M's and Raisins.  Went downstairs to let them know we didn't touch the minibar and they kindly took it off.  Went back upstairs, gathered out things and left the hotel.  Looked at the credit card bill a few days later and we had been charged another $50, this time for three drinks.  Again, a lengthy process going through calling the hotel and eventually the accounting department to remove these charges.  

We paid $800 for the room, for one night - and they are nickel and diming me $40 for a pack of M&M's.  Comp the M&M's Marriott.  Instead of staying here again, there was a Courtyard six blocks away I had stayed in the previous week that was $600 cheaper and supplied free water and chips in the room.

Pro-tip to NYC: unless you NEED this central park view room for your Instagram - stay somewhere else.

The Renissance Midtown is a great new hotel in NYC.  The Renissance Times Square can be a bit noisy but offers a much better experience.  Central park - stay at the Ritz.  The Essex house should be one of your last options in NYC.

title: Fantastic birthday weekend stay ♥️
text:
It was a very welcoming experience for my family to spend her birthday in this beautiful property. 
JW Essex House never failed my high expectations for a five star 🌟 hotel 👌
From the time I corresponded with Jasmin Chen ♥️ she went above and beyond to accommodate us, my request and all . Jasmin is like Mallory 😍 Thank you very much for your very reliable and professional customer service. 
In addition, she introduced us to the new VIP director Jenny 👌who was very gracious and accommodating. I’m very grateful for  both of your kindness and cordial dealings.
Likewise excellent meeting with your concierge staff and front desk .
Very pleased to know Charlene ( extremely helpful) and Michael.
There’s Jenny and Jasmin welcome us from arrival to our lunch at the Southgate ( my favorite restaurant) 😍
The room was very spacious and newly upgraded, renovated, new posh furnishings. Jasmin and Jenny made sure that the room was well decorated for my niece birthday 🎂 ( Antonette) She was very thankful for the great hospitality and effort from this 2 professional ladies. Thank you so much Jasmin and Jenny 🙏🙏🙏
We all loved the neat and clean cozy atmosphere you provided to my family. You definitely can compete with other five star hotels .👌👍 Antonette’s reiterated 😎 how much more if they get the Central Park View 🙏
I was not mistaken for my loyalty on this property ♥️😇🙏
One of the best property right across Central Park 😎 only few steps you’re there. The place in New York City that you would not  want to miss when visiting here 👌
The hotel is very accessible to stroll around going to 5th Avenue, down to the Rockefeller center , St . Patrick’s Cathedral 🙏
Every staff here were all friendly 👍
Housekeeping was excellent!!!
Thank you very much for providing the Club Lounge access 🙏🙏🙏
It’s great to endorse this property to anyone and of course to my family and friends ♥️ Its all worth it !!! 👌
It was a fantastic birthday weekend stay 🎉🎂🎊🎁🍾💐
Jasmin Chen you are a gem to the JW Essex House 😍😍😍Thank you 💐💐💐

title: great location, frustrating service
text:
The hotel itself is beautiful but every time I have stayed here I have noticed small service issues that are very annoying:
there is ALWAYS a long line to check- in and check-out, which tells me they are either understaffed or poorly run or both.   Mobile check doesn't seem to work here so don't expect that to help.   assume 15-30 minutes wait to check in. 
also if you stay at marriott like i do because of loyalty points, the lounge is also very frustrating: great breakfast but very disorganized staff: expect to wait fot a table, then have them mess up your cake on the list,  then accidentally give away your table.   also the layout is extremely cramped so there is no room to get up/sit down without interrupting other people.
bottom line: the hotel itself is great but if you are staying there because of marriott loyalty expect some disappointment in small details.

title: Another great stay
text: We live outside of NY and stay here from time to time. The rooms are recently renovated. The breakfast which is included for Marriott Gold member is very nice and the location is great (right across the street from Central Park). We highly recommend this property.

title: Great staff, location, size but issues with the room
text:
Overall our stay at the Essex House was pretty good however there were some missteps. We had a red eye flight and when we got to the hotel at 7:30 am they already had a room for us. Also the staff was so helpful and nice which was great. The hotel is in a great location within the city for walking, shopping and restaurants. When we entered the room we were pleasantly surprised by how spacious the room, bathroom  and walk-in closet were (PSA to all families: it was two double beds even though they could have easily fit two queens in the room). However throughout, our stay, the bathroom  was the sore spot. Whenever you would turn on the hot water it would sound like a train was crashing into your hotel room (this is not an exaggeration). Also on our last night when you would turn on the shower (AKA a trickle) the tub faucet would start running and the “shower” would just trickle on you. One of the worst parts was that the drain was open but the tub would keep filling so you had to stand in gross stale water while trying to shower through a few trickles of water. 

The staff, location, and size of the room   made up for some of the issues. However I do not think we would stay there again, although we really wanted to love it you could find a hotel for the same price with less issues.

title: What a disappointment
text: I used Marriott points to stay at this hotel on the way back from the World Cup. I have the Marriott credit card, stay fairly regularly, and don’t see that I get any benefit from it besides WiFi. The room is fine, but loud (I get it, it’s NYC), but every hotel I’ve stayed in anywhere in the world, they provide a kettle to heat water. This hotel charges $10 just for the kettle (no tea included). I’m thinking of cancelling the Chase Marriott card and going with the Hilton card.

title: Avoid paying for the buffet breakfast
text:
I pre-purchased buffet breakfast at Essex House for a 2 night stay last week. The buffet was the shared Marriott Club buffet and very similar to what you get in a Courtyard Marriott for $15...no omelet station, no waffle maker....limited choice of berries..stale croissants.and presented in the same style of the Courtyard Marriott. Not worth $38!!!

The main a la cart breakfast looked fine - but if you have prepaid for the buffet no good to you.  Pret a Manger next door is better and cheaper for breakfast.

Essex House seems to have lost it's way...having paid $1600 for 2 nights they wouldn't keep my bags overnight at the bell desk!

The rooms are OK (  we had central park view room ) but not big and nothing special for the price. After a couple of nights we moved 250 yards up the road to the Mandarin Oriental - about $100 more a night but a world of difference - huge modern room, great views and outstanding service.

title: New York is GREAT!
text: Because of places like this who have a heart of Gold. Yes, the beautiful word Golden goes out to a very special individual  Kevin!  Kevin if it wasn't for you , I would not of stayed there and LOVED it!!! So JW Marriott Kevin gets the 5 Stars because "He reigns Supreme"!!! His staff is also lovely! They are easy to find in the main Lobby!!! He wins the Hospitality award!!! YAY Kevin

title: Great Location
text: The hotel is on the South side of Central Park, within easy walking distance of the Time Warner Centre, the Lincoln Centre, Broadway theatre district etc. My room was  large, well appointed and the bed very comfortable - all as you would expect from a hotel of this standard. The only things I didn't like were (a) the locked bar fridge - couldn't use it for any personal items and (b) normally in room WiFi is an additional charge, but I was very pleased to receive this gratis. I would stay again, if visiting NYC.

title: Great location
text: Lovely hotel, great location and helpful staff. We stayed over Christmas. Rooms are spacious for New York hotels would definitely stay here again as I love this part of the city so close to bars and restaurants.

title: Weekend in Manhattan at the Essex House
text:
This property is one of our favorites of the entire Marriott/SPG Family. 
The location is perfect , the staff could not be any nicer and the concerierge lounge is open on the weekends. 
Mallory J and her staff are assets to the industry.

title: 1st Class Hotel with service to match!
text:
My wife and I stayed here for the weekend to celebrate our 50 th anniversary and had a wonderful time.
Clean updated rooms and public spaces, right across from Central Park, gorgeous weather, home run😍

title: Short but great stay
text: The hotel is very well placed, check-in was quick and easy. The room was immaculate. A/C a bit noisy but nothing major, great selection of minibar items. If you are looking for a business trip this is a great option. I didn't use the gym or the restaurant.

title: Nice but not as lovely as it used to be
text:
We’ve stayed here for years . It used to be they would greet you with a smile by name at curbside or check in and with a warm towel after your travels ; they make you feel like you were coming home. Recently we arrived and it was a lovely experience but lacking the personal touch it used to have before Marriott bought it . Lovely small lobby but with tired furniture.
Rooms were very nice . We had to wait until 5 pm or so to get in . Excellent location on Central Park.

title: Thursday thru Sunday. And the concierges are the best!
text: First time in the city as a tourist! Many business trips, but their concierge staff made our stay delightful. All the staff was super friendly, so much for the New York City reputation of not being friendly. These people were on their game! Service was excellent, the rooms were well kept and clean. Not to mention being located on the park.

title: Best view in Manhattan
text: We stayed with 2 children in suite with Park view. Best view of central park! We enjoyed location, renovated rooms and service. It's not Peninsula or Four Seasons but cost/quality for good hotel in NY is superb. Staff is very helpfull and well-trained. We were asked at what time we prefer room service. Restaurant is great for breakfast (buffet is great especially variety of berries), lunch or dinner with central park views as we like quite place with park view for convenience with children.

title: Un hotel frío y con pésima atención
text: Compramos una estadía en el JW Marriott Essex House pensando que quedaríamos frente al magnífico paisaje de Central Park en invierno. Pero no tuvimos suerte. Quedamos en un cuarto interior que miraba a los edificios contiguos. Y lo peor, estábamos sobre los motores del aire acondicionado: había que dormir con tapones en los oídos. Es un hotel de lujo, carísimo...pero no vale la pena gastar ese dinero porque es un sitio frío y con personal que no atiende un simple pedido de cambiar de cuarto, en temporada baja, cuando las habitaciones estaban vacías.

title: Great location
text: Loved this hotel. Clean and sophisticated decor. Good sized room with a view of Central Park. The concierge level breakfast was very good had a wide variety of hot and cold items. The only negative was the constant smell of horses in the lobby area. It was really overwhelming but Understandable because this CPS area is overrun with horse and carriage drivers. Great stay at this beautiful, historic hotel.

title: Loved the family connector rooms!
text:
I chose this hotel because of the family rooms and for its proximity to Central Park. The family rooms were perfect for 3 adults and 3 children and since there is a foyer between the rooms, the noise in one room did not affect the other. The bed was very comfortable and the darkening shades worked very well. My daughter, whose room faced 58th Avenue was awakened at 3 am by a very loud sanitation truck.  

I was disappointed that the rooms did not have coffee makers, although there was complimentary coffee in the restaurant foyer, but the doors did not open till 7 am (at least on Sunday). There was no cream, only skim milk, but the hostess did bring out some half and half when I asked. A cup of coffee with breakfast is $9!! We usually just picked up something at Pret A Manger down the street and it was very tasty!

I choose hotels based on my activities, so this hotel served its purpose of exploring part of Central,Park with my grandchildren. I doubt that I would stay here again.

title: Wonderful Historic Property
text: This is a wonderful historic art deco property built at the beginning of the Depression and beautifully restored. The location is ideal as you are across Central Park Ave from Central Park. It is an easy walk to Times Square and the Theater District. The staff is very friendly and courteous. The rooms are large and well appointed. It is one of the few luxury hotels that offer a family suite of two rooms that connect is its own foyer. For anyone wanting an ideal location in Manhattan I would highly recommend this hotel.

title: Nice.
text:
The rooms are beautifully updated and for NYC, a decent size. The lobby is beautiful and the location is pretty convenient. All that was a nice place to stay. 
We are gold members so we were upgraded for the room and with lounge access. But- the lounge wasn’t open on Saturday? So, we couldn’t even get waters.  And there is no coffee maker in the room. That was a bummer that we didn’t have usual lounge access to water, tea or coffee pretty much anytime. For this category property, would expect that. Especially in New York City when you need 24 hour access. We had called downstairs to ask where the executive lounge was located and the woman gave us directions -and we got there and it was closed-no Saturday hours posted. Would think that would be something she would have mentioned before sending us down 34 floors!  

Restaurant turned out to be a nice dinner. Had our doubts when we unfortunately had a difficult time understanding our waiter. Then he told us they had taken all the cocktails we read about off the menu... at $25 a drink you have 3 options (or of course a standard martini). $25. That’s balls.  But he eventually got them to make the drink I wanted. The food itself was great. We did a variety of small plates. All fresh and tasty. 

Overall, perfectly fine experience - just nothing stood out as impressive. And there are so many options in NYC

title: So disappointed
text:
We recently stayed at Essex house J W Marriott for 2 weeks. 

What a disappointment. A total rip off. 

Only the location was good. 

Service?! They have no idea what that means. No one greets you, No one smiles, turn down needs to be asked for. Never heard of that at any 4/5 star hotel anywhere else in the world. Rooms and bathroom are cleaned so badly. No vacuuming of the carpets, bathroom counter and floors are not wiped clean,soaps are not replaced even when nearly finished!! For the price they charge I have not seen such bad service. No porters or anyone at the hotel greet you at anytime of arrival. No one offers to help you with heavy packages.

Restaurant food was terrible. In house dining served by sullen waiters. The lounge has breakfast served so sloppily. At this price they charge for the electric kettle! And cups are not cleaned by housekeeping! 

I could keep writing because I have 2 weeks of living there.

I agree with the other reviews that the $25 destination amount, is such a farce. As a gold card member there are absolutely no benefits. You need to check if points are being added. They conveniently don't tell you or look puzzled if you ask! 

Does anyone in the top management know what's happening?

title: Huge disappointment so far
text:
Got here just after two today to check into a Central Park Suite.  When we arrived, we were told that the room is ready, but someone was being set up to make sure.  30 minutes later, we were given our key.  When we got into the room, it smelled like cigarette smoke and the room had not been serviced.  We went back to the front desk to get the room resolved and were told that they would send someone to clean the room.  We were given drink coupons for the bar and headed there for a few drinks.  While in the bar, the service sucked!  After an hour and a half and our four drink couples later (two each) we headed to the front desk to get our room - it’s now 4:20pm.  Not a surprise, our room was not ready... After over two hours, JW was still unable to get a room cleaned up.  Im a pretty frequent Marriott guest - Premier Platinum.  The service and experience is better at a Fairfield than this JW has been so far.  To top it off, no one seems to care about getting this resolved.  I’m guessing that most overlook the poor service because of the location?

I honestly cannot and would not recommend this place.  Oh, and this has been sitting outside my door since the first time we checked into the unserviced room.  Maybe it’s supposed to be my amenity for 22 years of loyalty. 

Brian

title: Average JW Marriott
text: Like any New York hotel it is overpriced and a average JW Marriott at best. However it does offer good amenities and executive lounge. Good clean rooms, food is bad but overall it is a worthy location.

title: A landmark building updated
text:
I used to stay at the Essex when I traveled almost weekly for business in the 1970's.  It was elegant and comfortable then but rather musty because of age.  Last month my wife and I stayed there for a week and i was surprised with JW Marriott's upgrade and rehab.

Despite some more rehabbing going on on one side of the building our room was fresh, modernized and clean, with a beautiful view of Central Park.  Staff was responsive, security good, and we felt very much pampered with the amenities.

title: Below average experience for a JW
text:
I stayed here for a weekend in early May and while the experience was horrible, it was not all too memorable. If you want a luxury hotel close to the park, shell out a bit more and choose the Park Hyatt on 57th/58th or the Ritz down the street - trust me, it’s worth it a little extra. The worst part about staying here is the check in process - nothing about it is what you would expect from a 4 star hotel in the Marriott portfolio.There were at least 5 parties in front of me checking in at 6 PM on a Friday night and only ONE front desk clerk (there are a total of 4 computers at the check in desk). Within a few minutes of standing in line, additional guests were queuing behind me. The whole check in process took at least 15-20 minutes. Meanwhile, the two employees working the concierge desk were not doing much of anything but laughing and telling stories to each other while observing the front desk backup. You would think these concierge employees would be empowered to jump over to the front desk area and help check people in.

I found it ridiculous that the concierge lounge was only open for Breakfast on the weekend (no snacks in the afternoon or dessert at night - you can’t even access the room after 11 am on the weekends to grab a bottle water)

The rooms were updated and were fairly clean. However, it looked as though some of the wood trim in my room was not replaced during the renovation and simply painted over, which detracted from the updated feel of the room.

Not the most professional front desk staff. Next time I am in town, I will stay elsewhere.

title: Good location in Central Park
text:
We stayed here for one night prior to taking a cruise to Bermuda.  This hotel is in an excellent location to explore Central Park and is only a few blocks from Times Square.  

Pros:  the room seemed big for NYC, the bed was very comfortable, guest services were friendly and helpful

Cons:  the room service menu was the exact same menu as the restaurant on the first level which we found underwhelming and overpriced, there was only a very small store in the hotel to buy drinks, toiletries, etc and it was only open during limited hours

I would recommend this historic hotel in NYC.

title: Lovely Stay
text: Just came home from an overnight stay. What a lovely hotel! From check in to check out, everyone took the extra step to make us feel welcome and well cared for. It started with Melvin ( I think that’s his name) at the check in desk. He was lovely and very kind to our dog. The room was super clean and renovated, as was the whole hotel. Surprisingly big room for NYC. We used points for this quick trip and was treated like we paid full price. We are already planning our next weekend stay,

title: Perfect location
text:
We stayed at that Essex House for 4 nights. The very nice person checking us in was kind enough to upgrade us to one of the larger rooms in the hotel, which was awesome because we are a family of 4 that includes two teenagers. The room had ample plugs for charging electronics. Very tastefully decorated with practical furniture. The bathroom was very spacious, but didn't have a strong enough exhaust fan so it remained very steamy long after a hot shower. 

We are fortunate to be Marriott rewards platinum members which gave us access to the concierge lounge. They had an excellent breakfast in the morning and access to drinks all day. There was a buffet dinner in the evening. All of the food was tasty and saved us a ton of money in the Big Apple! 

The location is fantastic- Central Park is right across the street. The subway is about a block away. If you are a walker, it's easy to walk to Times Square and Rockefeller Plaza.

title: Nice Property But Badly Managed
text:
This hotel is ideally located and the rooms have been recently renovated and pretty nice by NYC standard. However, the service is pretty poor.  First, at check in, no one confirmed the package benefits we booked, which included free breakfast and $100 food credit. We had to go back down to front desk to be sure we got these included.  Second, we asked for someone to come pull out the sofa bed, waited 30 minutes and had to call back to finally get
Someone to come.  Third, we paid $20 a nite for the enhanced internet, but it has been so slow that it’s been unusable. Then, the final rub is being charged $25 a nite resort fee for dubious benefits. That’s just put this hotel in the low class category in my mind. I don’t see Four Seasons ever doing this. I rather that you charge $25 a nite more in the room rate and keep your so call benefits.  I think you need a management change on this property if you want to maximize its potential.

title: A nice home away from home
text:
There are some hotels that make you feel at home even though you're away from home. JW Marriott Essex House is one of them. During my two visits there over the past couple of years, it has delivered on all the key components of a great stay: great location (right on Central Park close enough to the bustle of Times Square without being in the middle of it), refined ambiance (mix of timeless design and modern accents), service (gracious and welcoming from reception to guest services), amenities (spa, gym with Pelotons!) and rooms (updated and spacious).
 
Both trips have been to celebrate different family milestones – one a birthday and the other an anniversary – and in both cases, Jasmin in Guest Services made sure that we were well taken care of. Thanks to her and the rest of the team for the great experiences. We can’t wait for our next visit.

title: Great locations, nice rooms!
text:
We stayed in the residences for two nights, and we enjoyed it very much!
Our two bedroom was very spacious, and had two baths, a small kitchen and a large living room. Housekeeping kept it very clean and the location was perfect for our needs. I would stay here again in a minute!

title: Better than the Ritz.....
text:
This is the 5th time I have stayed at this hotel and it never disappoints.

The Ritz is located on Central Park South, too,  but I truly feel that this hotel is better than the Ritz.   (I have stayed at both hotels).    Why is it better?   JW Marriott's staff shares the Ritz's commitment to perfection.   Also, the JW Marriott's rooms are much nicer than the rooms at the Ritz.   A very small detail to share:   the bath towels at the JW Marriott Essex House are huge and that was not the case at the Ritz.

A random story about the hotel to share:   I had seen a gift package at the front desk with a happy face balloon.   I asked the concierge where I could purchase this balloon because my 2-year-old grandson was joining us for the weekend and I wanted to put a balloon on the gift that we had for him.   I was told that the front desk would gladly blow up helium balloons for my grandson's gift -- at no charge.   Needless to say, the gift was a huge hit and my grandson loved the balloons, too.   It is this attention to detail and caring for its guests that you can always count on when you stay in this hotel.    

If possible, ask if you can do the breakfast buffet for Marriott Platinum Rewards Members.   The breakfast is outstanding and is always one of my family's highlights for a weekend away.

Great location, too!

I highly recommend this hotel.

title: Great location, poor service
text: We stayed here for a week in April with our two children, I can’t fault the location, right opposite Central Park, convenient to walk into Manhattan.. that’s about it.. we were late checking in, our room wasn’t ready so we were asked to wait in reception, when our room was available not only was it the wrong one but the beds had not been made, the bedroom which was meant to be a Central Park view overlooked a heating unit and what looked like a building site in the centre of the hotel (see attached picture)... throughout the week the hotel staff were ignorant and less than attentive, not what you would expect having paid a premium price for what is marketed as one of the best hotels in NYC..

title: Great location with an amazing hospitality!!
text: Stayed here for the first time for two nights with my wife and was thoroughly impressed by their hospitality. First, they have us a suite upgrade for our anniversary , then sent a special note and drinks. On top of the special stuff the staff was at our service from the bellman to the concierge from start to finish. If that is not enough, the amenities in the rooms are top class, hotel is in a great location with full of old school NY character. Highly recommend this place to everyone

title: garbage truck at 3:30AM
text: We enjoyed the garbage truck outside our window at 3:30 AM Sunday morning and listening to it for about an hour pick up round after round of large metal containers of trash next door.  For those of you who might not enjoy such sights and sounds, make sure you get a room overlooking the park!

title: By far my favorite Hotel in the City other than the Ritz in Battery Park.
text: Location is the key for this hotel. Directly across from Central Park and easy walking distance to Central Park Zoo, Museum of Modern Art, Guggenheim, Metropolitan Museum, Columbus Circle Metro and more.Great service and restaurant is wonderful. I've never had a bad experience at this hotel.

title: Classy comfort and location!
text:
Class from the start - the minute our cab pulled up the bellman had our luggage out of the trunk and in line to check in.   
The common areas are spotless, well maintained and very tastefully decorated. 
The room is comfortable, pleasant lighting and clean top to bottom. 
The bathroom is well designed, and the shower has amazing pressure & soothes my sore muscles after a day of nyc sightseeing.  
The location is close near the entrance to Central Park, near the museums and great eateries.  I’ll be back!

title: great location poor rooms
text: the hotel´s location is great within walking distance to great museums, shopping and restaurants. The service was good but not great. For the price they charge the rooms are very very small. I would not recommend it unless you are willing to sacrifice size and amenities  for location.

title: Terrible experience
text: I was so excited to my trip and to my stay at the ESSEX however by the time I arrived I was given a room on the 7th floor and was told I was upgraded. I went to see the room and the room was SO small and smelt terrible like cooked and fried food. Off course because I looked out the window and it overlooked the roof or kitchen exhaust. I went to speak to the manager and he said the only room available is same location but 4th floor which had a worse smell and he simply attributed the smell to it not being serviced for a while. I requested to downgrade and see the room but he refused and said this is the only room he can offer me even as an elite member of Marriott. I just cancelled my reservation and went to the marquis in Times Square which was truly much better in room space and in customer service

title: Mr Samuels
text: Whisked my wife away for a romantic getaway for a birthday surprise so pulled out all the stops. Hotel was fantastic and the rooms were even better. Staff couldn’t have been more helpful if they’d tried. Food was impeccable so compliments to the chefs. I highly recommend staying here.

title: Great location but service is not good
text:
The location is why you choose to stay at JW Marriott Essex house. And if you are lucky your room has a nice view. Booking a Central Park View room does not mean you get the view you expect. It could also mean a part view.

We have stayed at the hotel several times and always complain about the lack of service and interest in guests from front desk. We read about this from many other guests too and are surprised this is not taken seriously. Having a nice location is not enough. High service and a warm welcome is to be expected without exceptions.

We had some trouble with our room and wanted to change to another and were promised a much better room the following day. We were told to leave our things packed so that they would be moved. This did not happen and we were given a much worse room with less view and not refurbished so we stayed in the original one. The front desk was indifferent.

Guest satisfaction should be top priority but we find we are always treated with indifference and often also rudeness. 

Would be nice to come back and find that this complaint that you read from so many guests is taken seriously and should never occur.

On the plus side - air conditioning worked fine and the new bathroom was nice.

title: Great Location - Super Comfy Beds
text:
Recently stayed at Essex House - the hotel is located right on the park and is super convenient to get around. Our room was very spacious (for NYC standards)  and was very quiet (we were at the end of the hall). Our room was very comfortable and the bed was absolutely amazing - probably one of the best night sleeps I've ever had at a hotel. Hotel staff were also very accommodating and allowed for a late check out. 

I agree with other people on here regarding the coffee, there is no coffee maker or fridge in the room (only a mini fridge that has no space to store any leftovers) For a hotel at this price, I definitely think they could put a Keurig in each room. The hotel restaurant Southgate did have coffee for free but this is only available before 11am and not all day. 

I wish there were more food/ cafe options available in the hotel itself (besides Southgate) - we ate breakfast at Southgate and were underwhelmed especially given the price. I mean, the food was still good, but not as generous with quantities (to give you an idea with prices, a coffee costs $9-10).  Also wait staff at the restaurant were not very attentive again given the level of service I'd expect. 

All in all, we were very happy with our stay and will definitely keep the JW Essex House top of mind whenever we are in NY next!

title: Cold Reception
text: Hubsters is Marriott Lifetime Platinum...yep, he travels a lot.  So I've decided to tag along on some business trips now. (Recovering from cancer, so new look on life and first venture out at 3 months after surgery). Front desk was extremely cold personality. Room was extremely small compared to other NYC hotels that I have stayed in for the last 25 years on my previous business trips. Very well appointed room. Loved close access to Sara Beth's, Whole Foods, and Central Park. We will stay again in September and hope for a more warm reception and a larger room.

title: Great location
text:
Pros-
Spacious rooms, especially for NYC standards. Great location for this hotel, right across the street from Central Park. When we first got there, we were given a low floor room that was very noisy with construction and jack hammering. We were able to move to another one that had a view of roofs. Do not expect a high level floor or view from this hotel as it is residences on the upper floors.
Good breakfast if you are an elite member, so definitely take advantage of that if possible.

Cons
-I have to join other reviewers that there is no coffee maker in room. This is really nice to have and feel like a hotel of this price and caliber should offer that.
-Also, no fridge in room is also a nice plus and feel like the mini bars should be replaced with a fridge.

title: Simplemente espectacular
text: El hotel es increíble y estás frente al Central Park, así que si te gusta correr es la mejor opción, te sientes como en una película, el servicio es muy personalizado, el Gym está muy bien equipado y las habitaciones son muy cómodas!

title: Central Park is Their Front Yard
text: This is a beautiful historic hotel, right across the street from Central Park.  The staff were fast and friendly, and my room was very nice and comfortable.  I got upgraded to a suite and the room was huge, and very nicely decorated.  It is on the expensive side.......but it is NY City and you won’t find cheap hotels with this kind of location or view.

title: Perfect location
text: The Essex House is beautiful and perfectly located across from Central Park (especially if you are visiting in the spring with Cherry blossom trees blooming across the street). My family and I spent the night in the double suite which was a good size (for NYC) with comfortable beds, no view but we assumed as much. The room had a nicely updated bathroom. The staff was wonderful in every interaction we had. From the front door on, everyone was pleasant and very helpful. If you are an elite member, take advantage of lounge access, the complimentary food and beverages are perfect for breakfast and a coffee to-go or after dinner dessert.

title: Not a great experience with my kids
text:
So, we decided on short notice to take our twin 5 year olds to Manhattan to see SpongeBob the musical.  I was happy to see that a suite was available and used my Marriott points (and some cash) to book a room at the JW on the park.  I have stayed at the Ritz and Four Seasons before but never at a JW.  I assumed they were on the same level.

I contacted the concierge ahead of time to have a small fridge place in our room since we would get in late after 9pm on Fri and wanted to have milk for the kids in the morning.  I also was intrigued by the Marriott ap and put in a request for more pillows and towels and a blanket.  

We got in later than expected after 10 and when we got to the room was very disappointed that the fridge was not there (also none of the other stuff).  When I called I was told that they only had one person doing this late at night and it would be a while.  Since the fridge had to go in the room where the kids were on the pull out couch, that meant my kids got to bed after 12....you can imagine how the next whole day went. I didn't have it in me to wait for the blankets, towels and pillows.

On Saturday I saw the maid outside my room when we left and put the make up room light on but when we got back it still wasn't done 3 hours or more later.  I had to call them to come do it...really?

When checking out on Sunday, after seeing the show (which was great), it took over an hour (64minutes) to get our car, so you guessed it, my kids got to bed after 930pm.
While we waited my wife walked into the lobby restaurant to order some takeout food for the road.  She was told they don't do that and would put it on a plate and she would have to get her own container (really?).  She walked out.  Since we had so much time she went to WholeFoods down the block!  

I was surprised that the $16 for ice cream from room service was them sending a whole pint of Hagen Daas up to the room with some bowls.  In an upscale hotel I'd think they would at least put it in a bowl!

The room was nice (smallish) but clean.  The bell boys, front desk and the manager who fielded my angry message were nice but at the end of the day anyone with a 5 year old (let alone 2) knows that once they don't sleep the next day is sort of blown.  Monday at school was fun too.

While they offered me enough points for one night honestly that doesn't make up for the whole weekend experience with cranky kids.  I may try a JW again, not sure...

title: Wonderful place to gather with friends
text:
We chose this hotel as the location for a weekend in NYC with friends from out of town.

The property is beautiful and beautifully restored in a manner that is true to its art deco past.  We were in a 1 bedroom suite, which was very spacious and richly appointed.  The shower had about the best water pressure I have experienced in my life.  I jokingly said to my husband that he might get blown away by the force of the shower.  When he got out of the shower he said "you weren't kidding".

The location is prime and convenient to the Central Park Zoo, Times Square, Broadway, etc.  A special shout out to Lenissa Firpo at the front desk for the incredibly warm greeting that she gave to our 9 year old son when we were checking in, and for the way in which she helped him when he decided to return an unopened minibar item to the front desk rather than have the cost deducted from his allowance.  We used it as a teachable moment, having him go to the front desk on his own (with us watching from afar), and she managed to make it go off without a hitch.

Only negative I can offer up is that we found the buffet breakfast at the Southgate Restaurant a little bit underwhelming.  ($38 for a buffet that does not offer omelets or made or order eggs is a bit steep - even by NYC standards.)

All in all a great stay.  We will be back next time we need a family weekend in NYC.

title: Essex in April 2018
text:
We came to NY for a family reunion.  My brother picked this hotel.  The room was pleasant, but a little small.  The housekeeping staff outstanding!!
My overall impression is if I am going to spend a lot of money for a hotel room- there could have been a few BASIC amenities.  For example- no coffee maker in the room, and while they say they have coffee available downstairs in the morning- we watched that pot drip so long we gave up and went to Starbucks.  No room in the fridge for our bottled water.
This hotel is in a good spot for Central Park access and excellent shopping.  But if I were to come back I would think twice about spending my hard earned money there.

title: Central Park is your front yard
text: Perfectly centered at the beginning of Central Park looking North provided you have a Central Park view room. Do NOT get excited when you see how tall the building is and think you might be lucky enough to get a room much past the 20 something floor. I do not know how high the public can go b/c the really nice rooms with a super view of the park and the height away from all the honking etc from CPS, are all residences. Most of your nicer hotels have their top floors sold as residences. The lobby is quite pretty and check in went smoothly. Once we arrived on the 20th floor and went into our room, supposedly with a view of the park through the scaffolding, we were thrilled with how large the room was but the view was definitely not what we had expected. We were moved the following day to a smaller room but the view was unobstructed. Perfect. Being a 5 star hotel- well sounds good. Beds/pillows and linens were super comfortable but disappointed in only 3 towels. Yes you can request more and did. One bathrobe/slippers and again you can request more and did. For a 5 star, I figured they would know how many guests were booked and would have robes to match the quantity. Yes they always mentioned our name at the desk or on the phone. Cleanliness - I have been to plenty of 4 star resorts that have been cleaner. I expect NOT to find a lick of dirt. THe carpet definitely could have stood a better vacuum job. Had to move the couch, something slipped behind it and found a lot of other things from other guests. Perhaps moving some of the furniture might be a good idea. Amazed for the age of the building that when the hotel was revamped, they did an excellent job. Wish parents of children taught their kids proper hotel etiquette when walking above another's room. Running/pounding of feet was unbelievable. Quality of sleep - if a sound sleeper you will be fine otherwise, we brought our white noise machines and they blocked the street noise very well. Never had room service (those prices were crazy $$$$). Breakfast - go to a corner vendor. For NYC their prices are great. We found one near Columbus circle heading down Broadway near Maison Kayser. Felt safe due to there is a 'guard' checking keys before entering the elevator area. Been to NYC many times and wanted to stay away from the hustle/bustle of Times Square. Much quieter relatively speaking, not as touristy, more residents, different vibe. Glad we did it but next time who knows where we will stay.

title: A beautiful view but it fails
text: The view of the park from the 14th floor was fantastic and it’s certainly less crowded than most of manhattan but this luxury hotel forgets about the number one goal of a luxury hotel, sssuring your guests have a great experience. Unfortunately this hotel does everything to assure this can’t happen. Yes it is expensive (5x the cost on a glass of wine and a $47 breakfast buffet). But there are no other options. Not even a coffee to go. The closest quick breakfast is a French sweet shop 3 blocks away. Not everyone wants to take the time for a sit down poorly serviced overpriced breakfast . The door men are pushy trying to insist they bring my carry on to my room. It made me want to tip them not to. I just don’t want to wait for my little bag. No refrigerator and no room service menu. To top it off they messed up our reservation which was a prepay, but fixed it at checkin only to try and charge me again at check out. Sterile with no support of the guests needs

title: Excellent location
text: We came here a couple weeks before I gave birth to our daughter! The rooms were comfortable and clean. Coffee in the room would have been a nice touch. The location really couldn't be better...it was perfect. The staff were very kind. We tend to love the JW Marriott locations, and this was no different :)

title: Great Location, Great Staff - No Coffee in the rooms
text:
Everybody has amenities that they look for when they travel; One of mine is coffee in the rooms.  Super 8 has coffee in the rooms.  They have coffee in the restaurant until 11:00am.  If you want afternoon coffee you need to get room service.  WTF
The location is great, the staff was great.

title: Great spot
text: I am a Marriott guy and normally stay in Marriott east side. Eastside has gotten really worn so I thought that I would try this property. Very nice and clean. My only disappointment is no coffee in the room.

title: A Great location for a special birthday!
text:
We spent last weekend at the JW Marriott Essex House in Manhattan to celebrate my husband’s 90th birthday. 

The hotel is what you would expect from a four-star hotel. The spacious lobby is welcoming and a great place to hang out, visit with friends, charge your phone, or just rest. The rooms are not large but are comfortable with excellent beds and amenities like an umbrella and slippers and robe. We didn't use the spa or the business center. The location is terrific and we had two spring-like days which made it even better. You can walk into the park (the hotel gives complimentary tickets to the zoo.) If you are able, the theaters and museums are all in walking distance. 

But what really impressed us was the staff. From the first moment of check-in when the front desk clerk didn’t just check us in but explained all the services of the hotel, offered to bring us a refrigerator for the room,  and made sure we  knew where everything was to the very last moment when Hannah on the front desk insisted on giving us an umbrella as we left in the pouring rain, everyone went above and beyond to make sure that we had a great time. 

We expect clean rooms and comfortable beds from a first-class hotel. What we don’t always expect is staff that takes an interest as these do – maids who asked us what time would be best to clean our room, a concierge who makes reservations but also helps us find the best bagels, the ones made fresh! When I couldn’t figure out how to get on the wi-fi, Hannah was there to help and insisted that it was no trouble! 

We had the party in the Southgate restaurant in the hotel. I started working with Ana Davio in January to plan it, and she was so helpful and responsive. All of the waitstaff – Wanda, Juliette, Sudhu, Paul – made us feel like family. 

It's a great hotel and made a special occasion just that much more special.

title: Wonderful stay in a lovely hotel
text:
I had some trepidation about staying at Essex House b/c of reviews here, but particularly on booking.com, which had quite mixed reviews.  However, I went ahead anyway (thankfully!).  As many have commented, the location is incredible - it was my partner's first time in NYC and she likes walking and bike riding, so being directly opposite Central Park was amazing.  We also had the nice side-benefit that it snowed for half a day one morning, so we experienced a white XMAS in Central Park in early April!

I wondered about the value for money, as it was $AUD800 / night, but it didn't seem overly expensive for that part of NYC, and compared to $AUD600 / night places I looked at it in that part of NYC, it probably is reasonable value (we did stay over the Easter weekend / start of school holidays).  I guess if you were picky you could say that for the money, the rooms could be a little more elegant (but it is picky!)
