The main positives were the beautiful historic lobby, well maintained rooms, nice restaurant / breakfast spot overlooking Central Park, and the very attentive staff - we stayed there for 5 nights, and dealt with 2 managers, as well as many staff, and we only had really positive and friendly interactions.  It wasn't like we didn't have hiccups - I didn't really like the first room we were in re outlook - it was one of the internal view rooms and it honestly really is a matter of preference whether you like it or not - it was very spacious for NY, but overlooked a back alley and the air con was (in my view, not my partner's) noisy.  Even though it was Easter weekend, the manager attentively allowed us to view a room with a street outlook (not CP outlook as much more pricey), which although smaller (more typical for NY), didn't have the noise or lack of privacy re other buildings (my partner probably preferred the original room though for its spaciousness) - the ease with which this move was handled was seamless and friendly.

I noticed reviews querying the state of the rooms - I was told that the rooms were refurbished earlier this year, and certainly, I was impressed with the condition of the 2 rooms we stayed in.

I know many have issues with the resort fee, but it was clearly stated that this fee would apply when I made the booking, so I was comfortable with that - a nice surprise was that it provided a $25 food credit per day, which is quite handy in terms of keeping high food prices more manageable when staying there (whether over breakfast or a late night drink) - it actually made the resort fee feel ok.  There does appear to be a bit of confusion re the terms of the food credit for some staff, so I should also add that this resort fee includes a $30 laundry voucher per day (this wasn't well explained when we arrived, so we didn't get full use out of this).  As an additional smaller bonus, there is complimentary water bottles and apples in the gym, which is a nice touch, given the long walks around central park etc.

Overall, we thoroughly enjoyed the experience - a special thanks to Louie, one of the doorman, who was always enjoyable to interact with.  A lovely hotel and well worth staying at.

title: Board meeting NY
text:
This is an excellent hotel.
I like the location just in front of Central Park.
The ambience is elegant, the food is great, room service always on time, nice decoration, every thing is perfect.
If you are in NY you have to consider staying at this JW.
The surrounding area is just the heart of NY with a lot of good restaurants at a walking distance.

title: New York
text: Что сказать? Супер отель. Десять из десяти. Расположен напротив Central Park. Очень красивые и удобные номера. Сервис супер. Очень хороший бар и кухня. Обслуживание на пять баллов. Один из лучших отелей в Нью Йорке.

title: Overall a good experience
text:
My family stayed 4 nights here.  Overall we were very satisfied with the stay but do have two occurrences that we are not happy with.  First the positives....the hotel is very clean and staff is friendly.  We are platinum members and enjoyed the lounge access.  The breakfast was had a nice variety of food and a lot of fresh fruit.  The staff was very attentive.  The location is great!  If you plan on spending time in central park, this is perfect.  There's also many good places to eat nearby.  

Our room was a nice size for New York.  The bathroom was very spacious.  My biggest complaint about the room, we booked a King size bed for a party of 3.  We assumed there's a pull out sofa or something that made this room for an accommodation of 3.  We get there and there is no such thing.  There is a small couch next the the bed. I called the front desk to ask about this and they told me maybe someone can sleep on that couch....it was small like less than four feet long.  They offered me a roll-away bed for $75 per night.  I didn't agree with the extra charges as I booked a room for 3.  I was then transferred twice before I got to someone who made it sound like they were doing me a great favor by waiving the charge.  Also, on the reservation it did say that roll-away beds are not permitted in this room type.  This was frustrating as I felt like the booking information was misleading and our room size so much tighter with the roll-away bed there. 

My second issue, on our last day there, we stepped out to get some breakfast in the lounge.  When we came back, we saw the housekeeping staff coming out of our room.  There was no reason for her to be in our room at that time.  We did not request anything, it was too early for clean up and we had not yet checked out.  It didn't looks like anything was moved.  Just left an uncomfortable feeling that someone was in our room.  I let the front desk staff know and they said they would look into it as it was strange.

title: Destination Fee
text: My wife and I stayed at the Essex house for 4 days last week. We had a suite called a family suite. When we checked out, I noticed that there was an item on the bill called a destination fee for $25 each night plus the various New York City taxes. When I asked the clerk about it she said it was something new and that it covered a various number of things that I had little or no interest in other than a $25 credit for food if you ate in the hotel. This is a rip off. A fine hotel like the Essex house should not engage in this deception.

title: Can’t ask for a better midtown location
text:
My husband had to work, so the kids (15 and 12) and I came into the City for a night to see Mean Girls. We stayed here because we had Marriott rewards points. We’ll definitely return. 

The location, directly across from Central Park, cannot be beat if you choose to stay in midtown. You can walk to literally hundreds of shops and restaurants. Try the Plaza Food Hall down the street for a quick bite. It’s worth it! Fifth Ave is a minute walk. Columbus Circle a minute walk in the opposite direction. It’s a 10-minute walk to Times Square/Broadway. There are multiple subway stations nearby. If you’ve never been to NYC and you want to be smack-dab in the middle of it all, stay here. If you’re driving in, use the SpotHero app to park. I parked in an Icon garage a block down and across from Carnegie Hall. $65 to park from 9 a.m. one day until 3 p.m. the next day.

Aside from the prime location, the hotel is beautiful. It’s what one would expect a fine, historic NY hotel to look like. I disagree with other reviewers that say it’s showing its age. Our room, 1735, was spacious, comfortable, and spectacularly clean. My kids loved that they could watch tv from our Netflix and Hulu accounts. The beds, doubles, were small but comfortable, with plenty of pillows. We had zero view (see picture), which we expected with a reward room. The plus side- no traffic noise. We didn’t hear neighbors above or to the sides so we slept soundly. 

The bathroom was large and very clean. The towels were nice quality. The bath products were ok. My only remark: there was zero air circulation, no matter how I adjusted the thermostat. Luckily it was cool out, so I cracked the windows for fresh air. 

If you’re staying for several days, there’s little drawer space. The fridge has sensors so you can’t store your own drinks. No coffee maker. There are plenty of outlets to charge. There’s a pretty little clock on the nightstand. Put it in the closet if you’re a light sleeper, as it ticks loudly in a quiet room. The hall area of the room begs for a table under which you can store your luggage; that space is not maximized. 

The closet has an iron/board, slippers, and two umbrellas for your use. 

Everyone from the front desk staff to the bellman were professional and personable. We’d return and recommend.

title: Wish I could live there!
text:
What can I tell you about Essex House...well, I wish I could afford to stay there every time I visit NYC.  
The rooms are specious, with beautiful remodeled large bathrooms, great and prompt attention from the staff.  We Never had the chance to stay in a park view room, but the other rooms were just as fine.  Yes, the hotel charges for room WIFI but,  sitting in the lobby to read your emails and search the web is like sitting front row at a concert. Great people watching.  And what about location, the BEST!

title: Very Pleasant Stay!
text:
I enjoyed my family's 3-night stay at the JW Marriott Essex House. 

We were greeted by friendly staff who immediately handled our baggage for us. The lobby is lovely, and feels sophisticated, just how you want a New York City hotel to feel. 

At check in, we discovered our rooms were not ready, but they more than made up for it by apologizing and escorting us to the restaurant and giving us vouchers for free food and drinks. The restaurant was comfortable, and the appetizers and drinks were much appreciated after a long day of traveling. 

My family got two rooms, one for my husband and I and one for our boys. They didn't adjoin, but were both behind their own, locked door. I adored this setup, because it allowed for us to have what felt like our own, private apartment. Perfect for a family!

The rooms were modern and comfortable, the beds especially so. There was no view to speak of, other than a brick wall, but that was okay. 

Our favorite amenity was Netflix on the television, which was fun for late-night viewing after a day on spent on the town. 

Every staff member we met was helpful and friendly. 

Overall, I'd recommend this hotel without hesitation.

title: Beautiful Hotel and Great Access to Central Park
text: My wife and I had a great stay at this hotel. Our room was spacious with a King Bed. We didn't have a view (looked into an inner courtyard) but loved everything else about the hotel. The hotel celebrates its history in NY especially next to Central Park including a great guided tour via a mobile app and a paper guide that was really fun. The concierge team was excellent and connected us with recommended churches and great restaurants even when I couldn't get a reservation on Open Table. I would highly recommend getting a room with club access. Marriott premier members get access for free. This lounge went above and beyond for breakfast with a full hot and cold breakfast served every day and even offered a nice bar with bites at night. Overall kudos to the staff for being friendly throughout the hotel. You won't be disappointed staying here

title: Luxurious Stay
text: My husband and I stayed here overnight while hanging out with friends in the city.  The hotel lobby is very luxurious and grand.  The room was a nice size with a marble bathroom.  We had lunch at the hotel bar and restaurant facing Central Park.  The food was excellent.  I had lobster tacos and my husband had an excellent burger.  The drinks were good as well as the service.

title: Comfortable stay
text: The hotel stands out for its location as it's in the hub and just walking distance from Times Square. The rooms were comfortable and the bathroom was nice. Although they didn't provide complimentary water and getting water for $11 seemed weird. But it's fine it's New York. The breakfast was good though the options in buffet style was less. The staff was courteous and helpful. Overall it was a pleasant stay.

title: Great hotel
text:
We stayed for 8 days  
The location is great the staff is very friendly.the breakfast is excellent.
The rooms are nice.
We came very late in the evening the staff were very kindly,the room was prepared. We had some fruit in the room chocolate mineral water.
The best in New York

title: Comfortable
text:
Well located for the Metropolitan Opera and mid town CBD the Essex House is slightly showing its age. But very helpful and courteous staff made our 5 night stay a pleasure. 
Charging $10 for a kettle to make tea seems like a liberty but then again no complimentary water.
This is NYC after all
Great concierges

title: Pet friendly a plua
text: Took our 2 dogs along for a family nyc trip.  Front desk friendly, nothing spectacular to note, but no issues either.  Great to be across the street from Central Park for the dogs.  A bit far from things to do but taxis are everywhere as well as uber/Lyft.

title: Great hotel at great location
text: Stayed here for the NYC Half Marathon in March 2018. Great location overlooking Central park and short distance from the half marathon finish line which was a bonus. Hotel staff is very friendly. Being a Marriott Platinum member, me and my wife had access to the lounge for free breakfast. The rooms have been recently renovated and look very nice.  Used SpotHero app and got a $25 weekend parking pass at a parking garage on 56th st between 5th and 6th ave, despite the streets being closed for St. Patrick's day parade, NYPD was very helpful in letting me thru with the car to get to the parking garage. I will definitely stay here again

title: disappointing
text:
Let me separate the review section into two sections:

1) we were treated to a wonderful upgrade, as Marriott Platinum member, associated also with our personal celebration. A room with a view over Central Park, a bottle of prosecco with some treats , was absolutely wonderful and priceless - yet not sustainable for the business I am afraid.

2) customer service / property condition comments:
- absolute lack of attention to detail (see enclosed pictures - dirty air filter, broken floor molding in the bathroom etc.)
- there were two of us staying - despite asking (twice), there was only one bathrobe, cosmetics for one etc.
- lounge: no 24/7 access to the lounge ! - totally outrageous - access only for breakfast, which was by far worse compared to some much lower end Marriott chain hotel (Courtyard , Fairfield etc.) - no real espresso machine, paper vs glass/china cups, choices so limited that almost embarrassing, awful quality of eggs, stale bagels (in NY which is famous of its bagels (sic!) - etc. etc.
- clocks in the room were not changed to reflect summer time
- I asked for hard boiled eggs (called from the room before descending to the lounge) and was told that 'we have what we have' - and I got hung up on (called on March 31st, 7/8am?, 'Concierge' button, person George? Georgine? picked up). Ironically enough, they had hard boiled eggs in their selection. To clarify - I didn't ask for quail or ostrich eggs - just normal hen eggs 
- they charge $25 per day so called 'destination fee' - total outrage, only upon my questioning of the validity of the charge, they removed it from the bill.

Finally, a week ago I happened to visit a Sacher Hotel in Vienna - if anyone from this NYC flagship JW Marriott wants to learn what luxury, attention to detail, supreme customer service etc. looks like - learn from the best, go to Vienna, and implement in NY.

For now, I am done with this property, not the right return for the money.

title: Great stay for a birthday weekend
text:
Last time when I stayed at the Essex House, about a year ago or so, I stayed in one of the older rooms so it was great to experience their newly renovated rooms this time around. A world of difference!
Beautiful. luxurious and modern update to the product with white, black and grey tones on the guest room. Very chic! Room was very comfortable with a great walk-in closet, huge bathroom and super comfortable bed. 
I love staying here because this hotel has some of the best views in the city ( in my opinion ) 
This was my birthday weekend and the front desk agent recognized the occasion. 
Room service for breakfast was fast and delivery person was very pleasant and made small talk while I signed the check.
Overall, another great stay at the Essex House!

title: Location
text:
Stayed at this hotel during a family visit to New York City.Great location on Central Park south.  Staff very pleasant but not knowledgeable about the rooms at Check In (pull out bed? For a room for 3 was not included..... lots of discussions, nothing they could do, but when we eventually got top the room, it had a pull out)

Restaurant/bar was pretty terrible from the service to the food to the prices.
Executive lounge is the one of the worst i have seen and only open for breakfast from Friday to Monday...

title: Fabulous location!
text: We have not stayed here since the renovations have been done and wow! Fantastic job!  The hotel has a great location across from Central Park with many opportunities to explore. The executive lounge has a wide variety of options so that was also a plus. Will definitely stay again.

title: Best Concierge
text: Ok, the hotel was nice.  Very much in line with what you would expect from a JW Marriott.  But Kevin is the reason that I'm writing this review.  He did an outstanding job of making us feel welcomed, securing our reservations, making suggestions, & just being friendly.  Clearly went above & beyond and stood out from the other employees.  Thanks to him, we'll be back soon.  Thanks Kevin!!

title: Can't beat the location
text:
We stayed here 6 nights and enjoyed ourselves.  We found all of the staff to be friendly and engaging, and did not have any issues with our stay.

We were staying the first few days for a small meeting taking place at the hotel, and added a few nights on to see the city.  As we were staying for a week, a larger room would have been nice, as our room lacked storage for our belongings for close to a week.  

Of course, higher floor rooms overlooking the park are highly sought-after, and we were put on the 6th floor- where you can still hear all of the street noise on 59th- which is a busy street, even in the overnight hours.  Try getting a higher floor if possible- as the street noise can be bothersome if you're a light sleeper.

Overall, a very nice hotel. Expensive at $400+ a night, but it's NYC- in a city that runs 85% occupancy.

title: Best Location
text:
I love the JW Essex House! It is in the best location. I visit NYC at least once a month for food, shopping, visiting friends. The staffs were amazing . The most notable were Melvin and Cesar. Melvin was tremendously gracious ! He was very attentive and extremely helpful with all of my requests and needs. I am a Marriott Platinum Status so he upgraded me to a very nice room. My room was recently renovated and it was beautiful. The decoration was contemporary. They left a thank you card upon arrival with these wonderful truffles and 2 bottles is Voss water . 
The hotel was within walking distance to the Plaza Food Hall . It was across of Central Park . All the doormen knew me and recognized me every time
I arrived at the hotel . The breakfasts were very consistent and offered a large different varieties of food. My last visit, I used the gym which was on the third floor. It was a decent size gym with adequate equipments .
The housekeeping service was outstanding.

title: Classic New York Elegance
text: We have stayed here several times and it is always clean, comfortable with excellent service. The rooms and bathroom are large for NY. The location right at the park is prefect. The lobby is beautiful with fantastic floral arrangements. The concierge lounge is an added bonus for a delicious extensive breakfast buffet along with cocktails and snacks at night. My first choice for a hotel in New York always.

title: Great visit to NYC
text: Room was spacious and newly renovated. Bathroom and bed linens were great. We had manhattan suite which was perfect for us and our 2 kids. The hotel / room service was fast. Great location on park and can also exit in back of hotel on 58th street. Would definitely stay here again.

title: The view...
text: I am a Marriott Platinum member, and I stay every week in a Marriott. I decided to check out the Essex House for a weekend in the city. It was expensive, as everything here, but I got a room with this view... I wish I spent half of what I did and stayed somewhere more centric.  I felt like they did not appreciate my rewards level. Next time: The Plaza.

title: Wonderful Hotel, Wonderful Staff, Wonderful Location!
text: Just returned from a weekend trip with family and can't say enough good things about this hotel.  The staff was super helpful with getting us transportation, and it was quiet and elegant.  We will definitely return.

title: Grand old lady of a hotel and with luck, a view of the park
text: I stayed one night for a business meeting and was pleasantly surprised.  A grand lobby off the park, and very welcoming reception, with staff that guided me to the elevator.  The room was small — typical of Manhattan — but clean and light-filled (I scored a room with a view of the park!). The wifi was excellent and the bed comfortable.  Nice big TV with good options.  Strong water pressure in European style shower.  Outlets where you need them — except none easy to access beside.

title: Magnifique mais vieillissant et trop cher
text:
Très bel hôtel historique, excellemment situé.
Accueil juste OK et artificiel.
Grandes chambres assez douillettes. Isolation phonique insuffisante particulièrement pour les bruits de la rue.
Du charme mais qui vieillit.
Dans ce contexte, même pour New-York, prix déraisonnables.

title: AMAZING experience, great location, helpful staff and wonderful hotel.
text: We took a family trip (2 kids, 2 adults) and LOVED this hotel.  It has a perfect location, the friendlies staff and overall had a great experience.  The front desk staff helped us extend our stay and even gave us Executive Lounge access, which was awesome.  The concierge were so helpful with all information and ready to make reservations at a moments notice.  I highly recommend.

title: Beautiful hotel
text: Great location right across central park.  Great security on New Year Eve. Good selection of fruits for the lounge.  Access to water, tea and coffee are great.  Staffs are nice. Rooms are updated, loves the new lighting.  Very large room for New York.

title: Beautiful hotel- amazing location!!
text: If you need a place to stay in Midtown Manhattan and want to be near Central Park- this is the hotel for you! Service overall is excellent! They allowed me to leave my vehicle out in front for a long period of time- the valet guys and bellhops were amazing!  Our room was very comfortable- great bathroom, tub and shower- and very comfortable bed!! We had a slight view of the park, but it really didn't matter.  The restaurant here serves a nice breakfast with many options although no omelet station.  Most of the people working at the Essex House are nice and helpful and made our stay more memorable.  Besides being across the street from the park, there are numerous places to eat within a 5-10 minute walk; and less than 5 minutes to 59th street subway station!

title: Great Room on Central Park South
text: This hotel was excellent. It is on Central park South.  Took the family for a weekend NYC adventure.  We went to Broadway, on a carriage ride to Dylan's candy bar, central park, just a great weekend.  Being a Marriot rewards member we had an excellent breakfast. The room was pretty big compared to other rooms I have had in Manhattan.  We had a fridge brought to the room for my son's milk and yogurt.  Very nice.

title: Prime Location
text: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Essex House. Upon arrival we received early check-in, and immediately went out to explore the city. The hotel is a few blocks from time square, across the street from Central Park, and located perfectly for the best restaurants on the Upper East Side. Highly recommend staying here.

title: 3 STARS, A GIFT !
text:
There are many nice hotels on Central Park South in NYC....do yourself a favor and go to one of the others.....they are nicer, have better services, and are pretty much the same price.
I've been to a lot of hotels in my life....this is one of the few hotels where they really believe that the guest comes in second.   I drove up with my family and planned on unloading the car, and having the car valet parked for me.  As I was getting out of the car, a man pulled up, identified himself as working in the catering department and told me to move my car as he had to park there as he was running late.  I informed him that I was a guest and was checking in, but he could of cared less and started to scream at me.   The doorman came over and hinted that if I gave him a tip that he would watch the car for me, but if I didn't he wouldn't be responsible.  I couldn't belive what I was hearing.   The employee became very loud and told me that he was going to call security....which he did....a man who identified himself as a security person, but refused to tell me his name and he quite quickly took his name badge off told me to move my car.  He told me that "we work differently here at the Essex House and if I didn't like it, perhaps I should go elsewhere.
I stayed one night and did just that !
Oh, the rooms are nice......

title: Attentive staff and gorgeous property
text: I reached out to the hotel via email prior to my stay to let them know that I was bringing my wife in for a wedding anniversary. From check in to check out, the staff was congratulatory, kind, and attentive. The room was beautiful, well maintained, and comfortable. We were also put in a room with a gorgeous view of Central Park with a very sweet anniversary card from the staff. Jasmine from Guest relations is a rock star in helping me set up my trip. The concierge assisted me with theater tickets, and made all of my plans a breeze. I can't say enough about our stay, the hotel really was the highlight of our trip.

title: Great views. Beautiful Hotel.
text:
Overlooking Central Park from the South, next to Columbus Circle.
Essex House is still one of the most beautiful hotels I've ever stayed in - and the views are incredible. Many of the rooms are small and pokey and the rooms are usually pretty expensive.

title: Central Park view
text: I’ve stayed at the Essex House before and enjoyed my stay each time. My only complaints are no exhaust fan in the bathrooms and no in room coffee maker. The bed was super comfortable and decor was beautiful Art Deco (newly renovated rooms). Right across the street from  Central Park and they also have a spa, gym and concierge. I used my AAA discount for a better rate and it was a good value.

title: Tremendous Hotel, Room, Location & Service
text:
This is an iconic hotel that just keeps getting better with time.
The rooms are luxurious. Every little detail is great.
The staff offer wonderful service. They smile and offer help at every opportunity.
The location is unbeatable.
Room sizes are generous compared to other luxury hotels in NYC
We wil be back

title: Christmas in Manhattan
text: This was a complete treat for me as a frequent traveler and guest at high end hotels as well as my spouse who rarely gets to travel.  Location Location Location is what it’s all about in the city, but it doesn’t stop there.  The service is hands down too notch and everything from the food, cocktails, guests... you name it, they’ve nailed it on perfection.  Worth the price and I’ll be back again and again.  Well done.

title: Great location
text: Love this location. I e stayed here before so it’s a rerun trip.  Had a good stay.  They missed one turn down service and twice my room service was cold.  Other then that they would of got a 5 star rating

title: Stay at Essex House with Kids
text: We stayed for one week at Essex House with 4 kids over President's Day.  We are Marriott Gold Rewards Members.  Location of the hotel is excellent.  We had a two-room Family Suite and a single King Room.  We requested connecting rooms but unfortunately did not get it. Nor did we get a room with a view. Overall the staff were friendly and helpful.  The rooms were not the cleanest and the bathroom was only half renovated.  The tub and tile were old, worn, and dated.  The breakfast in the Executive Lounge was excellent (included for Gold and Platinum members).  They had scrambled eggs, bacon, potatoes, pancakes, sausage, toast & bagles, yogurt, pastries, fruit, tea & coffee, juice.  In the evening they offered a couple of hot foods items, cheese and crackers, and dessert.

title: A FANTASTIC STAY at the ESSEX HOUSE
text:
I travel extensively as a biotech executive and rarely have time nor the inspiration to write reviews. I am making an exception here for my stay at the Essex House, where I booked the Central Park Deluxe Suite for a family vacation in NYC. 
I am accustomed to luxury travel for work, but I was especially concerned with this family vacation--it is completely different when your wife and children are with you, and you so much want the very best treatment for your family! The staff at the Essex House delivered in so many ways. 
First, the manager and people. Sarah Nesbit oversaw our much of out stay and took great pains to make our checkin seamless and added personal touches to make our stay enjoyable. She was incredibly welcoming to not only me, but especially my wife and children. She would greet us by name whenever she saw us. The children loved her! Additionally, guest relations were amazing. They knew the best way for parents to be happy was for the children to be happy. They were so pleasant and patient with the kids. Anna, Jasmin, Megan and Jenny would provide so many warm and hospitable touches--greeting the children as well as us, deliver surprise gifts for the kids (hot cocoa and balloons), free tickets to Wollman Ice Rink in Central Park, etc. Concierge services were also fantastic--great restaurant recommendations and reservations. Also housekeeping, who were uniformly polite, kind, and did a wonderful job.
Second, the room and executive lounge. The suite was clean, luxurious and had a stunning view of Central Park. The Executive lounge had great variety for breakfast, was especially convenient--great layout for adults and kids alike! 
Third, location. Can't be beat. Perfect. Right on top of Central Park south.

In sum, our stay at the Essex House was fantastic, but what really distinguished the experience was the hotel staff, whose warmth and attention to detail made the experience really special.

title: Nieces 16th Bday
text:
The lobby is beautiful! The staff  and rooms not so much! 
I was in room 1417. Do not take this room. The bathroom door literally hit the toilet seat. 
My head was hit many times! I asked to be moved. They told in the morning to come down and they would move me while we were gone for the day and pick up a new key when I came back. I came 7 hours later to learn, they did not move my luggage nor me. 
They could not tell me why. I called the front desk at 8 pm, the first night, and NEVER did I EVER get a person! I needed a new TV remote and I need the Shades that did not   work to work for privacy! Room service never came in and retrieved my breakfast tray , even when I called and asked.

title: Going above and beyond
text: My daughter and I were thrilled to visit NYC for a special weekend celebration. From the moment we arrived, Georgia greeted us warmly and proceeded to take great care of us. She helped us find a room with a view of the city so my daughter could see the snow fall. The room was lovely, newly decorated and very clean. It appeared as if the 10th floor had been recently renovated. We had several questions and inquiries from concierge and Cameron and Howard were absolute pros. From recommending us great dining to helping print out our boarding passes. They were friendly and knowledgable. During our stay, we dined twice at Southgate Bar & Restaurant and the food was very good. On our last day, we had breakfast there and our server gave us two bananas to have as snacks during our trip back home. We will come back to this special place again and again!

title: The Bed & the View were the only positives.
text: It pains me to leave this review, but I wouldn't revisit this hotel. Decided to do a quiet staycation in the city over Presidents Day weekend. Quiet is what I did not receive. Despite the gorgeous view of South Central Park and a very comfortable bed, the electricity in my hotel room kept flickering and became quite annoying. Lights would consistently go on and off. I had friends visiting and we decided to leave the room, unsure if it was the old wiring or if it was haunted at this point. the internet connection did not work, so Netflix on their TV wasnt available either. The service in the bar downstairs was great, though. I was impressed. Cue to 5:45am when we are waken to a full, CLEAR, conversation of two men in the adjacent hotel room next door. I mean, to describe the walls as paper thin wouldnt be doing it justice. Cue to a few hours later at 8am, housekeeping knocks on my door. Couldnt fall back asleep. On top of all this, my friend noticed my duvet wasnt clean when we discovered a "male hair" on top of it the night before. Disappointing for what I had hoped for!!!

title: Very nice stay over superbowl weekend
text: We have stayed at the Essex House in the past and although not for the past several years due to the price of accommodations, the rates were more at our price point recently.  The staff are very friendly (Mohamed at the front desk is really nice and professional) and the rooms have been renovated.  My wife and I loved our 3 night stay as there are great restaurants nearby as well as shopping.

title: Recommend You Book Elsewhere
text:
We had difficulty at checkin as Platinum members- both my wife and I are Platinum. They tried to provide one card for access to the Executive Lounge and since we were on different schedules that was unworkable. Additionally we had two maintenance issues in the bathroom and after reporting there was zero followup and the issues were unresolved for the stay.  The kick plate below the sink was laying on the floor and an open panel near the toilet that was extremely filthy inside.
Given the price the hotel is not competitive.

title: Beautiful!
text:
Comfortable bed; clean hotel; great view of the Park; restaurant/bar downstairs had great drinks and okay food.  

Con: I've never been one to immediately put a do not disturb sign on the door, but if I stay here again, I would do that.  Over the course of twenty minutes our door got knocked on three times by house keeping - twice offering chocolates and water, a third time asking if we needed anything.

title: Classic Old School
text: Great Hotel but rooms are small and thankful we received an upgrade.  The buffet breakfast included wasn't any better than the one at a Marriott Towne Suites a budget hotel.  Overall a bit of a disappointment!

title: Classic  comfort
text: Cannot beat the location.  Beautiful architecture and interior design in the common spaces. Great bar.  Rooms are large with very comfy beds, and appointments. Only drawback is the bathrooms are small and the showers don’t have good water pressure.

title: Gougers
text: It's a lovely hotel especially as our room looked out over Central Park. The only thing that spoiled it for us was the attitude of the door staff /porters, who even by New York standards, were unhelpful and downright rude. They wouldn't even open the front door for you without a tip. That's why it only gets three stars.

title: I love this property.  But i love all the properties across from the park
text:
The JW is regal.  It feels majestic.  The staff is friendly and helpful.  The elevators are fast.  The rooms have a good design, unique, and comfortable.  The concierge lounge is on the first floor, at first it seems odd, but then you find out you share the buffet breakfast from the restaurant and they have to pay and you do NOT.  Whoo Hoo!!  it was delicious.

The other great thing is you can exit on both sides of the building.  This is handy if going to New York City Center for a show, or getting a head start on walking somewhere.

All in all, a great place and we will go back!!

title: Зашибись!
text: Спокойный ньюйоркский отель. Номер маленький и не очень дорогой для данного района и вида на Центральный парк. Зимой прохладно в номере. Санузел на 4+. Чистенько. Персонал - типичный для Нью Йорка - любезный, но с постоянным намеком на панибратство. Если это раздражает - в США можно не ездить в принципе. Других тут не водится.

title: I love this hotel!
text: In fact, I'm staying here again tomorrow night!  I've stayed at this property three times, most recently on my birthday in October, and every visit has exceeded my expectations - from the friendly reception staff, to the gorgeous rooms, to just a pervasive feeling of warmth that permeates the property. And the location is unbeatable.

title: Amazing hotel
text:
We stayed in this hotel in January 2018, and we had a fantastic visit. We travelled as a group of 4 and had adjoining rooms on the 12th floor. The rooms were bigger than expected, very clean, and just all round lovely. The beds were super comfortable too. The rooms having netflix on the TV was a added bonus that we used as even though most of the time we were out and about seeing the sites of New York, when we were getting ready, going to sleep or woke up before others due to jet lag this was a great facility!

The hotel is in a great location opposite Central Park. We wish we had time to eat at the hotel too as that looked great but had already booked and planned other places in our short visit to New York.

Cameron at the concierge desk was a great help - he was super friendly and helped us plan routes/subways with ease. Great local knowledge and just a lovely person! 

I couldn't actually fault any of the staff here, they were all very helpful and really friendly. I would 100% stay here again in future, I don't think I would actually ever consider staying anywhere else in the City, and I would highly recommend to others.

Thanks for the perfect stay!

title: Better.....impossible
text:
It was a great stay,  the hotel is very well located in front of the Central Park and a walking distance to many NY attractions and good restaurants. 
Our room (a suite) was outstanding, bright, recently renew and cozy. With everything that you may need, feather pillows, safe box, etc. We really enjoy our wedding anniversary celebration. 
The only down point is the frigobar, is the one that if you take something, you will be charged immediately. In other word, if you buy something outside, you won’t be able to put it in the frigobar. This type of system belong to the last century hotels and is not appropriate to hotel of this category, please rectify this mistake.

title: Great Location
text:
Our recent stay in New York brought us to the Essex House on Central Park South. An excellent location for either Eastside or West.

Our Junior Suite was very spacious, clean and attractively decorated. A rather small bathroom was drawback. 

The Essex House is an older property but has been constantly renovated and refurbished.

Like many JW Marriott's it does have an executive club with full services provided. 

A very pleasant housekeeping staff.

A fabulous bed, I slept like a baby (bet you haven't heard that before, Ha!).

title: Great Once You Are There
text:
New York is wonderful, once you are inside.  This hotel has a great location, right on the park.  Driving in and out was no fun though (we needed a car for the weekend), especially around the hotel.

Other than that, we had a great stay.  We had two rooms, connected by a private antechamber, which we could lock separately - a unique setup.  Bedrooms were sizable and bathrooms were fine.  It was clear that the hotel had some sort of upgrade at some point.

While we did not eat breakfast at the hotel, we did enjoy a dinner there, which surprised us.  We had a number of small plates to share, and each was excellent.  I have already recommended it to others.

Back to location, we easily walked to Rockefeller Center, Times Square, Lincoln Center, etc.  No need to drive from here.

We will stay here again on future trips to Manhattan.  Next time, we'll take a cab in and out.

title: Work in progress...
text:
The hotel is ideally located and the overall look and feel of the hotel and rooms is very good.  There are, however, a number of areas where improvements are needed if you want to attract business customers.  First and most importantly the WiFi is very poor which means working in your room is a very painful and frustrating experience. Second, the concierge service is never there so when you need a taxi you can be waiting 10-15 minutes trying to hail a cab yourself. Third the attitude of the staff is very mixed at best.  The staff who check you in are full of attitude and the staff milling about the main foyer are more interested in speaking to each other than looking to help customers. Finally, the room service menu is very limited. 

Overall as a hotel to be based in for more than a couple of days on business it leaves a lot to be desired - very doubtful I will return anytime soon.

title: Stay Away
text: I  have stayed at the Essex House for years and love the hotel and location and have recommended to friends and family over the years. Unfortunately will no longer be doing so after my latest experience when an issue with a disfunctioning bath and shower  was dealt with very poorly by the reception manager. I had to repeatedly go down to reception to get a room change which took over 4 hours.  This is not acceptable  for a room charge over $500  and can only conclude that  the current management  courtesy of Marriott is incompetent. SO I will not be returning and will avoid Marriott properties in future.

title: Beautiful hotel
text:
a piece of New York City history.. In the lobby you can see artwork/historical photos about New York, the hotel, and the park.. this is a beautiful property in a wonderful location... walking distance to Central Park, the MoMA, shopping, and other attractions.
Very comfortable room and beds and clean.. 
Be aware that this is a pet-friendly property.. so if you suffer from allergies, you might want to inquire about an animal free room when you book. 
No coffee maker in the room.. which we found odd since even Marriott courtyards have coffee makers in the rooms. But that's the only negative really.. Highly recommend.

title: good visit
text:
rooms:3/5 
location:5/5
bathroom:2/3
lobby:2/3
pool and gym:1/3
service:3/3
exterior design:2/2
extra:5/16 (large hotel, skyscraper, view, multiple dining, spa)
total:28/40-price:1200-3300/rooms:515/stars:5
my rating (experience): Good

title: Historic property with contemporary touches and terrific staff
text: Conveniently located on Central Park South, the Essex House is an awesome property and the staff was terrific, especially Jasmin Chen! Rooms are totally refreshed, clean and comfy and while we did not have much of a view, it was extremely quiet. City hotel rooms are never spacious but we were quite happy with the king size, standard room, and it worked well for us.

title: Pleasure,    Christmas time 12-11-17-12-15-17
text:
Lovely room, every amenity, even umbrellas,  robe,, slipper, towels are luxurious ,  entire  staff were over the top in every respect.  Rooms were immaculate and beautifully appointed.  Cannot wait to return.

Short taxi ride to dept stores,  if it was in June, it would be a healthy stroll.

title: False advertising on their room size
text: We booked the park view king for our anniversary. We when arrived it was noticely small than the pictures online. When I asked how many square feet it was I was told they range from 300-350.  I told them that it was advertised as 350 SQ. They offered to switch my room to a non park view. I refused because I specifically chose this Hotel because of the view.

title: Room with a view
text: We stayed here for two nights recently. Our first night we were given a room with a view of scaffolding after upgrading to a Central Park View. We checked in around 5 so all the good rooms were gone I suppose. We stuck it out for the night, they removed the upgrade charge and the following night they moved us to an amazing room with a beautiful view. The rooms are nicely decorated and good size. The beds were some of the most comfortable we’ve slept in. Oh, and the view ❤️❤️❤️  all staff members we encountered were very pleasant and helpful. While the rooms are all updated the lobby and elevators all still have their historic charm. Great location.

title: A Classy and Comfortable Hotel in a Great location $$$+
text:
Retro-brick and old-ish looking from the outside, the JW Marriott Essex house, from the inside is comfortable and classy.  Details to follow...

In Manhattan for 4 nights, the JWMEH is situated on the south edge of Central Park, normally a comfortable walk to the Met, the American Natural History Museum and Times Square.  From the lobby to the hallways to the rooms, the decor featured polished marble, gleaming fixtures and a sense of art-deco comfort. 

Our bedroom with twin beds was comfortable, though not large.  The lighting was good, the TV updated and modern with adequate outlets and a couple of USB ports.  The bathroom was large, recently renovated, shiny and equipped with large, thick towels.

Room service was spot-on.

The gym was surprisingly large with several cycles, treadmills, steppers and a number of TechnoGym pieces of equipment.

All-in-all, the JWMEH was a great place to say by way of location, comfort and amenities.  If it is within your budget, you should check it out.

title: Exceptional Service and Location!
text: We stayed here for 5 days and did not want to leave. The location was perfect, not too far from all the attractions we wanted to see, but still felt removed and quiet, close to a few subway stations, amazing views of Central Park, lots of restaurants in walking distance. The lobby, hallways, common areas are beautiful. Plenty of employees around and happy to help or answer any questions. Anything we asked for was delivered to the room in minutes. When we called with questions the concierge was knowledgeable and friendly. The elite Marriott member breakfast was fresh and delicious. The room was exceptionally clean, stylish, warm and the bed was so comfortable we didn’t want to get up in the morning. Truly one of the best hotel experiences I’ve had. Would definitely stay again and recommend to friends and family.

title: Great Location, Nice Hotel
text: Overall a great value for NYC.  Great location across from Central Park, easy walk to Columbus Circle, Times Square and 5th Ave.  The rooms are good size and modern, what you would expect from a J.W. Marriott.  I stayed here many, many years ago, long before it was a Marriott when the rooms still had some art deco flair.  That is gone now, I felt it was a generic business hotel room now.  I'm not complaining, a good size room for NYC, clean and well appointed.  The elevators and lobby still have that old flair.  We had access to the executive lounge which was OK.  The hotel was very busy so you sometimes had to wait for a table.  Nice breakfast, the afternoon snacks were not appealing to me at all.  The lounge did seem to have a decent bar with wine and liquor, I didn't get anything.  The lounge is what you would expect for a Marriott, it's not the Ritz Carlton or Peninsula.  By the way, I would stay here over the Ritz, the rooms are bigger and its a better value.  I found the staff, front desk, concierge and bell man friendly and helpful. I hope to return soon.

title: Good location but expensive!
text: I was there last December on a business trip. The hotel is located opposite Central Park and is just a great location! Rooms were very clean, decently big and the staff was also very cordial. Breakfast is charged separately and was quite expensive ($45).

title: A great experience at the Essex House
text:
I have traveled to NYC many times, however, each time, I have stayed at a different hotel, mostly because none of the establishments, where I had previously stayed, made a memorable impression. The rates in NYC are typically higher than in most metropolitan areas, yet, the accommodations are not always on par, in my opinion. 

Traveling to NYC to partake in New Year’s celebrations, I searched for a hotel that would specifically accommodate three adults, in a single room or suite. I find that standard rooms in NYC can be a bit tight, especially for three adults. I did quite a bit of research preliminarily. I knew finding anything around our preferred dates would be difficult. I also generally prefer staying near Central Park, if possible, which only complicated matters, of course. The only option that seemed to meet our needs and expectations was the Essex House. I browsed multiple booking websites, yet nothing seemed to match the Essex House’s accommodations, either in terms of size or amenities. Therefore, I booked a Family Suite which offered plenty of room for three. 

The checking in process was very simple. The front desk personnel was efficient and courteous. At booking, I had requested a “quiet” room. We were put up in a fourth floor two-room suite, which was adjacent to the elevator lobby. However, the suite was accessed through an entry alcove, which acted as a sound buffer. Therefore, as promised, our room was indeed sheltered from any real disturbance. My only regret, from being on a lower floor, was our room was somewhat dim at all times. The windows faced onto a narrow courtyard. It, however, was not an inconvenience, per se. 

The suites at the Essex House have all been elegantly renovated. They are particularly well planned out, in terms of both functionality and comfort. The beds are particularly plush. The sofa beds are too, which I found very unusual and a real benefit. The bathrooms are quite luxurious. We had to extend our stay for two nights -our flight was cancelled due to the blizzard that affected most of the East Coast-. Our initial suite was no longer available, however, we were offered a Junior Suite, on the 25th floor. It was absolutely gorgeous, in fact, perhaps more so than our previous accommodations. The very ample space was efficiently divided into a sitting room and a separate bedroom, with a full ensuite bathroom. The vistas over Manhattan were mesmerizing. The only negative, as compared to a Family Suite, was the amount of storage space -our Family Suite had a large walk-in closet, as opposed to an in-wall closet in the Junior Suite- which, for an extended stay, may be a significant decision factor. 

Furthermore, what makes the Essex House a wonderful hotel, is the kindness, generosity and professionalism of its personnel. For instance, the in-room dining staff was extremely responsive and genuinely kind. We repeatedly ordered the “basket of pastries”, for breakfast, which, I was told was comprised of three individual baked goods. However, we were given at a minimum twice that amount, each and every time. Upon arrival, I asked if we could purchase mineral water, however, I was directed to the Spa, instead, where individual bottles are handed to guests, at no charge. There were in fact many other instances (from booking transportation to internet access) when, one team member or another, gave tips to find more economical options, yet, providing the same quality of service. 

I would highly recommend the Essex House to anyone looking for a perfectly-located establishment, which offers very attentionate services, in a beautiful setting. As compared to other hotels, of the same category, the nightly rate was quite competitive too.

title: Great location on Central Park South
text: A historic hotel built in 1929-1931, is has gone through multiple owners and remodelings. Initially planned as a multi-purpose development, it has functioned as a luxury hotel for the past several decades. In addition, Essex House has also been known for housing some of New York's best restaurants (remember Alain Ducasse?). The 44-story skyscraper has 426 rooms and 100 suites. The architectural style is Art Deco, which remains largely unchanged, despite multiple restorations. The hotel has large ballrooms and very good restaurant and bar facilities.

title: Great location & well-appointed room
text: My husband and I stayed at the Essex House for Thanksgiving week. We chose this hotel for two reasons - first being it was a Marriott property, and second was for its location.  I booked a basic room, which was small by most standards but not for NYC.  Thankfully its lack of roominess was compensated by a very comfortable bed and very nice furnishings and bathroom.  My only issue with my stay there was room service on Thanksgiving morning, but while it was disappointing, it was not surprising.  Management handled the situation satisfactorily.  Depending on the nature of our next visit to Manhattan, I would definitely consider staying at the Essex House again.

title: Thank you Terrance
text: We booked this hotel through concierge service of Citi Prestige and when arrived in New York realized that the concierge made a mistake in selection of the suite. Luckily the front desk manager on duty was Terrance; he was professional, understanding and  very helpful. Thank you Terrance for making my family stay in New York perfect. We will be back in this hotel again.

title: Nice facility, but disappointed at the Executive Lounge
text: Recently renovated facility is great - rooms awesome, and the bathrooms are real sized!  I generally stay at Marriott facilities and this was a great one, however, I’ve never experienced an executive lounge that required sit down meals and had no waters to take to the room.  Maybe it was because it was high season, but that was disappointing.

title: Just called in for a drink
text: I could have stayed here all day by the fire in the warm open bar. Good selection of drinks and seating, reasonable price and good service. Didn’t stay at the hotel but will be back for drinks in the future

title: Perfect Hotel with wonderful location
text: We stayed at the Essex House in late October and had a wonderful stay. The location is amazing and the service is great. We had access to the executive lounge and they had a wonderful breakfast and appetizers. The doorman was very friendly and gave us his umbrella when it was raining. Overall wonderful and we can't wait to go back in March!!

title: Amazing!
text:
We stayed at the JW Marriott Essex House the beginning of December.  Marvin at check in was extremely helpful and accommodating!  We were upgraded to a larger room, with a walk-in closet!  The bathroom was huge, with a separate tub and shower.  The hotel recently went under a major reno, which was nice.  Location, you can't get better than right across the street from Central Park.  Also, easy access to all the subway lines.

The only problem we had was the lounge.  The first morning we walked in, the blond woman staff balked at us and demanded to see our access card.  No good morning, nothing.  We were not expecting this from a JW.  We put some silverware down to "claim" our table, upon returning, some other guest took our spot, LOL!

title: No coffeemaker.
text:
I have stayed in probably hundreds of hotels. The JW Marriott Essex House is the only full-service hotel without a coffeemaker. If you want one, you have to pay a daily fee. That's just absurd, especially as a Marriott platinum. Even a room at the Motel 6 has a complimentary in-room coffeemaker.

Otherwise, the hotel was OK. Yes, it's busy. Sometimes wait for the hotel guest services operator to answer the telephone or the wait at the concierge was excessive.

The room itself was relatively big by New York standards. None of my special requests (extra towels, extra pillows) were fulfilled. My room had 1 bathrobe, but no slippers. I had to request a second bathrobe for my wife and two pairs of slippers. It took 2 hours for the extra bathrobe and two pairs of slippers to be delivered.

Turndown service was provided, but nothing was replaced. The housekeeper only removed dirty towels. No new toiletries were provided to replace used ones. Window blinds were not drawn. 

The executive lounge is VERY small. The unionized staff don't do anything but remove dirty plates. There's no espresso machine. Only EXTREMELY HOT coffee from big industrial coffeemakers. No indication what type of coffee is being served. The coffee was too hot to drink from the paper cups. 

The JW Marriott Essex House is an OK hotel, but the service and amenities are below the price charged and below the standard of JW Marriott hotels.

title: Amazing customer service
text: Prior to arrival I had made my request for connecting or adjoining rooms, as we were travelling with our children. Upon check in, the rooms were very far apart and the second room was too small for two teenagers and an 11 year old! The Bellman “Q” was amazing , took our bags from both rooms while we went to sort out problem and got us water while we waited. Front Desk Manager , Terence did some juggling and got the the most amazing family configuration, which gave us space and peace of mind. Great start to trip!

title: The Beautiful Essex House on Central Park South
text: From the beauty of the building to the gorgeous lobby and interior, to the luxurious rooms and views of Central Park and the City, you can't beat the Essex House for a great hotel experience. The area around the hotel is so lovely to walk around in and don't forget a carriage ride through Central Park. This is all a special treat not to miss out on.

title: Great place to stay and awesome staff!
text: This Hotel was perfect for our family! We could walk to everything and when we arrived at eight 8 o’clock in the morning they were able to check us in early so we could get a quick nap before we had to go to the Rockettes 11 o’clock show. Normal check-in is 4 PM and we were so grateful to the front desk staff for accommodating us early!!! The room was comfortable and clean. We would definitely recommend this hotel and we would be happy to stay here again!

title: What is with no coffee in Manhattan Hotel rooms?
text:
The second time in two months, I found myself in Manhattan. My experience at the previous hotel was not satisfactory (Review: https://www.tripadvisor.com/ShowUserReviews-g60763-d611947-r523344777-New_York_Hilton_Midtown-New_York_City_New_York.html), so I decided to stay at the fancy Essex House.
Guess what? No coffeemakers in the room here either - again the same routine, spend $15 and order from room service if you really desire so.
I have asked in the hotels if there is a specific regulation that prevents them from keeping coffeemakers in the room, but no such information has been forthcoming. Am beginning to wonder if it is a collusion between Manhattan hotels to get the guests to spend more....
Doesn't make sense though when guests are spending $300 upwards for a room, why be stingy for a few dollars in providing them coffee - which any half decent motel across the world provides?

Coming back to this specific hotel - nice rooms, spacious and free YouTube /  net access on the smart TV. Very well located for Central Park (I was there for the Marathon).

title: Simply excellent
text: My wife and I greatly enjoyed our stay here during the Christmas season. It has that “new hotel smell,” if that makes sense, although it probably doesn’t. Marriott should be very proud of this hotel, and the staff are excellent—in one case during check out, correcting an error swiftly that put the customer first. The restaurant food is pricey, but so is everything else in the area. The food was excellent, though. Cleaning staff were on top of things, and the hotel had no problem honoring the late checkout that came with my elite status—I only mention that because several other hotels/chains have granted me late checkout but no one else seems to know it, resulting in constantly telling different staff the same thing over and over. The only two minor negatives to this hotel are a TV remote that either needed new batteries or is just an unresponsive brand, and the fitted mattress pad that constantly and quite annoyingly kept coming loose. Otherwise, the hotel is great, with a spacious lobby and an obviously prime location.

title: Christmas in NYC
text: Recently stayed here in December for a weekend. We had a wonderful view of Central Park from our room. Our room was also decently sized. I am surprised to read other reviews which claim the customer service was poor. This was the exact opposite of our experience here. Everyone from the doorman to the Concierge treated us amazing. The breakfast lounge is a little bit small and crowded but besides that I can't think of many other complaints. If Central park and shopping are your thing you really cannot beat the location. Hotel itself is very classic and feels like alot of history has happened here. Yet, at the same time,  the hotel does not feel old or outdated. In fact it made me feel warm and fuzzy inside. One Word Review: Classic

title: A beautiful view of Central Park
text: From the moment you arrive one is treated well!  Great location!  Stroll in the park, explore the neighborhood.  Easy access to the Subway.  Sleep well, the bed was extremely comfortable.  It’s our go to hotel in NYC!

title: Perfect Location... classic NY
text:
We have stayed here a few times. It is located perfectly. Easy walk down 5th avenue, theatre district is walkable, Lincoln Center as well. Subway station 2 blocks away gets you anywhere.

Friendly, courteous service. Everyone is top notch. 

The rooms have been recently remodeled, and have all the conveniences.

title: Muito bom
text:
Excelente localização! Perto de tudo!
Ter duas entradas é fantástico, facilita muito, uma em frente o Central Park, outra pela w58, super fácil para chegar no metro.
Quartos são ótimos, atendimento muito bom.

title: Where did the tubs go?
text:
My husband and I checked in on Sunday and as much as I'm Platinum, the hotel was filled and an upgrade wasn't available.  Ok, so as much as my profile requests a high floor,  we were put on the 15, which is rather low in a 40 story hotel.   Ok,  it happens.

Up to the room we go,  it is corner room - one window looks into a solid brick wall and the other side looks into a brick with walls with windows.  Really that is the best I could get?? The bigger issue,  is that I have stayed here a bunch of prior times and the bath rooms had nice big tubs.  I like tubs.  Called down and explained the issue.  They asked me to come down and they were going to move me to a room on the 23 floor with a bath.  Great.

My husband goes upstairs with the luggage and I go get the key.  I get into the room 2309 and at least the brick walls are gone, but there isn't a bath tub.   I gave up at  that point.  Here is the kickers,  1)  I'm told I should request a bath tub on my profile, which I would do if you can do that, but there is no place to do that.  2) The website states the rooms have a shower/tub combo - not true  3) They left bath salts in the room that doesn't have a tub - very strange.

I was planning a trip in Feb with family members, but I may go to one of the less expensive Marriots instead (I have slept in most of them.)  The breakfast was great and the lobby looked very nice for Christmas.  Can someone explain the tub stuff?

title: 2 nights on Central Park
text:
I thought this was alovely hotel with great restaurant and bar for excellent people watching if you sat by the front windows.  The twin room we had didn't have a view but made up for it in size.  The room had all standard amenities including fridge and minibar.
The hotel is in a great location - right across the road from Central Park.  It also maybe the most affordable hotel on Central Park.

title: Customer Service was poor
text: Room wasn't ready until 6pm, they guarantee the room is supposed to be ready by 4pm.  We reserved 2 rooms, because we are a family of 5.  There was no blankets available for the pull out bed.  We called the front desk and asked for a blanket.  After 25 minutes, still no blanket.  So we called again, (front desk was extremely rude).  We asked if we could pick up the blanket as our kids were ready to go to bed.  They told us that wasn't possible and we would just have to wait.  Hotel rooms are nice, but the customer service at the hotel leaves a lot to be desired.

title: Beautiful Hotel
text: I am so glad we picked to stay at the JW Marriott Essex House on our last weeks trip to NYC. The location of the hotel couldn't be more perfect. Nothing like staying right across Central Park. The concierge at the hotel were amazing and very helpful with dinner reservations every night we were there. The members lounge breakfast was perfect and provided several different options for breakfast.  I would stay here again on our next trip to NY. The two draw backs that I had were, the view from our room was of scaffolding and the members lounge is not opened all day during the weekend.

title: Needs some improvement
text: First off I should start by saying I have always heard great things about the Essex House, so I thought why not give it a try. The hotel is nice and decorated lovely for Christmas, however the front desk staff is not very friendly. As a platinum elite member I’m normally greeted and thanked as well as asked what brings you here. There was no warm fuzzy...also with a hotel like Essex you would think you would be greeted by the doorman. Housekeeping was super friendly! I’m also typically given an upgrade and if that was upgrade what a sad one. We were staring at a brick wall. Im just truly upset that the hotel does not live up to the hype. We will be staying somewhere else next year....

title: Does not live up to the JW Marriott brand
text: The hotel location is fantastic (across the street from Central Park).  Very clean, recent renovation - very classy hotel.  The problem is the level of service.  I am Marriott Gold member, and expect basic amenities like bottled water in your room, coffee maker in-room (usually a Nespresso or equivalent).  This property has neither, and one front desk employee grumbled about getting me water and told me to order room service.  Completely unacceptable for a hotel supposedly of this caliber (and was the worst JW Marriott-labeled hotel and I have stayed at many!).

title: Sad Fall from Grace
text: Platinum status doesn’t mean much at Marriott anymore. Despite months of advance reservation our room was very sad.  View of a brick wall, shower leaks because door does not close, front desk swears there are do not disturb “lights” above door you can activate, NO! Shower leaks badly, tub handle is sad retrofit & little stuff like cold water indicator on tub missing & WiFi was very spotty & did not work without calling under our reservation more than once.  Breakfast was slammed & out of lots of food an hour before closing. The front desk staff was just not helpful. Just not Marriott standards, we clearly like them enough to earn platinum status but, also why we have earned status at SPG - Hilton in past as well.  Hotel options are obviously changing. Such a pity to see JWMarriott & great location like Essex House slide.

title: Great December Getaway
text: My fiancé and I stayed here for a quick trip to the city to get into the holiday spirit. The location is great - not far from many subway stations, right across from Central Park, a short walk from Times Square, great shopping on 5th Avenue, and the Christmas market in Columbus Circle. The Lobby is beautifully decorated for Christmas. We checked-in early, which was great - our room was ready around noon. The only hiccup of our check-in was finding someone in our room! The front desk handled it gracefully and promptly, and overall, it was a non-issue for us. The rooms are clean, the bed is comfortable. I wish there were more outlets in the bathroom, as well as additional hooks for towels, but these aren't deal breakers for me. We had drinks at the bar one night (Southgate). Service was wonderful, but the drinks were a little pricey, even for New York. I enjoyed the mixed nuts that were offered with the drinks. Overall, great hotel and I'd recommend to others visiting the city.

title: Kevin is the best!
text: We used my husband's hard earned travel points to take a girls trip and stayed in the FABULOUS junior suite. It was amazing - all around. The club lounge is top-notch, the location can't be beat - the smell of the lobby is sooooo amazing and we just loved staying there. Kevin (chief concierge) truly made our stay that much better and elevated it. He is so friendly, caring, and pays attention to detail. He saved us a ton of time at check-in and helped out whenever we needed something. Even told us some interesting history of the hotel. Kevin - you're the best -thanks!

title: Needs Attention to Detail
text: My Boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel this past weekend.  We were in room 3812, a corner suite with 1 1/2 baths, master and living area.  My boyfriend is a Marriott Platinum card holder and we are vacation club owners, so we have stayed at many Marriott's in many locations.  Every year we start off our Christmas season by venturing to NYC for shopping, shows and of course to see the tree, we typically stay in the heart of times square at the Marriott Marquis, but felt that the marquis was getting run down and far too busy this time of the year, so we decided to stay a little further away from the craziness.  We arrived Thursday night at 8:30 pm, when we pulled up in front of the hotel there was really no designated area for guests to check in, no door man to greet us....I saw a women in the revolving door cleaning the windows so I figured I'd ask her, but before I could, a door man came running out of another door to help with our luggage and to valet the car.  The husband of a couple we were meeting is wheel chair bound and there was no ramp for him to access the sidewalk in front of the hotel, he had to wheel to the end of the road, at night, against traffic to access the corner ramp.  The check in process was smooth, the lobby was beautifully decorated for the holiday season and we were assisted to our room.  We were told on the way to the room that it had just been renovated two months ago, so we were expecting greatness.  The decor of the room was under-whelming, modern, and in tones of gray, black, white and beige.  The suite was a nice size.  The master did not have a dresser so we had to live out of our suitcases for things that did not get hung in the closet.  There were an abundance of outlets and USB ports built into the night stands, which was very convenient.  I noticed several things about the room that need to be addressed, the following aren't big issues, but for the price one would not expect to see the lack of detail.  The small corner shower head pointed directly towards the door, the head had to be turned towards the wall before starting the shower. The knob on the shower faucet was missing the insert, along with the "cold" knob in the bath tub.  There was a cut out in the bathroom ceiling that had not been repaired properly with dirty hand prints.  A light cover in the living room chandelier was missing, and another outlet is needed in the 1/2 bath.  Here is the big issue we had with the room.....Friday morning when getting out of bed we noticed a great big stain on the sheets, down near our calves and ankles....and in an attempt not to offer too much information, there was the presence of little black hairs....This was unacceptable and totally gross!  We immediately stripped the bed and made sure the sheets were changed when we got back to the room.  Saturday morning at 10:00 am we were awoken by housekeeping attempting to enter the room, but could not because the interior latch was in place.  I can't say that the hotel is average, because it is far from average, but I can't give it a "very good" rating either because of the stained sheet and lack of detail.  We should have reported the sheet incident, but just didn't want to cloud the trip.  The sheets were changed and the issue remedied.  The housekeeping and maintenance staff needs to pay more attention to detail at this hotel.  Other than this, the hotel is beautiful, actually it was easier to access the holiday attractions from the Essex House then from the Marquis, less congested sidewalks.  All of the staff we encountered were friendly and helpful. And the bar makes a great Cosmopolitan.

title: Small hangup
text: My dad booked this hotel a few months in advance as a platinum elite member. He had called multiple times to try to ensure a high floor with double beds. When we arrived they tried to put us on a low floor with 1 bed. We waited a few hours in hopes to get a better room. Three hours later we went back and were upgraded to a room with 1 queen bed on a higher floor. We went up to the room and it was nice but small with no view. We called the front desk one last time and were finally able to get 2 beds with a city view 20th floor. This room was perfect, it was updated, spacious, and had a city view. Beds were super comfortable, room was quiet, breakfast was great. Throughout this whole ordeal the staff was friendly and accommodating. Although we were frustrated at first we ended up having a great stay and wished it was longer.

title: Beautiful building with a lovely staff
text: Out of all the hotels I've stayed at in NYC, this is hands down the friendliest staff. I appreciate that the staff makes the effort to smile or say "hello" when you walk by. Plus, the building is just spectacular.

title: Family of 3 over Thanksgiving.  Awesome.
text: We may not ever stay anywhere else in NYC again.  Absolutely loved this hotel.  We got a king room for my husband, my 11 year old and myself and it was plenty big.  I wasn't expecting a fold away bed but we had one and still had plenty room.  We did not get a parade route but just walked out the back door and walked to the parade.  I will say, though, that the club lounge was so crowded this weekend with people that acted like they had never eaten before that we didn't use it but once.  We just got a keurig delivered to the room one day and got the complimentary coffee in the restaurant the other days.  It was a crazy busy day when we checked in but they handled it perfect and our room was ready.  The bathroom was plenty big and you really could not beat this location.  Housekeeping was great as were the bell staff.  Seriously, no complaints.  Loved this hotel and this experience.  Also of importance, to be right in the center of the action, this hotel was VERY quiet.  We all slept wonderfully.  Our room was in a corner so I am sure that helped as well.

title: Wonderful 2 years in a row!
text:
Last year was our first time visiting and we loved it so much we had to come back this year for my birthday and our anniversary. Every staff member smiled as we walked by, and the hotel itself smelled amazing and of course is absolutely stunning. I adore the old charm with new accents. 

Thank you to the staff for the large, delicious piece of chocolate cake that was in our room when we return Friday evening, a “sweet” end to our wonderful day. 

The breakfast spread was delicious, Salmon and capers?! What a delight to have such selection!! I hope to continue our new found tradition for many years!

title: What a View
text: Best view of Central Park anywhere in the world !!! Hotel did a renovation of all public areas upstairs ( downstairs does NOT need it) as well as my room so probably did most or all as well.  I had the most amazing view of the entire park from my 20th floor suite.   The staff are great and it’s a pleasure to be here again.

title: A Great Location for Thanksgiving
text: I made plans for a family vacation to New York City for Thanksgiving. I worked with several members of the Essex staff months before our trip. They were extremely helpful. When we flew to La Guardia Airport, our driver was waiting for us and quickly got us to the hotel. Check-In was a breeze. I had sought advice from Concierge Michael before the trip and he was always helpful. He continued to help up with our scheduling after our arrival. Housekeeping was also considerate and friendly. I give the entire staff the highest rating. Plan ahead if you want a room to view the Macy's Parade. It is worth the price.

title: Very bad customer service
text: I chose this hotel for my special 60th Birthday celebration for my wife and I and it was the worse hotel experience of my life!  I am a seasoned traveler, a new Yorker, and I was treaty horribly from the first moment at check-in when I was told that my central park view room, that I paid extra for, was not ready.  This was at 5pm, a full one hour after the 4pm check in time.  So you would think that the guy would even offer us a comp drink?  I had to ask for it!  So after an hour wait, still no room.  Now im really upset.  They could care less, just a free breakfast, that was equally horrible. Not what I expected from the Marriott as a silver member.  Never again.  I should have stayed at the Plaza down the street.

title: Just Great!
text: Is this hotel overpriced for the size of the rooms? Absolutely! The rooms are small, and the elevators are even smaller. But it’s truly a wonderful hotel with a rich history of New York City. It’s right across the street from Central Park, a few blocks away from time square, the Opera house and tons of great restaurants. The hotel didn’t wow me, and if available I would go back to the intercontinental, but no complaints at all about the hotel.

title: Perfect Location for NYC Marathon With Staff Who Go Extra Mile
text: Our family had three rooms at Essex House for NYC Marathon Weekend.  It’s on the last mile of the race, across the street from Central Park and a short walk to Broadway Theaters and a long list of good restaurants and museums.  The staff are very attentive and professional.  This was our first visit to Essex House but it definitely won’t be our last.

title: My "Go To"
text: I have stayed in a number of great NY hotels, but I always come back here when I can.  Location-unmatched. Service-superior & customer focused.  And the staff is actually "nice." Checked in after 10 p.m. on a Sunday.  Extra kudos to Aetienne (sp)Same service as if it was mid-day.  Executive lounge has a good, hot, full breakfast with offerings for all diets.  Rooms have been updated.  Good size rooms for NY.  And my papers were at my door each and every morning.

title: Maybe its fine if you use rewards points, but...
text: Yes it is a great location across from the park, but everything about my 2 nights was average..  Check in was fine.  I arrived early and got into a room.  No view, small bathroom, no evening turndown service, bland food at the breakfast buffet.  What bothered me the most was late night and early morning noise from possibly trash cans outside the building that was annoying even on the ninth floor. I was not impressed.

title: Business & Pleasure
text:
We enjoyed an outstanding experience staying at this Marriott --- from the people and accommodations to the location and amenities.

Our rock star concierge David Rahner was very informative and tapped his local network to help us with everything from dinner reservations to navigating the local music scene.  Thanks David! 

The location on the southern border of central park was perfect for both business purposes and personal pleasure.

title: Amazing experience from start to finish
text: If you’re looking for a quintessential New York experience, this is a great hotel to stay in.  From the moment we checked in with Felix we felt cared for and not rushed.
