Our room was not quite ready but the valet held our bags and we walked along Central Park south to sightsee.  I do have platinum access to the concierge lounge and it was very well appointed. I will make it a tradition to stay at the Essex house again.

title: Lovely Hotel
text: We had no view from our room but we did get an early check in, so I️ guess those equal each other out! We stayed for two nights on a quick weekend celebration. Location is superb, room was comfortable and clean. Jasmine in the concierge lounge was very professional and helpful! One big negative is the very high cost to valet the car!

title: Great date night in the city
text: I used my Marriott points to stay at the Essex House with my husband last night. Great location- directly across from Central Park and walking distance to Columbus Circle and the Time Warner Center/ Jazz at Lincoln Center. Excellent use of reward points for this iconic location. Rooms have been updated. Surprised to see a single vanity for a bathroom that was so large but it was tastefully decorated. The room had plenty of windows letting in natural light. The room was a junior suite - large living room area, walk in closet, king bed. We also had drinks at the hotel bar. A little mellow but nice atmosphere. Could have done with some live music given it was a Saturday night. Overall- very nice hotel and would definitely stay here again.

title: Confortable, impersonnel.
text:
Débarquant d’un vol de 8 h plus transfert à 14h00 la réception nous informe que notre suite ne sera libre qu’à 16h00. Nous avons poireauté dans un hall d’entrée sans charme. Même,pas un café proposé.Réception impersonnelle. Cet hotel manque « d’ âme «  , 
La Suite était grande et agréable sur le plan déco. Vue magnifique depuis le 34 ème ėtage. Confort literie excellente. Mais les robinetteries et la baignoire repeinte datent de Kennedy.....
Bar sans charme. Petit déjeuner US classique ,copieux et bon sans plus . Personnel d’accueil au restaurant qui se la pète. Celui de salle est souriant, attentionné, efficace.
Un hotel bien placé mais où on n’en ramène pas de souvenirs nostalgiques.
Sorti devant l’hotel ,sur le trottoir , pour fumer, je me suis fait jeter agressivement par le voiturier comme si j’avais la peste. C’est ça le paradoxe américain. Le pays le plus pollueur de la planète qui a une industrie du tabac quasi monopolistique applique de façon exagéré les dictats de khmers verts.

title: Upper East Side Class
text: Essex House being right on the southern edge of Central Park is the perfect spot to see this amazing city. Wedged between 6th and 7th Avenues, Essex is the perfect site to access the Park, the theatres (Times Square is only 6 blocks away), the Upper East side for the museums and classy restaurants. The Subway on either Lexington or on 8th will take you up-town or down-town making access to the rest of the city easy. 5th Ave shopping is a mere hop away, just make sure you have space in your luggage to get it all home. The Staff are all very courteous and helpful. The rooms are beautiful, even without a view of the park there is plenty of light and space.

title: Wonderful location for a New York hotel
text:
The Essex House has a sense of style and graciousness from the New York of the last century. The lobby has gravitas and gives one a sense of a great hotel. Actually the room I had, back facing, was pretty ordinary but a nice size and well fitted. As a Marriott Gold Elite member I had access to the Club Room and had an excellent breakfast.
Best feature is the position, near Columbus Circle, Carnegie Hall, Lincoln Center, etc.
I'd go back in a heart beat.

title: Classic Hotel, Great Service
text:
The Essex House is a true NYC classic.  I've stayed here twice this year and had outstanding stays both times.  The public spaces are beautiful; many of the vintage touches have been retained, but everything is sparkling clean and functional (including the elevators, which hark back to an earlier era, but still work beautifully).

Location across from Central Park is excellent - convenient to many landmarks.  

We stayed in a recently refurbished suite (with a terrace!) and found the updated decor to be a definite upgrade.  Room was quiet, with excellent soundproofing.  Bed was very comfortable.  Internet was fast and stable.  (We did miss a coffee maker in the room, though.)

Service was great, from the moment we arrived all the way through departure.  Everyone we interacted with was both friendly and professional.  A special thanks to Cesar at the front desk.

As a Marriott Platinum, we had lounge access.  The lounge breakfast here is probably the best of any U.S. Marriott . . . nice variety, and super high quality.

I very much look forward to returning to this classic property again and again.

title: An elegant hotel in a fantastic location
text: Essex house is one of the old elegant buildings in New York. Always been a hotel. On the ground floor you walk on inlaid shining marble (?) and the flower decoration which meets the eye when you step through the entrance is breathtaking. The rooms and I believe the whole building is renovated in an elegant way. Our room was large and very nice indeed. The only drawback is that the there is work going on on the front/the facade?. This did not disturb us at all but you could not see the beautiful front from outside.The staff is first rate, all of them! a sign of a first rate hotel. The breakfast room is very nice and the breakfast is highly recommended. This is not a cheap hotel but we will definitely stay there again

title: Top Notch
text:
We chose this hotel due its close proximity to Central Park, where we were attending a wedding.  What an unexpected treat we were in for!  The lobby is large and gorgeous, and the rooms were great (comfortable bed & bedding, spacious for NYC, extremely clean).  The concierge team, especially David, was outstanding: genuinely courteous, upbeat and helpful.  Actually, everyone who worked here, from the cleaning service people to the bell attendants, couldn't have been nicer. 

Having great restaurants, a small grocery/sundries store and good shopping nearby was also a plus. Looking forward to staying here again!

title: Pure luxury..
text: I recently visited the JW Marriott Essex House and stayed for 5 nights with my family. On arrival we were treated with care and warmth. I had read reviews that staff were stubborn and unhelpful however I never found this to be true as staff members were very pleasant and helpful. The hotel itself is beautiful and luxurious and the main lobby is gorgeous. Our rooms were also great, very spacious as far as new york hotel rooms go. The only thing I was disappointed in was the Wifi service in our room as it often disconnected and was never a strong connection however this did not take away from my enjoyment at the hotel. Breakfast every morning was amazing with a buffet style offering many different breakfast options. Loved this hotel and would love to go back.

title: Loved it!
text: We loved it!  Stayed here 5 nights at the end of September.  From the moment we checked in we were blown away by the friendly, helpful staff at the door, check in desk and concierge.  They all went above and beyond to make sure we were well taken care of.  Our room was perfectly cleaned and freshened up each morning.  Housekeepers that we passed in the hall were always smiling and cheerful.  The newly remodeled room was perfect.  Bathroom and room were large for a standard room.  Excellent location made it quick and easy to see the city.  Easy walk to several different subway lines.  Uber pick up and drop off was super easy from back entrance of hotel  Lots of cabs available any time out front.  Great restaurants and bars in walking distance.  Complimentary coffee just inside the restaurant/bar door was a great perk.  Highly recommend to all!

title: Luxury At Its Best
text: I stayed last week with my sister and our stay was amazing.  The staff took care of all our needs from the time that we pulled up in front of the hotel until we left to go home.  Courtney and Luis are the best persons to greet you and they are extremely friendly.  Our front desk experience was totally awesome.  Our room was not ready but they kept our luggage until it was ready and called me right away.  We have access to the lounge and Charly and Ivan catered to our every need.  They made each guest feel at home.  I am looking forward to returning.  Greatest experience ever.

title: Refurbished, still nice
text: I love the location of this hotel, its staff and the flowers in the lobby.  I stay in it whenever I go to New York.  For me, they did not need to have mono colored updates or a sleeker, contemporary look.  But I still love it.

title: Disappointed
text: My husband booked this hotel because of the location.  We were under the impression that we would get a room overlooking Central Park so we were sadly disappointed when we saw our room and found it to be facing a back wall with 0 view.  We had requested a room with double beds and apparently all their rooms with double beds face the back.  That was a big let down.  I think if we had a room with a view I would have probably rated this higher.  My husband is a Elite member and we were able to take advantage of the lounge for breakfast.  Everyday they had the same menu but it had good variety to please the kids and the adults.  We had a room on the 11th floor and it was renovated.  But there was nothing about the room that screamed JW MARRIOTT.  It was just a standard room and didn't have the luxury quality to it.

title: Luxurious hotel, excellent location
text: I stayed one night at the Essex House to avoid a long commute back to NJ. The hotel is beautiful, the staff at check in was very welcoming. The room was, for NYC standards, HUGE. King size bed, couch, and a large bathroom. Super comfortable. The view was of a brick wall, but since I didn't pay for a view, it didn't bother me.

title: Concierge Made this Stay
text: First off the hotel was beautiful, the location was exactly what I wanted, but the service was impeccable, impeccable and flawless. They took the time to understand why we chose this hotel, what the occasion was, and welcomes us with open arms. To the team thank you, I have already had three friends book the hotel because of this!

title: Awesome
text:
This hotel is absolutely beautiful. My room was immaculate. Luckily for me I was upgraded to a suite with Central Park view which was breathtaking in the fall. 

The hotel itself is conveniently located, and I found an inexpensive parking garage around the corner. The subway is about a block or two away, but not a bad walk. 

There is no complimentary breakfast unless you are an executive member. I can tell you the breakfast for Executive key holders is fantastic. A wonderful display and variety of options. 

This hotel is my top choice for NYC.

title: Excellent Stay
text:
It’s almost like we’ve been staying at a different hotel than some of the other reviewers here.  I was hesitant to book this property because of negative reviews, but I’m so glad that I did.  We still have 2 nights of our 7 night stay left, but I wanted to review immediately in case anybody is unsure whether to book after reading some negative reviews.  Trust me... book now!

STAFF:  Sharlene at the front desk gave us such a warm welcome upon arrival.  She thanked me for my loyalty (Marriott Gold), gave us a fantastic room upgrade and even treated my daughters as though they were a VIPs.  As a business owner, I would love to have someone like Sharlene as a first point of contact for customers.  She is courteous and professional... a perfect representation of the JW Marriott brand.  Felix and Muhammad at the front desk have also been wonderful.  Be sure to ask Felix about food recommendations in the city!  Juned in the executive lounge is such an asset to the hotel.  He has been so lovely and even treats my daughters to special desserts every night since we leave early for bedtime.  We haven’t encountered anyone here who isn’t friendly and helpful.  When staff heard that we were celebrating, we were treated to flowers and a beautiful handmade card signed by no fewer than 20 staff members.   Service has been superb.  We’ve witnessed some very rude behaviour towards staff members and I can only assume that those are the guests leaving negative reviews.  Be kind and treat staff members well... they’re an exceptional group of people and I’m so happy to have met them.

ROOM: Central Park suite with 1.5 bathrooms, 1 king bed and a pullout sofa.  The view can’t be beat and the renovated room is lovely.  Huge room with tons of storage space and great water pressure in the shower.  Aromatherapy amenities smell amazing.

EXECUTIVE LOUNGE: great selection of food and beverage.  Breakfast is the same buffet as offered in restaurant.  It’s almost the same every morning but more than anyone could ever need.  Weekend was busy, but weekdays have been very quiet.  Evening offerings are plentiful (pastas, seafood, etc) and we haven’t felt the need to go to a restaurant for dinner yet.

BOTTOM LINE: Ignore negative reviews.  Ask for a renovated room.  Be kind.

title: What a treat...
text: The Essex House is one of the grand dames of Manhattan’s Gilded Age.  Exquisitely updated, keeping the best of the old world and mixing in some 21st century treats. The hotel lobby and interior oozes class. We arrived around 4 pm on a Friday afternoon. Our room was not quite ready, so we went to grab a quick bite and adult beverages at Southgate. The bar/lounge/restaurant are the most modern part of the building. Very airy, open and inviting couches/chairs. Great drinks and snacks. While relaxing, we received a text saying our room was ready.  As a lifetime platinum with Marriott, I tend to get treated pretty well. I never have expectations or make demands (like so many pushy people do). When we received our key, we were thrilled to get a high floor room (1804) facing Central Park. Muhammad set us up with access to the executive lounge also.  So many of the older NYC hotels have small (by US standards) rooms. Our room was HUUUGE.  The bathroom was modern. We like the Aromatherpy line of toiletries provided. USB charging is a nice add to any hotel these days. The executive lounge does get crowded around 9 am on the weekends, so keep that in mind.  The lounge offers a very complete breakfast, that may cost you 50 bucks a person if you had to pay for it. Great staff here always willing to help with just about anything you may want or need.  Give the Essex House a try. You will be glad you did.

title: Mixed feelings and poor first impression!
text:
My wife and I are Marriott Platinum Elite, so one can say that we spend a decent amount of time - business and pleasure - on Marriott properties. For all the hype, the New York JW Marriott Essex House has been so far a rather mixed-feeling experience, a soft way not to call it a disappointment. We believe in the first impression - we are still here for the next 3 days - and the first impression was nothing to write home about! 

Checking in: we got at the hotel around 9:20 pm. By the time the check in process was done, it was 9:30 pm. Went straight to the Lounge! It was supposed to be open though 10 pm. Lo and behold, it was a no-man’s land. Nothing left, no drinks or food, not even hot water for a tee. 

Lounge: this is the first and only place that the lounge is closed on Fridays and Saturdays. For the manager who came with this idea, an IQ test should be administered ASAP! This is called weekend when people come to the hotel! Take the perk away and you will be loved to the end of life on earth! We went next day for breakfast! Other than probably 100 other people - not exaggerating - trying to elbow their way in and a very small place with tiny tables and not enough seats to accommodate half of the population at one given time, the breakfast offering was bland and unimpressive for a JW Marriott. Eggs, some very strange cheese blintzes and bacon! The breakfast of champions. I guess they did have some cold cuts and cheese but at 8:30 am was long gone. I asked one of the lounge waiters were do they have the cutlery and his answer was “really, it is in the other room”! Really, I didn’t know that.  

Room: small, but this is NY! However, after the first day here none of the glasses we used the first night were washed! Only one pair of sleepers (we have a reservation of 4, two adults and two kids in a room with two queen beds). The view from the room is unforgettable - one side I have lovely scaffoldings and the view of some decrepit building, the other side there is a constant high pitch hum from some - I guess - HVAC units and the lovely view of some old roofs! We are staying at the 16th floor and the only way to see the city is to use the google maps on your tablet! 

People: we knew that New Yorkers are not a friendly bunch but it seems that JW Marriott made an effort to hire the some disagreeable ones! Asked for the TV remote to be changed - no luck. Asked for directions, got very vague answers. Asked for a good place to eat with the kids within walking distance, got back a dissertation and not a single fact! Asked for a cab, got military orders where to stay and how many inches to move left and right. 

As I said, first impression! However, as the saying goes, first impressions are the most lasting!

title: Another great stay
text: We have stayed here a few times. The rooms were recently renovated which is a nice plus. The location is great - right across the street from Central Park. The hotel really tried to allow early check in and late check out. A great place to stay in NYC

title: Great stay in a great city
text:
Stayed here for a wedding and reception and thoroughly enjoyed everything about the hotel.  They are currently refurbishing all of the rooms and we stayed in one of the newly refurbished rooms.  The room was very nice, well appointed and very comfortable and spacious (for NYC).  The hotel staff was extremely courteous and helpful and very prompt with everything.

The hotel is nicely located to all the nice places in midtown and Central Park.  Great walks to all places.  I would definitely stay here again.

title: Unbeatable location great services
text: This hotel certainly  lives up to the JW standards. Beautiful lobby and rooms.  Granted some of the rooms are small and face not so grand view. But it is New York. The location, however, is wonderful.  Right across the street from the Central Park. So very easy to escape the busy city after work.  The executive lounge is definitely amongst the best.  I think I will have to pick one from Switzerland to top it.

title: Mixed results regarding staff professionalism
text:
Staff response so far has been less than supportive and mostly ungrateful. Best not to expect too much in terms of customer service. Maybe that will change...

We deeply appreciate the workers efforts. Some have shown us politeness, while others have been downright rude!

title: Great experience
text:
Went for our anniversary. Wonderful classic building. Lobby is an example of a more formal era (30's, 40's?). Love it.

Great room with view of Central Park. Actual heavy wooden room door. With a door bell!

Great mini bar, bed very comfortable. Bar is excellent, and while we only had appetizers they were delicious, so I can only guess the dinner menu would be as good.

Breakfast offered a good selection. Room service prompt.

Entire staff was wonderful. 

Returning soon. Can't wait.

title: Very Nice Hotel and Location
text: I have been a very loyal Marriott traveler for many years.  Was just in New York City for a meeting in Midtown.and stayed one night.  Enjoyed getting drinks at the Southgate Restaurant on the first floor with a view of Central Park.  Great location and team of professionals at the hotel.  Looked like a good breakfast for members but had to run to get to get my UBER early morning.  Would stay again.

title: A bit old-fashioned, but a great location
text:
A very enjoyable stay in a great location, but the hotel does feature a number of things that irritate me
1.	Roman blinds. When I want to open or close the curtain, I want something quick and easy. Roman blinds are a fail on this score. Hate them!
2.	A master light switch by the bed is pretty much essential. Arriving at a hotel tired and having to work out how to turn off each light in the room is a chore I’d rather not have.
3.	I want coffee when I wake up. Room service or coffee on tap in the lobby doesn’t do it for me.
So, what was good? The rooms were spacious, wifi access was good, comfortable bed and bedding, separate shower and bath, nice shampoo, great location, helpful staff.

title: Classic NY Hotel, Beautifully Restored
text: We have stayed at the Essex House several times.  It is a classic old NY hotel on Central Park South.  It has been beautifully restored.  Many of the rooms include multiple original rooms so floor plans vary.  the best views are toward the park.  Free breakfast is offered for Marriott members and a nice gym.  Walking distance from Times Square, Central Park, Columbus Circle and many other Manhattan sites.

title: Prime Location of Manhattan
text:
JW Marriott Essex House New York is located in the prime area of Manhattan located in the south of Central Park. It is close to Colombus Circle and all subway lines. It's only 1km away from Central Park and 500m away from the 5th Avenue.

The hotel is under renovation for the moment. Some of the rooms are renovated and some are not. Make sure you ask for a renovated one as the old one are really old. 

Service of the hotel is good but not excellence. Honestly, only Asian owned hotels like Mandarine Oriental and Peninsular in New York City provide great service. 

I would say JW Marriott is great value for this convenient location and spacious room. But I heard they will raise up their room rate after it is fully renovated. 

Service:                         ***
Location:                       *****
Quality of Bed:              *****
Quality of Toileteries:  *****
Food & Beverage:         ****
Facilities:                       ****

title: Royalty next to Central Park
text: I want to acknowledge the front office and the staff from Southgate. The level of service I received was very elevated to Marriott Standards. I was fortunate enough to find this JW Marriott so close to Times Square and in front of Central Park. I was given one of nicely renovated rooms which seemed very clean and spacious. If my travel plans call for NYC I know what Marriott to visit !  Thank You!

title: Weak for a JW Marriot (. my 13th NYC hotel review)
text: This is a fairly basic JW and not up to the standards of most others (I quite literally had a more attractive bathroom recently at a courtyard). Its location across the road from central park will make it attractive to some.  In and of itself I would have given three starts but as it falls short of JW standards (but not JW prices) I have dropped it to two stars. if you can get a free night/good rate then its OK, but if you are paying $400+ you'll be disappointed. Read my other NYC reviews for other options.

title: THE GREAT, THE GOOD, THE BAD AND THE UGLY!
text:
Our son booked our room as part of a holiday gift. He was a Marriott Rewards member at the time.

The Great - Breakfast in the Concierge Lounge!  Probably the best lounge offering I've ever had as a lifetime Gold Member and I've had many!

The Good - Dinner in the lounge.  Not as good as the breakfast, but serviceable.
 
The Bad - The room was a joke!  It was so small, how small was it, that you could 
barely get into the bed on either side.  As this was booked months in advance, this was "their best room available"?????

The UGLY - The woman who checked us in.  As I said, our son made the reservation.
She would not accept a Picture ID Driver's license from NJ, a Marriott Visa card and a Marriott Gold Lifetime card as identification.  She called my son and luckily got him on
the first try, which is very unusual.  Then, she denied us lounge access even though I an a Gold Lifetime member. I demanded a manager and she finally relented.

Lastly, the part of Central Park across the street was filthy!!

title: Iconic Essex House in New York
text: My husband and I recently stayed for the weekend at the now JW Marriott Essex House in Manhattan, where I hadn't stayed in a long time. I was quickly reminded of the elegance, comfort and style of this grand hotel, along with its fabulous location across the street from Central Park and walking distance from many of the City's finest restaurants, shopping, museums, theatre district and other destinations of interest. Our room was large, elegant and comfortable, with a modern, spacious bathroom and no street noise whatsoever!  The food in the hotel's Southgate was delicious and the Executive Lounge service and food will NOT disappoint! We had a fantastic experience and look forward to coming back again and again!

title: Worst Marriott hotel we have ever stay.
text:
My husband and I left our home in Delray Beach do to hurricane Irma on September 7th and checked in at JW Marriott Essex house.  The receptionist, name Georgia, answered all our questions with NO, very rude and unfriendly, left us very uncomfortable.  Next, the room was not suitable for even a 2 star hotel, the carpet was dirty with dark spots all over, the bathtub had numerous yellow rusty spots.  My husband is Marriott vacations club for many years, this hotel show no appreciation for loyalty or just a simple curtesy. After we are told at the checking that no fourt night is available to add to our first three nights, we checked in Kimpton Eventy in Manhattan, what a tremendous difference in service and accommodations.  I'm going to write a great review to Kimpton Eventy.
Please, avoid staying at JW Marriott Essex House!

title: Good option in NY
text:
Stayed there for 3 weeks during a business trip and it was great. The hotel is in front of Central Park and only a few blocks away from Columbus Circle.
The room was nice and comfortable, but I had some issues with the internet connection. After that, I was moved to a different room and the problem was solved. The manager did everything he could to compensate me for this issue, which I found very helpful and kind.
Breakfast is available for guests with executive lounge access. In this area they also offer complimentary snacks in the evenings and coffee, tea and other non-alcoholic beverages throughout the day. 
Gym was being remodeled, so wasn't so good, but I believe it is just a temporary issue.
During check out I asked for my receipt, but they wanted to email it directly to my company. I asked to check it anyway and found many incorrect charges from mini bar, which I hadn't consumed. They corrected it, but I suggest keeping an eye on this cases.

title: Good location,  small rooms, staff attitude can be improved
text:
The Greats- The location is in central park south, so especially if you are a tourist the location is very convenient. If you are a Marriot/Starwoods gold or Platinum member they have the "snack" room where you can always have some food and coffee.  I really appreciated this room. 

The Goods- The wifi is for free, and they gave us a code to connect to the free and speedy wifi, which we appreciated. 

The Not-so-Goods- Our hotel room (renovated floor) was very small. It was also freezing. I lived in NYC for 5 years, and it was even cold for NYC standards. One day it was 57 F which is too cold even when it is boiling hot outside. When we called the reception about this issue, they said they would not be able to help because the system was centralized. We ended up opening the windows, which decreased our sleep quality. Our suitcases (we had 2 big suitcases) barely fit the space. This is standard in most hotels in NYC though. The bigger issue is that the staff was very rude and not cooperative when we asked to store 2 suitcases for 3 days (while we were staying at the hotel), just not in the room, but in the luggage room. They eventually accommodated our needs, but the small room and unhelpful staff were a suboptimal combination. Granted US Open was at the same time, so they might have been overloaded.

title: Great stay but..:
text:
This is the 2nd time we have stayed here over the past few months.  The hotel is going through a renovation and the first time we stayed in an older room with stained carpets.  This time we were fortunate enough to stay in a renovated room and it was gorgeous.  Not all of the rooms/floors have been renovated yet so I would try to reserve a newer room.   Overall, it was a great experience.   The lobby/room and location are incredible.  This time we had access to the executive lounge and the breakfast/snacks were amazing.  

My only complaint (it is not a small one) is the front desk staff and the concierge were unpleasant.  Our check in did not go smoothly and when we asked for information about restaurants or tickets to a show it seamed like they were doing us a favor (with the exception of Jason at the front desk who was great). 

Overall the hotel is incredible with an amazing location and a very fair price.  I can appreciate that dealing with guests can be challenging but the front desk and concierge are key points of contact and if they can't put on a pleasant face they should find another job. 

We plan on being in NYC in a few weeks and we will stay here again.  I'll take a little rudeness in exchange for all of the good things the hotel has to offer.

title: UNPROFESSIONAL staff lost my package, promised to refund, but eventually REFUSED to communicate!!
text: JW Marriott Essex House is the hotel worst hotel ever! Their staff lost a package delivered to me, signed by Ron [-] on May 11. After calls and emails coming back and forth with Denys [-], the Front Desk Manager, she confirmed with me that the package was missing and the hotel would like to return me the amount. I gave her the credit card number, but the amount was eventually credited back to some unknown credit card. Starting from July 16, I didn’t receive any response from Denys [-] after I told her that they’ve returned the amount to a credit card that doesn’t belong to me. ISN'T IT STRANGE? THEY CREDITED TO THE WRONG CREDIT CARD, AND THEY THINK THE PROBLEM WAS FIXED!! I asked her to send me a check instead, but there were no further responses. It's a really bad hotel. I don't know why they think they are the "5-star hotel". If anyone from the hotel saw this message, please feel free to contact me. But I don't think you will, because what the hotel does best is "TOTALLY IGNORE COMPLAINTS!!"

title: Awful service and rude staff
text: Spent two nights at this hotel on business. When spending this much on a hotel, you'd expect 5 star service. Don't expect anything more than 1 star service, and  rude, disrespectful staff. This is supposedly a Marriott property, but they treated me like I just walked off the street, even though I'm a platinum member. There is too much to list, but go next door to the Plaza or a proper New York hotel that will treat you like you matter.

title: Perfect location, lots of great personal attention, but - conferencing service indifferent.
text:
This is generally a very well managed hotel. The management has clearly told staff - of every variety in every role - to pay attention to the needs of the guests. And generally they do so, brilliantly.

Why generally rather than always? I found the food service for a conference I was attending there to be a bit perfunctory: not enough spoons and napkins, or plates, hot water refreshed only occasionally, hot water mislabeled as coffee, having to ask to get here things fixed, that sort of thing. It was a great contrast to the attention given to me as an individual guest.

The location could not be better if you're in the mood to walk in Central Park which I did every day I was there. 

The rooms themselves were clean and adequate if in need of some updating. The fixtures in the bathroom were hyper modern. The desk and drawers in the bedroom were 1980s or so. The totality could have used some attention to a more integrative design.

But all in all, a good place to stay.

title: Very Good Place
text: This hotel has the best location in NYC .. Central Park walks became part of my daily plans as it is across the street from the hotel ..  friendly staff and clean rooms .. you may feel that some rooms are old .. but it is not something major. I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel and would highly recommend staying here.

title: Beautiful property with some service glitches
text:
This is a beautiful property in a great location (Central Park south) with beautiful and spacious suites and a seven day a week concierge lounge (most are closed on weekends).

There are still some service glitches that include:

1. Damaged heating system in room (last time)
2. Damaged air conditioning in room (this time)
3. Staff did not inform me when park views or suites were selling out so I could upgrade
4. Rude concierge staff upon arrival

This property has high potential but will need to bring its service up a notch so that it can reach its potential. We are hoping it succeeds.

title: Careless staff
text: We were in town for a wedding, which was held at the hotel. Besides the sub par service to clean and replenish supplies in our room, the catering staff failed to acknowledge my wife's food allergy, and served her, making her ill, and us missing the wedding. The hotel wanted to give me points to accommodate my troubles. Are you kidding? Better places to stay in NYC.

title: Amazing view. Renovated rooms are stunning. Service Par Execellence
text: Great view. I asked for the renovated rooms and they were spectacular. The service was amazing. I had very pooor wifi connections and complained and they put a aserver in my room. Staff go out of your way to make sure you are having a great time. Would highly recommend.

title: Location location
text:
Booked a deluxe double with 2 beds, family of 3.  I am a Gold member.

The cost of the excellent location of being across Central Park is that the street noise is quite bad if you're not use to it.  You are either facing the street or the back where the ventilation vents are so it's noisy either way.

I was told all 2-bed family room faces the back so Central Park view was not an option.

Initially was put in floor 5.  Room was very small and the noise was not bearable for me.  We switched to floor 11 next day (higher up from the vents).  It was slightly better noise wise.  Interestingly the room felt 30% bigger and apparently it was still classified as the same room type.

Not perfect still, the carpet was so old that there was some carpet nails sticking up.  Had to make sure we had slippers on at all time.

There was no complimentary water by default but as gold member  I had access to the lounge and I can bring bottle water up.  However the lounge does not open beyond breakfast on Friday and weekends.

Dinner and desserts provided at the lounge was excellent.  The only drawback is that there is a lack of staff in there to clean tables which ruins the experience slightly.

The staff and decor of the hotel at the lobby was faultless, as expected of any JW.

Hard to give it 5 stars.  I felt it lack the experience I expected from JW because of the location it's in.  Also felt undervalued as a gold member since I was given the smallest room and had to complain to get out of it.

Another tip:  there are 2 laundry on the same (58th) street.  One charges $25 minimum and the other $12.5 minimum.  Far cheaper than hotel services.

title: Big disappointment
text:
Our stay was disappointing as we expected great quality after staying at other JW Marriotts  We chose the hotel partly because we were able to book a King Suite which would fit our family of four and provide a view of the city.   Upon arriving on Friday afternoon at 1:30 pm, we were told that our room was not going to be available (we were given two different reasons for this).  We would be given two king rooms for the same price as the suite.  After about 20 minutes of trying to register, I was told someone would call us when the room was ready.  No one called so we tried again at 5 pm to check in (check in time is 4 pm).  We were able to check in to one room but the other wasn't ready until about 7 pm.  This has never happened to me before.

In the morning one of the rooms smelled strongly of cigarette smoke.  Also, there was hair all over the wall in the shower.  I explained this to the front desk and they apologized and said they would address both issues.  When we returned around noon, the room had been cleaned, hair was gone, but it smelled even more strongly of smoke.  They sprayed the room a few times which helped but never eliminated the smoke smell.

We reserved a rollaway bed for $75 per night for one of the kids, but it was the worst plastic mattress I have ever seen so we asked them to remove it, which they did.

Additionally, our reservation was for a high-floor room with a city view.  We did not get that.  And the final blow was that we were overcharged, which we had to fix at check-out.  

On a positive note, the location across from Central Park is nice and the king beds were very comfortable.

title: amazing lighting in luxurious suite
text: As a frequent traveler I was taken by the upgraded lighting in the room that was on the floor, made the evening glow. Gorgeous corner suite overlooking Central Park, so convenient to mid-town restaurants and Broadway. My new favorite NYC hotel.

title: JimS
text:
We just finished a three night stay at this Central Park South hotel.  How any property can have a third of  its rooms under renovation and still hold it together is impressive. 

For us we return to this hotel over many other choices because of the front end service of their concierge staff. As of now they have three who are selected for the Clefs  d'Or designation, the highest level in the world..
Kevin Oakes, head concierge is a remarkable man. He makes reservcations at Jean Georges or L'artusi or a window seat at The River Café when no one else can. And on indecently short notice.  And when we're at those restaurants we are always given special recognition, special seating and welcome.  The man has a gift of making restaurants find seating, and good seating. and the restaurants know it..  His attitude on every request is ''yes, I can do that'' then he figures out how..  Recently he sent a last minute text saying a guest had 2 tx sell  to Hello Dolly that night if we wanted them.  One just doesn't get that kind of personal service everywhere. 
 The service we receive from this man is the nr. one reason we return to JWM Essex Housel now 3 times in the last 7-8 months.
Good hotel made great by a good concierge staff.

title: Great Hotel and Location
text:
I've spent a week with my husband at the JW Marriot Essex NY; and it was great.
The rooms are comfortable, they have a good size -taking into account NY hoteles room sizes-, and the location is superb.
It is located on Central Park South, walking distance from the 5th. Av., Madison Av., Times Square and Columbus Circle.
The concierge lounge has excellent breakfasts, we really enjoyed them.
I would stay here again without any doubt.

title: Ok but not worth the reward points
text: Great location. Room size is good. It's petty but the night table was dusty and one light bulb was out. No fridge space only the mini bar. I used points for a free room but I think it's way over priced if I were paying. If you are visiting NYC you probably aren't spending much time in your room. I'd spend less on a hotel and use it on eating out or other tourist stuff.

title: Essex NYC
text:
I really enjoyed my time here; from the moment I arrived I was made to feel welcome. The architecture and atmosphere are overwhelming yet you are embraced by a glowing sense of family. 

Truly a must see, must do, must stay and wow!

title: Decent property with a great location on Central Park South
text: The best attribute of this hotel is the location on Central Park South.  If you have a room with a park view, it is amazing.  If not, it is average.  The hotel is undergoing renovations in summer of 2017, so make sure you get a renovated room, which are very clean, modern, and bright.  However, the designer majorly goofed on the bathrooms because there is no toe kick so you will constantly bang your toes on the vanity.  The concierge lounge has excellent food, but no ambience.  It is a shame that Marriott did not capitalize on the amazing art deco style that this hotel has, because their renovation could be any average Marriott in Des Moines instead of an historic iconic property on Central Park.

title: Amazing View!  Waste of Rewards Points...
text:
This review is based on my experiences during a 3-night Rewards Stay at the end of June.  

COST:  We paid 240,000 Rewards Points for three (weekend) nights in the city.  One can get a standard room for 40,000 points/night, but in order to guarantee a park view an additional 40,000 points/night.  At 80,000 points/night we really expected something special - it didn't happen.  Perspective:  A week later, my husband and I had an amazing 7-night stay at a JW property in London (Grosvenor House) and the total cost was only 40,000 points higher than our 3-night stay in NYC.

This is what I thought about our stay…

ARRIVAL:  When we arrived on the morning of our scheduled check-in, we were warmly greeted at the front desk.  The host checked our bags, showed us to the lounge so we could have a nibble, and told us that they’d call when our room was ready.  They could not have been nicer through the entire process.  Around lunchtime, I received a call informing me that our room was ready.  When we returned to the hotel we were handed our keys and told we had been given one the host’s favorite rooms in the hotel.  (In my experience – as someone who stays 300+ nights a year in hotels – statements like this are usually a red flag)

ROOM:  Two good things.  First, you really can’t beat the view.  As you can tell from the picture I added the view was absolutely spectacular. You can see north past the George Washington bridge.  Second, the bathroom was amazing.  I have friends who have lived in Manhattan for 20 years and haven’t had apartments as big as bathroom it in this room.  The bathroom was well stocked with great products.

Everything else in the room was downhill…  We had been given corner room, but there was a broken seal in the west window, so the double pane was filled with moisture/condensation – it might as well have been frosted glass.  Our sheets had little holes in them (see photo), every wooden surface was heavily nicked/scraped, and the small chaise/sofa thing had seen better days.  Basically, the room felt dated and dumpy – something one would expect from a budget chain that offers “suites” but certainly not from Marriott’s flagship luxury brand.  And most definitely not one would expect from a room with an 80,000 point/night redemption rate.

EXECUTIVE LOUNGE:  Though it got a little cramped late in the mornings, the Executive Lounge was well appointed with classic modern décor.  The staff bent over backwards to make us feel welcome.  Excellent breakfast options – something for everyone.  Note:  The lounge is only open for breakfast on Saturday and Sunday (it does reopen for appetizers Sunday evening).  It would be nice to have access in the afternoon for water or soda after a day out in the city. We did not try the appetizers on Sunday, but if they are anything like the breakfast, you won’t be disappointed.

OVERALL:  Loved the view.  Very happy with the location.  Walked away from the experience feeling ripped off.  Nothing about this experience made me feel like I was at a luxury hotel.  I don’t feel like this property cares about its premium members; if it truly cared, we would not have been given the room we were given.  This is not a Park Hyatt - unfortunately.   I was (and still am) so unhappy with the “luxury” product we were given that I’m currently booked at Hilton properties for the next three months – I was given their Diamond status during a match promotion and it is time to give it a try.  It is sad that it was a bad experience with Marriott’s flagship luxury brand that pushed this customer away.  I’ve been loyal to Marriott for years, but I need a reward program that can be loyal to me.

title: Wonderful hotel reminiscent of yesterday
text: We stayed at the Essex House for 7 nights and couldn't have been more pleased.  Everything was what you would expect at this great old hotel.  Don't stay here if you like modern but if you like a hotel with character and charm, this is the place.  We are elite gold members of Marriott and was treated to a wonderful full breakfast each morning in the executive lounge, and a generous evening meal as well.  Alcohol was not included but available.  The rooms were clean and spacious and ours overlooked Central Park.  It was quiet and security was very abundant.  I would definitely stay here again.

title: Great service, rooms and  location
text: Our extended family just spent 3 nights at the JW Essex house and the trip couldn't have been better.  We had several rooms on a high floor (we have Marriott status).  All rooms were newly updated and very spacious.  The beds were comfortable and we seemed to have a variety of pillows to chose from.  Three of our rooms were not street  facing and were very quiet.  The street facing room was quiet but also had a spectacular view of Central Park.  All the staff were courteous and friendly always asking if they could be of assistance or offering bottled water (which is a necessity for long days of sight seeing).  There were no mini fridges in the rooms but they delivered one to our room upon request.  The location can't be beat- across from Central Park, close to several subways, Columbus circle and a short walk to Times Square.  The executive lounge had a great selection of cold and hot selection, fruit and pastries for breakfast and was quiet full with guests over the weekend.  I only wish that the executive lounge stayed open on the weekend after breakfast so that guests could get a snack or refreshment.  The bar in the hotel restaurant had plenty of room, a decent drink selection and stayed open late.  Bottom line, the JW Marriott made this the most relaxing visit that I've had to New York!  Can't wait to go back.

title: Great location for a Concert in the park!
text: Went to see All Time Low play a concert in Central Park. Easy to get to hotel in NY. Great staff and amenities. Just wish that they had a pool!! Great food! Walk in and out of the park with ease!! Comfortable beds!!

title: Vacaciones en NY
text: Hotel mal atendido, los servicios son poco amables, bien ubicado.  Lounge pequeño, personal poco interesado en atender. No se conduce el precio y la categoría de 5 estrellas con la calidad de la atención

title: Love the location, but dated rooms and street noise will prevent us from returning
text:
We stayed here for 3 nights. We loved the location - across from Central Park, close to Columbus Circle, & close to multiple subway lines. We have status with Starwood, which is now honored by Marriott. We enjoyed the Elite lounge which has a complimentary breakfast with a variety of options (cereals, oatmeal, eggs, fruit, yogurt, juices, pastries).

Our room was a suite and it was wonderful to have a lot of space. However, the rooms are very dated and overdue for renovation. The hotel seemed very expensive (around $500/night) for the quality of the rooms, but you are paying for the location!

We were on a low floor and the street noise was terrible. The garbage truck was there for around an hour after 10pm each night. Traffic noise made it difficult to get a restful sleep.

title: Gran ubicación. Muy bueno
text:
Por u$s 600 la noche consigues una habitación en piso 35 con vistas al parque. Increíble. 
Te incluye un desayuno buffet de primera calidad y libre internet. 
Habitaciones cómodas y bien mantenido. La atención es muy buena. No es barato, lo sé, pero NYC, Piso 35 y Central Park lo valen. El desayuno solo costaba u$s 100 para dos que no pagamos ya q estaba en incluido en los 600. Era un desayuno..... almuerzo. Haz cuentas!

title: Great hotel, Unbelievable location
text: We had a work function in NYC over the weekend and I believe that we had around 7 rooms in total.  Your hotel and your staff, in particular Kevin Oakes, were nothing short of incredible!  As I am sure many are aware, traveling with 10+ guest, especially in NYC, can be a cumbersome task at minimum.  Kevin in particular made the weekend 100x easier in helping with transportation, reservations and guidance in the city.  It was so great that I tried hiring him… and Im not kidding but St Louis has a hard time competing with NYC when it comes to attracting young professionals.  I have traveled a great deal in my lifetime and I truly do think that he is the single BEST concierge that I have come across to date… and I have delt with some of the best in the world.

title: Prime location but overpriced
text:
Pros: Across the street from Central Park, down the street from Columbus Circle, the Elite lounge is pretty nice with good breakfast spreads, baskets of fruit and snacks, and all you can drink bottles of water and other canned beverages and coffee service

Cons: Not worth 70000 points a night. Those hard earned Marriott points (and it's hard to rack up Marriott points) got me an outdated room with a crap view and a sink where the knobs are in front of the sink and not beside the faucet. The building was also under construction so during the day there would be constant drilling sounds.

We were given a card to get into Elite lounge room because my husband is a gold member, but on the third day our card was denied. The card of someone behind us was also rejected but a third person allowed us in. The woman behind the desk chased after the flood of us coming in for our room numbers and then while we were checking out the nice breakfast spread she informed us we were not allowed to be in the Elite lounge. It seemed weird that they would suddenly tell us this on the third day of our stay.

If you plan to use points, save them for a place like Ritz Carlton Tokyo, where it feels like you're getting a steal for the points.

title: Good location but expensive
text:
Great location right on Central Park and within walking distance of Times Square and other attractions. Rooms are comfortable and nicely furnished and some have a great view of the park.
Public areas are nice, clean and modern and the service was excellent. Food and drinks in the restaurants and bars are expensive, but I suppose this is to be expected. Lots of bars and restaurants nearby though.
Small but comfortable and well stocked executive lounge. 
Overall, it feels like an upmarket hotel and as such, you can expect to pay upmarket prices.

title: Regular
text:
La expectativa con un marriott siempre es alta y este no la cumple. Reserve una habitación con puntos y era muy pequeña y con vista a un patio interior, al preguntar por upgrade con vista al central park me pidieron 350 usd la noche que es la tarifa plena sin puntos ( buena manera de atender a los viajeros frecuentes)
El baño amplio pero viejo , las llaves del lavamanos están al frente y no al lado del grifo, es rarísimo y ademas estorban mucho !!
La magia es el central park para dar una vuelta pero no hay nada mas
No justifica el precio

title: Nice, but worn
text: The JW Marriott Essex House was a well located hotel in Central Park South. It was easy to get to 5th avenue, museums, and shows. The staff were friendly, helpful, and accommodating. We had a extraordinarily large corner room, especially by NYC standards. The bathroom was fantastic and large. However, there were some points that were cause for concern. The room was falling apart. The shades were clearly well worn and needed to be replaced; as was the carpet. It seemed like some pieces of the room had been updated within the last decade, however, many were not. Additionally, the room service was borderline inedible. We are Marriott members and received a fantastic deal on this hotel due to a sale, however, if we had to pay full price I probably would not have been as happy as I was with our stay.

title: Over Priced and Worn Out!
text: I don't usually write hotel reviews unless there is something exceptionally good or bad!  In this case, we were not pleased with the Essex House.  Understand that you are in NYC and paying top dollar, but this is a hotel that is in bad need of an upgrade and renovation throughout.  The rooms were adequate but badly worn--the beds have a wood bottom frame around them that extends beyond the mattress but is hidden under the cover, and I hit my foot on it several times.  The location is outstanding for the Central Park area.  I have stayed at other NYC similarly-priced venues which are much more comfortable and appointed.  I simply would not go back to Essex House!

title: New York Weekend....reasonably priced suite on the park.
text:
Great Location!
Very nice place.  I was able to get a suite with king sofa pull out for kids for much less than it would have been at the Ritz.  This gave the family a great place to hang out before dinner.  The breakfast in the lounge was very nice as well.

title: An Iconic Hotel in a Great Location
text:
This was my second time staying at the Essex House.  It has now become my favorite New York hotel.  Let's face it--New York City is a very busy place.  In the past, I have stayed on the East Side and a number of times in the Times Square area.  I find it's easier to get around the city, particularly by subway, from the West Side, where there is a lot more service, but Times Sqaure is always packed with pedestrians.  Central Park South is a great neighborhood and although still busy, much less crazy than in Times Square.  I love the Essex House's location.

The hotel itself is an icon on the skyline as seen from the south end of Central Park.  The patterned marble floors and the chandeliers in the entry impress immediately upon entering.  Because I have status with Marriott, we were upgraded to a 1-bedroom suite this time and I fully enjoyed it.  Another great perk is the executive lounge, on the ground floor.  Their breakfasts are outstanding with almost anything you could ask for, including lthe standard eggs and breakfast meats, cheeses, fresh fruit, breads, lox, etc.  They also serve a nice meal in the evening, always with one hot dish.  For us, that worked out because we were often busy with theater or music activities, planned on late dinners after those activities, and needed a snack before we left the hotel.

The hotel staff is very friendly, too.  I will go back as often as I can.

title: Fantastic views of Central Park and stay for our family.
text: We have a family of 5. It's always tough to find a hotel in the city which can accommodate all of us. The King 1BR suite with a pull out sofa and roll away did just the trick. The location of this property is top notch too. Good service. Good maids. Great plush towels and robes. They are in process of working on exterior of building and modifying some rooms. Our sweet suite was perfect for our family. We used the fitness facility and it was great too. We loved our stay.

title: Very nice hotel on the edge of Central Park
text:
The JW Marriott Essex House hotel is in a great location on the edge of Central Park. It is not a cheap stay and the charges are in proportion to its size and location. We booked a standard room which was a decant size, if a little shabby, at the rear of the hotel with a view over the street. Wifi was available but the price meant we didn't bother and used the mobile phone network instead.The bed was a good king size and very comfortable. There are no tea and coffee making facilities so we brought our own travel kettle which did the job nicely.

The restaurant was fairly basic with a limited menu. We used it on a couple of occasions and found the food to be very tasty and well cooked. We also used the restaurant which was in the same area as the bar for a couple of post sight-seeing trips and can confirm the drink prices are very expensive. However, if one is staying in a 5 star hotel on Central Park what do you expect? We didn't breakfast at the hotel so can't comment on the quality of the meal.

Our checkout was a little confused due to the booking agents payment system failing. However, the check out staff were superb and sorting out the issues while we did some final sight-seeing. 

Overall, a great location and a nice hotel. Costs are high but not extortionate like some of the other hotels in the neighbourhood. Well worth staying here if you are ever in New York.

title: Be careful with the Central Park "view" rooms - they should be on a higher floor
text:
Was only going to be in NYC for a night and my wife wanted to spend the next day in Central Park. Opted therefore to pay a bit extra to stay here and splash out on both a Park View room and a picnic.

Technically speaking, it was a "Park View" but it was only on the 6th floor and therefore below tree level. I had been hoping for a view out over the park and not just looking at trees across the road!

The picnic itself was really good. We were contacted sometime before our visit and asked about any dietary requirements/preferences etc. The food was good and the picnic hamper, plastic dishes that fit well with the size of the hamper, knife, bottle opener and blanket which you were allowed to keep came in handy for the rest of our vacation.

The breakfast was good but a bit pricey, especially given that we were already paying a premium for the "Park View" and a picnic. 

Reception and bell staff were friendly but the bar/lounge staff a bit standoffish.

I however must say that the pre-visit contact and service by Mallory Jolly, Director of Guest services was excellent.

title: Wonderful and warm staff, excellent location, beautiful views and old world charm
text:
VERY HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.
The location is amazing, Central Park South! Perfect to visit Central Park's small amusement park, walks, boat house, zoo, people watching, etc. Sat and Sun in the park are obviously the best times to go...
The staff is amazing, warm, hospitable and friendly...
The decor: The hotel is up-market and the art deco details are really delightful, like the bronze elevator doors. Love the baby grand in the foyer, some NYC students came and gave a beautiful performance during one night while we visited. Rooms are 1930's elegant and large.
For Marriott Rewards members, guest services do a great job accommodating all kinds of (reasonable) requests. Mallory West and her team took care of all the little details that made this visit really special! The staff in the Executive lounge made us feel right at home: thank you Omar, Colin and Charly!
Finally, a note about the housekeeping folks, who did a great job throughout our stay, we loved the turndown service!

title: Care for the customer's needs are top priority!
text:
I had booked a stay at the JW Marriott Essex House to celebrate a friend's 30th birthday party and was looking forward to the experience of staying in a really beautiful hotel.  My experience did not live up to my expectations for this level a Marriott.

When I made my issues know to the Front Desk Manager Tim Henriquez, he immediately empathized with my situation and ensured that I was taken care of  without question. The customer service far exceeded my expectations and will be sure to book another stay when I visit again.

title: Very impressive property!!!
text:
This was a last minute trip so I really didn't know what to expect. The only available suite was the Park Deluxe suite. This suite is perfect for those who like to entrain several guests etc. This property is also close to all the major banks and directly across from Central Park in case you're an early AM jogger like me.

Only complaint this suite didn't come with a microwave or refrigerator so I'll be sure to request that in advance next time but IMO it's 2017 every suite should come with those bare essentials.

My other complaint is i requested a late check out so I could jump on several conference calls that morning/afternoon. For some reason that information didn't make it to housekeeping so I had to keep putting my calls on hold to answer the door.

This property is now my preferred hotel for New York. I do have hotel tour lined up for another major hotel chain located on West 57th street but for now this property is number 1 in my book.

Thank you!

Platinum Member
GB

title: Wonderful Hotel
text: This JW Marriott is a beautiful hotel. It is in the best location because it is near so many attractions and restaurants. The building was very clean and the rooms were spacious. The love lounge was very nice and the food was pretty good. The staff went above and beyond. Gina helped us with our stay and any questions that we had. Next time I am coming into the city I am staying at this hotel.

title: Un albergo di lusso non all'altezza del suo livello
text: Sono stata al JW Marriott per una vacanza di 5 giorni a NY con la famiglia. Posto in una splendida posizione di fronte Central Park, accoglie gli ospiti in un lussuoso ingresso che ben farebbe sperare sul resto della struttura. Così però non è. Le nostre camere erano spaziose ma con un arredamento obsoleto dei peggiori anni 70, di una tristezza indicibile. Il bagno della camera matrimoniale era piccolissimo. Nelle camere non c'era neanche il bollitore con il necessario per preparare un tea, come ho sempre trovato in alberghi di questo livello. Richiesto espressamente, ci è stato portato ma la mattina dopo lo hanno tolto di nuovo. Temevano di consumare troppa elettricità? La lounge, che dovrebbe essere a disposizione degli ospiti gratuitamente, viene chiusa dal venerdì pomeriggio alla domenica alle 17.00 e il personale di servizio per la prima colazione è decisamente scortese. In conclusione una vera delusione. Se volete godere dei servizi di un albergo di lusso, evitate questa struttura.

title: Huge potential but needs improvement
text:
Given that this is a luxury hotel and I am a platinum member (and a VIP coordinator handled my reservation) i really did expected more of this hotel. It was all in all a good experience, but felt like a lot of things could be improved.

Arrival: doorman and/or bell captain just standing there and did not help with luggage nor help with the door (kind of a useless doorman don't you think? this happens to me everytime i go in and out throughout my stay!)

Check-in: courteous and friendly front desk agent who kindly informed me that my junior suite was not ready (at 1pm) and that somebody will call me as soon as it is ready. We head to lunch and at 2pm i was informed that the room is ready.

Room: roomy and spacious. comfortable bed and pillows. outdated furniture that needs to be replaced (lots of dents and scratches). robes and slippers are provided (customary of a luxury hotel and definitely appreciated). No tea or coffee maker (there's an additional charge to request for one which is ridiculous!)

Bathroom: beautiful marble bathroom with separate shower and tub within enclosed glass and modern sink. nice aromatherapy associates amenities. TOILET EASILY CLOGGED (handyman came and fix it). Shower drain drains very slowly. BATH WATER IS CLOUDY!!!

Lounge: mostly cold food for breakfast, pastries, tea, coffee, juices. No service. All self serve. Basic but definitely a nice amenity to have! 

In addition, the DELICIOUS chocolate ganache cake for my mom's birthday was a tasty treat and surprise!

title: All About Location
text:
We were in a standard room which was adequate size based on rooms in New York which are typically small. The lobby is beautiful. The room was comfortable and we thought decent value for what we paid. We had access to the business lounge and the breakfast had abundant high quality offerings - scrambled eggs, bacon, lox, sausages and waffles/bread pudding every day. Also great selections of fruit, breads, pastries, bagels and cereal. The fitness rooms is large and well equipped. Hotel staff were attentive. 

The location is great. Adjacent to Central Park and near subway.

title: Exceeded Expectations
text:
The JW Essex House is located directly across the street from the south end of Central Park, and within walking distance to Broadway, Madison Square Garden, Times Square, Rockefeller Plaza, Radio City Music Hall...you get the idea. There are several excellent restaurants in or near the hotel. As rewards members, we enjoyed the breakfast and evening desserts during weeknights. 

Our room was perfect for us as a family of four in need of space to sleep but not a view. We had a very spacious interior room, with windows looking out onto other interior rooms. There were two beds and a sofa, generous drawers and dressing areas, and a spacious bathroom. Everything was updated and in clean, good condition. Since we were in NYC to see the city, this was perfect. 

The staff were all attentive and very kind and helpful. Staying at Essex House helped make our trip to New York City enjoyable!

title: Great Service
text:
The Essex House is one of my long standing favorite NYC hotels.  It has views overlooking Central Park.  They make their guests feel valued.  The rooms are well maintained and the staff is attentive.

The hotel has a really cool art deco feel.  When you step out of the lobby, you find yourself standing in one of the many New York City iconic locations.

title: Great location- horrible breakfast
text: This is a great location if you want to be by the park and shopping. Much less expensive than other places and decent service. The hotel is beautiful and we had adjoining rooms that had plenty of room.  The breakfast buffet was awful! It was sooo expensive and horrible powdered eggs and no choices. It was $9 for a cup of coffee. Crazy.  Party of 5 breakfast was over $200. Go down the street one half block toward the plaza to sarabeths for a much better option.

title: YUCK!
text:
When we checked in @ 3PM the Guest Relations Rep made me promise we would check out by 11AM. If I agreed she would  allow us to check in "early".  How kind of her.. this was a bad sign.

After 5 minutes in our small (I know it's NYC), moldy, chipped furniture, broken lamp room, old towels we decided this was no JW Marriott.  We must be in the wrong hotel.  

As a long time Marriott Platinum member i couldn't believe they would place a member  in a room of such low quality. 

I called the Front Desk Mgr and requested a renovated room on a higher floor. She said, "sorry we can't do that, fully committed" I said we will have to leave....no reply, so we left. They Guest Relations Rep questioned her mgr if we should play for 15 mins of parking. 

Off to the Marriott Marquis we went... clean, large, friendly, no broken furniture or mold.

What is Marriott thinking? This iconic hotel needs a full renovation. Not one guest she be allowed to stay in an un renovated room.

title: Distinguished property with fantastic views of Central Park and easy access to all of Manhattan
text:
I stayed a weeknight at the JW Marriott Essex House New York, receiving a complimentary upgrade to a newly renovated Manhattan Suite on the 17th Floor with a commanding view of Central Park.  

The hotel's classic exterior opens to a beautiful, but small lobby facing 59th Street and Central Park South entrance.  The ground floor hosts the Executive Lounge and the Southgate Restaurant, both of which warrant a visit.  The luxury suite offered a large sitting area with soft carpet and modular seating.  The sleeping quarters featured a soft, inviting pillowtop mattress and the prospect of a good night's sleep.   The large bathroom and douche à l'italienne finished the complement to the suite.

The finest point, aside from the architecture and luxurious accommodations, is the staff.  Every member of staff with whom I interacted--concierge, bell staff, reception, elevator attendants, lounge staff, bartenders, food servers, and room beautification--was delightful, pleasant, and friendly.

In terms of location, Central Park is directly across the street and it's a reasonable walk to garish, odious Times Square and the Theatre District.  Just across the street to the rear of the hotel on 58th Street is the famed French house  «Petrossian» with its selection of caviar.  It's located in the amazingly ornate Alwyn Court building, a fine example of French Renaissance style of architecture.

title: Exceptional Hotel but Security People are Rude
text: The hotel is a very fancy hotel with big chandeliers, rooms and corridors. The service is exceptional and Guest service too, but when we made our visit to this hotel Real Madrid team arrived which was non of our fault so the security team became rude and didn't let us go to our rooms which we have paid for!!!

title: Weekend getaway
text: As always, this place is simply amazing.  Great concierge staff, beautiful, clean rooms.  Southgate is a great restaurant on the property if you are worn out from walking the city and great for a drink.  The hotel is renovating floors right now so we weren't able to get our room of choice but they did try their best to accomodate as always.

title: Great time in NY
text: The hotel is gorgeous! Outstanding location and great service! Right at the Central Park entrance! Rooms are spacious and clean! The city is getting more beautiful every time we come for a visit! Loved it! Would stay there again any time!

title: Great hotel - clean rooms and very friendly staff
text: Room was very clean and quite.  The Consiere restaurant always had good food and friendly staff.  Close to the park and away from the crowds of Time Square. Staff was extremely friendly and helpful when making recommendations and reservations for restaurants.

title: Pior Hotel da rede
text: Pior recepção da rede. Quarto sujo e nada confortável, super barulhento. Já estou no segundo dia e a higiene no quarto cada vez pior. Funcionários mal humorados e me parecem descontentes com suas funções. Café da manhã já aprendemos como limpar nossas próprias mesas antes de iniciar o café. Não recomendo ! Nunca mais retorno neste

title: Nice Hotel in a Good Location.
text: Manhattan, although quite dense, can be surprisingly large from a distance perspective. This hotel is in a good location. Close to Times Square, the Theater District, Hell's Kitchen, the offices of Midtown, and the relative scenic sanity of Central Park and the Upper East/West sides. It has JW Marriott quality service and nice enough rooms.

title: Mmmmh it's a 3
text:
I was for a business meeting.. it's a JW marriot.. so don't misunderstand me: it's a good Hotel with way too many but.. check in service: its LONG!... check out: even longer!!!!! Hey ' marriot manager'.. it's not working!
We were in a meeting on the 2 floor and... no bathroom available... you have to go on lobby level
Excellent professional service.. 5+ in term of courtesy 
Need a renovation

title: NewYork@EssexHouse
text:
JW Marriott in Manhattan, NY has all the Top-Class marking aesthetically and service, I enjoy the decor as i walk thru the hotel and around surrounding area. Located between 7th Ave and 59th St, this hotel is close to Restaurants, Retail Shopping, and most of all Central Park. I had the pleasure of staying for a couple of nights and it was a great experience.

The room that we stayed in had some smoke smell in the bathroom which was an annoyance. I don't think the bathrooms had fans. My wife asked the front desk to do something like spray some type of air freshener but I don't think they ever came up since we were there for only 2 nights.

This is the reason why I gave only 4 Stars.

I enjoy JW and I will still book when they have specials for Platnium Elite members.

title: Memorable Birthday celebration ever 🎉🎂🎊
text:
My sincerest Thank you !!!
First to the following people for the successful, memorable birthday celebration 🎉 
Mallory Jolly ( Director of Guest Services & VIP's ) without her my special event won't come true 🙏

Vinny Sharma 
Tyler Cathcart 
Both Managers of Southgate Restaurant 
Very professional & accommodating 🙏

Jasmine 
Megan 
Collins 
Charley 
all from Club lounge 
Who happened to gave me special greetings for my birthday 🙏

Bell service were John ( petite )
Carlos , hardworking & pleasant 😊

Got to meet Terrence for the first time  , head of the Concierge 

Untiring service of Mr Mo 
my favorite waiter 🙏😊from beginning to end, even during my extended stay with friends 😇
& the dedicated service of Clinton from housekeeping, he helped me a lot 🙏
Kofi , funny valet parking guy was gladly to assist my incoming family & visitors 😄

Also , the security man named Dexter who assisted my other family. He was very calm and professional 🙏

I hope I didn't miss anyone else to special mention ✌️

About the room, 
It was the Central Park Terrace Suite!!!! Amazing view in the Terrace 😎😎😎😎😎
Thank God , it was perfect weather for my birthday celebration 🎉 

It has 2 bedrooms & 3 bathrooms 
Living & dining room- open concept 

Thank you Mallory for giving me the opportunity to experience my special day in your beautiful suite 🙏 It's just breathtaking to spend time @ the Terrace 😎❤️😇🙏

Plus the Manhattan Suite was also nice for my visitors from Texas & Canada 😍
We all love ❤️ the amenities of this property.  Safe & no chaos  whatsoever.🙏🙏🙏
My extended stay was great 👍 

Overall, I can't wait to go back again & again!!!!

My loyalty with JW Essex House always worth it 😇❤️🎉👍👌

Thank you very much everyone ❤️
Your outstanding service melts my heart ❤️

title: Great stay right on Central Park South
text: This hotel has it all, first class styling and lobby, very comfortable rooms, many with at least a partial view of Central Park. The staff were extremely courteous and professional. The convenience of this location cannot be overstated. It is not cheap, but, hey, that's why I have and use a Marriott credit card!

title: Overnight in Manhattan
text: Nice hotel across the street from Central Park. We are gold members and based on the Marriott on line check in we we supposed to get an upgrade - unfortunately I don think the happened. The room was small and only on the 3rd floor. Overall the room was clean and the breakfast in the lounge was very good. We had a nice visit.

title: Location and Service had me Return
text: Back again for a quick NYC visit and location near Central Park perfect for enjoying the Park and shopping.  Upgraded to lovely room with a view, Fanastic comfortable bed and linens for good quiet night of sleep.  As a Marriott Gold I had access to the special area with free breakfast and evening snacks.  Even better bottled water sodas and teas as needed. Staff just very caring and personable. Also as Marriot Gold free wifi

title: Classic and Great Hotel on Central Park South
text: Stayed here for two nights, June 16th to the 18th.   Wonderful staff that takes care of all of your needs.   The room was comfortable and due to the fact that I was upgraded had a fantastic view of Central Park.    Great bar and restaurant as well as one of the most memorable concierge lounges that I can remember.    The hotel is located close to 5th Avenue as well as Columbus Circle and a short walk to Times Square.   I highly recommend this property for anyone seeking a luxury experience.

title: Summer Visit at Essex House
text: We went to NYC to celebrate our daughter's 18th and our son's 16th birthdays. We wanted to stay somewhere special that was also within walking distance to many of the places we planned to visit.  Essex House fit the bill perfectly.  It is historic, lovely, and well situated across from Central Park. Who could ask for anything more? Additionally, if you are a platinum Marriott member the Executive Lounge is quite nice offering late breakfast up until 11 am each morning.  We thoroughly enjoyed that feature along with our large room that was pretty high up at our request and very quiet. The beds were super comfy and the room well stocked each day. I would only point out that although the hotel is older, the rooms could be updated a little. In particular, the bathroom is need is in need of an update. The round glass sink sitting on top of the marble vanity takes up nearly all of the space on the counter and there are 2 shelves nearby but they are directly above the toilet so you better keep the lid down! We had an older tub with a shower head and curtain and no coffee maker in our room. However, we did enjoy the coffee in the Executive Lounge. Our son has medication that must be refrigerated and we requested a refrigerator upon arrival and they brought one up right away. Very nice experience and the hotel staff are friendly.

title: Will definitely book it again!
text: I am a loyal SPG customer, but this experience was better than I have had for a long time. I have been platinum and gold for so many years, and rarely feel any value. This hotel treated us so nicely, likely nothing even to do with our status. They have us a lovely room at check-in, we're so kind to the kids at dinner (nice, casual eatery), and club breakfast was great. Add to that the perfect location, late evening stroll in Central Park, and we are thrilled!! Whole Foods is a block away, everything else too. Enjoy your stay!

title: The staff really cares about their guests - EXCELLENT SERVICE
text: I have stayed at the Essex House many times.  The location is the best in NYC.  The service is outstanding and the staff treats each guest as if they were royalty.  This past week, my family had two rooms and I asked for room upgrades if they were available. The hotel provided my grandkids with a very large double and provided me with a suite on the 39th floor.  Both upgrades were not only unexpected (I was hoping for one upgrade) but they rooms themselves were truly amazing.  If you plan to stay in NYC - you won't find a better hotel, a friendlier staff or a better location.  The Director of Hotel Services (Mallory Jolly) should be commended - what a great experience!!!

title: Good for business
text: This hotel is very well situated for our New York office and also has the advantage of being next to Central Park.  Rooms are quite spacious and comfortable, without being particularly modern in terms of fittings.  Good buffet breakfast.

title: Very, very good!
text: The city's mobbed, lots of hotels totally full, and we were lucky to find a large junior suite.  The staff is friendly and helpful.  The location is the best.  I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again. Get a room as high as you can to avoid street noise.

title: Disapponting
text: Quite disappointed. Arrived tired and looking for rest, and my booking included room upgrade and site credit benefits, but I was given mediocre room, since I was told the hotel was fully booked; I had to request the site credit twice and then show proof of it before they were able to finally 'locate it' in the reservation. Found hair all over the bathroom counter, around the sink, in the bath tub, and even on the ceiling!! Took photos in amazement. Tried turning lights out and only 1 out of 4 switches worked normally.
