Had to call the front desk and be given instructions to turn them off - literally holding each switch for 6-8 seconds while it dimmed off.. Later found proof the hotel did have availability and so demanded and was given a room upgrade (better view but smaller room, actually). 3-star experience in what should be a 4.5 star place. More issues at restaurant with foreign objects in food, topped off with over billing issues that had to be out sorted out (credited back) after the stay. Nice beds, fantastic steam room and classic old NY building and lobby, but doubtful I'd return for the cost.

title: Fantastica Ubicacion, Gran Hotel, regular desayuno
text:
El Hotel es altamente recomendable, esta cerca de la zona turista por excelencia Museos, Parque, Times Square... pero muy tranquilo, sin ruido y sin agobios.
El personal es fantastico a nivel general, siempre intentado ayudar, agradables y profesionales.
Las habitaciones amplias comodas y acogedoras, la cama de 10 tanto en tamaño como en comodidad, quizas la mejor cama de hotel que he probado.
Lo unico por lo que no lo merece la mayor puntuación es por los desayunos, no estan a la altura del hotel ni tampoco los camareros, nada profesionales ni agradables (los unicos en todo el establecimiento). El desayuno es muy caro y nada recomendable.
A 50 metros del hotel esta Bobby Vans con unos desayunos fantasticos.
El wifi del hotel muy bueno.

title: Wife loves this place
text:
Good value and nice NYC style you can't go wrong with Central Park South. Why would you not stay here? Everything in waking distance. Columbus circle a few minutes away
With restaurants for everyone as well. Great service at the hotel

title: Disgusting room
text:
Checked in and went to a show - next morning my wife tried to take a bath but we find the tub full of hair - then we saw dirty towels stuffed between closet and credenza 

Asked mgr to call - never called - if it was his family he'd be all over it 

They did clean room but no accommodation for the " experience "

Slipped drink coupon under door overnight - lol we were leaving that day 

Nice to be a platinum member

title: Great Landmak
text: Did you know this is where David Bowie lived?  Wonderful hotel.  Rooms are small but it's an old hotel and thats how they built them.  Amazing location across from Central Park.  I love old and new.  I love Essex House and W Hotel.  Which means that quality is important.  This is a great hotel, where you will likely have a star sighting as well.  Great fitness facility.  Free on-the-go coffee easy to grab on the way out.  Love love this place.

title: Great place to stay for all types
text:
I have been staying at this hotel for nearly 30 years and it has had quite a few owners , now part of the Marriot Group . Don't let that put you off , this Hotel still understands that it is the service that differentiates it from the others . Location is great for business , shopping and Broadway . Conceirge service is just exceptional and the team do not get phased no matter what the requests .They are alwasy uptodate on the shows , can find you a hairdresser and understand sometimes a guest just wants a simple restnt with good food . 
Breakfast is expensive , but if your main meal of the day you can indulge with a very good buffet . If not plenty of other places to go nearby .
Gym is well equiped , but could do with a rowing machine . Otherwise a clear cardio area and good weights section . Can get a bit busy , but easy to work round . 
Rooms are small but well fitted . Service exceptional and beds super comfortable . If you don't mind the view of the back of the hotel , there are savings to be made in the room cost . I do recommend bed and breakfast as the breakfast becomes very good value for money . 
Lastly I have noticed an investment in security and the teams are attentive . This can only be good ? 
I go to NYC 4/5 times a year and wouldn't stay anywhere else .

title: Great Location, Wonderful Staff, Modest Accommodations
text: My wife and I stayed at the Essex House while attending a family wedding being held nearby in Central Park South.  Having lived and worked in Manhattan for many, many years, I was familiar with this hotel as one of many that clients would stay at.  The hotel lobby on Central Park South, near Seventh Avenue, is large, comfortable, modern with certain style references to Art Deco.  Exactly what you would expect in this premiere NYC location.  The pleasantly diverse hotel staff are models of friendliness, attentiveness and discretion.  I can't say enough good things about them - from the receptionists, the porters, the cleaning staff, the telephone operators. The elevators are prompt, the floor common areas well lit and soothingly decorated.  Our room was a king bed and reasonably sized bathroom.  The appointments were good though looking a little worn in some places.  The light switches seemed to be an older design that required a slight learning curve to operate. One unexpected, heartwarming touch was the surprise of a smallf exquisite cake in the room to celebrate my wife's birthday.  Classy touch!

title: Average Stay- Disappointed!
text: My husband and I checked in and the front desk clerk only acknowledged him even though I was standing right by his side. The check in clerk asked my husband would you like one room pass or another for her. My husband recognizing the insult, quickly corrected the check in clerk by saying yes, one additional room pass for my wife.  I noted the unfortunate exchange. Rooms were a decent size however, the beds were not comfortable. Sheets on the bed seemed very worn and the bed creaked.  Walls were also very thin. Every time the guest in the room next door went to the bathroom it sounded as if it was in our room.  Luckily, we were only in the city for a short stay or I'd asked for a different room.  On a good note,  the breakfast for Marriott Platimium members was good. Great location across from Central Park.  Marriott has nicer properties. This to me was not JW quality. When next in NY, I'd probably stay else where.

title: Disappointing, Wish I'd read the reviews earlier
text:
We had booked a free stay with Marriott rewards because my husband is lifetime platinum premier.  Usually we are treated like royalty when we stay with Marriott due to my husband's status, but it was not the case here.  Maybe because it was a "free" stay.

We have been charged for the whole stay on our daughter's credit card as she arrived first in NY.  My husband had contacted the hotel a week before our stay to make the management aware of all this.  We were told it was not a problem for her to check in first. We noticed it the day after we arrived home as I was concerned that the express check out in our room was not working.  It said we owed nothing but would not respond.  I called the front desk and was told they would check us out just leave the keys in the room.   The day after we got home we called and were told by the person that answered the phone, we couldn't have our daughter check in and could not use a rewards certificate if my husband was not there.  We have done this many times as long as he handles it with the rewards line.  My husband spoke with a manager that said we were right and it would be fixed.  Fast forward two weeks and my daughter gets a bill! A nice person in accounting seems to have it fixed now.  We will see.

The room was not anything special.  The beds were very comfortable.

title: Eine Woche New York
text: Wir haben zwei Nächte im Hotel gewohnt. Mir hat es nicht so gut gefallen. Die Zimmer waren Durchschnitt. Der roomservice machte auch nur das nötigste. Dafür waren die Zimmerpreise zu hoch. Ich habe andere Hotels gefunden welche für weniger Geld mehr geboten haben.

title: siam tornati e resterà nel nostro cuore
text:
Controlli assurdi dell'immigrazione a parte, che per gli anni a venire sicuramente ci faranno evitare gli USA come la peste visto che viaggiamo esclusivamente per turismo e pertanto nulla ci obbliga a tornarvi, anche questa volta Essex House ha continuato ad affascinarci per l'autentico lusso fatto si di architetture magnifiche, ma soprattutto per il servizio ineccepibile fin nei minimi particolari.
Oltre all'estrema quanto spesso cordiale professionalità di tutto il personale, basti dire che ogni mattina alle 5,30 (la mia prima sigaretta, poi torni a letto) arriva il furgone dei fioristi, anch'esso elegante, che provvedono alle bellissime decorazioni floreali sparse per tutte la hall in un tripudio di orchidee, rose, peonie ed altro.
Se per lusso intendete ambienti rarefatti e denaro ostentato sicuramente questo non è l'albergo che fa per voi. Diversamente provatelo e siamo certi che vi conquisterà.

title: What a view
text: We had a room with a view of central Park. It was very impressive. Although the room was a little dated it was very comfortable and nicely decorated. Close to everything and the trains are nearby and easy to navigate.

title: Comfort in The Midst of Hustle and Bustle
text:
Stayed here for 5 nights and I really enjoyed my stay. We did a lot of touristy things as well as saw two shows - a lot of walking but glad we stayed here. 

This hotel is located just south of Central Park and is close to Broadway theatres and Times Square but yet far enough away from all that hustle and bustle. 

We were greeted cheerfully and promptly by hotel staff the moment we stepped onto the property. Lobby is clean and very chic. The elevators are very ornate, beautiful and surprisingly fast - push the button and ding, the doors open - I never had to wait for one. 

We had requested for a room on a higher floor and facing Central Park but none of our requests were available at the time of check in. We were instead given a room on the 3rd floor facing 58th Avenue. I did not like this room at all - mainly because, for the first night, all I heard was the ruckus from garbage trucks and loading trucks (and whatever other trucks were on 58th Avenue) the ENTIRE night! The noise sounded like it was directly outside our window. Whatever happened to sound-proofing buildings or noise curfews?! In addition, we were also arms-length away from the building across the street... I can see what our neighbours were watching on tv! Talk about a lack of privacy. We requested for a room change the next morning and they happily accommodated our request. We were moved to the 14th floor - still facing 58th Avenue - but at least it was a bit quieter and there's no one directly across from us.

Our room was beautiful... comfy firm king bed with (too-soft-for-my-liking and it-gave-me-a-kink-in-my-neck) pillows, chaise lounge chair, desk and leather desk chair. The bathroom was beautiful and modern but it offered lavender aromatherapy bath products - couldn't use it because I'm allergic to lavender so I ended buying my own products. There's no coffee maker in the room but if you have lounge access, you can zip down the supersonic elevators in 1 nano second and get one (or three) in there. 

We had Executive Lounge access because of our reward status. The breakfast was delicious - a mixture of hot and cold breakfast items but my FAVE is the smoked salmon, which I had every day. Too bad there's no cook-to-order egg station though. Breakfast also included great fresh fruit selections and it didn't end till 11am which meant no unnecessary early rising just to feed a grumbling empty stomach. I love that they had bottle water and soft drinks available too - great to take a bottle of water to our room in case we get thirsty at night. Happy hour (or as they call it "evening offerings") had a great selection of hot and antipasti items - our fave is the honey roasted mixed nuts. 

Concierge was helpful and offered commuting advice on how to get from point A to point B. Housekeeping was delightful - they greet you every time they see you! 

Please note that parking is (eye bulging-ly) expensive at this hotel (and in Manhattan in general) so take this into consideration if you're driving to NYC - look to park your car elsewhere. We did and while in the city, we walked everywhere. You'll get nicely toned calves and bust a record on your pedometer.

Would I stay here again? Oh yeah, for sure, but I'll have to save some money (or points) first.

title: Sadly being eclipsed by boutique hotels who provide little extra touches to make you feel welcome
text:
We've stayed here before,  nearly 5 years ago for my 50th and at that time the staff could not have done enough for us and rescued us from a dreadful apartment rental disaster. So for that we will always be grateful. 
Back here yesterday for 5 days and having stayed at various NYC hotels since then this, for the price, is just so disappointing. Yes it has a lovely foyer its in a great location and the staff are mostly helpful ( more in that later)  but the rooms are dingy and worn out with bits missing from various surfaces particularly in the bathroom. The high floor we requested when booking was not forthcoming and we had to ask to be moved- better but not a massive amount although at least we can now see sky. No water in the room no opportunity to put anything in a fridge that clearly assumes all the guests are thieves, no way to make a hot drink without paying to rent a kettle. The small towels in the bathroom are too small to wrap your hair in - annoying! 
And in further developments- because we are still here- the kettle saga continues. I rented one that was then removed and asked for another last night to be told- no problem it'll be right up- waited 40 mins feeling jet lagged and just wanting to go to bed- phoned down again to be told we have no kettle for you! When I asked why someone could not have phoned to let me know I was just met with 'it's not my department'. This is not something that works well when you are paying this much a night and Essex House needs to bear that in mind. And so it continues this morning still no kettle available so I asked hopefully 'where can I get the free coffee promised for Marriott cardholders'  'in the restaurant in the lobby' I was told- so got up, clothes on trotted down to the lobby only to find said restaurant doesn't open till 7- would this not have been good information to pass on?  Sadly now even more disappointed. 
So if you want a faded hotel in serious need of a refurb with staff who do not go the extra mile in a hotel that does not think it good customer service to provide you with free tea and coffee making facilities or even just water in your really quite over priced absolutely no frills room then maybe this is for you. But the icing on the cake is that on Tuesday night- our last in NYC we are having to move hotels- why? Because the price of this same room doubles for that one night and it is seriously not worth it. So we'll be going to the a boutique hotel down the road the Refinery and will report back on that in due course. Something has happened here since our last visit in terms of customer service and not in a good way. Report for the JWMarriott Essex House - you need to do better location is not everything.

title: a bit dated
text:
our room had issues, it was tiny and in need of renovation. considering it was an upgrade, it was not acceptable. Breakfast was boring and static for choice.

On the other hand, the staff were extremely helpful, they checked us in immediately when we arrived after a red-eye from LA.

title: good service, great location
text:
great location. nice rooms and friendly staff. one of the best jw marriott hotels i have stayed so far.
South of the central park, near the apple store and 5th avenue, great for going anywhere on foot.

title: Perfect Stay on Central Park
text: Perfect location, comfortable room and great staff.  You can go out the front and straight into Central Park or out the back an head a few blocks to Broadway and the theater district.  Lots of places to dine as well.

title: Overnight stay
text:
Let me preface my review by saying I'll always love the Essex House. I got married here 22 years ago and guests still rave about how amazing the wedding was.

We decided to treat ourselves and plan an overnight stay in the city with our kids. It was a splurge, the room was $600+ for one night.

At this rate, I expected more elegance and more attention to detail. It's "fine" (except for the bathroom) but I definitely expected more.

The stunning lobby has been  marred by large garish color photographs of Central Park being hung as "art." 

I paid about $50 extra to have a room with two double beds and was given a king room with a pullout couch for my kids. I wasn't happy about this but the kids said it was fine so I didn't complain. (Noting this because to be fair the hotel did not have an opportunity to make good on this without us bringing it up.)

We arrived at 10 pm and had to figure out the parking by ourselves. (When the bellman did arrive he was very courteous.) The front staff was not rude but also wasn't welcoming. 

The room itself was cheaply renovated to look like a business class hotel. It was quite spacious and the actual bed was comfortable. The bathroom smelled odd; not at all what I would expect from a five star hotel. Also, our room had views of brick walls. I'm not complaining about the views because we didn't pay for a nice view. However, to cover them, the small windows had excessive drapery, making the room feel windowless, like an inside suite on a cruise if there were such a thing. 

I have stayed in the Waldorf and the Plaza, and even though I am a Marriott club member, I would have to say that while the stay was acceptable, it didn't feel luxurious and wouldn't stay here again unless I got a deeply discounted rate.  This grand lady of New York has changed hands at least twice since my wedding, and she seems to have suffered for it.

title: Beautiful overlooking Central Park
text:
From the moment you walk in you feel the classic beauty and reminisce with the past. It is upscale modern classic
All hotel personnel very helpful and friendly. 
all willing to assist if they think you look lost. All say hello in the elevators and introduce themselves. 
The golden key lounge is beautiful subtle and comfortable to visit with plenty of TV with different channels on 
Friendly cell captains loved my stay here so will you!

title: Class
text: Excellent location with spacious rooms and delicious food. Central Park views are stunning. The staff was friendly and the bar served up cocktails with finesse. Only downside is there was construction going on with building behind it when I stayed there beginning of May, but that sort of thing is common in most areas of Manhattan.

title: I have always liked this hotel but...
text: I love the location and the way this hotel is, however , it looked aged . The bathroom and even the towels looked like they were old .On top of it , the street in front of the hotel was under construction and it was a total mess getting in and out of the hotel . The room even felt cramped . My previous stays had never felt that way. I hope it is not a Marriott effect on this hotel.

title: Disappointed
text:
We revisited after a long lapse ;although we had mixed memories we decided to give it a go due to my long experience with Marriott.
The first shock came at the check-in when , although the room has paid in full , in advance , its cost has been included in the amount blocked of my credit card ! 
Soon after that although I mentioned that we need a quiet room we got a very noisy one and the shift manager tols us that the hotel was fully booked . We could not sleep due the noise coming from outside from the climatization plant. We were promissed that we will get a quiet room the following day.
Next day , afternoon we asked what happens and a different manager told us nonchalantly that they have no soultion ; with a lot of nerves , after alternating pressing 
and cajolery we got a better room , NOT quiet but bearable ... Reading other reviews I wonder how the other guests were so lucky ?
We got a room with a view but a distorted one : the beutiful panorama of the Central Park was impeded by both fixed and moving scaffolding
The old habit of two visits per day of the room maid was gone 
The room service told me one day that a coffee could only arrive after 45 minutes !!!
Finally : maybe the hotel management could use the time spent to answer the reviews by supervising the staff ...

title: Location
text:
Right on Central Park and  a block from the subway makes this a great location for a NYC visit. The first room we had was a large double with a lot of light but no view.  The second room was even larger and had a view plus the bathroom had a soaking tub and separate shower.  The rooms were a bit dated but we're large and quite.

There is a nice gym on the third floor which while not particularly large was never near full.  The gym also has saunas and showers.

The bar and restaurant is a bit basic.

Service was good and prompt.

title: Great location.
text: Well maintained, elegant and recently refurbished hotel. Great location across the street from Central Park. Within walking distance of most sites in NYC, and there is a a very close subway stop if you do not like walking. Great service from staff with easy check-in and-out. Spacious room and restroom which were maintained very well and clean! Highly recommended for a romantic getaway.

title: Historic property, needs some improvement
text:
This hotel has a storied history on Central Park South and overall was a good property for a NYC vacation for two. However, there was room for improvement. When we checked in, our room's AC didn't work. We called the front desk, they said they sent a mechanic by while we were out to supper, but it still was too hot. At 11 p.m. when we returned we called again, a different mechanic came, worked on the unit and said it had never been turned on. He did turn it on, but it made a rattling noise, probably why it had been disconnected.

It worked, and because we were exhausted from a day of travel we managed to sleep despite the rattle. 

There was no follow up call from the management staff apologizing or asking if our problem had been resolved. I was surprised, as this isn't the level of service one usually encounters at a JW Marriott property.

In addition, the room carpet was past the point where it should have been replaced, being stained in a number of areas. 

Finally, the hotel restaurant and lounge was closed on Friday night for a private function and we weren't notified that would be happening. When we checked we were told an email had gone out to the guests, but it wasn't received. A message or call to the room the day the restaurant was going to closed (or the night before) would have been a better option.

However, in general the staff was pleasant and the location on Central Park South made this worth a visit.

title: Central Park Quiet
text:
This hotel is our favorite hotel in NYC! Centrally located midtown, walking distance to everything, theater, concerts, museums, Central Park. The only negative is the scaffolding which mars the exterior beauty but the lobby, rooms, and executive lounge were wonderfully appointed. 
The staff were also helpful and friendly. The concierge even arranged our travel between Newark Airport and the hotel. 
We enjoyed the bar and loved watching the Kentucky Derby on a huge wall. They offer a special charcuterie plate and Mint Juleps. Lots of fun rooting with the crowd on Saturday afternoon.

title: Views of Central Park
text: Nice staff, great location, excellent views.  Clean.  Not fussy but nice.  Rooms are big and beds are comfortable.  Will stay again. The doorman gave me water when I came in from a run and the front desk gave us great suggestions for bars and restaurants.

title: One of My Favorites
text: This is one of my most favorite places to stay in NY. Staff is excellent, rooms provide a great sense of comfort, very quiet, excellent amenities, and one of the bes(if not the best) Concierge Lounge buffets.

title: The Essex house is no longer the Pride of Central Park South
text:
My wife and I have been going to the Essex House for at lease three decades. It was once the most elegant of all the choices. along picturesque Central Park South, which made it a great spot among NYC hotels. This seems to no longer be the case. Our disappointment started with check-in at the front desk. It is obvious that the system that the desk staff works with is very slow and it takes a very long time for them to help each person - leading to long waits. We then went to the lobby restaurant for tea and had to get up from our seats to find a waiter. My wife reported that the ladies room in the lobby restaurant was very dirty.
Moving on to the rooms, the lighting mechanisms consist of some sort of dimming switch that requires about 10 seconds each time you want to turn off a light - assuming of course, that you can figure out how to do it. In the bathroom, the toilet is so low and the flushing handle also so low that I worry for older guests.
At Sunday breakfast, the staff member that was busing the table was not-so-subtly rushing us along even though we had been there for less than one  hour.
I should mention the bright spots - the front door staff, bell staff, and security men were all very polite and helpful.
All in all - our experience might have been acceptable at a medium-grade hotel with lower room prices, in a less competitive hotel market. But on Central Park South, NYC, at the prices Marriott is charging, they had better figure out a solution to these issues or they will lose discerning travelers to  competitors. They have already lost THIS discerning traveler - We are unlikely to go back to the Essex House and we are sad to see this once top-of-the-line property having fallen so far.

title: Excellent location and service!
text: Stayed here while attending the NRF convention.  The location was outstanding, right in the heart of everything and I had a tremendous view overlooking Central Park.  The staff could not have been better.  They responded to every request and went above and beyond.  The concierge lounge served a much greater variety of offerings for breakfast then I have experiienced in other locations.  The food was excellent.  The rooms were clean and well appointed.  Everything you could ask for and more.  The room was extremely comfortable and met all my expectations.  Truly a pleasure to stay here.

title: Not bad !
text: This hotel is in the center ! So traffic jam to get there ! But it is correct. Not very expensive for the area ) a bit old fashion ! Service is good and good not tried ! We went elsewhere ! You are in front of Central Park and near 5th avenue !

title: Old world luxury
text: I stayed 5 nights for business and was very satisfied with this hotel, The staff is professional and efficient. The rooms are spacious, clean and quiet. The bed was one of the most comfortable I have slept in at a hotel. I had a wonderful view of Central Park. The hotel faces Central Park making it easy to go for a morning walk or run.

title: Extremamente Barulhento
text:
Após horas de vôo para uma viagem de lazer, é lamentável que não se consiga dormir devido à um barulho no qual parece que continuamos voando pois nos remete à turbina de avião.
Solicitei por 3 vezes junto à recepção a resolução deste inconveniente , fui ignorada nas duas primeiras vezes e na terceira , houve a troca do quarto que para minha surpresa era ainda menor e igualmente barulhento.
Já passando da meia noite e sem solução , voltei à recepção e chamaram o gerente que me informou que todos os quartos com duas camas tinha o mesmo perfil ou seja barulho de turbina de avião , e me ofereceu tampões de ouvido !!!!!
É um total descaso com o hóspede.

title: Always enjoy the Essex House
text: A beautiful Saturday night, park side room and all the classy atmosphere you can ask for.  Always enjoy the Essex House.  Alicia at the front desk and Michael at the concierge desk were terrific.  Love it.

title: Very disappointing
text:
This hotel used to be well managed under the Jumeirah group but is in constant decline now. Every visit is now worse than the last. The rooms have not been upgraded in a long time, the facade of the hotel always seems to have some permanent scaffolding and the spa, the restaurant and overall service levels are way below expectations.
I would certainly not recommend this hotel and will no longer stsy myself

title: Old School NYC
text: This historic NYC property exudes old world charm and, if your room is facing Central Park, has spectacular views. I was here for one night on business and had no major issues; the room was modern, clean and comfortable and the location is great. The staff was friendly and attentive. The only minor annoyance was that I had to fill out some sort of voucher for a couple of beers I had in the lounge. I don't get to NYC nearly as much as I would like, but I would definitely stay here again either on vacation or for business.

title: Great hotel. The nicest I have stay at NYC!
text: Stayed here for one night after our overseas flight was cancelled. I always wanted to stay here and “this was my chance!” We are Platinum members and used points. With our status, we got a 4 pm checkout. Check-in was simple and the executive lounge was well stocked and well organized. The workout facility was good……for a hotel workout facility.  The facility offered fresh apples, water, towels, and plenty of equipment. All staff throughout the hotel were excellent. Just a great location right across the street from Central Park. The hotel is a 15-minute walk from Times Square and many of the best restaurants.  Lastly, getting a taxi to the airport was a breeze.

title: Wonderful customer service
text:
I really want to share this because of the negative reviews I read prior to arriving at this property. I know that  sometimes reviews can be taken with a grain of salt as everyone has such different expectations but I rely on trip advisor to guide me and the recent reviews were not pleasing. 
I was using points and I wanted to ensure that we had a terrific time and no major concerns. I was so nervous I called the hotel a few times and each time they were beyond patient and reassuring 
We arrived and were able to get checked in early.We were upgraded to a double room from a king size and the room was so much larger than l expected [not typical for NYC].The room was super clean, beds and linen were so comfortable and the room had a partial Central park view. The hotel is a bit dated but they are renovating starting in May so it will be very stylish.
The front  area of the hotel has beautiful  flowers and chandeliers in the hallways are outstanding. The staff -the front desk, cleaning staff, concierge lounge and  really everyone who works there were so friendly and willing to help you with whatever you needed. The breakfast in the lounge was outstanding and the staff had huge smiles on their faces ,greeting returning guests and welcoming new ones. I have not had that kind of caring attitude in most of my travels and it made you feel very welcome.
The 
So please DO NOT  worry about this property- you will be pleasantly surprized and if you are really  concerned the hotel encourages you to contact them directly ,as they will answer any questions and alleviate any concerns. Enjoy and have fun in NYC 
JW Marriott, I can't wait to return.

title: True Luxury
text: Christmas in New York was made particularly memorable by my stay here. All the people I met and who took care of me during my stay here made all the difference: smiles greeted me and ready hands took my luggage or baggage. Really great staff!

title: Пора ремонтировать.
text: Я неоднократно останавливался в данном месте, на моей памяти было несколько брендов , ну и конечно же JW Marriott . С сервисом стало не хорошо , а просто так себе. Мебель вся старая  ковры вытертые. В румсервисе кушать нечего.   Ценник несправедливый. Одним словом все сто осталось  это отличный локейшен с центральным парком.  Буду искать другой отель для следующего раза.  Надеюсь , на его реновацию. Сам Брэнд меня всегда до этого посещения устраивал.

title: R. Berkowitz
text: It was interesting to read that other guests had similar housekeeping annoyances as we had.  Upon returning to our room we found that there was only one bath towel so I called housekeeping to ask for another.  After all, there were two guests in the room.  Housekeeping said they would take care of the towel.  Forty minutes later l called again and there was no answer.  I called once more and the response was that I had just called and they would be there soon.  The towel never arrived.  Upon checking out, we mentioned it to the desk clerk and he said that one towel was standard operating procedure which, was more insulting than not getting the towel.

title: Good but a few anomalies
text:
The location of this hotel is superb if you want to be out of the bustle. When I stay in NYC by myself on business I prefer to be lower down town closer to Time Square but this trip was a treat for me and my wife and I booked a suite at Essex House with a view onto Central Park. There are many subway options in close proximity so getting around Manhattan is easy from this hotel. Broadway and Time Square are an easy and pleasant walk down from Central Park and Bloomingdales, Lincoln Centre
and The Met are also easily walkable ( Carnegie Hall is round the corner). The hotel is comfortable and perhaps a little tired. Our suite was very comfortable but a few observations: 
- while there's a good champagne (Louis Roederer) in the mini-bar, the glasses are plastic !
- the bathroom is spacious and could accommodate a bath but there's only a shower ..... and the water pressure is strong but can't be adjusted ( only temp can be adjusted)
- the air conditioning is good and quiet
- the Aromatherapy bathroom accessories are excellent
- the prices for breakfast and room service are steep ..... there are many excellent breakfast options in close proximity that are half the cost. 
I'm glad we chose to stay here on this trip but I'm sure I'll also consider other options on our next visit.

title: "Decided to stay at the Essex House for a treat and was very disappointed!"
text: My husband and I are frequent visitors to New York.  We have a daughter who lives there.  On our last visit we decided to treat ourselves and stay at the Essex House on Central Park South.  But we were disappointed right from the start.  The room they gave us was small.  I think it was really a single.  It had one robe and one pair of slippers and a closet like a broom closet.  We were there for three days and the entire time there was an empty refrigerator left on the floor.  The tub was clipped up and the water did not drain properly.  At the end of a shower you were standing in about 6 inches of water.  The rugs were a bit dirty and the woodwork banged up.  In general the service was good.  Breakfast was fine.  I did order room service one night and was in a bit of a hurry.  They were very prompt in getting my food to me.  And housekeeping was fine.  I have stayed at many Marriott hotels in many different locations.  They have set a standard that I have come to expect.  The Essex House fell short during this stay.

title: Best way to spend our last night in NYC
text:
My husband and I stayed here with our daughter who had just had brain surgery at NY Presbyterian. We had been staying in another location for two weeks closer to the hospital and came to the Essex House for our last night in NYC before heading home. We were exhausted and emotionally spent when we arrived. Walking into a Marriott is like coming home to us. We were treated so kindly by the receptionist and she even upgraded our room. (I think she could tell how much we needed a moment of peace after the chaos we had experienced). I wish I remembered her name, but she asked me if she could give me a hug and I will never forget her compassion for me as a person in that moment. What a fabulous employee to have on your staff! 

We had the most peaceful last night in New York and were finally able to get a good night sleep. Thank you so much Marriott Essex House for being a top notch hotel chain. We will be back in June for follow up appts and hope to get to stay here again.

title: Very nice place but a couple of disappointments
text:
The Essex House is a very nice hotel in a superb location.  Paid a little extra for a view of Central Park and it was totally worth it.  Rooms are plenty large for NYC and have nice TVs and amenities (although no coffee).  I stayed on points so hard to assess overall value.
To the disappointments...as a Marriott platinum member i had access to the exec lounge which offered a wonderful breakfast each day.  Problem was it was often too crowded and one day it was inexplicably closed early without any prior notification.
Second problem was after returning around midnight from being out all day, i had no towels in my room.  When i called down to have them brought up it took a little bit so i called back.  The rude phone answerer the 2nd time told me i called back faster than they can normally deliver, kind of a weak answer...when they did finally deliver we had fallen asleep and they woke us up.  Overall, pretty shoddy.
So, bottom line, mediocre service, great locale and nice room

title: The most spectacular stay so far while visiting New York
text: We have stayed many times in New York both in hotels and apartments through airbnb.  Our stay this weekend at the JW Marriott Essex House exceeded our expectations!  From the time we checked in, (Melvin at the front desk was so warm and welcoming) to each time we returned out after sightseeing as well as each morning at breakfast (at their incredible executive breakfast buffets for Marriott Gold/Platinum members) we felt so appreciated as a guest.  The location is spectacular as well.  It is within walking distance of the theatre district but away from all the chaos of that area.  The hotel overlooks Central Park right where tourists pick up horse drawn carriage rides.  Without question, I will book our next stay to New York at this hotel!

title: Great location, very accommodating, perfect for our stay.
text: We stayed here for 6 nights and it was perfect for what we needed, the location was great being right opposite Central Park and two blocks from 5th avenue and broadway and it is right by the subway. When we arrived our room was quite noisy as it was by some kind of vents so I called reception and they gave us a choice of three different rooms and we moved straight away with no problems. There is some kind of work going on outside and there was scaffolding up but this had no impact on us - the staff were all really friendly and on the last day our flight wasn't until the evening and I asked for a late check out which they sorted with no problem. The bathroom in both of our rooms was a little tired and the wardrobe was really small but these are my only negatives - really sad to leave New York and wanted to stay another week.

title: Good one but I don't like it
text:
The hotel is in good location, just next to the central park and subway lines. The service, facilities, and staff are as nice as ot should be for Marriott. 

However, there are smth I don't like about this hotel, compared to the price, e.g. 
1) Even next to central park, but the rooms has no park view
2) No free wifi in the rooms, only at the lobby
3) Executive lounge is so small and crowded that it needs queue

title: Hotel correcto
text: Hotel correcto que no llega a la categoría de bueno teniendo en cuenta la relación calidad precio. Un hotel de lujo, a precios de lujo que requiere mejorar prácticamente en todo excepto en la calidad del servicio de todo el personal.

title: Satisfied and Great Location
text:
We were satisfied with our 3 night stay. There is renovation (or maintenance) going on, so you have to walk through scaffolding at the entrance, and on the roof where some rooms overlook Central Park. Everyplace needs periodic maintenance. However, Management should have given us a heads-up that workers might be going up and down on a moving platform immediately outside our window. Still, we were pleased with our rooms and the way a temperature control problem was resolved, thanks to Alicia. The location is great. Bottom line: we would go back.

Tip for breakfast: the Epicerie Boulud in the food hall in the basement of the Plaza Hotel nearby is much better than Bouchon Bakery and Cafe at (Columbus Circle) where the service was slow and we were served a leaden, stale croissant.

title: Wonderful hotel
text:
Fantastic staff at ths hotel, just superb every single one of them.

The bedrooms are huge with the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in .

This is one hotel I would definitely return too in a superb position opposite central park

title: Modern Hotel with Classic Bones
text:
This is honestly my favorite Marriott property (that I have been to so far at least). I came here for my birthday weekend and was upgraded from a Manhattan view suite to a deluxe Manhattan view suite. In a prior stay I stayed in a regular Manhattan View Suite and the difference is that you trade a kitchen for a half bath, at least between these two suites. However having stayed in two of them I feel all are unique. The suite was sleek, clean, and modern with plenty of room to stretch out, which was great for watching the NCAA tournament. This is one hotel where suite really means suite, which isn't always true these days. The living room had a view of Carnegie Hall and you could see a sliver of central park from the bedroom. I feel like most of the central park views at this property belong to the condos, although I am sure Marriott kept a few. But if the park is your thing it is right out the front door so there is that. The sofa bed in the living room also makes these suites a great choice for groups of friends traveling together.

If you have access to it the free breakfast in the executive lounge is excellent, with plenty of hot and cold options and fresh orange juice. It is a great way to start the day off. My friend and I also did late night room service, which came quickly and was very good. Service through the weekend by the hotel staff was excellent. This truly is a high end hotel which lives up to expectations.

If you have alot of Marriott points this is an incredible value as a points redemption.

title: Disappointing experience
text:
We booked an 8 day stay as a special treat
Disappointed to arrive after a long flight and find the room dirty
The night manager was great but generally the rest of the staff were below par  
It is a good location in the historic Essex house 
We had stayed about 5 years ago when the hotel was operated by a different chain
The rooms are a good size but are pretty tired
The joinery fittings are not historic but are very worn
Cleaning during our stay was not very good -  the toilet was not cleaned under the seat
Our room was on the 16 th floor above the top of another building which had its air con plant & was very very noisy
I would not stay there again
Only positives 
Bed very comfortable
Good sized room
Got free wi fi because of length of stay

title: Life Time Premier Elite
text:
Being a Marriott Life Time Platinum Premier Elite does not mean anything at this property !!! Guess because it is NYC 

I am not only disappointed but so frustrated with the customer service at this property and the Manager on Duty pretty much told me it does not make any difference if I am a regular guest or a Life Time Platinum. The room they gave is the best !!! Take it or check out 

I stay at a Marriott every week within USA and internationally at JW and have always enjoyed the hotel staff and management taking care of its Life Time Premier Platinum, so I thought I would give this JW a try. Needless to say, it was my mistake. 

I have requested the GM of this property to call me in the morning and tell me that Life Time Platinum status means nothing at this property!!! 

I am confident no one would bother to call me 

Very un happy dissatisfied Marriott life time premier Elite member

title: Incredibly (Below) Average -- Though We Did Find Some (Free) Underwear
text: Four things:  first, we found strange (not ours) underwear under the table by the bed.  Next, the wallpaper was peeling off the walls.  Third, after receiving an email confirming check out time was 12 noon, was browbeaten into (almost) accepting an 11AM check out time.  It was only after I informed the front desk that I had an email in my hand -- FROM THEM -- that told me that check out time was 12 noon, that they very begrudgingly agreed to a noon check out -- very begrudgingly (read:  not nice on the phone).  Fourth, Concierge told us he'd call at 5Pm to check on how crowded a restaurant we wanted to visit was, but never called.  (There's actually a fifth thing:  the Concierge told us not to pay too much attention to TripAdvisor.)  Really?  Spent $1,700 for two nights.  If this hotel wasn't on Central Park it would be a Motel 6.  They really need to step up their game and not treat their guests so disrespectfully.  Obviously will never return.  PS: they've had scaffolding in front of the main entrance forever.

title: Hotels have one job
text: This maybe a harsh review but a hotel needs to do one thing really well... allow the guest to have a great night sleep.  The cleaning staff failed to turn off the alarm clock so on Saturday morning i jumped out of bed at 6am.  After ripping the alarm out of the wall (because who can figure out the alarm clock in the dark), my sleep was broken and the dream of sleeping in was over.  I complained to the desk and got a little apologize   I would have expected some written acknowledgement that it happened and they were sorry. Nothing.  Really disappointed and expected more.

title: New York'un merkezindesiniz
text: Manhattan'ın merkezinde, Central Park'ın yanı başında, görmek isteyebileceğiniz bir çok yere yürüme mesafesindesiniz. Otelin konumu çok iyi. Odaları lüks. Her şey çok iyi. Kahvaltı hariç. Türk olup, yabancı ülkelerde kahvaltı beğenmemek zaten normal... Bu normallik böylesine bir otelde de karşınıza çıkıyor. New York'ta şehrin tam merkezinde, konforlu bir yerde kalayım gibi bir isteğiniz varsa çok iyi bir seçenekle karşı karşıyasınız.

title: 16 days stay
text: We had a great time at Essex House! Classy rooms, Staff is very friendly and very helpful. Ask for TIM if you need stuff done and taken care of! Great guy and went above and beyond his duty! We were there for 16 nights on a business trip! Conveni

title: New York long weekend
text:
Stayed at the Essex House for a long weekend 17th - 21st March. As others have said cannot fault the location of the hotel, close to Central Park and 5th Avenue. Close to Columbus Circle for some nice shops including a Whole Foods for when some healthy food is required. 

Hotel itself is clean, lobby area is nice with its Art Deco style, plenty of staff around to help. My wife is a smoker and the doormen made sure she was OK whilst having her early morning smoke. Check-in was fast and efficient, I had checked in online before we left Heathrow, lady provided us with plenty of bottles of water when requested as we had quite a long cab ride from JFK due to disruption from the St Patricks Day parade.

We were not given any upgrade based on my Marriott status, not sure if you have to request this directly again on check-in. We had a room on the 9th Floor overlooking a side street which was actually OK as I’m sure it would be much quieter than a room facing Central Park. Room was fairly small but we weren't visiting New York to stay in our room and were out most of the time.

My status gave me access to the executive lounge which we used for breakfast each morning. Selection of food was good and more than adequate for our needs. Closed at the weekend in the evenings so we only got to sample the hot food one night which again was perfectly nice.

All in all a good hotel and would be happy to stay here again if we return to New York.

title: Located on Central Park, Large Room
text:
Stayed here for a night while in town. Large family Suite with sofa bed and large king bed. 2 large rooms  and 1.5 baths. Located right on Central Park in middle of busy tourist area. Great location for all uptown activities. 

Pro:
1) Large room on 34th floor
2) mini bar fully stocked
3) nice large TVs with Netflix
4) decent bathroom size with large tub and ok size shower
5) in room safe can hold laptop
6) only about 10 rooms per floor
7) very comfortable king bed
8) dual thermostats
9) close to 5th ave
10) parking nearby in case u did not park at hotel.
11) nice Art Deco lobby, modern

Con or area for improvement:
1) service not up to par. Had to call twice to get sofa bed turned down,
2) no water in the room, had to call for this as well
3) understaffed at checkin. I really don't understand mobile check in when you have to wait and show Id anyhow. Nothing gained in terms of speed.
4) closet was small

Would I stay here again? Maybe. Other options nearby (like the Peninsula) to consider.

title: FANTASTICO
text:
Ogni volta che vado a New York alloggio in questo hotel.
Fantastico 
Camere grandissime ben curate, eleganti.
Vista su central park da mozzafiato.
Servizio accurato.
Personale gentile.
Da provare immancabilmente 
GIANFRANCO BRUNI

title: Perfect location
text: We decided to stay near Central Park this time and despite reading some previous reviews, we booked Essex. We were not disappointed! Our first encounter was Melvin at the front desk. He was very accommodating and friendly. He even called 15 mins after we were in our room to make sure we were ok. The rooms are very clean and we did not hear any of the noise previous reviews mentioned. All of the staff seemed to have Great customer service. The only thing I can think of somewhat nit the most positive- the prices of the drinks in the bar are very pricey. Overall- great hotel, great proximity to trains, Central Park and 5th avenue

title: Great stay -- 2 different nights
text: Super nice people -- took good care of me while traveling with my children.  Rooms were spacious and well-cared for.  Breakfast was nicer than most lounges.  Elevators were fast and plentiful.  All around great experience.

title: Nice hotel; unfriendly staff
text: We visit New York several times a year. I've stayed at many hotels over the years. This was, by far, the most miserable staff I've ever encountered. Every staffer I came into contact with treated me as if was bothering them. They were not welcoming at all. The hotel itself is nice. However there are many nicer hotels in the city with warm, welcoming staff that make your stay very enjoyable. I definitely do not recommend this hotel

title: Wonderful trip
text: Just came back from an awesome night at the JW Essex House. Everyone that we encountered working there was so nice. They upgraded our room.. and surprised us with a dessert since they knew we were celebrating. Also, the concierge lounge offers an extensive breakfast.  Wish we could have stayed longer.

title: Terrible management
text:
Possibly my first 1-star hotel review??

Booked the hotel for a birthday/anniversary weekend in NYC. 

Called the hotel to order champagne and chocolate strawberries to be put in the room. Resulted in 5 transfers to Guest Relations, which never answered. Spoke to Front Desk and she was to go to Guest Relations to request a call back...  45 minutes later still no call. So, called the manager who took the order. Then, 30 minutes later was called back saying I had to place the order direct w/ room service and to 'please hold'; 10 min later no one picked up. Called the hotel manager back - 2 hrs later I'm still trying to make a simple, standard request. Hotel 101. 

Manager agreed to our early checkin request; 1.5 hrs after the requested checkin time we got a call that our room was ready. On arrival they said the room was not ready but we could have another room. The new room was a "partial park view" when we booked and paid for a full park view. 

Every interaction with the hotel was a disappointment. 

Overall the property is fine but not exceptional. I booked because of a Condé Nast article but was pretty underwhelmed. 

Would never go back.

title: Classic hotel right in front of Central Park
text: This hotel was very responsive with my requests, however the doormen aren't as attentive when you're getting down from the car and we had to bring our luggage into the hotel ourselves.  The rooms are clean but ours was  facing another building so no view.  The hotel is right across Central Park and a few blocks away from Fifth Avenue, Time Warner, Carnegie Hall, and a lot of other New York attractions.

title: Surely This Isn't a JW Marriott...
text:
My wife and I took the Acela down from Boston to meet my in-laws in New York City for the weekend and needed a hotel for one evening.  My in-laws were staying nearby so we decided to splurge and use points from accrued business travel to stay at the JW Marriott Essex House.

Price: 45,000 points seemed a little steep, but an essentially "free night" for accrued loyalty in a Central Park hotel seemed worthwhile.

Location: Excellent.  Situated at 160 Central Park South between 6th and 7th Avenues, the JW Marriott Essex House is in a prime location and was very accessible from Penn Station (with minimal luggage, we walked after sitting 3+ hours on the train), and very convenient to Central Park, 5th Avenue, and Broadway.

Arrival/Check-In: Two doormen outside on arrival but neither offered to open the door for my wife - we went through the revolving doors which are a little difficult to push.  Check-in was relatively straightforward - I had checked in on the mobile app earlier on the train and requested a 12 PM arrival.  The lady at the front desk was very gracious and helpful, confirming my high floor request away from the elevator.  Of note, I didn't see an alternative check-in desk for Platinum members - it would have been a nice touch.

Room: We had room 2505, an Essex King.  The room layout was quite large and the two windows had a view of Central Park (if you craned your neck just enough you could see it).  Since we didn't pay for a Central Park view (and I don't think we got an upgrade), it was nice to have a little view.

Bathroom: Average.  the tub/shower was old and is in need of refurbishment. and the grab handle on the wall was a little loose.  I'm a big guy (6'6", 275 lbs.) and didn't feel particularly safe holding on to wash my feet.  Water pressure was average and the temperature control wasn't very good (the water barely got hot, even turned up all the way).  The toilet was an odd contraption - a low slung, low flow piece that took forever to flush.  A little discomforting the first time!  The sink was the highlight of the bathroom in terms of design - a pink bowl with better water pressure than the shower!  My wife and I agreed that the bath towels were amazing - so large, soft, and absorbent!

Bed: The first time in my life that I have stayed at a Marriott property and not had a good night's sleep.  The bed was so very firm and uncomfortable, even with three pillows.  I couldn't understand why I woke up sore until I got a chance glimpse of the bed this morning - the mattress was sitting on top of a piece of plywood!  This is unreal!  How on earth is this a JW Marriott property?  I generally sleep very well at Marriott properties, but this sleep was most uncomfortable.

Wifi: Nearly $20 per night for wifi is ridiculous in 2017.  Thankfully it was provided free of charge to us owing to my Platinum Elite status, but this is one of those amenities that should come standard for everyone two decades into the 21st century.

Executive Lounge: We received a key to the executive lounge (assume it was the M Club?) at check in, but every time we walked past the door there was a sign out front indicating it was closed.  I assume they're usually closed on the weekends, but curious why we got a key if that was the case.

Minibar: Overpriced, but expected.  Prices aren't readily posted (always a bad sign).  We finally found the price guide on the TV - $9 for a Pepsi, $11 for a beer, $12 for an airline bottle (50ml) of liquor, and $60 for a 350ml bottle of wine.  I had one late night Heineken.

Smell: When we arrived on the 25th floor, there was a work crew cleaning up in the hallway, and the carpet was soaked.  When we came out about a half hour later, there was an industrial blower fan set up in the hallway to dry the carpet.  Thinking nothing of it until we returned to our room after a show, and the 25th floor landing/hallway smelled of dry vomit.  Quite possibly the worst thing to smell right before going to bed.  The scent lingered this morning as we left.  If that's what the work crew was cleaning up, they either missed a spot or forgot the cleaning agent entirely...

Overall: The Essex House property served its purpose - a place to sleep for my wife and I for our one night trip to NYC.  The location was phenomenal and the service excellent; however, the bed was absolutely horrible, the room felt dated, and the smell in the hallway/landing was...gross.  I used 45,000 points for this stay, but am having a hard time justifying it.  I would have been furious if I'd actually paid cash for this stay instead.  It's hard to believe that this hotel is a flagship JW Marriott property.

title: Well....
text:
I'll say first the location of the hotel is way too perfect especially is you're a tourist. You have central park in front of you, 5th Ave seconds within walking distance, and times Square is a few blocks away!! 

Other than the location I felt the service was mediocre.  I checked in for one night requesting a high floor and I had to pay an additional $50 for a higher floor on a Sunday... c'mon? We ended up with a lower floor with no view, whatever we were going to be out the entire day. Later for dinner we decided to eat at the hotel restaurant. Oh my.... I wish we chose a different restaurant. Our waiter was beyond rude, and our salads were drenched in dressing which tasted very salty, and finally when we ordered dessert we ordered this chocolate lava ice cream. I received this plastic ice cream with the sell by date that looked like it was purchased by the 7/11 store and they wanted $12 for the ice cream. Oh my goodness....

title: We Love Marriott but this one is very overrated!
text:
1-No help with baggage on arrival
2-Room had loud banging noise day and night. 
3-Platinum guest given room with the view as in photo. 
4-Shower fitting very loose. 
5-Room dusty. 
6-Light bulb not working 
7-Receptionist asked for my video evidence as she said management needed it!
8-Barman showed resentment when we used a complimentary voucher. 
9-Room very old fashioned. 
10- Good club breakfast. 
11- Great location. 

We would not stay at this hotel again and do not recommend it.

title: Loud thumping sound in well
text: The hotel has a great location, but there is a frequent loud thumping sound.  It didn't bother me too much during day, but it definitely did during the night.  Despite my profile asking for a quiet room, which I didn't get upon arrive and had to ask for another room higher up, this higher up room was not quite either with the loud thumping. I called the front desk. They said they are aware that some rooms have this issue and there is nothing they can do about it. They offered for us to move rooms, but that is far less than convenient and no guarantee since was already supposed to be a 'quiet room'.  They did give me 10k Marriott points for the inconvenience.  Given that that this hotel requires 45k points per night to stay here, while it was nice, it was not generous.

title: Very Worn Hotel
text:
Our stay began with having the Bell Captain staff ignore us upon arrival.    We have walked our luggage pass the Bell Capitan staff members.  

 At check-in, Melvin was fantastic. He explained everything and was phenomenal.

 We booked a Manhattan Suite and thought it was going to be luxurious. We were wrong. The room was extremely extremely extremely worn. There are multiple stains and rips in the carpet.   The air-conditioning rattled throughout the entire night. The toilet broke twice in a five day stay. 

 There was no turndown service.   We thought that booking a suite would mean we would receive a newspaper every morning. We were wrong again. 

 We were stuck in the same elevator twice in two days.  Apparently staff is aware of the elevator malfunction. The second time I was stuck in the elevator, that was a staff member on board who open the door and then manually slammed it shut.  If they are aware of this, they should have it fixed.

 When I tried to complain to upper management, I was forced to deal with a Supervisor. I asked to speak to management, and was refused many many times.  I believe if a guest should request upper management, we should be able to speak to them.

There are plenty of hotels to stay in Manhattan. Choose any other hotel but this hotel.  It's a shame, because the location is perfect. It is directly across the street from Central Park, and within walking distance of Broadway and Times Square  it's a shame, because the location is perfect. It is directly across the street from Central Park, and within walking distance of Broadway and Times Square

title: Great location, a bit dated
text:
Located right next to Central Park, a few blocks away from both columbus circle and 5th avenue, location doesn't get that much better than this. The hotel may not look like much from the outside, but walking in you can see the history of the hotel. Also, there may be quite a bit of construction up-front, but that's par for the course in NYC.

The JW Marriott platinum lounge is great, with plenty of non-alcoholic beverages, and a nice breakfast spread and decent hors d'oeuvres in the evening. The lounge is busy, but not packed, and there is a cash bar if needed. Only problem is that it's not open 24/7, so if you need water past 10PM at night, you will need to raid the gym.

The room is comfortable, I was upgraded to junior suite with a view of... other rooms and an alley. I may recommend a park view room over a junior suite upgrade, but it'll depend on your own personal choices. The room is a bit tired and dated, but everything worked so no real complaints there. However, the lack of bottled water in the room is a big negative.

Overall, not a bad hotel for NYC, but I've stayed at better JW's.

title: Five wonderful days and nights in NYC!
text: We arrived last week the day before the "blizzard".  Hotel staff knew our names when we stepped out of the cab. We were checked in quickly with no problems at all.  The staff could not have been more professional. I felt confident they would take care of us and they did! Our room overlooked Central Park and with the new snow it was a real treat for this Southerner! The bed was very comfortable and the room was large in comparison to other hotels. I was worried about the "small" elevators but they moved quickly and rarely were they full. I would highly recommend this hotel!!! Thank you J W Marriott Essex House for making our first visit to NYC wonderful!

title: No sleep!!
text: Wish I had read "trip advisors"  ( which I usually do) before my daughter booked this hotel. ...lots of other well located an beautiful hotels we could have stayed in. All night long we heard a loud thumping noise just about every hour and sometimes more frequently. When I complained to front desk, I was told it was an old hotel and in some room locations, the heat and water pipes caused this problem. My question to them, why put us in one of those room? With no sleep, my 7 month pregnant daughter and myself were not happy campers. Just confirmed the importance of checking trip advisor no matter the supposed quality of the brand.!!

title: Week long Visit for Pleasure
text: If I could give more than 5 stars I definitely would.  This hotel is outstanding in every aspect.  We were here during the "blizzard" .  The hotel accommodated everyone for breakfast.  The doorman is always ready to accommodate you in anyway he can to get you where you're going.  The beds are the most comfortable beds that you could ever imagine.  You will find it hard to make yourself get up every morning.  The cute gift shop by the elevator seems small but the little man that works in there seems to have anything you could possibly ask for.  We stayed in one of the family connector rooms and it was perfect for our family.  The bathrooms are very large and very clean.  The hotel is also conveniently located across the street from Central Park.

title: Great location in NYC
text: We stayed at the JW for a special birthday celebration for my husband.  Although our check in took quite a while waiting for an available room, the staff treated us very well and ended up giving us an upgraded room with views of Central Park.  The room was fantastic, with a separate living room and our concierge gave us great recommendations during our long weekend stay.  My only critique would be the executive lounge,  which was way too small for the size of the hotel, as it had very limited food choices - some of the worst that we have experienced at a JW Marriott.

title: Great location, and overall very nice
text: Our initial room was overlooking Central Park and the view was beautiful. It turned out to be a very noisy location because of a loud room above us, so were upgraded to a suite which was roomy and much nicer. The hotel was spotless, but could benefit from some updating. The breakfast buffet was expensive but was absolutely delicious.

title: GF Family of 5... 1 night Pre Cruise...
text:
Half decent hotel in a great location, rooms seemed in need of a little TLC... Not a lot but a little, perhaps a good carpet cleaning and some paint in areas. Staff was "helpful" in some ways and not at all in others. I have been to NYC on many occasions and have had better service at sister properties! I am a GOLD Marriott member and this did not come in handy whatsoever nor was it mentioned anytime during our stay!

I would return to this hotel ONLY if other choices were not available!

title: Nice, warm stay at the Essex House
text:
My wife and I needed to stay one night in Manhattan given work functions, and decided to use our Marriott points for a free night stay.  We were pleasantly surprised overall with the hotel.   

The lobby area is very nice, with the first floor running between 58th and 59th Streets.   The concierge's lounge, located on the first floor, was one of the biggest I've visited at a Marriott property with ample seating and a wide selection of food for breakfast.

The room layouts apparently differ given the shape of the building.  We had an inside corner room that was atypical.  The room was very wide running left to right when you walked in with the bed on the left and bathroom on the right.  The room was clean, modern and pretty spacious.  The bathroom layout was odd - if someone sat on the toilet, and someone else opened the door it smacked right into you.   

The room was pretty quiet from the noise in the hallway, and given it was an inside corner room, no noise was coming from the outside. 

All in all - a very nice hotel.

title: Long weekend at the Essex House
text:
Stayed for 3 nights over a long weekend. Overall, we had a pleasant stay with no major problems. The hotel is historic and has a nice location overlooking Central Park. We had a room with a view of the park. Unfortunately, the room was not very high up. If you are interested in a park view room, request a high floor. I tried the mobile check-in and was notified that I was eligible for an upgrade but none was actually offered. 

Check-in: Polite and perfunctory. The person who checked us in needs to brush up on giving the proper little check-in speech. There was no explanation of the lounge use, amenity hours, how to connect to wi-fi, etc. 

Location: Having lived in NYC before, I can say that this is a nice location but it's really up to the traveler to decide what is a "good" location in Manhattan based on individual needs. If you are a tourist or traveling for business I think this is a nice location. Close to Time Warner Center (a mall, meh--but has Whole Foods in the basement); close to several subway stations (A/C/E and 1 lines to go downtown on the westside; N/R/Q and B/D to go down to mid-town and beyond; NOT close to the 4/5/6). Being a 5-min walk from a Maison Kayser bakery was dangerous but delicious for us. It may be difficult to call a cab or Uber during busy times and you may have to wait in the smallish lobby. Tip: walk out of the hotel and go to one of the other corners with a major avenue (say 8th for going uptown; 7th or 5th for going downtown; avoid Broadway for going downtown so as to not go through Times Square) to call a cab, which is often faster than ordering Uber.

Room: Some other reviewers have mentioned "old" decor. The lobby is "old" but it is a historic hotel and it is beautiful in that way. However, it is a small lobby. The wood in our room had wear and tear but it was not terrible. Otherwise I would call the size of the room "compact" for non-NY standards, and a decent size for NY standards. If you have a lot of large luggage it is quite tight. We were there on a very cold weekend and it was cold sitting near the window. The bed was a bit too soft for me. The bathroom door really needs to be a pocket door. There was hardly any hallway noise but we heard lots of footsteps stomping from above (must have been a kid). Facing central park, there was some street noise but by Manhattan standards already far less of it than elsewhere in Manhattan. Honking is a fact of life around here. The only feature I really did not like about the room is the carpet. When is the last time you've seen beige carpet in a hotel room? It really showed stains and I don't want to know what else. ugh.

Amenities: The enhanced wifi speed is quite good and is complimentary if you are a gold or platinum member. We did not use the restaurant. We ate breakfast in the executive lounge. The breakfast is  good for a complimentary meal and has hot proteins, high-quality pastries and croissants, oatmeal, cereal, fresh fruits, deli meats, bagels, toast, yogurt, juices, coffee, tea, etc. I did not use the fitness center but it is moderately sized and does not have much more than treadmills. The "spa" is very small and is part of the fitness center. My husband had a nice 80-min massage in one of the treatment rooms. Kudos to the concierge Michael Antonelli for arranging this and communicating with us promptly when needed.

Service: Aside from the person at check-in, staff was friendly and helpful.

title: Keep up JW or this property will soon be a two star
text:
This place is in need of a total update of rooms.  Nothing has been done since Marriott to back the property from TAJ.  THE rooms are we in sad shape with lots of broken items like light switches, badly marred furniture and carpets that need cleaning.  

The beds are comfortable but everything else about the hotel is well before a JW STANDARDs.  

QUESTION do you send your bellman home after 9pm?

Wake up Marriott.

title: Great place to stay in Manhattan
text:
Wonderful location withCentral Park just in front, with a lot of nice restaurantes really near. 
Check-in process kind and efficient, upgraded as Marriott's gold member status, the room was clean with a couple of windows looking the park.
You have 2 or 3 subway stations not far than 2 blocks and a lot of chances to get a cab just at the door over south central park.
The hotel is nice, people kind and better than other places I have been in Manhattan.
You can take advantage of the executive lounge if you hace credentials or the free coffe at the end of the lobby just at the restaurant entrance.
Good fitness center.
Price according the hotel lebel.

title: Much to Love
text: There is a lot to love about the Essex House! First of all, the people. Not a hint of New York attitude, just good, kind folks at every turn...at the front desk, in the lounge, and at the door. The concierge lounge was the best I've experienced, with an absolutely delicious and filling breakfast. The old school charm of the hotel is lovely and the Christmas decorations were a beautiful touch. Very nice to walk out onto the park. The rooms could use an update, as the decor was a bit of an 80s,90s and today mismatch.  They are nice, for sure, but do not exactly feel like a JW. Though also quite dated and in need of some touch ups, the bathroom was very spacious by NY standards and worked well for the two of us.

title: Beautiful Stay
text:
The staff of this hotel are THE best.  Beyond helpful, courteous and generally sweet!  Well done Marriott. 
First, when I called on my way to the hotel to find out where to park, my call was answered immediately by a human....not a machine directing me to push 1, 2, etc.  I was directed clearly on what to do.  Just drive in front of the hotel and the valet will be there!  In NYC, this was incredibly easy!  I've stayed at many NYC hotels and the ease was awesome!  On a Friday morning!  
Additionally, the hotel is clean, organized and easy to navigate. 
It is a great location for tourists also.  
Highly recommend.

title: Marriott Platnium Status - this is for you!
text: As a Platinum Rewards Member I have stayed at many Marriott brand hotels in NYC. The JW Essex House is hands down the BEST treatment when it comes to Platinum rewards and perks. Each time I have stayed I have enjoyed upgraded rooms and the concierge lounge of morning and evening offerings are by far the best I have experienced in NYC. In order of my other NYC choices for upgrades and concierge lounge offerings are Marriott East (morning and evening offerings), Marriott Marquis Times Square (morning and evening offerings), Residence Inn Central Park (morning only offerings)

title: Not Even The Best Marriott in NYC
text: We arrived around 8 PM on a Saturday evening.  Upon arrival we were met by the door man who was pleasant, but less than impressively dressed due to shirt tail hanging out and ill fitting uniform.  At the front desk, there was one attendant and he was helping a woman who had a litany of questions.  OK, she deserves attention, of course.  But no "just one moment" or " I will be right with you" from the front desk clerk, rather we received no acknowledgement whatsoever.  Finally, he appeared to complete the questions of the guest he was attending to, only to have him acknowledge us and tell us that he would be with us when completed the various "tasks" that the previous guest had given/requested.  When he got to us, we checked in and asked that the bags be sent to the room as we had a dinner reservation.  No bellman, but the door man was summoned to take the bags up.  Meanwhile, we were left to find our own cab in front of the hotel.  Not a great arrival!  The room helped the impressions a bit as it was large by any standard, not just NYC standards.  Bed was comfortable and TV was new, large, and had plenty of channels.  The bathroom was a bit underwhelming and cramped.  The bathtub / shower combo was simply old and in need of a makeover or replacement. Next morning was not much better as we were going to have a quick breakfast in the Marriott Honored Guest breakfast area.  This did not occur as there were more people than tables and a waiting list was established.  Upon checking out later that day we took our bags to the lobby ourselves and  arranged a car to pick us up.  Good thing, as again, no one offered assistance with bags or to arrange a cab or alternative.  Instead, the two doormen stood and chatted / laughed with a local while guests managed by themselves. Of late I find myself saying "not JW Marriott standard", but perhaps I am incorrect and the standard simply is not what it used to be.

title: Great place
text: Very good location (it oversees Central Park), very well maintained. Rooms spacious. Efficient, courteous personnel. The bar is nice. Reasonably priced. Will start using this JWM in the future when in town.

title: JW Marriott Essig House New York
text:
Very nice hotel,  rooms, people, bar.
Restaurant had a limited menu.  Don't order the lobster bisque. 
Hotel advertises across from park, and it is, good luck getting a room with a view of the park.
I like to visit New York but when reviewing the hotel bill and seeing all of the taxes they stick to guests, I now remember why I don't visit this city often.

title: Mais estrelas eu te daria!
text: Frequentei este hotel desde o tempo do Jumeirah. Pessoas maravilhosas trabalhando, educação impecável. Café da manhã de cortesia todos os dias das minhas hospedagens (3 vezes por ano, por 4 anos seguidos). Ceia grátis antes da Broadway, antes do Jazz e antes do MET. Este hotel só me trouxe felicidades. Até com Ivete Sangalo esbarrei no elevador!

title: Very accomodating
text: Hotel was very attentive to our needs, particularly when they saw us arrive with our one year old. They provided an extra mini fridge to store her perishable snacks (milk, etc) and the concierge even gave her a small stuffed animal with a cute NY logo on it. She loved it! Breakfast was delicious and plentiful. The location right across Central par was great and we found many restaurants conveniently located. Overall a wonderful stay. We will most definitely return.

title: Great NY Hotel
text:
We checked in on Feb 21 and will check out Feb 28. 
Very high end hotel with very quiet room in excellent location on Central Park South.
We enjoyed proximity to all areas of the City. South Gate Restaurant very good - high quality with prices to match. Felt secure there with superb hotel staff and professional security. Even free coffee for guests!

title: Nice start to a business trip
text:
Traveling for business I frequently arrive well before official check in time.  I arrived at the property at about 10:30am and there was some confusion among the staff where I should go to check in.  Apparently there had been an event that morning that required them to move check in from one side of the lobby to the other.  They were in the process of resetting things to the normal configuration when I arrived and it took a minute for them to determine which side of the lobby they needed me be.  This was really no problem for me at all, but clearly created concern for the staff as they were very apologetic even though I really only had to walk about 30 steps total before we they got everything figured out.  Given the shift in check in operations there was a bit of a challenge for the staff to get logged in to their system to check me in.  Again, this was really just a minor delay, but the staffs clear concern for my time was evident as they were extremely apologetic.  I suppose if I was in a major rush this may have been a concern and while it was not a concern for me at all I did appreciate that they were mindful of the delay.  It was pretty obvious within my first 5 minutes there that the staff at this property takes customer experience seriously.  

While my room was not ready, which I did not expect it would be they quickly stored my bags and provided an access card to the lounge, which was great because I really needed a coffee.  The lounge was well appointed, comfortable and easy to navigate.  My status warranted an upgraded room with Central Park views.
