While this wasn't important to me, as I didn't get back to the hotel until it was nearly dark, if you were on vacation or views are important to you, especially if booking and paying for the park view but even if upgraded, I would request 10th floor or above.  I was on the 6th floor and while I faced the park it was pretty much tree level so you really did not see much of the park.

The food in the lounge in the evening looked very appealing and had a lot of options although I did not partake.  This is probably a NYC thing but all adult beverages where for pay on an honor bar system, many Marriott lounges have some or all free options during the early evening hours, but not this location.  Just something to keep in mind to calibrate your expectations if you are an elite rewards member.  

I did enjoy the breakfast.  The food was great and there were enough seating options that I was able to conduct a business meeting in the lounge at breakfast.

Every interaction with the staff was positive and while I did not have any issues that required special attention my feeling was that if I had it would have been handled with style.

Located on the south side of Central Park, the Essex House is a easy walk to Radio City Music Hall, MOMA and I am sure many other NYC areas of interest that I did not walk past on my way to my office.

The JW Marriott Essex House will be at the top of my list the next time I am booking a trip to New York.

title: Christmas Concert in NYC
text: My favorite part of staying here was the location. The hotel was very nice and what you would expect from a JW, the concierge lounge was to small for the volume of people who had access, the location to main NYC attractions is the big draw and why I am happy to have stayed. The bellman was uniquely friendly and made us feel right at home. Overall nice staff and would definitely stay again.

title: Right on Centrak Park
text: A great hotel that's easy to find by car; but you have to pay attention and watch out for the horse-drawn carriages. They make a great Sidecar at the bar. You can catch the "A" train at the subway station at Columbus Circle. It is 15 minutes to The World Trade Center and one hour to JFK Airport Howard Beach Skytrain station.

title: weekend in ny
text: besides check in everything was almost perfect .We waited almost 20 minutes to check in but that was the only down fall about the weekend. The room was small but very clean and well stocked , We were directly across the street from central park which was the main reason for staying at this hotel...all and all a great place to stay for a get away in NYC

title: Great Stay, Staff Could Be Friendlier
text: This hotel has a truly beautiful lobby. The hotel bar is great as well. Our suite was spacious and clean with a beautiful view of Central Park. You certainly can't beat the location, especially around the holidays. The only issue is the staff. There were quite a few times that I got the feeling I was bothering them, even with the simplest of requests. I try to give everyone the benefit of the doubt, and I won't name names because I don't believe that's fair unless something really egregious occurs. There just seems to be an overall feeling that guests are more in the way than valued. For the price, there are plenty of other places that will make you feel welcomed and appreciated. Try the Pierre.

title: NYC is just too busy for my taste.
text:
sWe drove to NYC for the Christmas Holiday 2016.  First advice, DO NOT TAKE ANY ROUTE THAT TAKES YOU THROUGH THE LINCOLN TUNNEL!  Holy Traffic! Once you get to your hotel, let them park your car and leave it behind the entire time you are there, those people are crazy, and sorry, do NOT know how to drive.  Walking is surely the way to go, but since nobody seems to know their way around the city (even when they live there), it's a crapshoot if you'll get where you are headed.  Uber did manage to get us from point A to point B but, well, lets just say those crazy drivers were some of them.  

On to the hotel.  The JW Marriott Essex House is beautiful upon entering, and the staff was very nice and helpful.  However, when we requested a double room we were told that they don't have such rooms at that hotel and were offered a type of family suite with adjoining rooms.  Our room was directly right of the elevator, and the thin walls allowed us to hear people coming and going all night long.  The room size was totally fine, but the furniture, blinds and bathroom could use some updates.  While standing at the sink, the wooden panel in front fell straight down and hit my foot, lucky for me I was wearing shoes, or I'd have easily lost a toe.  UGH.  All in all, the placement of the hotel is great, the food is right in line with how expensive the rest of New York is and the people were very nice and super helpful, but the hotel itself could use an overhaul.  For the price we paid for these rooms, I can say I don't think I'd stay there again if I were to return, (which frankly, I don't plan on doing, NY is for sure a shopping city, so if that's not your thing, I wouldn't bother.)

title: Physical Hotel Fine, Management Needs Improvement
text: We booked a park view room for our trip to NYC.  Upon arrival they said we would get an upgrade to a much nicer room.  Well the room was a handicapped accessible room so definitely larger but it was on the back side of the hotel with a view of another building.  While the more spacious room was nice, we didn't need the handicapped accessibility and would have preferred our original booking with the park view.  We went back to the desk and were informed our original room had already been re-booked and they had no park view rooms available.  Strike one.  If you are in NYC on business over the weekend, you have no access the the executive lounge except for breakfast.  They close it Friday and Saturday with only breakfast service.  So if you wanted a place to work other than your room, you are out of luck.  Strike two.  We also booked a late checkout of 1pm on Sunday.  Be prepared to be sitting in your hotel room not yet presentable with your wife in the shower and hotel management lets themselves into your room because they were not informed you had scheduled late check out and when they see you they STILL proceed to enter the room even when you are telling them to stop and leave and they walk into the middle of the room looking at their checkout paper insisting it says we checked out on the paper.  Strike three.  There are other great hotels around with the same amenities and location as this one.  I would pick another hotel.

title: Amazing !!!!
text:
I took my mom to New  York city for Christmas and we stayed at the JW Marriott Essex House and we absolutely loved it ! From location to the quality of service we received. 
You're across from Central Park and minutes walking to Times Square .  There's a Rays pizza within walking distance too . That was a plus :) and they are open 24/7

Rooms were cozy and beds were great. Bathrooms were fantastic . 
Highly recommend this hotel for any occasion, when in New York.

title: 5 звезд? Вы серьезно? Максимум 3...
text:
Честно, проще сказать, что понравилось. Хорошее расположение - через дорогу парк. Неподалеку Whole Foods. На этом из хорошего все! Никто вас не встречает, не помогает открыть дверь с тяжелыми чемоданами, никакого вам "здравствуйте" и знаменитой американской улыбки. Такое еще можно простить 2-х звездному мотелю, но уж Мариотт с 5 звездами - нет! Номер страшно грязный, покоцанный, везде жуткий слой пыли, даже на видных местах. Мебель из ДСП  с отбитыми углами. Но самое противное, что в сливе ванны были чьи-то волосы. Фото прилагаются. Мы попросили прийти и разобраться с этим администратора, на что нас спросили, не хотим ли мы водички? Принесли пакет с самой дешевой водой "Нестле" и через какое-то время пришли прочистили трубы. А пыль так и не вытерли, может они думали, что за 400 баксов за ночь я сама должна это делать? По поводу волос ни извинений, ничего. Делайте выводы, какой уровень сервиса в известной сети отелей.) Фото прилагаются, я думаю текст тут излишен и так все видно, что стоимость берется только за место в центре города. А уж если случайно заглянуть в комнату с полотенцами, то совсем плохо станет. Фото так же прилагается. 
Завтрак, который я включала в номер оказался невключенным! За тарелку каши, 2 куска хлеба с клубничкой и какао "Несквик" мы отдали 60 долларов! За что? 
Ах да, у нас был мини-бар в номере, но не было ни одного листка, сообщающего стоимость алкоголя там. Специально убрали, чтоы потом выставить счет на несколько сотен? Мы все облазили в поисках цен и ничего не нашли.

title: Een zeer gemiddelde ervaring
text: Dit is de derde keer dat ik in dit hotel verblijf. De ligging vind in zelf uitstekend: vlak aan Central Park waardoor voor mij alles op wandelafstand ligt. De kamers zijn behoorlijk oud en zouden eigenlijk een update kunnen gebruiken.  Zo komt de koude en wind bijvoorbeeld voelbaar binnen langs de ramen....De roomservice is correct en alles is vers en warm wanneer het op de kamer geleverd wordt. Dit heb ik in andere hotels al anders mogen ervaren. Het ontbijt is een bevreemdende ervaring: het personeel in het restaurant waar het ontbijt genomen kan worden, is talrijk, maar doet er alles aan om je in de tweede helft van de zaal te plaatsen, terwijl de eerste helft en de tafels met zicht op  central park leeg blijven. De sfeer tussen het personeel is goed, maar je hebt het gevoel dat je hen eigenlijk stoort, hoewel er vaak maar drie tafels gebruikt worden voor het ontbijt. Tot slot, nog een opmerking inzake de kamer: in vraag steeds een kamer op een 'high floor', maar deze keer zat ik op de vijfde verdieping (een andere kamer kon ik niet krijgen) en dat heb ik geweten: enorm veel lawaai op ieder uur van de dag....

title: Classy Hotel, Terrific Location
text: We had a great, inexpensive 2 night stay here using Marriott points.  We were assigned a 6th floor room overlooking Central Park.  What a blessing!  The Essex House served as a great base for us to enjoy the city.  We also found a small mom & pop pizza place just outside the south entrance that was convenient, tasty and relatively inexpensive.

title: Poor customer service all the way up the management chain
text:
I wrote an email to the GM on Monday morning following my stay on Saturday night.  I have still received no response to my complaints. My husband and I are Platinum members so this is extremely disappointing. The level of service at this location is barely a 2 on a scale of one to 10.  They do an injustice to this beautiful, Iconic Hotel.
BEWARE...if you book a package, make sure that you get all the perks upon check in that you are entitled to per the terms of their advertised package.  We were to receive a 50% off coupon for the on-site restaurant and we did not get the 50% off.  The bill was $600.  There are many other places that we could have chosen to eat in NYC for that price.  My daughter never got her entree, it took 25 minutes to get our car from valet and then they acted like we were putting them out to put the bags in the car.  The front desk manager Anthony was condescending and rude.  I could go on and on.  The location is perfect and the hotel is beautiful but don;t expect to get good service.

title: Lindo e elegante
text:
O Hotel é muito bonito, o quarto amplo, a roupa de cama e banho divina, o colchão maravilhoso, sono dos anjos.
O Staff é atencioso e simpático.
 A localização é excelente, em frente ao Central Park, há um ótimo Shopping perto, além de lojas top.

title: Best Place to stay in New York
text:
I travel all the time. In fact I have probably spent more nights in hotels than in my own home. Most of the time this is for business - this time it was an indulgent trip to New York with my 2 sisters to celebrate my birthday.
To start off the staff went out of their way to spoil me - upgraded to a ENORMOUS suite, early check in no problem. The day of our arrival there was foot of snow on the ground and we were so grateful to be able to check in and put on warmer clothes before venturing out. Surprise number 2 - when I mentioned to one of the housekeeping personnel Dolores that it was my birthday she smiled and a few hours later room service brought us a bottle of Prosecco and a wonderful chocolate cake.
Wow. 
And even my sisters - who were there to celebrate with me - could not get over the incredible service from all the staff - nothing was too much trouble. We enjoyed a show the first night and came back to the hotel bar/restaurant for a nightcap - the server was so flexible and when we agreed that a snack would be good he put together a plate of cheeses, cold cuts and the most delicious chicken wings. 
The next day was warmer and we were able to explore the environs - what a perfect location. Close to everything (even Times Square - a place I avoid but I know is an attraction for most people visiting the city).
The bedding and beds were incredibly comfortable - something I find a challenge at even some of the best hotels I have stayed at.
Overall an incredible visit - definately  plan to stay here next time I am in the City.

title: Sisters In The City
text:
This was a girl's trip to celebrate my sister's birthday.  When the hotel heard it was a special birthday they upgraded us to a magnificent suite and sent up bubbly and birthday cake. We couldn't have asked for more!

The hotel is beautifully decorated, the food very good and the service friendly while being everything you would expect of a first class hotel. 

The location is excellent - being directly across from Central Park with easy access to nearby attractions.

title: OK
text: The hotel is very nice down stairs. The food is very good as well. My room was a different story. Attached is a picture of the mold in my shower and the broken drain. The bed was OK and the furnishings dated. I think you can find better accommodations  in NYC for the price.

title: Absolutely Superb
text: My wife and I stayed there the week of January 21. We had a lovely stay and really enjoyed our beautiful accommodations. We want to send out a big thank you to Etienne who was extremely kind and helpful dealing with our situation. His kindness and friendliness is greatly appreciated! We were there to celebrate our 10th anniversary and Etienne's professionalism and kindness truly helped make this anniversary memorable.

title: Já faz parte da cultura NY
text: Lindo e tipico de NY, mas como em muitos reviews anteriores, realmente o padrão de atendimento Marriott é bem melhor do que o representado neste hotel, fomos muito melhor tratados em Orlando, Rio, Marbella ( Exceção dos Porteiros que foram super amáveis e gentis )... Imagino que isso faça parte da "magia nova-iorquina". A linha aérea  perdeu nossa mala e nos entregou no hotel, bem fácil pois hotel famoso. No mais o Hotel tem estrutura de bom padrão Marriott, quartos ótimos, comida ótima, Destaque para Localização em frente ao Central Park, caminhamos e passeamos por tudo. A antigüidade do Hotel me fascinou, mas do que incomodou.

title: Lovely room, great location and great concierge!
text: Our room was lovely even though it was booked through Expedia (3rd floor),  but nicely designed. Best to ask for a quiet room and not near the garbage pick-up location. Even with that, we liked it! Very comfortable bed. The concierge, Mike, was very helpful on a number of occasions. We liked the location. Did not eat there for breakfast, but walked down to Sarabeth's for breakfast instead. Would highly recommend it. Also near Luke's for lobster rolls (wonderful) - only 2 blocks away at the Shops in the Plaza Hotel lower level.

title: Hotel céntrico
text: Las instalaciones son muy cómodas, se encuentran cerca de la mayoría de las atracciones turísticas de NY. Mis felicitaciones al personal, fueron muy atento y amables siempre pendientes de las necesidades tanto mías como de mi familia.

title: Great anniversary trip
text:
My wife and I stayed here for 22nd wedding anniversary and had a great time.  The staff and concierge were terrific.  It directly across from
Central Park and easy access to the theaters and Tim Square. We got upgraded to a suite over looking the park, it was great.  We will be back.

title: Not worth the money
text: I chose this hotel for its reputation and location for Christmas in New York City. One thing i have to say is that you can't beat the location, as you have quick access to central park, subway and great restaurants. As for the hotel, I would say that there are better options out there for your money. I upgraded the standard room to a "Room with a view" of Central park, which cost me about an extra $100. The room had a view, but that view was meh, and the one window in the room felt like a port window from a boat (very small). As for the amenities, pretty standard. One oversight on the staff was that my room came with an iron, but no ironing board. My personal interactions with the staff were great, but i witnessed a few things that made me think less of this hotel. The elevators are very small, and often packed with people. While the elevator was clearly full, a bellhop decided it would be a great idea to push a luggage cart onto the elevator making everyone squished. Then when a family, with a newborn, tried to get off on a stop, the bellhop didn't move the cart creating a nightmare scenario for them trying to get off the elevator. Finally, stopped at the bar attached to the hotel for a drink. Only thing i can say is that it was the worst service i have ever had. I have stayed at a handful of other hotels around NYC, and my stay has been much more pleasurable than this hotel, and for a cheaper price.

title: Spectacular Location - Unpretentious Suites
text:
The location is perfect for our visits to NYC!  Within walking distance to Central Park; Lincoln Center; Carnegie Hall; 5th Avenue; Madison Avenue; MOMA; and, Broadway! 

We have always loved the no fuss, clean lines of furnishings and neutral colored curtains and walls in their very comfortable suites! Though with this weekend stay, an awful smell of Clorox filled the air as we entered our suite & an upkeep of scuffed walls and furniture is badly needed for a more pristine welcome!

The staff and services rendered inside the hotel is superb!  The front desk is friendly; room service is efficient; executive lounge's staff is cordial; and, the bellhops are most gracious!  Our only one constant disappointment is with their doormen:  we have yet had one in assisting us with luggage as we arrive; and, to have one in helping us to find a cab or car when needed!  Still, with our many visits to NYC each year, we have made Essex House our home there!

Happy Travels Y'all!

title: Terrific Location
text: We stayed in a junior suite for our one-night stay. It was spacious and very comfortable. Dinner at Southgate worked out well for us and we enjoyed breakfast in the Executive Lounge. The location is ideal, right across from Central Park and near several subway lines. I would describe it as very nice, not quite luxurious. The lobby was lovely. Most, but not all, hotel employees we met were friendly and willing to make our stay special. The women's locker room in the fitness center was small.

title: Average hotel near Central Park
text: The Essex House has a few high quality attributes including its location and service.  I stayed in a suite with a great view, but must admit that the room was in desperate need of a renovation.  If you are looking to stay in Midtown Manhattan, the location is fantastic.  I usually try to give hotels the benefit of the doubt, but considering this hotel is a JW Marriott -- I expected better.

title: Classic Elegant Hotel in Fabulous Location
text: We have stayed at the Essex House when it was a Marriott, then Starwood, now a Marriott again. The location is perfect, close to everything and directly across the street from Central Park. Being a platinum member we were upgraded to a "noisy" room facing W58th Street when all the trash trucks were picking up at 11PM. I called the manager, who could not have been nicer and more professional by immediately changing our room. She could hear the noise during our conversation and was genuinely concerned about our experience at the property. This is always my first choice when going to Manhattan and will be due to the great service provided by the Manager, Tatyana.

title: Great hotel, great location
text: The rooms are updated, the personnel are friendly, and the location is great.  There are lots of restaurants nearby and the park is right across the street.  Hard to get a better location unless you want to be in the Village

title: Solid business travel stay
text: Good executive lounge for business stays and good rooms. On Central Park so great location for pleasure or business. Friendly and helpful staff who know the local neighborhood (but had to ask for non tourist areas).

title: Central Park elegance!
text: We visited NYC for a few days before heading to our son's wedding in New Jersey. We had a total of 6 adults along with our two grandchildren ages 7 and 3. My husband and I stayed on the 35th floor and the view of Central Park was fabulous! The hotel was very busy and even experienced the failure of a bank of elevators, but the staff was on their toes trying to accomodate everyone's needs. The conceirge gave us a less than satisfactory recommendation for lunch with children but we found the Brooklyn Diner nearby which was great! The breakfast buffet for Marriott Platinum members was excellent. The flowers in the lobby were stunning and the room was clean, bed was comfortable and well appointed. The hotel shows off it's Art Noveau architecture and features while providing modern bathroom and bedroom amenities. The location is excellent and you can walk just about anywhere, from the Museums to the north or Times Square to the south!

title: Very Nice!
text:
High level category hotel.
Well located in front of central part, 5 min. from 5th avenue and the Apple store.  The lounge room for Gold Marriott reward is impressive because of the quality of the food included.  The room are all but very clean. This is a really nice hotel.  The valet parking is really efficient.  It is an hotel a little bit expensive but, it's NY and the location is perfect!

title: A wonderful wedding venue!
text:
It was our first time staying at this hotel and everything about itvwaa outstanding! From the room upgrade overlooking the park to the wedding in the grand salon. Food was excellent and service was commendable.
Congratularions to this hotel, it was one of the best stays and certainly highly recommend it!

title: Lovely Hotel
text:
We stayed here on short notice. We were staying in another area of Manhattan, and while visiting Central Park, wandered  into the Essex and enquired about rates. They were offering a deal which included New Years Eve and the following six nights, which we booked. 
The hotel is very comfortable, and was beautifully decorated for Christmas. We had a wonderful view of the park.  I really  liked the lobby, but It doesn't have bar service, which is a shame. It would have been nice to relax there with a drink and some bar snacks. There is a restaurant, but we were not very impressed with the food or the atmosphere there, so we ate else where most of the time. But overall  it was a pleasant stay at Essex House.

title: Bom
text:
Hotel bem localizado, unico problema é o transito. Quarto é amplo e o atendimento é bom. Bom fitness center e sauna. Nao experimentei os restaurantes e nem o serviço de quarto. Estava esperando algumas caixas que chegaram mas tive que pedir 4 vezes durante um dia inteiro que me entregassem no quarto
Vale a visita.

title: excellent location
text: Excelente ubicación sobre el Centra Park South y casi 7 avenida. Habitaciones amplias, con wiffi. Los baños limpios y también muy amplios. El personal fue muy amable, cordial y servicial. Precio razonable. Teníamos una vista muy linda al contra frente.

title: Great hotel !!!
text: Stayed here in January. Hotel had lots of scaffolding outside the front which kinda ruined the look but New York is covered in scaffolding! Inside is really nice and Cesar on reception was excellent and very helpful. Room is very clean and comfy with huge tv for times when your feet can't take waking anymore and you just need to rest. Location is great as you are facing Central Park and 5 min walk to broadway and all the shops on 5th avenue. Would def stay here again !!!

title: Very Authentic, Classic, and Convenient to Immigration and Central Park
text: Very Classic.  It would be one of the best NYC experience.  Most items are worn down, as expected from the classic and historical hotel.  Still the most important quality of the hotel comes from the bed and the environmental control of the room: I say "Excellent"  For the younger generation, not sure if you want to become usual, but for people who love classic: here is the place for you.  I say here is much better than Waldorf Astoria Hilton.

title: Location and History
text: Beautiful art deco decor. Comfortable rooms, large bathrooms. Gracious service. Perfect location on Central Park. Lots to do close by. Restaurant on site. Breakfasts and light dinner in Club room delicious and generous.

title: Location, Location, Location
text: Spent a long weekend at Essex House with a Central Park view room.  Room size was excellent for the City and although it is an older building, it has been renovated nicely.  Staff were friendly and helpful.  The executive lounge was only open for breakfast and closed at 10:00 am for those platinum Marriott members.  Would be nice to also be able to have afternoon time as most other properties offer.  Room size is a bit limited and the hostess seating in the lounge was helpful but a bit harsh as well.  Overall positive experience, great location right on the park and would definitely return.

title: Location, location,location
text: What can I say, great location, great breakfast, great staff!  Stay here! Central park is at your feet and everything else is around it.  Subway just around the corner and horses across the street!  Great restaurants in the neighborhood!  This is one romantic place to stay at!

title: Fantastic hotel, great staff, fabulous location. Ideal for a base to explore this amazing city.
text: We stayed here from 26th Dec until 2nd January. It's a short (2min) walk from Times Square and dead opposite Central Park. My husband and I are early risers and like to explore while cities start to wake up. Starbucks opens at 5am and it literally a 1 minute walk from the hotel. The hotel offer complimentary coffee from 6:30am (with to-go cups) for those who want to head out. Although a  couple of mornings we took them back to our rooms. Columbus Circle is 1minute walk away offering all the shopping you could want. The Disney store, M&Ms store plus more are on the edge of Times Square (so within 2 min walk). We took a number of strolls through the park at different times of the day which was just stunning. I'd recommend having lunch at the Leobe Boathouse which is in the centre of Central Park. There's not much I can say about the hotel because everything was just so easy. Our holiday consisted of us turning up, (albeit our flight was delayed and I had to phone the hotel as soon as we landed to say we were definitely not a NO SHOW and would be there- but this caused no problem and we had our room ready and waiting on arrival). Perfect for a no-hassle, just arrive and enjoy, stay. The rooms are 'dated' but certainly nothing to complain about. Adds to the charm.

title: Beautiful Location
text: The JW Marriott Essex House is a beautiful hotel in a great location across the street from Central Park. The hotel staff was excellent and always friendly. The rooms are well kept and very modern. The beds were very comfortable and "normal" size for New York. The heating and cooling systems are very effective. We were on a very high floor and the elevators were fast even on a busy weekend. Many great restaurants are within walking distance. I strongly suggest you seek the advice of the hotel staff for restaurants and transportation. We will return!!

title: Correct word: terrible
text: This is not the type of hotel that meet the usual standard for JW Marriott. It's a terrible, it's a terrible service, it has a dirty carpets, dirty furniture and lack of maintenance in the bathrooms. Water damages in walls and rusted tiles. Don't lose your money.

title: Nice location
text: Overlooking Central Park, the JW Marriott certainly has one of the views in Mid Town Manhattan. The room was small but cozy. The ameneties were standard Marriott, nothing special about a JW though. Overall it was a good experience.

title: Time to pamper at the Essex House
text:
It's Heaven! I'm in Heaven! 
You will be so pampered here at the Essex House. Hotel gives excellent service. Super Clean! Professional friendly staff. Have amazing FOOD! It even Smells Awesome! It's at the best location where you can enjoy NY City!

title: Excellent Experience but Really Tiny Rooms
text: The service and employees at Essex House are fantastic caring people....every one of them. Great location at the center of Central Park South right on Central Park. Restaurant is well run, but the pricing is really exorbitant...almost as bad as room service or your mini-bar. The bed is heavenly. Shower is great. The amenities are top notch....even a 55" 4K TV in the room. The room, very well appointed was very small, barely enough room to walk around the bed on 3 sides. The room was a KING overlooking Central Park and the views of Central Park were amazing and the Horse & Buggy rides pick up directly in front of the Hotel. Security is great. Movie Stars & Ballers alike graced the place while we were there.

title: Very convenient, but old hotel with very expensive breakfasts
text: We had a lovely quiet room on reward points and that was fine. The hotel is centrally located and the staff is very nice. Nevertheless the breakfast was hyper expensive with served coffee $9 for starters. Fruit, muffins and yogurt cost $20. We headed out. Furniture in rooms is old with no chairs except at desk and limited. Also no heat in bathroom with stone tile floor.

title: Exactly As Promised
text: The JW Marriott Essex House is exactly as their website describes.  The service was lovely, the basic king bed room (sans park view) was comfortable and clean--the bathroom was quite modern and the cable TV service worked perfectly.  They checked us in quickly and were quite helpful overall.  Nice place to stay and great location.

title: 4 stars only for the location
text: The hotel is horribly over priced for Thanksgiving week due to the Macy's parade, but the location couldn't have been better and thus the 4 stars.  The room we were assigned, standard queen, faced an internal opening between several buildings - couldn't tell if they were all the hotel or other buildings.  The floor actually sloped in the room which was a bit unnerving, and you could hear the plumbing from other floors.  The bed was comfortable.   Lobby is pretty though and high five for the concierge staff - they know their craft and are the cream of the crop.

title: The best New Year's Eve experience Thank you 😊
text:
I'm very grateful & humbled being offered to stay @ their Presidential suite in JW Marriott Central Park South !!! Thanks to Jolly Mallory ( Guest Relations ) she helped me realized my wishes come true.
Every email exchanges to arrange every transaction was flawless.
I was well informed & notified ahead of time.
Because of the gridlock in New York City , we were advised to check in early, as early as 11:30 am 
& they will take care of you when you arrive at the property.
Our arrival was smooth!!!
Great workers were cordial & courteous!!!
Luis , the valet guy
Carmen, the bell woman 
Jasmine, guest relations on duty
Tyler, the Southgate in charge, who made my room so festive from dining to living set up...was beautiful, buffets & even Christmas tree🎄 by the fireplace. 
Thanks again to Jolly Mallory!!!
Mr Mo , the open bartender , both Mo & Tyler went above & beyond to their roles .
Thanks to Vinny Sharma ( Southgate Overall Manager) who allowed Mo to extend his oper bar service up to 12:30 am 
It was all worth it !!!!
They provided us Champagne for the new year toss up .
Even my young guests received trumpets 🎺 
Very careful that we won't disturb any other guests.
Ernest , Dorota from housekeeping were very courteous.
The whole suite was huge,
It has an open layout for Living room & Dining room.
It has a big foyer , where open bar was set up .
There were 2 king bedroom , additional single room, every room has its own complete bathroom & amenities, total of 4 bathroom, 1 for the guests.
The whole concept was so personalized  & private.
The housekeeping services , c/o named Mo ( young Mo ) what a coincidence, same name of the bartender 😊Mo assisted me to do a clean up in my suite after party @ 2 am
We had a swell time &  heavenly sleep , great , soft  linens & pillows 

The bathroom was immaculate.
The amenities were overloaded 
As
Thank goodness

title: Disappointed in Essex House for not being a true JW
text:
Seems like the JW Marriott Essex House should not be part of the brand.  Am a Marriott Gold Member, and do always stay loyal.  Wanted a special night with my adult family in the city for the night and paid dearly for a family suite, that honestly was not up to par. Read the reviews prior to going and thought to myself, can't be that bad to be in the brand, and unfortunately it was. Our rooms were not ready upon arrival 2.5 hrs early even though mobile check in said they were. Then we even waited past typical check in time, I had to push back and say come on already. Front desk clerk was not very friendly or caring, and did not treat me in any way as a gold member. We were not given a high room, even though that is specified in my profile. Upon finally getting the rooms on the 11th floor they were not fully clean, obviously not vacuumed, with rugs and bathrooms especially in very poor condition. Thermostat did not work in one room at all, and in the other worked incorrectly.  Property is very worn, with mold in tubs, chipping paint, peeling paper, and poor fixes in many spots. Rugs have stains and feel so dirty you want to wear slippers the whole time. Wifi never fully worked in either room, it kept dumping you off and then not logging you on properly. I did not make a fuss on site, as this would have upset the family dynamic and wasted precious time, and then we only figured out the thermostat issues late at night - which made for miserable sleeping. 
So not a JW. I stay Marriott loyally the world over, both in business for arranging events and personally for fun and I have to say, in twenty years that this was one of the biggest disappointments based on brand and cost.

title: Nice hotel.
text: The location and size of the room was superb. The lobby is gracious and comfortable. However there was no coffee in the room. You had to go downstairs for coffee. Also the  rooms are a little dated, but the comfort of the beds makes up for that. We had to call housekeeping a couple of times for small things that kept breaking in the room, but they responded quickly.

title: Special Thank you to Tim Henriquez
text: An error occurred with my reservation and then my suite.  Given the Hotel´s ¨Holidays full booking status¨ no one seemed to be able to assist me.  Of all the staff involved in my stay, Mr. Henriquez, front desk manager, was exceptional in helping my family and I and more than met our expectations in resolving all issues.  I want to personally thank him for making what could of been a potentially horrible trip, one of our most memorable!!  Special thank you again to Mr. Tim Hernandez, I hope the hotel management values his great work in assisting customers in such a pleasant and professional manner!!

title: Nice suite- soft bed- no water!
text: We stayed here for NYE weekend. The location is great and the hotel pleasant. Like most places in New York City it did come with a hefty price tag. The suite was pleasant- the pullout bed in the lounge wasn't the most comfy, which for the price I would have expected. The bed in the main room was extremely soft- so great if you like that kind of thing. The disappointing thing is there is no kettle or water in the rooms apart from the mini bar at -$8 a small bottle. Insane prices. It was $10 for a black tea!! I think for the price of the room it would be nice to either have a mr coffee in the room or offer tea and coffee to go in the restaurant. Nevertheless, great location so plenty of places to eat and drink nearby. Would I stay there again- probably not, better value for money in NYC than this place.

title: Go elsewhere
text: I stayed for two nights in December and had problems from check in to check out.  This hotel is perfectly situated for moving around the city.  However, the staff upon check in were rude.  I'm  a Lifetime Plat Elite and they refused to give me an upgrade even though rooms were available.  I had a view of a brick wall.  The second morning there was no hot water and the plumbing in my room backed up.  I reported this to the housekeeper outside my room.  I left the hotel to return hours later and the plumbing was still not resolved!  I complained to the management and they were very rude.  I paid over $500 a night, have been a very loyal customer and expect to be treated better.

title: Great location for stay in Midtown away from Times Sq
text:
I am a Marriott Rewards member and was staying for one night with my wife in the city. I was looking to be close enough to the park as well as midtown Christmas activities and a restaurant we were planning on going to down in Flatiron district. We wanted to be away from Times Sq (Marquis is great but too busy) and this was much nicer. 

This hotel overlooks the park on Central Park South - don't plan on a park view room even as a rewards member upgrade for gold. The room was great - old NY charm, clean, larger for a NY hotel room. Breakfast was great and the executive lounge makes the hotel worth the trip. The redo on JW branding is very nice, as I had not been in one for a few years. They now have their own 'style' and previously just was a nicer Marriott. We did have a few key issues getting in the executive lounge which was a bit embarrassing, as we had to go to the front desk when it would not scan in. It made us look like we were trying to get in when we shouldn't be.  

Overall, the hotel was great - location is ideal, easy to get a cab on CP South, and nice to cross the street and walk in the park.

title: Great management
text: I gave them 5 even tough the checkin wasn't very good because they've a manager literally sitting next to the front desk who took care of it ASAP.  Great location across from Central Park, near the Plaza hotel and so much more.  Beautiful rooms.

title: BRief 1 nite stay but totally impressed!
text: WE stayed on December 30 because my daughter was getting engaged at the Mandarin Oriental, and I figured I'd redeem my points for a free room. LAst time we stayed at the Ritz down the street but there were no available rooms. I was pleasantly surprised at the efficient and personable staff. A   Busy holiday weekend and they were totally accommodating. The restaurant manager at breakfast was very nice. I was just getting complementary coffeee but then ordered oatmeal. It is a very bright room that overlooks Central Park!!!I I look forward to returning !!!!

title: Teens First Stay in NYC
text: Fab hotel and well positioned for the subway to access some favourite haunts.... 911 Museum was worth the wait, high line was worth the walk, Matilda was sensational, shopping was fun and the food amazing.. hotel staff and amenities were stunning as was our apartment. Highly recommended.. don't buy any drinks in the theatres though they were ridiculously over overpriced!

title: Very comfortable and great location
text: After staying in times square one too many times, we decided to try a different location.  We went to Radio City Music Hall one night, and Lincoln Center another night and the location couldn't have been more perfect.  The best part is that we found the location to be much quieter and relaxing than in times square.  Our room was spacious and relaxing. The staff was very accommodating, helpful and friendly.

title: Great location! Slippage on quality.
text:
I was a bit hesitant to book a room for my husband & I after reading the reviews. However, because of the location I decided to take a chance.  The JW Marriott Essex
House has great potential to be a landmark quality hotel that would be a gem in the
Marriott crown.  Simple details seemed to be overlooked, or ignored completely.  When we booked the room we were told we would be on a high level floor with a view of Central Park.  We were given a room on the 7th floor.  We did have a splendid view down the center of Central Park but it would have been better on a higher floor which is what we expected.  When we inquired about the discrepancy, we were told there are
no guarantees for a high floor and none were available because we were there for the Christmas holiday.  We paid over $400 per night and didn't even get complimentary bottles of water!  We are reward members too! The furniture looks like it needs to be repaired or replaced as there are chips, dents, and scratches in most areas.  The wallpaper in the bathroom was peeling off the wall, and the area that was peeling seemed to be a very poor patch up job.  When we returned to our room after an outing there was a pile of trash in the hallway by our room, and it was still there when we left for dinner hours later.  By morning the trash was finally gone, but it was disappointing to see in the first place.  The bed was extremely comfortable, although my husband thought it was too soft.  The room was quiet and overall our experience at the Essex House was good. The staff was polite and friendly.  However, for over $400 per night we expected there to be more attention to details. Especially, with the JW Marriott name! As far as returning there....we're not sure.  We will look around and see what else is out there. For the hotels reference we were in room 703.

title: Great Service, Great location, Great Suite!
text:
Loved staying here, loved the location on Central Park and the warmth and charm of EVERYONE who we came into contact with - down to the Cleaning lady who had the joy of a room with a sick baby in it!!!! And kept being smiley and kind! Love the doormen, and the easy cheerful check-in!
Executive lounge will save you lots and lots of meals if you choose to use it - great breakfasts!!!!!!!!
WE had a little problem of facade work going on outside the room - and were moved in an instant to a much nicer larger more luxurious suite with smiles and charm and loveliness!
Thank you to Mallory Jolly and all of the staff for a memorable and wonderful stay in New York!!!!!!!!!!!!

title: Great Christmas night visit
text: We usually stay in Times Sq but decided to we wanted to be somewhere less quiet and not as crowded.  The JW Marriott is across the street from Central Park and two blocks from Columbus Circle and the subway, or 5th Avenue from the opposite direction.  Cesar checked us into a spacious, clean room with very comfortable beds and everyone in the hotel could not have been nicer.  The lobby bar/restaurant had a nice vibe to it and was nice for a drink after dinner out, and the breakfast in the executive lounge the next morning was great.  We will be back to the JW Marriott in the future, maybe during the warmer weather so we can enjoy the park.

title: Just bad! Not JW quality!
text: We arrived in the early morning after a delayed flight. The front desk attendant was half asleep. She forgot to give us Lounge keys, didn't bring up the Internet code and we had to ask for two keys. Okay, rough start at 7:00 am after flying all night. We got to our room and the door is propped open with the deadbolt. A bill from someone else is on the floor and we are creeped out! We head back downstairs and the same sleepy attendant calls her manager. He swears that it was cleaned and that the room was saved for us because we had paid for the night before but missed it due to the delayed flight. I ask for another room as a simple solution and he swears (his word not mine) that it is the only one in the hotel and that it was cleaned. He then promises us 15,000 Marriott points (which he has never credited to our account). We go back upstairs exhausted and concerned about the safety of the room to find garbage from the previous occupant on the floor, coffee stains all over the counter and the floors had not been vacuumed. Wow, unsafe, filthy and a manager who is full of fast talk. I should mention we have stayed in a dozen JW Marriott properties this year - SF, Palm Dessert, Chicago, Boston. This property and the front desk personnel are not up to JW Marriott standards. Totally disappointed!

title: Wish I'd stayed on at the Residence Inn
text:
This is the 3rd JW we've stayed in as a family over the past year or so (the best of these being in San Antonio, TX). Having walked up from a great experience at the Residence Inn (Central Park) I regret to say I wish we hadn't. Having come from the 55th floor with a view over Manhattan to die for our 7th floor accommodation with a view of a brick wall was, to say the least, a massive come down.

If it matters too you to stay directly on the Park then this is on the park, however... My expectation of any brand is consistency and to compare Essex House to the JW@San Antonio is, well, not easy. I don't expect hotels to be influenced by local/regional attitude, indifference or anything else for that matter. 

Staff functional more than friendly, decor a little tired & for a hotel on CP, the room view was totally non-existent. 

Hotels that charge top dollar for everything really do need to deliver more than an average experience...for me, I'd take the less ornate surroundings of, say, the Residence Inn, for a better all round experience after all, who comes to Manhattan for a view of a brick wall?!

title: Perfect Location and Beautiful Hotel
text: This is a very convenient location in NYC.  You are on Central Park South with The Park right across the street.  You are in walking distance to many things tourists will want to see and do and if walking is not an option, the subway is around the corner. The hotel is beautiful and the service excellent. The rooms are small which is typical of a NYC hotel.

title: Just Fine.
text:
We spent the weekend at the Essex House this past weekend.  This hotel gets 5 stars for the location, history, and housekeeping staff.  They seem to have done a nice job preserving the turn-of-the-century beauty and keeping the high-traffic hotel well maintained.  The real downside is the rooms.  They are well stocked and clean, but let me tell you - they are SMALL.  We had 3 people in a double room and it was not particularly fun.  We had to literally roll the desk chair into the closet so that we had space to just walk around the room.  

But, that being said, you shouldn't be spending too much time in the room considering this hotel's location.  Within easy walking distance you have: Central Park, Columbus Circle, Lincoln Center, Midtown, 5th Ave, Times Square, the Theater District, and Hell's Kitchen.  If you are traveling by train, Penn Station and Grand Central are just a short cab ride away; there are also plenty of subway stations nearby.  

The other downside is the concierge lounge - it was an utter zoo this weekend!  It was not the exclusive business lounge that I have come to love and depend on when traveling.  I couldn't even sit down to enjoy breakfast because it was so busy and the staff was horridly rude to patrons.  I saw a woman being yelled at in front of a lobby full of people for *attempting* to bring a banana out of the lounge.  

If you just need a place to lay your head - this isn't a bad option.  If you're looking for luxury accommodations - go elsewhere.  This is just an average Marriott in a historic building.

title: Fantastic stay - great location and A+ service
text:
First off, I was deciding between The Plaza, RC-CP and the JW. Ultimately the price, suite availability and Trip Advisor ratings made my choice. After my stay, I must say I made the right choice and found myself overly impressed at how personal and customer-focused the Jw staff was, even admits a fully booked weekend all across the city! 

I stayed here for two nights the weekend before Christmas, so the city was bustling with Christmas events everywhere. This location is perfect - easy cab ride at night to Radio City/dinner after the show, and during the day we walked all along 5th Ave down to Rockefeller for lunch at the food court and over to Times Sq for more shopping. 

Was such a fun trip with family and the JW delivered the best overall service, accommodations and location. 

Lastly, huge kudos to Chris during check-in and Randy from in-room dining. Excellent people with the best down to earth personalities!

title: Stunning!
text:
We came into the city for one night for a much needed change of scenery and to enjoy the holiday decorations. We pulled up to valet our car and the bellman was so very friendly. He followed us up right away with our luggage. Turned out he was familiar with our hometown and we enjoyed a wonderful conversation. 
The views from our 38th floor Central Park facing room was literally jaw dropping. One could just stare out the windows and ponder all the comings and goings of everyone below. The room decor was lovely and the bed was truly comfortable. There was a main bathroom and also a powder room. We travel frequently and have have had the good fortune to stay in many lovely hotels here and abroad. So glad we tested out this classic hotel. We would return without a doubt. Loved our experience!

title: Good Location and Decent Stay for Business Trip
text: I stayed four nights at this hotel in December, travelling for business. The lobby, as expected, was decorated nicely for the holidays with a large tree and other decorations. The first floor is beautiful, the restaurant nice and it truly feels like a luxury hotel. The room was nice size and clean, and offers a large TV. The room could definitely use some updates as it is looking worn and a bit dirty. The view was of buildings across the street, definitely not the park side. A few issues--housekeeping does not care if you have the door flipped to "privacy" as they are going to knock and knock regardless. I was also awoken at 1:30 am on a Friday morning by four maintenance men looking for a leak. After obtaining proper identification (I am a woman travelling alone) they all four piled into my room for the next 20 minutes and messed around in the bathroom. Not one word, credit or acknowledgement from the front desk for such an inconvenience. Room service appears quickly and the food is decent. I was very disappointed by no coffee maker in the room, and no creamer available for the complimentary coffee downstairs. At these prices, you can expect a coffee maker in the room or creamer available in the restaurant. No complaints about the location--it was very convenient.

title: Великолепный вид на центральный парк
text: Отличное местоположение рядом с 5ой авеню и парком. По утрам бегала там, очень необычные ощущения как в кино. Вид на парк это чудесно. У меня не входил завтрак в стоимость, я вышла купила кофе и круассан и позавтракала в номере наслаждаясь прекрасным видом.

title: JW Marriott Essex House NYC  is grandeur
text: We traveled to NYC for a few days of vacation before a family event in NJ. Got a chance to stay at the Essex House, which has been party of Central Park South landscape for over 80 years. Stately is its architecture, the JW doesn't disappoint. Staff and concierge services were fast, efficient and professional. Executive club breakfast featured fresh, taste and picture perfect fruit as well as a selection of standard breakfast fare, and included delicious (and plentiful) smoked salmon. Rooms were modernized and well appointed featuring a crystal clear big screen TV and premium cable channels. Every staff member we interacted with was friendly, cheerful, helpful and professional. We will stay again. Great JW experience.

title: Classic NY hotel, now run by Marriott
text:
The Essex House is a Classic NY hotel, now run by Marriott. It is very well located, within walking distance to Lincoln Center and even the theatre district. 

The Executive lounge for gold and platinum members is probably the best in the Marriott system...

It was very busy, and turn down services (Marriott standard) are only provided if you call to request --- every day of your stay. Just sharing so you know what to do.

title: SIMPLY NOT GOOD ENOUGH - LEFT FEELING DISAPPOINTED - TOO EXPENSIVE
text:
I'm a huge fan of Marriott and  I have stayed a sufficient number of their hotels to compare objectively. I booked the Essex House to celebrate a special occasion and because it has always been on my list of 'must do' places.

Pros

- Amazing location

- Friendly staff (particularly the housekeeping/chamber staff)

- Excellent foyer

- Great breakfast offering in the Executive Lounge (would be even better if they prepared back bacon as well as crisp & streaky smoked bacon)

Cons

- Unless you get a Central Park view room there is little to see (the photo attached shows the view from my room).

- Expensive, expensive, expensive. (Local beer £12 for about 4/5ths of a pint, prosecco £18 for a glass not a bottle - yes that's in GB Pounds not $ - calculated at the December 2016 exchange rate and including an obligatory 20% tip). Usually, in Marriotts we make great use of the hotel bars and restaurants but the Essex House was so overpriced we went elsewhere. Midtown will never be cheap, but this was ludicrous.

- Seen from a distance the hotel looks amazing and dominates the skyline overlooking Central Park. There is nothing in the hotel that takes advantage of its location. It needs a bar/restaurant/roof garden with views over the park.

- Unlike most Marriotts the Executive Lounge only offers complimentary soft drinks

- The Executive Lounge does not open on certain days

- On one evening they closed the bar to hotel guests for a private party and did not offer an alternative.

Summary

There are much, much better Marriotts in NYC (I have stayed at four others). This place could be breathtakingly good but, as it is presently, it falls way short. It might meet brand standards but JW Marriotts are supposed to make you feel special and excited by the hotel. To illustrate: as soon as I settled in my room I felt so underwhelmed by the Essex House that went straight on to the Marriott website to see if I could book another Marriott and move hotels. Next time I'm in NYC I will choose another Marriott.

title: 忘れ物
text:
ホテルに買い物袋を忘れました。夜中にスタッフのみなさんが嫌な顔せず、とても熱心に捜してくれました。忙しい中一緒に捜してくれて、とても親切な対応に感謝します。

Great appreciations to Tim and Etienne at front office, and Derek and Carlos at security.

title: Perfect location, friendly staff, great concierge lounge
text: We are Marriott Platinum status and that made for a nice visit with the concierge lounge opened throughout the day to get water, tea, snacks, etc. At breakfast, there was an extensive buffet - one of the best I have seen in a concierge lounge. The staff throughout the hotel were professional and friendly. They were very helpful offering advice about NYC. The location is directly across from Central Park - a perfect place to start each day.

title: Can I get my points back? My Worst Experience in a Hotel Yet
text:
In all my years experience in being a Platinum Premier / Platinum this hits rock bottom as my all time worst experience. I just started coming to New York again and I took an extra day for myself and thought I would check out a new hotel that I might switch too, I used 45,000 points. I showed up about two hours after the check in time. The took me away from the main check out area just as I was about to be assisted to a small area down the hallway, it was strange, the way the guy snapped at me to follow him, made you feel like you were not good enough for the main check in area. Total rudeness, put in the shabbiest of rooms, no view, no upgrade of any kind. dirty carpets, awkward layout, she offered my points because she said 10 would not get me anything. The management of this hotel does not understand how long it takes to accumulate 45,000 points and they don't care it is totally clear. The way she talked to me I felt like they wish I had not come and so do I. I tried to express my disappointment I was immediately shut up before I could finish talking with a line I'll never forget saying "Maybe" we can give you a nice room on a future visit. 

Why would I risk another 45,000 points just to see if they will treat me right. I will never set foot in here on any future visits to NYC, as a consumer you should trust that the overwhelmingly bad reviews on this site and others are a sign that you should select a different Marriott Hotel of which there are so many. If this is how they treat there most valuable guests imagine how they treat someone who has no status.

title: Should have been better
text:
We stayed on points and got a pretty good deal, so can't complain too much.  But if I'd paid $900/night I'd have been livid.  The hotel is nice, and the room is large.  But it's not that nice.  I understand that everything in NYC is expensive, and the CP address is even better, but some things felt dated, and a few amenities were lacking.

On the good side - friendly staff, the proximity to the Park is great, especially if you are a runner.

Bad stuff:

1. We arrived Friday night around 10pm and noticed a glass on the floor in the hallway, likely left by our neighbor.  When we returned to the hotel Saturday night, 24 hours later, it was still there.  Attention to detail

2. Mold along the caulk lines in the shower.  Pretty much unacceptable in my book for a hotel at this level

3. We noticed some major dings on the baseboards and elsewhere in the hallways that had simply been painted over.  That's a Motel 6 practice.  Baseboards are cheap, and a 5* hotel should be doing it right.

4. There is no coffee pot in the room, which makes absolutely no sense.  We like to drink hot tea, and usually bring our own tea bags and use the pot for hot water, which of course is impossible here.  They do offer complimentary coffee in the lobby in the morning, which would be fine except that they only have coffee - no tea or hot water.

title: Overall a very nice hotel.  Fun amenities and pleasant staff.
text: Rooms are cozy, but all of the amenities are pleasant.  It is an older building but maintained nicely.  We enjoyed the breakfast in the executive lounge.  The food was good and the staff was friendly.  The proximity to shows and the subway were important to us.

title: Fabulous location but tired decor and great view of the HVAC systems
text: I just checked into the hotel and while the location could not be any better, I'm really disappointed in my room. I am a Gold rewards member, ended up on the 5th floor. The room is small but that's not the issue. The carpet is dirty and the furniture is stained. I am in cell service neverland as my room overlooks the HVAC system.The room is dark, even with 2 windows. I won't stay here again, too many other options.

title: Thanksgiving visit for 7 days.
text: Great, well trained, friendly, knowledgeable, helpful, efficient staff. Clean spacious rooms, comfortable lounge where a quiet conversation is possible. Across the street from Central Park. Close to a lot of fun places, good food and theaters. Easy to get everywhere from here.

title: Old World Charm
text: Have stayed here a few times. This hotel is right on the park. It hasa beautiful art deco interior.The room was nice and quiet. The breakfast was a real highlight. The staff was polite and helped us with directions.

title: Park View
text: We moved to the JW Marriott House New York after a disappointing experience at the Four Seasons Downtown.  What a relief. Classic hotel across from Central Park. Great location. Nice little lobby bar, we sat by the windows and enjoyed the view.  We had a larger, very comfortable room on the back. Next time we will opt for a room on the front with a view of the Park.  We will definitely be back.

title: Best location, Good hotel
text: Service was really good. Not great, but really good. Kevin is a fantastic concierge. Everyone else I talked to at the concierge desk was robotic, uninspired and not very helpful.  All of the front desk staff was kind. The valet guys are nice and helpful but something strange is going on when they get you a car. They are very aggressive in wanting you to use one that they want you to use. We even witnessed two different valets arguing with each other about who got to recommend their car to us. They must get a commission from the drivers. That's ok. I think the last complaint I would say is that the rooms are getting just a bit worn. There were stains on our couch, banged up and water warped wooden furniture and the telephone handset wasn't working. Listen, this place is really nice and it's literally a stones throw from the side of central park that has the zoo, the ice rink, a good playground, etc. it's also one short block to the Plaza hotel which had great shops underneath. We were also a 5 minute walk from 5th avenue. The location couldn't be better.  I would definitely stay here again.

title: AVOID!
text: I am so disappointed as the Essex House has always been our got to hotel on our yearly trip to New York City.  We will never stay there again.  I had two rooms totaling $5,800.00, One a regular room with king bed, the second a suite overlooking the park.  The condition of these rooms are deplorable.  The first room we were placed in (the suite that overlooked a brick wall) had a noise that literally kept us up all night.  It may have been an elevator or service closet, I'm unsure but it was LOUD.  They moved us to a higher floor and this room was quiet; however, the condiiton of the room was terrible for the price paid.  I took pictures of the ripped carpeting, a sink that does not drain, and worn furniture to the point of holes in it.  When I explained the situation, I received an email offering me 10,000 points toward my next stay.  No thank you, we will go elsewhere.  Marriott really let this place rocket downhill!  This is a $100 a night room, not $1000.

title: Great location for nice hotel
text:
The location of this hotel is spectacular. You can save money and time on transportation since you can walk to so many things. We stayed here specifically for Central Park and it was relaxing to stroll back into the hotel to our room. 
Our room was fine. I love the luxury of the Ritz but knew this would not be at that level since their room rates were much pricier, as was the Plaza, which are right next door. This hotel has a standard tub and shower curtain, which is not luxurious but still had nice water pressure and was clean. 

The interior view caught me off guard when I checked in and made me feel claustrophobic. They were able to move me to a street view which was better for me. I didn't mind the noise on the 11th floor. 

I feel I got a good value for a great location. I wanted to stay at a Marriott and wanted to see the Park, and this fit the bill. I would stay here again but I'd make sure I got a good rate again!

title: Classic NYC hotel. Old, but well maintained with renovations
text: The location of this hotel couldn't be any better; on 59th by Central Park.  Centrally located to everywhere we planned to go.  It is a landmark, and it seems to have been very well maintained. But like many classic NYC hotels, it is old.  The rooms have had upgrades, but the rooms are definitely on the smaller side relative to modern design.  The concierge service is super professional.  The head concierge (Kevin) really knows what he is doing and is willing to help make happen whatever you need.  Rooms were clean.  Housekeeping was responsive.  Guy who took care of our room was a champ and everything was cleaned and reorganized to perfection when we returned to the room each day. Overall, a good experience.

title: Good location, otherwise disappointing.
text:
This was my first (and last) stay at the JW Marriott Essex House. My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights for a weekend birthday trip. Friends also joined us in another room in the hotel. Check in was simple using Marriott's iPhone app, and the room keys were ready when I arrived. The hotel doesn't have the texting to guest services option turned on in the app as some Marriotts do. 

Guest relations had contacted me via email ahead of time to inquire about what brings me to NY. I responded that it was a birthday trip for me and my husband. I am a Platinum member so requested an upgrade when I replied. They were unable to upgrade me, but did leave a handwritten note with two drink vouchers in the room. 

We were in a room on the 16th floor; it didn't offer a view of anything but an adjacent building. Our king room was modestly sized as others have described. The bed and bedding was comfortable. The quality of the furnishings was poor in light of the hype (Category 9) of the hotel and the JW brand. The room had not been updated in a number of years and had a worn feel. This is a historic property with some ornate details (lobby, elevators), but this doesn't fully translate to the room. We appreciated that there were robes provided as well as an in-room safe. We found that our room was turned over promptly each day.

We had breakfast one day in the executive lounge. There was a full array of hot and cold options consistent with any Marriott lounge- nothing special. It gets crowded, so they manage it by forming a wait list.

We had a few drinks in the lobby restaurant, but didn't explore the food. At the 5PM hour on Friday, the bar staff was struggling to quickly attend to the bar seating. 

The location of this hotel is prime, directly across the street from Central Park and accessible to trains plus the shops and restaurants of Manhattan. Other than location, it is underwhelming. I had an incredibly disappointing service experience on my last day. I had requested a late check-out upon checking in, so in the morning of the last day, I called to confirm what time late check out was. The person who answered the phone stated the hotel was unable to offer "any more" late check-outs. When I noted I had requested it at check-in, she told me they didn't offer "any" late check-outs and that I'd need to check out by 11AM. I had to skip my workout then hurry to get myself out by 11, then check my bags with the bell desk. I called my friends to give them a heads up and learned they had a late-check out. I discussed this sloppy service mishap with the front desk attendant who apologized, looked at my account and stated I could indeed have a 1 or 2PM check-out. This didn't help since I'd already rushed around and moved my things out. I stay in a Marriott almost every week of the year, usually in NYC or a major city, and have never encountered such a sloppy service situation (or a problem obtaining a 1PM check out). It was very unexpected and had a disappointing impact to my day's plans. Based upon this, I won't return to this property when on pleasure or business in NYC.

title: Great location, but...
text: ...as a Marriott Gold member, while I understand that upgrades are not always available, I could have been given a better room than one on the third floor overlooking the back alley. Right below my window sanitation trucks were picking garbage at all hours of the night. The rooms look fairly dated as well. There was not much "executive" about the Executive Lounge. Completely overrun with a waitlist to have breakfast. With the SPG and Marriott merger likely half the guests have lounge privileges. On a positive note, the staff was very friendly, the concierge outstanding on giving us dining, transportation, and sightseeing advice. Also enjoyed the food in the restaurant and bar lounge seating near the fire place. Excellent menu. However, I would not stay here again, the rooms are too expensive for the value received, even for a New York hotel.

title: A high quality establishment located very well for the upscale tourist and the mid town business person
text: Working under pressure, the short staffed team at this location did a wonderful job. In particular, the Front Desk Manager, Jeffery Rosenberg, ably assisted by Etienne Giral. They do need to take a leaf out of their siste property in Dubai and staff up .. This is NewYork City .. No one has any patience!!! The rest of the infratsrructure delivers what a 5* place offers with a very fine executive lounge .. Minor flaw .. Staff at the Southgate Restaurant need some training on how to make a strong cup of tea!!

title: Wonderful Location
text: Very nice hotel within easy walking distance of the shopping and "wow" places in the city. Staff was enormously kind and helpful. Standard pricy food and drinks at the restaurant and bar. I would like to give it 5 stars, however, rooms are a little tired and need some TLC. Very clean however. All in all, a great medium-upper priced hotel near it all!

title: 최악이었어요.호텔오너는보세요.
text:
회사에서 5일 그리고 개인적으로 2일 총 7박을 이곳
메리어트 에섹스뉴욕에서 묵었습니다. 
일단후기가너무없어서 걱정했고,우리는 10월30일부터11월 6일 까지 묵었습니다. 영어가 능통하지 않은터라 걱정은 했는데, 첫날 냉장고를 사용하려 했는데, 냉장고문이 락이 걸려있었습니다. 냉장고앞에 영어가 써있는지는 확인 못한건 제 책임이라 생각하고 $35 기꺼이 낼수있습니다. 개인용도로 사용시 35불 지불된다는 영어안내문을 나중에 알았기 때문에. . 근데 그보다 어이없는건,안에 센서가 걸려있는지 먹지도 않은 위스키,샴페인,술을 꺼놓고 다시 집어넣었는데 28만원이 청구가 됬어요. 진짜 어의없지 않습니까? 그것도 그거지만. . 체크아웃할때 청구된거 없다고 그러더니. . 한국와서 카드값 폭탄맞았어요. 그럼 먹지도 않은 음료,술 어쩔껀가요? 그것뿐만아니고, 자고있는데 새벽에 에어컨디션이 고장인지 물폭탄 맞고, 새벽 7시에 방을 옮겼어요. 그거에 대한 보상은 커녕 그 시간에 자다 방을 옮기게 하지를 않나,카드청구는 얘기도없이 그냥 승인을 따고. . 28만원 쌩돈 날렸습니다. 먹지도 않은 음료와 술값 받으신거 안마신 증거있는데 어쩌실껀지 궁금합니다.

title: Getaway
text:
We always stay at the Essex House when we're in the city. The rooms are beautiful and the staff are always friendly and helpful. 
The Executive Lounge staff somehow always remember our names. They really pay attention to the little things. I would highly recommend this Hotel

title: Excellent location in New York City
text: We booked this hotel for a business meeting at the request of a client. The price was a bit steep but we were able to negotiate a reasonable rate for our group. The main reason for choosing this hotel is the location; right across from Central Park and within walking distance from multiple attractions including the park itself, fifth avenue, multiple places to see, shops, restaurants, shows, etc. The meeting rooms were very nice and the service was good, though somewhat expensive; our meeting went well. The service and accommodations are what you should expect from a JW Marriot, and the restaurant and bar were very good. Overall a good experience but try to negotiate a group rate if you can.

title: Muy Buen servicio
text:
Somos propietarios de Marriott weeks y siempre usamos la cadena Marriott , el Essex house es uno de nuestros preferidos por su ubicación y buen servicio , llegamos a la ciudad muy temprano en la mañana y a pesar de que el check in es a las 4 pm nos dieron nuestra habitación aproximadamente a las 10 am , luego de mi insistencia .
Siempre todo impecable , lo único que me parece muy exagerado es el costo de los desayunos y consideró que el bar de un hotel como este debe mantener e abierto hasta más tarde en la noche.

title: Perfect location and good service
text: Perfect location right on south side of Central Park.  Staff are courteous, friendly and always there to help.  Rooms are clean and fresh, with the only criticism being that the rooms lack a luxury level that you would expect from a 5 star hotel on Central Park - eg amenities, touchpoints, dated rooms.  If you want a great location and great service it's a great option to look at.

title: Recherche le luxé désespérément
text:
L'emplacement de l'hôtel est super Juste a côté de Central Park
L'hôtel est majestueux Grand hall avec plein de fauteuils Tous le luxe est là et que là !
Une fois dans la chambre ça se gâte !
Chambre petite avec un lit de 140 un seul peignoir une seule paire de chausson À croire qu'on nous à donner une single !
Maintenant les détails !! Ne vous mettez pas près des fenêtres !! C'est pire que la clim tellement ça souffle
Pensez à prendre vous bouchons d'oreille tellement on entend la rue 
Quand à la salle de bain, la porte ne restait pas fermée si on ne l'enclenchait pas !
Côté propreté : pas génial ! Le client d'avant avait du éternuer sur le miroir et on nous a laissé les restes ! La faïence de la baignoire est pleine de tartre 
Au niveau entretien, plein de petites choses sont abîmés : abat jour, gond de porte, marqueterie du bureau abîmé 
Cote petit déjeuner : un grand buffet mais cher cher cher pour la qualité et le goût ( 50€ par personne)
Point positif : Etienne qui a fait notre Check In Super Gentil
La deco style Art Deco que j'aime beaucoup
Dans la chambre on peut se connecter à son compte Netflix 
Il y a également un Super Petit bar ( surtout regardez mais ne touchez pas : très cher)

title: It's not worth what I payed, I hope to never come back
text:
I was participating in a conference in town, and this hotel was located very near the venue..... I thought, given the prices, that the hotel would be a good one, and I booked a standard queen room. I was not expecting to have a view of the Central Park, because I had not payed for it, but, I could not even see the sky from my room, and moreover, I looked to a wall.... My room was in the 3rd floor.
Breakfast was not included, and you do not have a coffee machine in the room, although they provide complimentary coffee on the first floor.
One of the lamps in the room did not worked, and as of the third day I left a note and they changed it. The air conditioned system made a terrible noise. It is really surprising for me that they even not review the basics and essentials of a room.

I leaved the refreshment paper in the door, for breakfast the next day and they did not picked it up. I was waiting for breakfast, and I do not received it..... I called and they told me they would rush, but "in the rush" they forgot some parts of my order.

On the good side, location is ok, very near metro stations, and they have ice machines in some of the floors.

All in, definitively they have a problem with service and the quality of the rooms. It was annoying the way people that actually works there treats the passengers......  the Doorman did not opened the dor or even helped with luggage upon departing, the girl at the restaurant in the morning was very unpolite, like: "if you are not having breakfast here, I am not even interested in your needs".

Net/Net: If you can, avoid this hotel..... for the same price I am sure that you can get something better.... this wasn't worth the money I spent.

title: Central Park is at your doorstep.
text:
We had a wedding at the New York athletic club rite next door to this hotel so it was a great choice to stay here rather than drive back to NJ. 
it was our first time at this Marriott but it will not be our last!

When you enter you can feel the historical charm... It has that " welcome " feel when you look around the main reception area and all of the staff we met were an extension of that too 
We had a king bed and the room was not as small as most of the NY hotels we have stayed in. 
I found the entire hotel to be very clean and maintained constantly. 

And.. You can walk out the front door and there is the glorious Central Park for you to enjoy. 

I must say ,as with all hotels, the food is expensive and drinks were too!
There are some fantastic restaurants all around this hotel so try them for sure. A few we like are LeColonial ( French /Vietnamese).. Brasserie 8 1/2 (French ) all within in walking distance.

title: The best choice for visiting New York
text:
Great staffs
The staffs are well trained and smart.
Great attitude
The staffs are willing to help out every inquiries and help us until we solve the problems.
Great location
It's right in front of the Central Park, really convenient.

title: Terrible hotel - AVOID
text:
We flew 8 hours from London and were given a room with a noise so loud it sounded like a jet engine was outside the window (i.e. as if we were still in the plane). When we requested another room we were told there wasn't a room available. To make matters worse the night manager eventually admitted the hotel knew about the noise AND previous guests had complained, but still put us in the room without any prior disclosure. The night manager came to our room around midnight and stayed until 1.30am trying to stick a duvet to the window with sticky tape to muffle the noise. It was never going to work and eventually he told us he was sorry but it wasn't working. I said there was no way I was paying for that first night as it was ridiculous that a) we had been stuck in a room with a known problem and b) we had been kept awake half the night watching this ridiculous attempt to stop the noise.

The next day we were moved to several different rooms all of which had similar, or in 1 case worse, noise problems. Eventually the third room we were given was free from this jet engine noise but as it was on a lower floor facing the main road still had traffic noise though this was preferable to the previous noise and at the least had a view of the park. 

The hotel is apparently due to be refurbished and I certainly hope they will get better windows to keep out the various noises from outside to allow guests to sleep peacefully. 

Whilst the hotel rooms were terrible for the poor noise insulation as well as being in need of modernisation, the staff were polite and offered as good customer service as they were able to. 

We stayed as a couple but were there to attend an event with other family embers  and friends also staying at the hotel and all of us were equally unimpressed. 

My Amex was charged the room rate for all of the nights we stayed at the hotel even though I made it clear I would not pay for that first night and the night manager on the first night seemed to acknowledge it was unreasonable to charge us for the first night whilst trying to stick the duvet to the window. My card was also charged without discussing the bill with me, which I have never experienced at any other hotel in the world.

For the rate of almost $500 per night there are a swathe of better hotels you can select in the city. This is one to avoid. 

This year 2016 I stayed at the Starwood in Athens in September and the Marriott in Paris, but after this experience I do not plan to ever stay in a Marriott again.

Terrible experience.

title: Luxury and Location
text:
The hotel is luxurious and the staff is attentive, capable and caring.  Our room overlooked Central Park, a breathtaking view of the Park and both the East and West Sides. The fall leaves were still on the trees; beautiful colors. The room was a good size, comfortable for a few night's stay, with a good expanse of dresser and desk, a long couch beneath the three windows, and a king size bed with beautiful linens and those fabulous Marriott pillows.
