The colors of the room, peaches and golds, went so well with the colors of Central Park beyond our windows.

After walking all over midtown, we settled into our room for a late afternoon nap.  The hotel hallways and the other guests are quiet;  a nice change that!  The windows shut out most of the street noise, save for the clip clop of the horses pulling the Hansom Cabs. But that was a pretty sound to which to fall asleep. 

The location is perfect for seeing all of what NYC offers at Christmas time,  from Fifth Ave. to Rockefeller Center, to Radio City.  And, in the morning, Central Park is at your doorstep for some morning exercise.

title: Location, style and amenities...at a price
text:
On the park within walking distance of the theatre district, shopping on 5th avenue and great restaurants. Great fitness facility, full breakfast at the executive lounge (but no newspapers available, odd.)
Been  Our room was large for NY standards, about 500sf...but no view of the park and still $1000 a night. Thus the 4 vs. a full 5 star rating.

title: Wonderful location, hotel upkeep lacking
text:
We visited the hotel for 5 days over the Thanksgiving Holiday! We loved the staff we interacted with, however the hotel upkeep is sorely lacking. Management must have eye off ball.
Our first room didn't have heat and it took two maintenance visits to say heater didn't work. They moved us and the next room's air exchange filter didn't appear to have be changed in months, it was filthy. In another room we had, the curtain wouldn't work.

title: Excellent Stay
text: I decided to take chance on the Essex House, in spite of some mixed reviews on this site.  I stay freqently in mid town, but have found in recent years that any place charging less than $500/night risks being overwhelmed with tourists weighed down with shopping bags, clogging up the lobby, the front desk, and the elevators.   I am pleased to say that this was a great stay. I arrived on a quiet Sunday afternoon and found my check in to be polite and efficient. My room was in good shape - not brand new but there was nothing bad to say about it. There was more than enough storage space, the bathroom was up to date, and the bed was very comfortable. My room was on a low floor on the 58th street side of the buidling, but I did not experience any noise issues. The breakfast buffet in the ground floor was very good and was never crowded.  Lastly, the fitness center, while not large, was well equipped and very clean. I will definitely return.

title: Upscale Hotel at the Tip of Central Park
text:
My wife and I stayed at the JW Marriott Essex House on November 23, 2016 while visiting New York City for the Macy's Parade on Thanksgiving.  I am a Marriott Gold Rewards member, so I decided to use my Marriott Rewards points for our stay.  I did mobile checkin 2 hours before arrival, and our room was available at noon when we arrived.  Our checkin went very smoothly.  In addition, the clerk informed me that no room upgrades were available.  I did not expect any upgrade to begin with, because the hotel was completely booked for the Macy's Parade.  Plus, I was using my Marriott Rewards points for our stay.  However, we still received a key pass for the Executive Lounge, which is for Marriott Platinum and Gold members.  

My wife and I were very impressed with our room.  It was classified as an Essex King, and it was about 330 square feet, which is good size for New York standards.  We knew this was an upscale hotel by looking at the furnishings and decor of the room.  In particular, when we walked into the room, a motion sensor light automatically turned the lights on.  There was also a motion sensor light on the bottoms of the 2 night stands at the edges of the king bed.  The floor had carpeting, and there was a nice desk with a comfortable chair at the end of the bed.  Furthermore, the drapes on the windows were very fancy.  Moreover, the bathroom was good size, and it contained an elevated sink. The bed and pillows were very comfortable,  so my wife and I had no problems sleeping that night.  Plus, the noise level was non-existent.  Another positive of the hotel was the staff, which were all well dressed, very pleasant, and helpful.

My wife and I took advantage of the Executive Lounge that evening.  This lounge contained a diversity of food to satisfy one's appetite.  There was no need to go out to dinner that night.  On Thanksgiving morning, the Executive Lounge contained coffee and water.  

Even though the JW Marriott Essex House is on the Macy's Parade route, hotel guests were not allowed to stand in front of the hotel.  Rather, guests could walk one block up to 7th Ave or another block from there to Columbus Circle.  In our case, my wife and I went out the back door of the hotel to 58th Street, turned left, and went a short distance to the intersection of 6th Avenue and 58th Street.  

In summary, this is an upscale hotel that my wife and I strongly recommend to anyone willing to pay above average prices.

title: Disappointing
text:
We have been frequent guests at the Essex House over several years, including hosting group events.
This year our 5 night stay was so bad that we will not return.
Unanswered phones, tubs don't drain, no bellman on duty, walls chipped and dented, bottle wine not accessible in the restaurant, jaded and indifferent staff and souvenir bedbug bites to remember my trip. 
The only ray of light was room service which was quick and courteous.

title: Thanksgiving 2016
text:
Fabulous location,beautiful decoration in the lobby,feels very glamorous, quick efficient check in via the app,room and keys were ready on time.Special mention to Mallory Jolly who helped with the booking for this once in a lifetime trip,she was more than helpful and got me the floor i requested.Thoughtful gifts in room for Thanksgiving.
1 minor niggle,now whether its because im british but in the UK its common to have a complimentary kettle and coffee/tea in room for 3* and over.If you are paying 1700 a night you would expect that and bottles of water to be provided.

title: Thanksgiving at the Essex
text:
My husband and I have been coming to the Essex for many years. Now that it is owned by J. W. Marriott the Essex has certainly lost some of its charm. However, it is a convenient location and generally a well priced hotel for NYC. Thanksgiving the rates go up significantly. If you are attending the parade, Columbus Circle is a short walk. 

DaynaPapp

title: Our new hotel in NYC
text:
First time to stay at the Essex House, but will now be our hotel of choice in New York.  Location is perfect.  Just across the street from Central Park which was perfect for a morning stroll through the park.  Hotel is updated, clean and the staff is fantastic and friendly. 
The room was much larger than the typical NYC room.  Very spacious and comfortable.  Bathroom large, great shower and the towels are like beach towels!  Bed very comfortable.

title: What a view
text:
Notre suite était immense, deux chambres, un salon une belle entrée ! 
le room service absolument irréprochable.
Mais la déco est vraiment vieillotte c est dommage 
En revanche la vue sur central park est belle ! 
L'emplacement est idéal !

title: Yearly Tradition
text:
This is beautiful JW Marriott property. As I am a frequent business traveler and Elite Platinum Lifetime member, I recognize and appreciate the exceptional professional service provided by your staff during all my stays. Your property was not only beautiful, all the staff we encountered were professional, and dedicated to ensuring our every need was met from dining recommendations to Art exhibits.  

Although most weeks my travel is for business, but this is trip we do annually for the holidays.  This year we are going right after Thanksgiving. 

I would like to personally acknowledge Sharlene at the front desk who is definitely one of Marriott’s treasures worldwide.  She always remembers us. 

The Vasquez Family

title: Delighted with location, room and service
text: I love this hotel--I stayed there before a Marriott and love the art deco style in common areas.  With Marriott takeover and being Gold member happy with Executive Lounge for breakfast and evening appetizers and drinks--excellent perk.  Bed super comfortable. I had a reasonable rate for the location and did not splurge on the view---that was fine--because the room was clean and comfortable and needed a good nights sleep which was what I had.

title: amazing
text: Loved the rooms and especially their beds, extremely comfortable. Location of this hotel was great as we went during the Christmas Holiday and really enjoyed the lights and festivities of the city during that time.

title: Relies too heavily on their location and former reputation
text:
This was my second stay here. I'll give every hotel two chances. It will be my last stay here. 

Used mobile check-in, and noted that I would be arriving at about 4PM. My flight ended up landing late, and I made it to the hotel just at 5PM. My room still wasn't ready, and while the staff at the front desk was friendly, there wasn't anything they could do about it. If check in is at 4:00, I expect my room to be ready at 4:00. I had to request a coupon for a free beer at the hotel bar while I waited an additional 20 minutes for my room to be ready, and received a phone call later that night letting me know I would receive 5,000 points. That is all well and good, but points don't make up for a bad experience. 

The executive lounge at this hotel desperately needs to be expanded, or needs to stop being sold as an add on to guests. The hotel informed me they don't sell it as an add on, but there is a big page on their website that lists you can add it to your room. After I pointed this out to them, they ceased communication with me. Waits of 15-20 minutes on weekends for breakfast are just ridiculous. The hotel wouldn't even offer breakfast vouchers for the hotel restaurant, so everyone just huddled up at the door to the lounge. It looked terrible, and was a terrible experience. 

After expressing my concerns to the hotel over twitter, I was told I would be sent an email addressing them, but I never heard back. No surprise there.

 In the year between my last visit and this visit they made one change. They removed the telephones from the bathroom. I think it's more important to look at your staff, and the experiences that your guests write about here on tripadvisor on a regular basis, and decide it is time to make a change. Positive reviews speak of the location, which is fantastic, but that is just about all this hotel has going for it.

title: 立地よし。思い出に映るホテル
text:
映画の背景によく出てくるので、映画を見ていても、泊まった事をを思い出を振り返る事ができます。
セントラルパークに面したロケーションで立地がよく、豪華なホテルで、マンハッタンのミッドタウンに位置しています。
アメニティーは＜アロマセラピー　アソシエイツ＞ で、とても良い香り。

title: A nice stay-thought it would be nicer
text: Just left a 2 night stay with my husband and two kids.  The positives-great location right by Central Park, spacious room, large bathroom.  Bell staff was awesome and raced down a taxi for us for our airport return while a Trump protest was happening and blacking traffic.  The negatives-for what you paid, you would think the room would have more amenities.  No coffee maker, limited plugs, no info about hotel or NYC.  Restaurant breakfast buffet was disappointing.  Eggs were cold and my son just wanted cereal for which we paid $15.  Nice location and comfortable stay, but for what we paid, will probably search for a new place on our next trip.

title: Great location.
text: The location, on Central Park South, is great for getting around Manhattan. Subway stations bookend the area - we were able to walk from Penn Station to the hotel with our luggage (1.4 miles), and then realized the subway for that route was very convenient (Columbus Circle, 59th and 7th avenue). We used points and stayed in a one bedroom suite that easily accommodated three of us. The bedroom had a day bed/couch, and the living had a pull out couch, so 4 or even 5 could probably have fit. Service was very attentive. The executive lounge restricts breakfast guests to one plus the card member and charges $50 for any additional person. The buffet was relatively robust, with eggs, bacon, oatmeal, yogurt, sausage, waffles, etc. The eating space in the lounge is too small for the demand, resulting in people crowding the entry way, waiting for a place to sit. But the food was fine. We ate there once and then opted for Le Pain Quotidien across the street for a cheaper meal (if you have more than 2 people). The only complaint I had, and it is nit-picky, is that the shower head was low - I'm 5'11" and had trouble getting my head under it without bending my knees. Other than that, a lovely room, great location.

title: Buenisimo
text:
Un hotel confortable, bien ubicado frente al central park a metros de Columbus, muy elegante con personal de habla hispana me encanto. 
El lobby muy elegante, mucha vigilancia, durante todo el dia se debe mostrar la llave para poder tomar el ascensor para acceder a las Habitaciones.

title: Dirty room
text: Would not recommend. Our room was filthy. We took a wet wash cloth and wiped the love seat and it turned black. The carpet was very dirty with numerous spots, it should be replaced. Even though I am a gold elite member, we got downgraded to a room with a view of a wall and trash bags and next to the elevator. Service in the restaurant was bad, we were ignored trying to order a glass of wine. The location is nice, across from Central Park

title: Great service - just what you would expect from a legendary hotel
text:
It was great to have corporate travel book me here - especially since its a Marriott property so i get points too!
Check in was flawless,  got a room with a view of Central Park.     The bed is incredibly comfortable and there were lovely amenities,  chargers if you forgot yours, bath salts,  and a well stocked minibar.     Plenty of desk space and lots and lots of outlets to charge everything i need to charge.    If the room falls short on anything it would be the lack of a comfy reading chair, especially with such a great view outside of the window.     Location is fabulous, walkable everywhere i needed to go.    Would highly recommend this hotel.

title: Can't beat the location
text: It was our first time staying here and we picked it mostly for the location across from Central Park.  We stayed here for a week and really liked it. The rooms are a little outdated, however the suite was quite spacious for NYC standards. The Club lounge was very good and convenient for water and coffee/tea. Brunch and evening snacks weren't bad either. Does get pretty crowded on weekends but quiet during the week. Again you cannot get a better location-we walked in the park almost daily which was great. Walking distance to Broadway, the Lincoln Center and Carnegie Hall. Would stay here again solely for the location!

title: Beautiful hotel with a luxurious bed
text:
Fantastic location on the south side of Central Park.  Some of the rooms have a unobstructed view while others are partially obscured.  The rooms can be a little small,but the comfort of the beds make up for all of it.  The beds are comfortable and the pillows are the softest of down. 

The continental breakfast for the elite Marriott rewards members offers fresh fruit, eggs, oatmeal, sausage, bacon, bagels, assorted pastries, and lox.  The food is good, but the wait staff is not consistent in how it treated its customers.  Some people were doted on, while others were completely ignored.  

Overall, nice hotel with some beautiful views of the park.

title: Great Location and Hotel
text: Spent two nights with my wife to visit friends/family that live in NYC. Location is perfect on Central Park South and great historical building with updates. Bartenders in the restaurant were very friendly and made some great cocktails. Roomsize was larger than expected and very comfortable. Great view of the Park. Gym also was very nice and had adequate equipment to use.

title: Amazing stay at a beautiful hotel in an amazing location
text: I cannot say enough about the customer service during my stay. Leading up to the stay, the staff were extremely helpful with coordination. During the stay, the staff were helpful and treated us very well. They even called to congratulate me on my race and to notify me they were going to provide an upgrade. The location is also amazing and the views were excellent.

title: Gem in Central Park South
text: The location is perfect and the staff make it even better. Friendly and welcoming, the staff at every turn help to make your stay great. Highly recommend this property. Room size better than most and lounge exceptional.

title: Weekend in New York
text: The Hotel location is great, just in front of central park. Room is ok but Needs some dates/tlc. Concierge help is great. Staff us friendly and helpful. We had a king room with no view. If you can afford it choose a room with a view!

title: Amazing long weekend in NYC
text: Spent a long weekend in NYC just to get in the Christmas spirit, shop, see shows and enjoy the NYC food.  The Essex House was above and beyond my expectations.  It is in a PERFECT location on Central Park South, walking distance to shopping, theater district, Rockefeller Center, across from Central Park and close to tons of great restaurants and bars.  The front desk was very helpfull and professional, my room wasone of the largest I have ever had in NYC-very comfortable, clean and luxurious. Everyone was professional, kind and helpful.  The onsite restaurant and bar is great to grab a burger and drinks.  Will for sure be coming back.

title: Birthday visit
text: Spent 6 amazing days, everyone was so nice & helpful, loved it. Museums, Central Park, 5th Ave., Times Square, Empire State Building, and everything we wanted to see was so close to our hotel. Or just a cab ride away.

title: Superb Location
text: By any measure this is a great hotel in a superb location facing the South entrance to Central Park and all its attractions. The public areas are all very tastefully decorated and the staff are both attentive and knowledgeable about where to go and what to see. The bedrooms are large and airy but could probably do with a measure of redecoration. For some reason our room had an antique brass telescope in it and it worked a treat. Well worth the money in my opinion.

title: Lovely but dated
text: It is a great location - across from Central Park.  The style and vibe of the hotel reminds me of the luxury era of the 1950's.  Unfortunately, some of the rooms needs some TLC and updating.  My desk's wood veneer was peeling off the sides.  The rug looked like it had seen too  many snow storms. The executive club was modern but seemed oddly out of synch with the rest of the hotel's decor.  BTW - I ordered room service and asked for a medium steak.  It was cooked to a deep dark brown - and tasted/chewed like shoe leather. It was too late in the evening to return it, but consumer beware.

title: Great location, rooms and service just okay
text:
I have stayed at this property three times over the last three months.  I chose it because of its reasonable (for New York) price and its superb location.  

For those of you that want to run in Central Park it couldn't be more perfect.  It is right across the street. It has good access to all amenities.

The cons of this property is that the rooms are pretty dated (particularly the bathrooms) and the service at the hotel is pretty spotty.  Some people are great; some not so much.

I give the hotel a bit of a pass because it is a Marriott so I don't expect it to be a Ritz or a Four Seasons, but since they sell themselves as an upscale property I would expect more from them.

title: Very Good with a Taste of Perfect
text: I recently spent 4 days in New York at the Essex House and was pleased with the overall look and comfort of the hotel. I found the bed exceptionally comfortable as I'm use to sleeping on a Tempur-Pedic matress. The bathroom was roomy with an exceptional shower with great water pressure (nice). The hotel staff was accommodating and helpful when asked for assistance. I did have a chance to experience breakfast at the hotel of which I would give 4.5 stars with regards to presentation and quality. Unfortunately I was unable to experience any type of room service. Overall I was most satisfied, as the hotel is within blocks of everything exciting about New York. Street food vendors were about 1.5 blocks away with a New York Style Pizza shop directly across the street on the backside and Central Park in the front. Be sure to check the bar amenity (If so equipped) status in your room upon entry and during check-out.

title: Good property, treated well!
text:
I stayed at the JW Essex House on October 22nd for one night.  Being a Marriott Platinum I had requested an upgrade but didn't hold my breath.  I did not get to the hotel until 10pm that night and I was pleasantly surprised to see that I was upgraded to a family suite.  The room was huge (for NY standards), and had 1.5 baths and a separate sitting area.  The next morning I had breakfast at the Executive Lounge, and I must say the spread was excellent.  The space is not huge, so a little wait for a table can be expected.  The hotel has a great location (from a tourist standpoint)!

The concierge staff and other housekeeping staff were friendly and helpful.  Couple of dings - rooms are in need of a refresh (not sure when they were done last), as there are small things you may notice in the room (a little pain peel or water stain)...nothing that impacted my stay.  One suggestion - if you truly want to be considered the luxury brand for Marriott (aside from Ritz), you need better bathroom products - this generic stuff made by Sysco is not going to cut it.  Even Marriott Park Lane (London, not a JW) provided L'Occitane products.

Overall a good visit, would love to stay again.

title: Gone down hill!
text:
We stayed here a  good while ago on our honeymoon when owned by Starwood/Westin.
It was a grand place then. 
stayed this time three nights in October 2016
now it is like any grubby old Marriott once you get past the lovely reception area and old lifts/elevators.
years ago there was a lovely art deco dining room with amazing sunday brunch. This has been ripped out and it is now a soulless brown and gold modern thing you could find anywhere. We ate breakfast here and for two adults and a child a buffet breakfast cost us $116 and it really wasn't anything special. The staff are surly and useless. we got up and refilled our own water glasses and were never offered a refill of coffee. AVOID.
Our room was on 9th floor and was only adequate and decoratively bland and tired. Bath not big enough to drown a mouse. The maid was careless: things knocked on floor and left there and on the coldest day of the Autumn 12c/55F she left the window open all day. Nothing we could do with the aircon/heating got the room back up above 63 and we were glad to check out the next morning frozen to the bone. Also
not happy with bell staff/ doormen. On our last afternoon we waited outside to get a yellow cab to JFK. They insist on calling one off the street and have their hand out to you waiting for a tip. Our cab driver told me that he nearly drove off as they demanded $10 FROM HIM to be given the valuable JFK fare!!!  he told them where to go. And I will tell you to go and find a better hotel for the money in NY. It wont be difficult.

title: Very Noisy Room 704
text: We spent five days last week at the Essex House in a combination business / vacation trip. The room and bathroom were very, very small but it is NY and the location can't be beat so we were not complaining. However, starting on the second day, we started hearing a non-stop noise above us. Sounded like a large dog running around. We complained and they said they would deal with it. Long story short, the room above us is part of a condominium and there was nothing they could do about it. They couldn't even switch us as the hotel was full. In the end they gave us 25% discount on two of the nights but if you are a light or even average sleeper, stay away from this room!

title: Perfect in every Way
text:
Stayed in the city after visiting family in Jersey. This was the perfect location we had all the shopping on Madison and 5th Ave at our disposal. We walked everywhere Rockefeller Center, Times Square, Carnegie Deli, Broadway the Diamond District . We stayed on points and was provided a beautiful one bedroom suite with a huge Bathroom. For NYC this place would be large enough to live in. The executive lounge
breakfast was great it was like being on a cruise, bagels and lox, pastries all fresh and tasty. The seating was a little tight but the service was great. The evening service at the lounge was good also they provide drinks on the honor system but they keep a pretty tight track so no free drinks. We enjoyed our stay at the JW and cant figure why I haven't stayed here before. I tell you the apartments across the street at night were very visible from the hotel. Many guests were attending the US Open  and I met some of the players from Italy.

title: Price is for Location, Location, Location
text: For the price, I would expect the hotel to have an indoor pool. The size of the bathroom was the best part about the accommodations. The shower head was great too. But you could tell that the tub itself and the faucet were dated/old. The bed was very comfortable.

title: Great Location, so so Comfort/Service
text: Chose this hotel for a 5 day mother daughter NYC trip.  Used points as I am a platinum member with Ritz Carlton/Marriott.  It was a good value for points compared with the Ritz a few blocks down but they did not upgrade as usual due to high occupancy.  Our first room was on a lower floor with a view of the air shaft and was really noisy due to the industrial fans keeping the hotel cool, and I wearing ear plugs.  We moved to a smaller room, also facing the air shaft but on a higher floor and that was much better. As a platinum member we could use the exec lounge for breakfast but not much else was on offer at the lounge.  All in all it was a perfectly fine stay but mostly due to the location of the hotel and the history/architecture.  The service and quality of the rooms were so/so for a JW Marriott property, but from what I read on Trip Advisor NYC hotels can get away with it since it is such a hot destination.

title: Not Clean or Updated
text:
We visited NYC over Labor Day weekend & stayed at this property. Being a Marriott Rewards member, I paid with points. While the location is perfect, the hotel & service in definitely not. Our room was a very nice size, but was dirty. There was a banana peel behind our door, a clump of hair on the shower wall & a booger (there's really no nice way to say it) smeared on the wall next to one of the beds.
When we left for the day, I went to the desk & notified them of the cleanliness issues. I was assured that it would be taken care of ASAP. When we returned later that night, none of it was cleaned. Someone came up & cleaned the snot off of the wall, but since my son was sleeping, I took care of the banana & the hair in shower. The room was just gross. I told the front desk & showed them the pics that I had taken & he told me the manager would credit some points. For a 70,000 point stay, I received 5,000 points, for a filthy room that my family could not wait to get out of. Very disappointed & would never stay at this property again.

title: Nice Hotel
text: The location cannot be beat and the history is amazing.  I stayed here with extremely high expectations and left unsure of what to feel.  The rooms are nice but the hotel is showing its age and can use some updating throughout.  My biggest disappointment was the staff.  They seemed nonexistent and the service was not at all what I was hoping to see at this level of hotel.  I travel weekly and am a Marriott loyalist but not sure this will be on my list as a hotel to return to in the near future.  Ample dining options in walking distance and the hotel has a great Executive lounge

title: Lovely oasis in the big Apple
text: We stayed here for a business meeting . We really enjoyed the breakfast lounge . Charly and Omar were extremely helpful even when they were super busy! Hats off for hiring such warm and friendly staff!

title: Amazing hotel and staff
text: We had the best time in NYC due in no small part to the Essex House.  The staff, especially Mallory Jolly, couldn't have been more helpful and welcoming for our stay there.  We have been to NYC many times but have never stayed in such a great place.  The hotel is classy, well located and elegant.  This is definitely our new NYC home for our next visits.

title: Lujo y ubicación
text: La pasamos muy bien el Essex House. Tiene una espectacular vista a Central Park y muy bien ubicado cerca de Times Square, Rockefeller Center y Fifth Avenue. El hotel es antiguo pero muy bien mantenido. El personal A1.

title: Lovely Hotel
text:
The Essex House, an old favorite on Central Park South, is now part of the Marriott group.  It has remained one of the nicest hotels in New York!  The staff could not be more pleasant and it was always their "pleasure" to accommodate their guests.  The bedding was luxurious and we had a very restful night.  Never heard a single noise from the hallway.  There are staff members everywhere, which makes one feel quite secure.
 Our room was quite small, with the king size bed taking up most of the space, but we were not in the room very much so that wasn't an issue.  One point I want to make is that I had to look really hard for the gift shop to buy a bottle of water!  I usually spend time browsing in hotel gift shops to pick up items that we may have forgotten or to purchase gifts for the grandchildren.....but this "shop" is literally a small closet!  To me, they could make a fortune by stocking incidentals for guests.  
 The hotel is expensive for sure but we had a wonderful stay.

title: There for a wedding
text:
The Room:  Chic, modern, very comfy.  Loved the bath salts with the other sundries.  Nice TV, great bed.

The Wedding Venue:  Exactly what the bride and groom wanted, so props to you guys.  The turnover from ceremony to reception was quick and efficient, for the most part.

Food/Drinks:  The food was fantastic, and I couldn't even finish my entrée due to the variety, number, and quality of the hors d'ouevres.  Had room service brunch, too, which was good.  Nothing super notable, but perfectly adequate.

The bartenders were very obviously pouring/making drinks slowly before and during dinner.  Drinks service was to start at 6, but didn't start until closer to 6:15.  After dinner, they were molasses.  The servers pouring wine were better, but they were way too quick, to clear drinks if I left the table to dance, mingle, etc.  More than once I lost more than half a drink to the servers clearing it ASAP.

Location:  What's to say?  Prime location.

Overall:  Great stay.

title: Great location. Great service
text:
The location of this hotel is amazing. It is right across the street from
Central Park and 2 blocks from Columbus circle. The rooms are good. The staff is amazing.  They pay attention to every detail. I was very impressed

title: Essex House is the best hotel in NYC
text:
Our stay at the JW Marriott Essex House was just incredible over Columbus Day Weekend.  My wife and I have been celebrating our anniversary here for the last 3 years and we always enjoy the Essex House for its unbeatable location on the south side of Central Park and world class service.

Mallory helped to get us a beautiful room before our arrival and both David and Kevin on the concierge team were extremely helpful.  David was able to get us timely reservations and great seats at The Boathouse, Sarabeth's, and Wayfarer which were all delicious and quite enjoyable.  Also, we followed the Central Park tour based on the hotel's recommended route and found that to be both inspiring and educational.   

Thanks to the Essex House for another great stay and we will look forward to our next visit!

title: Essex!!
text:
Wonderful jacuzzi, hot steam room, too hot sauna, pool and tanning service for the Mrs.

Great family fun. Although mainly for the adults, we had great time. Rooms comfortable, airy, TV, good bathrooms, food a class!

Recommended by us!  Going back pressure Christmas.

title:
NYC 
FIT and Deepak
text:
We came here with an agenda, 'Mainly two meetings. The rest of the time we took advantage of the theaters and galleries. Since we were here in the summer for a month at a property in Times Square, we opted for the other end. The hotel lobby was usually vacant- not much going on there. We were given a corner room, which had an entry way and large closet, - chair with reading lamp as well as two queens or doubles as well as bathroom across the hall. No view except scaffolding. The Essex House was a great place when I came with my parents years ago. It could use some fine tuning- i.e. Our toilet ran unless you jiggled it and the blue lights on the not well maintained light switch were too bright at night as well as the shades with some rods sticking out. It could use some sprucing up. Our bathroom bulb was also burned out. Housekeeping was good to give plenty of towels and bath products as we have 3 heads of long hair. The night reception guards were cordial. It's lacking that je ne se quois which could boost the vibe. 
Great location to the musesums and Central Park across the street. 
Great concierges. Many great recommendations for great restaurants. All in all, we enjoyed our stay. Would have been nicer to stay in a cleaner room with a view.

title: Mais ums visita com as mesmas qualidades e os mesmos defeitos.
text: Tendo visitado o hotel algumas vezes, retornamos em outubro agora com as crianças. Já tendo avaliado o hotel com 4 pontos resolvi nessa avaliação retirar um pois os defeitos continuam os mesmos. As qualidades também, mas a idade do hotel está aumentado desde a última reforma. Qualidades principais: localização e tamanho dos quartos. Principais defeitos: check in/front desk e lounge. O lounge, onde é servido o café para membros elite do programa de fidelidade, continua o retrato da desorganização: pequeno, apertado, absolutamente insuficiente para o tamanho do hotel. Não bastasse o subdimensiomento, os funcionários que não me parecem poucos, parecem perdidos e as mesas sujas se acumulam enquanto os hospedes de apertam esperando para sentar. Não sei se é o fato das gorgetas aqui serem minguadas em relação ao restaurante principal, se é falta de treinamento ou excesso de trabalho. Foi colocada uma pessoa para receber as pessoas mas pelo que pude observar ela pouco ajuda. O retrato da desorganização pode ser notado pelo fato do suco ter acabado e ter ficado sem reposição da hora que entramos até a hora em que saímos. Poderia ser normal se não tivessemos passado cerca de 1 hora sentados e os recipientes não estivessem imediatamente na frente do hostess. Se o café no lounge não estivesse incluído certamente não comeríamos alí. Quanto ao front desk ele me parece incompatível com a faixa de preço hotel. Falta cordialidade, pessoalidade e interesse. Em nenhum momento, em nenhuma visita me senti bem recebido, algo que apesar de incomum em NY pode ser sentido até em hotéis muito mais simples e baratos. Tenho status gold ou superior em praticamente todas as grandes redes de hotéis o que agrava ainda mais a sensação de desconsideração. Um exemplo foi o check out: liguei perguntando sobre a necessidade de passar no front desk, visto que tinham meu cartão e todas as informações necessárias... para minha surpresa, em vez de ser transferido para o front desk, fui "mandado" pelo atendente fazer o check out via tv - que não estava funcionando. Nova ligação e pedi direto para ser transferido para o front desk, que atendeu, tirou o telefone do gancho e continuou atendendo a pessoa do balcão... Mais uma ligação, relatei o problema e o atendente sugeriu que se eu estivesse ok com a conta poderia simplesmente deixar avisado que estava saindo e ele avisaria a portaria. Longe de ser o atendimento de um hotel de alto padrão a um cliente que paga uma centena de noites de hotel por ano....

title: UNPROFESSIONAL STAFF MEMBER
text:
Good Afternoon,

I would like to describe the unprofessional actions of Terrence John, a staff member at this hotel. This past weekend, I was walking by the Essex House hotel and while standing away from the entrance, Terrence John came up to me and berated me for standing on a public sidewalk. He said this was "my area" and threatened me. He then told to leave the area. I refused, knowing my rights as a law abiding citizen and Terrence John then proceeded to escalate the situation by calling another security guard and ordered him to tell us to leave the public sidewalk. We were causing no problems or disturbing any hotel guests, yet Terrence John decided to make a problem out of nothing. This man needs to go to sensitivity training and he also needs to study the law. Nobody owns the sidewalk!!!

title: Unbeatable location, luxury accommodation, and helpful staff
text: The traditional Essex House, now run by the JW Marriott, is a great place to stay in New York City. We got a room with a view to the street (there are rooms facing building walls so make sure to stay away from those) and were very happy with it. The hotel has all the amenities of a 5 star hotel in a big city. One of the main attentions is that once you exit the hotel lobby you are right on Central Park, and you can pretty much walk anywhere. The complementary breakfast, served at one of the hotel restaurants, had plenty of options to chose from. The hotel staff was very helpful, especially for New York standards. There's security near the elevators to make sure only hotel guests take the lifts. Overall a very good experience, including for our 4 year old son.

title: Grand Old Hotel
text:
My wife and I stayed here following a cruise from Montreal. We stayed for four nights before flying home to London. 
This really is an opulent, grand, old hotel. The lifts are a bit creaky (but with fabulous Art Deco doors) and the rooms may be a bit tired but this is a hotel with STYLE. However, the best thing about the hotel is the staff. The reception staff and the concierge staff couldn't have been more helpful. As it was our first trip to New York, their advice on places to visit, how to use the metro and good local places to eat was invaluable and made it all very easy.
We didn't eat in the hotel so I cannot comment on the food.  We did ask for a kettle and coffee maker in our room. This was replenished each day for $10 but the teas and coffee were top quality so we felt it was worth it. This was a busy hotel with lots of conferences and celebrations.  The hotel is ideally situated next to Central Park and as it is in the centre of Manhattan and near to the metro stops, you can get to most places pretty quickly.  We would definitely stay here again.

title: Poor
text: My husband and I drove from Boston to New York and when we arrived we couldn't even find a place to park in front of the hotel due to the hotel entry construction. The hotel was pretty bussy, so it took about 20 min to get to the check in counter. The representative was exceptionally nice and give us a warm welcome. When we got to the room I got a rude awakening and couldn't believe how outdated the room was and how bad the carpet looked, old and full of stains. It's hard to believe this is a Marriott hotel. I will definitely not recommend this hotel unless they do some remodeling.

title: Perfect Location and OHHH the Bed!!!
text:
Yes this is a large hotel with a high occupancy rate and the issues that may arise from that and yes the old girl is a bit faded from her days of opulence and elegance but she is still a grand lady worthy of respect who will give you a warm shelter from the cold, provide a heavenly bed to rest your weary self from the day's activities, provide fantastic views from her windows, and feed you bountiful breakfasts from her lounges and restaurants.  

In no time we felt the Essex House was home and looked forward to seeing the #160 on the marquee after a long day of sightseeing and receiving a warm welcome from the Doormen who always had a kind word to say no matter how busy.

The location for a NYC vacation is unrivaled at the price point with multiple subway access points at each block and within walking distance of the major sights.  The Art Deco accents and luxurious decorations in the public spaces maximizes the warmth of the surroundings and our room had all the storage space we needed to unpack and have easy to access to everything.  We did have a Central Park view room and I would recommend that no matter the floor.  We were on the 6th and loved the ever changing sights out our windows and tried to devise multiple ways to get the super comfy divan packed into our luggage so we could bring it home 😀.   Eating a warm croissant and watching a rainy Sunday morning from that most comfortable of couches was a lovely way to end our stay.

We will stay at the Essex House again!

title: Nice Marriott in great location
text:
Nice hotel, great location, best Marriott concierge lounge in NY and decent gym.

I tried to hit all of my main points in the first sentence.  This is probably my fifth time staying at the Essex House in the past year.    

This is however, the first time I have been upgraded to a suite, which was very nice.  I checked in via the Marriott app and was pleasantly surprised to receive a nice suite when I checked in.  Because it is such an old building the walls are thick and you can't hear your neighbors like in most hotels.

The concierge lounge puts out an amazing spread, probably one of the best in the U.S.  The only place I've seen better is in Europe.

Lobby bar/restaurant is nice, but extremely pricey.  $12 for a Coors Light draft is a little much, even at the Essex House.  Food was good and bartenders were friendly.

Gym is nice but lacks a good strength area.  Equipment is new, but very small strength area especially if there are a few people in the gym.  Treadmills are nice and on the new side.

I have to admit that I would not stay at this hotel at the price they charge if work was not paying for it, but they are so I do.  I'll continue to stay at the Essex House at every chance I Get so long as it's not on my dime.  Besides A Ritz or Four Seasons this hotel doesn't trail far behind.

title: Disappointing, Upsetting and Drugs
text:
Arrived on Friday afternoon and we were told a that our bags were going to be taken to our room, I have no issues with giving people a tip but before I had a chance to give him one he made myself and my wife feel uncomfortable by almost demanding one, it was not a good start. 
We then found out that you had to pay for wifi which at the price of the hotel is unusual. 
The most upsetting thing is that on the 2nd night we were woken up at 3am to a lot of noise from the room next door, at 4am there was a very strange smokey smell filling our room, this carried on till 6am when I'd had enough and went and complained. I was told by security it was marijuana! My wife is pregnant and we had our 1 year old son in the room with us so totally ruined the experience for us. I was then told by security they didn't want to point fingers and if it happens again they would deal with it properly, I feel this must be normal in the hotel with how laid back they were about it. For my wife this put her on edge the whole time we were in the hotel and she could not sleep properly as worried it may happen again, she was very upset and it ruined what was meant to be a holiday of a lifetime. 
I know the hotel can't always control their guests and what they do but I feel it was very badly handled considering how serious it was.
On a plus not the cleaner in our room did a fantastic job!
But it's safe to say I will never be staying with them again.

title: Excelente localização
text: Muito bom! Excelente localização, pratico para aproveitar muito NY! Foi uma escolha muito acertada, difícil pensar em outra localização tão pratica. Todo tipo de lojas e serviços por perto além de entrada de metro perto.

title: Birthday Celebration
text: The JW Marriott is an exceptional hotel.  We chose the location for our stay in NYC to celebrate my sister's birthday.  The JW was extremely accommodating and made the stay very memorable.  I want to give a special thanks to Mallory who went above and beyond.

title: Great location, terrible service
text: We stayed at Essex House for a total of 4 nights. The entrance to the hotel, and the fact it was on Central Park South, was brilliant. That is where the brilliance ended. The doormen took our bags whilst we checked in and then we meandered around downstairs for a while. Only to walk back through the entrance hall to find our cases still there and unattended. Therefore we took them off the trolley and took up ourselves. When we arrived in the room...for that cost per night...they were small, dark & pokey, with quite dated fixtures & fittings. We unpacked & couldn't even fit our clothes for our short stay in the wardrobe. Nor could we fit both average sized cases in the wardrobe, so we had to move the sofa in order to tuck the other suitcase behind it so that we wouldn't trip over it. On not one of the three mornings that I ordered breakfast did I get the correct drink that I ordered, but waiters were unattentive & couldn't have cared less. On one occasion we got locked out of our room - I had to visit reception 3x times as they kept advising that I had to wait for security at my room, but no one came. Yet the room phone kept ringing off the hook. What frustrated me the most was the attitude of the receptionist who didn't apologise once during the whole 30 minute debacle of trying to gain access to the room, and was actually quite rude. Then on the last night, seeing as we were leaving early the next morning, we went to settle our bill, of which there was nothing - which is what we expected. Yet at 5:30am the next morning, we got a bill for one breakfast (our breakfasts were included & this wasn't on our room 8 hours earlier) so even though our airport shuttle was waiting, we had to go and have the charge removed at reception. Every interaction with hotel staff was either riddled with total incompetence or a passive approach to customer care. We would suggest that you don't waste your money on Essex House - a totally dated, overpriced hotel with terrible service.

title: Great location, wonderful employees
text: We booked a king suite. Cesar at reception could not have been more helpful. He upgraded us to the 38th floor to a large suite. Wow, we loved the view and room. Our bed, a king was so comfortable as was the bedding. The air conditioning was perfect. We had great interactions with the employees and they could not have tried harder to please my husband and I. The location is perfect. We walked to all of the restaurants at night so easily. We would do it again.

title: paying for the location
text: My wife and I stayed here for a vacation in August 2016.  The location across the street from Central Park is great.  But beyond the location, the hotel doesn't live up to expectations.  The furniture in the room was a bit old and needs to be updated.  The bathroom sink did not drain.  The outlets were loose, and whenever I tried to charge my computer or phone, the charger fell out of the socket.  The light switches were strange, and difficult to figure out how to operate.  We had no view out of our window.  I got up on Sunday morning about 6am and tried to find some coffee, but I had to leave the hotel and go somewhere else.

title: Great Location and Amazing Staff!
text: Decided on a last minute stay in NYC for my birthday and didn't plan my restaurant reservation ahead of time. Raphael, the amazing concierge, worked magic and I had a fabulous time at one of my favorite restaurants.  The hotel lives up to the JW standard, the staff exceeds it - especially Raphael.  I will definitely go back!

title: Great Location, Great Hotel....
text: First time on this property, but absolutely loved the location on South Central Park.   Staff very friendly and accommodating.  Elevators very swift, despite being a large hotel, rooms were good sized for NYC (although not large by other city standards), but easy to navigate for 2 people.  All the amenities you would expect from a Marriott, and they definitely do not disappoint here.   We could walk everywhere - museums, restaurants, jazz club, and of course the park.  I would definitely stay here again.

title: только позитив
text: Отличное месторасположение! Хороший, состоявшийся, респектабельный отель прямо у центрального парка, при очень адекватной стоимости за номер (сравнивая с другими отелями в этом районе). Замечательные просторные удобные номера со всем необходимым - халаты, тапочки, мини-бар, косметика и тд. Основные достопримечательности и торговые улицы в шаговой доступности.

title: Fantastic One Of the  best hotels in New York.
text:
This emblematic hotel has been there forever. A few years ago JW Marriott bought this venue and has expanded incredibly. 
This hotel has everything.  It's so amazingly well located. The lobby is fantastic. Rooms are so brand new. The bar and restaurants are top of the top

title: Casa Club del Central Park
text:
Ci sono stato almeno un paio di volte. Questa volta con due stanze (famiglia). 
Gentilissimi nel trovare un upgrade, camere pulite, ovviamente non tutte uguali.
Servizio front desk piu' che buono e gentili.
Posizione strategica al lato sud del Central Park con Metropolitane a portata di mano.
Ci tornero.

title: Great location, modern rooms and excellent staff
text: The location can't be beat. Right in the middle of midtown, next door to Central Park and a block from fabulous shopping on 5th Avenue. We stayed in a junior suite with a view of Central Park. The room was more than spacious, the beds were extremely comfortable and the amenities were exceptional. The concierge staff, housekeeping, front desk and the doormen were very helpful and always friendly. I highly recommend!

title: Out of the hustle and bustle .
text:
We were looking for somewhere to have a quite Sunday night drink .
We have been here before with friends .
They have big comfortable lounges or you can sit at the bar which is always entertaining and there is also a dining area .
  
We sat at the bar and after a few cocktails that kick like a mule we dined at the bar .
 
Nice atmosphere and good bar food .

title: suite junior très grande
text:
un véritable vieille hôtel new yorker. Deco parfaite pour ceux qui aime le vieux. J'aurais pensé qu'il avait besoin d'une bonne rénovation, mais parait il qu'il a été rénové récemment, donc c'est juste le style début des année 1900 que je n'aime pas.
Le service est assez basique et donc pas du tout a la hauteur de sa catégorie.
Exemple: les assiettes des rooms service qui restent plus de 48h dans les couloirs ou les oreillers pour le lit de ma fille que j'ai du demandé plusieurs fois pendant 4h au téléphone.

Il est idéalement situé pour vous promener dans Central Park ou si vous avez un enfant qui chasse les Pokemons et donc peut repérer de la chambre ceux qui trainent dans le park :)) !!!!
Entre 2 lignes différentes de métro, c'est parfait. 

J'avais pris une suite junior, j'ai été très agréablement surprise par la taille de la chambre. Elle était immense (certains hôtels de NY auraient considéré cette chambre comme suite). La salle de bain avait également une très bonne taille pour un hôtel dans NY.

Le petit plus que j'ai aimé: pouvoir me connecté sur mon compte Netflix sur la tv de la chambre.
Le petit moins (en plus de la deco) est qu'il n'y a ni bouilloire, ni cafetière ni Nespresso dans la chambre. Je n'avais jamais vu ça dans aucun des hôtels américains ni ailleurs je crois. Et ça manque !!!

title: Fantastic location!
text: This place was perfect! A short walk to Central Park - my sister and I got to go for a walk in the park every morning! Easy walk to Times Square and Broadway. Could not ask for a better location to access the best parts of NYC. And it's easy to find when you are walking back because of the big "Essex House" sign on the roof! Rooms were nice, beds comfortable, staff helpful. Honestly didn't spend much time in the room except sleeping, but did have a nice desk and a comfortable chair. Great pizza place right outside the back door...my 8yr old daughter was thrilled to find that they sold Dr. Pepper!
